Wonderful puzzle for my two year old twins.  They are able to put it together with minimal assistance.  The pouch is nice for storage and keeping all the pieces together.  I would buy more like this.
the picture is pretty busy so it's harder to do for a child, but my 2.5 year old does like it anyway
summary: hard to do, but daughter loves it

reviewText: My son received this for a gift when he was about 26 months old. He'd never done a jigsaw puzzle before, but he loves vehicles. Much to my surprise, he instantly took to the puzzle! It held his attention and right away he was able to put it together with very little adult assistance. Now that he's familiar with the puzzle, he still loves putting it together and talks about which pieces go with which while he does it ("Where's bunny's ears?" "Where's the mixer truck?" etc.). We love this puzzle. The pieces are sturdy and easy to manipulate, the images are cute, and the pouch is convenient. I'm amazed how well this puzzle holds his focus, and any toy I can say that about for a toddler is a winner!
My kiddo loved these stickers!  Arrived on time and a good variety of stickers.  Peeling them off was easy enough for him too.

I bought this for a 5 year old's birthday.  He loved it and played with the stickers for hours and made up stories about the scenes he created with the stickers.  It is not an album, you will have to take the stickers out and use a piece of paper.  Would make a nice little gift or stocking stuffer.
the no. of stickers are less than what i expected. i will not recommend it to my friends, disappointed ><~
summary: will not purchase this item again

reviewText: Fun stickers that my two year old loves!  The trucks are adorable and make for great reward stickers. Great for the price.
This was a great party activity for my 3 year old's birthday! We had the kids put these stickers on their cups
summary: Was great for my 3 year old's birthday!

reviewText: These are great stickers for older toddlers who are into construction vehicles.  However, there are only 2-3 good-size construction vehicle stickers per page and the rest are tiny stickers, like construction cones, signs, etc. Note: These are actual stickers, NOT the re-usable kind that you can decorate pages with, remove and use again. This is not a "sticker book", just a small book of sticker sheets.  Not really worth the price in my opinion, although my toddler loves them and they were under $10.
summary: Very Small, Only 2-3 Good Size Stickers Per Page

reviewText: The ethnic diversity of the dancers in this book made my niece very happy. She kept saying that looking at the ballerinas in the book makes her feel like she's looking at her ballet class.
summary: My seven year old niece loved it!

reviewText: I ordered these for my sons birthday, they were a huge hit! The robots are very sturdy and well made. The kids loved them!

The sweet four year old mermaid in training in our life loved this crown collection.  Her parents plan on taking them along to restaurants for her to color in.  I thought it was the perfect party activity/favor.
summary: Perfect gift for a budding mermaid!

reviewText: I bought these masks for a robot themed birthday party. They were just okay visually, and none of the kids wanted to color one. I should've passed on this one. Maybe they would be better for a child who really loves robots and detailed coloring projects.
These were better than expected.  Great quality, great color. So cute indeed. Size is perfect, and they keep my little 17 month olds attention.  She has really been learning from them. Love them.

This is a good product and just what I wanted for my 1-year-old who is interested in magnets. They are recommended for ages 3+, and I think I should have followed that guideline. He still puts everything in his mouth and chewed a few letters. When he chewed them, little shreds of magnet and wood made it into his mouth (of course). When he's older, these will be perfect.
summary: Good magnets, but I should have followed the age guidelines.

reviewText: Great magnets for my 13 month old who likes to chew. They withstand her handling and she is able to hold them easily and put them back on the fridge.
summary: Great magnets for my 13 month old who likes to ...

reviewText: recommend to all young parents,well manufactured.bright colors to attract child.  Can be stored in box. Child can readily access the letters.

I wanted to get something special for my Robert. He is all over the place with boundless energy. One of the best ways to calm him is to give him something to keep his mind working.There is no better way to quiet down his body than to hand him stickers and a sticker book. It is like a chalk board and chalk but with that there are too many endless possibilities.Not with stickers and matching books!.Kids love stickers. They love books to paste their stickers in them too!  You can't go wrong with stickers.My Robert sat in the same chair for 30 minutes trying to figure out where to stick the red trick or the blue one in his sticker book!Stickers are cheap, they are fun and require no electricity or game board.
summary: Ohhh, stickers! What kid doesn't like them!

reviewText: A beautiful magnet set.  Magnets are a nice thickness and great to re-create Eric Carle stories, group/sort, or just interact with animal names/sounds.  The colourful magnets are a hit with our 19 month old and I'm sure will entertain for years to come.
Bought for 3 year old grandson who is huge hungry caterpillar fan. Clips on container a great idea too. Would recommend.

I just redid our playroom and Eric Carle figures predominately in our decorations and activities.  These magnets are adorable.  They are fantastic on their own, but even better if your children are fans of his books as they can make connections between the magnets and the books.  Some are pretty small, so I would keep an eye on those under 3 just to be safe.
This set arrived right on time and in great condition.  The pieces are a perfect size and very colorful. Perfect for the age group.
summary: Erice Carle Shapes Wood Magnetic Sets - LOVE :)

reviewText: I love these and so do my daughter. Brown bear brown bear is her fav book. However she does chew on them and the paper comes off. So ... I guess they will be saved for later. I'm editing this to say outright that they say that this magnet is for 3+ years. I'm in no way being negative. They know their product and they are right. Definitely not for 3 and under.
summary: Beautiful and fun but not for under 3

reviewText: These magnets are great, but the description says there are 40 pieces and the package only contains 35.In my opinion, they should have included the teacher and children to complete Brown Bear, Brown Bear, another section of food and the cocoon to complete The Very Hungry Caterpillar, and a zebra and boa constrictor to complete Polar Bear, Polar Bear.
summary: Set could be better  - Only 35 pieces not 40

reviewText: When planning for a road trip this summer, I decided to make themed activity bags for my 5 year old son.  I was looking for travel-friendly activities that would be easy to pack, and these robot finger puppets exceeded my expectations.  They were much thicker and sturdier than I was expecting, and large enough for small hands to easily manipulate without being bulky.  By just asking him a few questions about the robots (How do you think this robot feels?  What is he thinking?  Which robots are best friends?  What are they doing today?  Where are the robots going on their trip? etc.), he started acting out stories with the finger puppets.  They held up for the entire trip, and popped out from time to time to do shows for us. I'm sure they won't last forever, but they did much better than I was expecting. We've added these to our travel toy stash, but I could also see these being a great party favor or other small gift.I love Mudpuppy, and once again, I'm thrilled with their product!
summary: Sturdier than expected, and great for travel!

reviewText: Love these! My 2 year old does too. Great thick wood and magnet, had them for a few months now and they are still going strong!
These are great magnets and hold up.  Only wish would be that they are a little larger.  They can easily get swept under the refrigerator.
What a great classic toy.  We also have the letter ones like this.  My daughter loves to play with them and won't ever tire from them.  Would definitely recommend!
Students have enjoyed using these magnets to help retell several Eric Carle books.  Also the magnets great for sorting activities.

WE bought these for a huge magnet board which my wife built for our 2-year-old daughter. Our little one loves the Very Hungry Caterpillar and other Carle books, so she loves these. They seem well-built and the cardboard box with snaps on the top is also durable and very handy for storage. Would buy again.

As you can see on my title the capital "i" looks like a lower case "L"  That is exactly how the letter looks in the box and this will be confusing later on since the capital "i" that is taught in schools doesn't look like a lower case "L".  Other than that letter they are strong, magnetic and my daughter loves them. You get some extra of some letters.
summary: Love all but the upper case "i"

reviewText: I have really enjoyed reading Eric Carle with my 15 month old, and finding out he wrote more than The Very HUngry Caterpillar.When I saw these I just had to get them, more for me than my daughter!Lovely designs, and full back magnet - not small attachments that can fall out.  Layered paper/wood cut outs.  Safe non - toxic vegetable based inks.My daughter has not chewed them but I guess they would sustain some damage if you had a chewy child.
My grandchild loved this. She was soon spelling out words on the refrigerator. Sturdy, attractive, with good, strong, well-attached magnets.

My son has recently been facinated with magnets, so we purchased this for his 1st birthday.  We have placed them on our fridge for him to play with while we're in the kitchen or out on the back porch.  I was a little shocked by the size of the magnets - I anticapted they would be bigger than they are.  I had to move a few higher up on the frigde so he can't get to them because I think they are just too small for a 1 year old to play with.  The larger magnets (they are all different sizes depending on the type of animal) are better sizes.  The box they come in is nice and could probably be used to store the magents or something else.  The magents themselves are wonderful, as they represent a ton of animals in the colorful Eric Carle signature way.
summary: Nice magnets, some a little small

reviewText: These are great!  My 1-year-old loves the fun colors!  We only look at point to them at this stage in the game.  They are definitely too small for younger children.  I agree with the age recommendation.So far, they are very durable and look great on the fridge.

These letters are absolutely adorable and I much prefer them gracing the front of my fridge over the standard plastic ones. They have pretty colors and patterns and the magnet covers the entire back side of the letters. However, I didn't really think about the fact that, due to being lowercase, they'd have dots for the "i"s and "j"s. The dots are not attached to the letters and are itty bitty (1/3" x 1/3"). I imagine they'll be lost very quickly, and I'm kind of disappointed about that. Overall, though, the fact that these are wooden and ridiculously cute outweighs the fact that our "i"s and "j"s will soon (inevitably) be dotless.
summary: Adorable letters with very tiny pieces

reviewText: My litlle one is just at an age where they are trying to pull everything off the fridge, so I thought they might like this magnent set. PROS: Magnents are super cute. They are very sturdy. The magnent backing is strong enough to stay in place through trips to the fridge, but not so strong my baby can't manipulate them freely. CONS: Half the peices are very small. My baby still puts everything in thier mouth, so I had to pull out the bigger animal pieces and put the smaller ones up. I can' t fault the company though, they cleary say it is for ages three and up. So as our little one gets older we'll just add a few here and there until they can play with them all.

These are super cute stencils.  Bought for my girls - 3 and 6 years old and both of them love them.  There are flowers, butterflies, gardening tools, etc.  Very cute designs.  The stencils are made out of really thick cardboard and so far have held up just fine.
These are adorable and well made. Fun  animals that any child will love. Hold very well on any magnetic surface.
I think our grandson will like it.  It is a novel idea and I hope the company will have more catagories in the future.
This is a gift, and looks awesome. I think any child that had an interest in drawing. It will show HOW to mirror an image to build grey matter in the kidd-o's.
we love mudpuppy, the puzzles are such great quality, and i enjoy them as much as my kids do. plan  on buying more soon

As always, so so happy with Mudpuppy Puzzles. I like this size since the pieces are still big enough for my 3.5 year old to work alone, but there are more pieces so he is challenged longer. I bought this puzzle for my son, it was the only 42 piece Mudpuppy available at the time, but I was pleasantly surprised to find it was not totally girly like the picture of the box would have you believe ( not that my son would have cared). Yes, it is a puzzle featuring a girl at a tea party, but the array of animals and cakes in the picture are so colorful and varied, they steal the show- and create a festive and joyful vibe to the puzzle overall.Mudpuppy puzzles are colorful, have sturdy pieces that fit and stay together while small and sometimes uncoordinated hands try to fit the puzzle together (and try and try again to fit the pieces in). The boxes are durable and attractive to store and carry the puzzles. We have many different puzzles at our house, but the Mudpuppy puzzles are the ones my son picks up and plays with over and over and over again (without fussing that the pieces wont stay together).
summary: Such a fan of Mudpuppy Puzzles

reviewText: My 5 yr old son loves puzzles and I was happy to find one that came in a nice tin box vs a card box. The pictures are nice and vibrant , the puzzle pieces are sturdy and the 100 pcs is the perfect challenge for him right now. I got him two so far and plan to get him more.

Got this puzzle for my 4 year old daughter.  She loves it.  The puzzle is made with nice thick cardboard that is sturdy and can take a beating.  The pieces fit together well, very satisfying.  Also the picture is very nice, with good colors and detail - no boring stretches of same colored pieces.
My granddaughter loves all things Babar.  Hard to find things other than books and stuffed animals in the U.S. so I jumped all over this when I saw it quite by accident.

I bought this for my 22 month old grandson for an airplane trip.  He loves the book and  loved the magnets.  We put them away untul the trip but know he will love them since he did when he first opened the tin.  He is a little young for "scenes" but I feel he will grow into it more in a few months.  My daughter and I loved the storage tin, it was well made and will store the magnets.I recommend it to any child who loves the book!

A really fun idea for those who love the book! I was a little disappointed in the size of this product. The scenes from the book and the size of the magnets don't allow for much imaginative play. The magnets are very flimsy, too. My son has barely shown any interest in it. I'm hoping that will change bc I think it's cool!

My 4 year old loves this magnet set! He loves that the magnets look like the characters in his book (Goodnight Construction Site).  I didn't notice any weird smell like one of the reviews mentioned. This is the perfect gift for a little boy!

My son is a major fan of goodnight goodnight construction site. And this toy has all of the characters. But what it doesn't have is a lot of space use the magnets; they all end up on top of each other. I thought it could be a good car toy, but there's no way for a 3 year old to handle the large amount of magnet since they all can't be in the scene at the same time. The product is cute, but I wouldn't purchase it again.
My son loves his magnets and matches them up to the book every time we read it. I would have given it five stars but the tin is flimsy.

What can you say, it's an amazing story so what better way for your kids to interact with the characters than with this magnetic set. My 2 year old boy absolutely loves it so when he opened this up Christmas morning, he had it opened in no time and playing around with it. So that's the why with this purchase.As another review has mentioned, the magnets are thin, but I honestly don't know what they were expecting. It's no different than the magnet you get from a dentist with their number on it or anything similar. They are relatively strong, strong enough to hold the different scenes up on the fridge. Speaking of scenes, as in the description there are 4 of them. They are on the flip side of two pieces of paper stock with a highly glossed surface. They've got some stiffness to them, but still can be bent/creased, so beware if your little one has a knack for that.I've added 2 customer submitted photos. One just shows the scene card along with all the magnets and the second one shows some magnets "set" in a scene. One really cool thing about this is that the tin container is magnetic so it can be taken with you on the go for the kids to play along with whether it's in the car or at grandma and grandpa's house.Summary: For the price it's a good value. The magnets are of high quality, the scenes are really cool and the nice tin just adds to that value. This set has had a nice workout on our fridge for the last month or so. If you're on the fence, I'd definitely get a set. It just adds that much more to the story since we've used them to reenact it.

Smaller than I thought it would be and not all the pieces can be used at the same time--the kids love it though. All pieces come ready to be punched out for use. One of the children used the scrap leftover from punching like a puzzle. All pieces can be stored in the metal container.

My son loves the book so we got him these magnets as a birthday gift. I read a previous review that there was an awful smell coming from the magnets, but it might have been a fluke because we didn't experience that. I opened and inspected the magnets before wrapping them, and the magnets look great and have all of the trucks he loves so much from the book. Can't wait for him to open them for his birthday!
My 2 year old Grandson loves theses magnets because they go along with his favorite book, as we read the book he finds the magnet to match!

Hey,Like most of you, my sons LOVE this book and so this seemed like the perfect gift. It really is a wonderful idea but the smell from the box or the magnets themselves is SO bad that I can't sit near it.Not sure how to remove the smell, but it's horrible.
My son was playing now!Very fun to us too! It's interactive and very good to my son learn how mount the block puzzle.We want more about Little Prince!

Have always loved the Little Prince artwork and bought the block puzzle for my grandsons. Disappointed not in the style but the fact it was a cardboard block not the traditional wood maybe this is an enviromental decision but plantation pine would have been fine.
This is a good replica of the Andy Warhol soup can series. It's only 200 pieces, but fun to make.

If your child loves the Small Prince he will be delighted:)Me and my son like everything about these blocks (yes they are cardboard but i'm ok with that). He isn't really interested in making a puzzle himself so far, because it's a 3-dimensional task here. So i do it for him and he wathes happily and helps a little. I think in couple of months he will start to enjoy doing it himself.The paints are nice and not too bright, they are also soy-based and probably it is not dangerous to swallow a bit.
summary: Very romantic toy and a perfect present. Great thing for kids from 2.5 y.o.

reviewText: how can you go wrong with America's preeminent artist holding up your grocery list and reminds to pick up your meds at CVS? no you can't.

These magnets are great and do well to withstand the aggressive play of my 20 month old.  I like that the entire back is a magnet so there is no fear of it coming loose and falling off.There are duplicates of some shapes/images in different colors which is fun as my daughter likes to match them.This is a fun, high quality magnet set.  They're not a go-to toy, but they can offer a distraction occasionally when we are in the kitchen.
very fas shipping, as described

We recently had a robot themed birthday party and I thought these would be cute for the kids to use to color their robot masks. When I opened the box I was surprised to find that they are just plain colored pencils. The only thing "robot" about them is the word "robots" and a little robot picture on the box. The pencils themselves are fine. They are functional and the triangle shape seems good for my preschooler, but for price I could've bought another set of plain colored pencils (or 2 or 3 sets). I did try searching other websites to see if I could find a picture of what the actual pencils looked like. When I couldn't find anything I decided to take a chance and just get them. I am disappointed. They are just colored pencils.
i was very disappointed with the quality of this item.  They are made of cardboard.  I think this is very over priced for the quality/

The puppets are really well executed. The material is great and the case is perfect. I gave this as a birthday gift to a friend (adult) who has been a fan of the Little Prince all his life and he loved it!
summary: Excellent gift (both for children and adults)

reviewText: Details are too thin to be convenient and pleasant for kids. They are made from a plastic-magnetic sheet pre-cut before packaging. I expected to see at least 1/4 inch thick details that are usual for kid mosaics.Pre-school teachers can use it but kids will not be inspired with it.
summary: Not a mosaic for little kids

reviewText: I have to hide this from my son in order for him to stop playing with this. If your child is a "Brown Bear" fan, this is a must have!
summary: Love this toy, but wish it was a little bigger

reviewText: Graphic is a little complicated for a 12 piece puzzle! There's a lot going on... But my son still loves it :)
summary: Not as simple as it looks!

reviewText: These puzzles are colorful and fun but the very best things are they are easier to store than the usual box most puzzles come in.  With the large size of some toys these pouches are a breeze.  Secondly, they are very easy to take along when you travel, don't take up tons of space.  Also not so large that you can even use in a restaurant while waiting for food. Wish they made them with more pieces as we are on the verge of outgrowing.
Daughters love it! My 3, 5 & 7 year olds love it.  Great to take in the car or to a restaurant to keep them occupied.
My granddaughter loves Toy Story and she loved this coloring book. It will provide a lot of entertainment for her. Arrived as expected in excellent condition.
Beautiful board!

The Enchanted Spellboard is wonderfully illustrated. However, the actual board itself isn't as durable as The Pathfinder or The Psychic Circle. The material the board is made of is somewhat flimsy, but it still works well.

i just got done using it. im alittle uncomfortable.i asked it did it have any important messages for me first it pointed to a tree.laurel then i said elaborate then it went to present then i said elaborate then it went to near.then i said goodbye.then a few minutes i got it back out and asked it did it mean me any harm it landed between enlightment and abundance.then then  i put the indicator in the middle that what i do on each question.then it went to right twice.it tells you how to cast spells.nothing bad but still thats a little too much for me.i like psychic circle the best.never played the pathfinder.its so expensive.
summary: i feel a tingle alot of times i use it.

reviewText: this was an answer for his studies for an eighth grader who needed a course that covered Health that was needed to complete his work load

I am a certified secondary teacher of 10 years. I also have taught adults for the last 4+ years. I am certified literacy specialist & Academically Gifted certified teacher for 5 + years. In my career I've  spent years examining many programs for various schools systems looking for quality cost effective programs that were user friendly to teachers and provided strong results for students,.Now that I am teaching my own children I have chosen Switched on Schoolhouse because of the complete product it provides. The lessons, projects, quizzes, tests, games, video's, research projects, internet clips, and teaching tips are high quality. The program also provides a progress report, grade book, an adjustable school calendar, transcripts, and a report card.As the teacher I get quality feed back to see what I need to help my student(s) re-learn or fast forward them if they already mastered a concept. This is a high quality full service product that aligns well with the federal standards of the New Common Core, and even better prepares my students well for college. I grateful I can use this program at home, but I REALLY wish I could also use it in the public schools!
summary: Master Teacher Critical Reviews of product

reviewText: I won't waste my time going into reviewing the interface quality for a program at this price point; let's just say there is more to be desired.  What I am writing about today is about the quality of customer service you can expect from this company.  They tout themselves as Christians but are more like thieves.  Whenever you purchase software you are in essence licensing the software itself not the media on which it is printed.  I had just purchased this product and had accidently scratched the CD shortly after opening it (accidents happen).  I called the company and was able to produce the receipt proving that I had just purchased their product, I also told them the truth about what had happened (I wish I would have lied at this point).  I was told that they had to charge me almost the full price of the CD to replace it!  I was shocked!!!!  I told them that I purchased the content on the CD and not the CD itself and that I did not mind paying a processing fee for a new one but that cost should be minimal.  They forwarded my call to a manager who ended up calling me a day later to tell me that they would have to charge the full replacement price for the CD.  I told them that this was the last year my child would be using their product and I would let everyone else know what kind of service they offer.  I do not recommend doing business with a company whose only goal is scrape every penny from your bank account.  Christians?  Yea Right!!!
summary: Any they call themselves Christians... more like thieves...

reviewText: The idea of a program completely on the computer was appealing to me as a first time home-schooling mom.  I bought this curriculum (2008 version) for both my 7th and 8th graders.  We all found the program very constrictive and quite honestly, just plain irritating!  We struggled with having the right concept, sometime even answering with synonyms and the computer still telling us the answer was wrong.  In a few cases more than one word is acceptable but if you are not on track with their line of thinking - you can be close but not close enough.  I would have to use the parent password to figure out what EXACT answer was needed.  I do mean EXACT - spelling, plural/non-plural, no synonyms, spell the number or numeric...I agree that in certain subjects spelling should be correct but sometimes learning a new concept you just need to get the concept and grasp the spelling later - even partial credit would be nice -but not with SOS. There was way more hands on involvement than I expected - I would have rather used paper/pencil workbooks like by 2nd and 3rd graders used.  After paying 600 dollars for both grades we struggled through but I definitely will not buy this curriculum again.
I love it because the SOS curriculum is working great for my son; and I found it on Amazon at a good price.I like the Teacher tools the SOS software provides.Very easy to use and good helps.
Hard to figure out. I never used it. I did the code thing. Then it was like for a teacher to student.

When answering a 3 digit multiplication problem (3 on top & on bottom) or long division, it takes much longer to do when you have to click on & enter each digit in each block.  I like Teaching Textbooks Math better.  We like everything else SOS has, but the MATH needs less detailed answer blocks - just the answers are necessary (they have to use a scratch paper anyway).
summary: Each digit in each block can get tedious

reviewText: Great program. I really like how it tests and grades "concepts/categories." It allows you to see precisely the areas where your child is weak and where he excels.

I wasn't sure how to make it work. Should have clearer instructions. I installed it, and even found a sample lesson. However I didn't find the placement testing part. As much as I loved SOS, I didn't end up getting it because I wanted to see if he would be better off with all 5th grade materials or if he could do higher in some subjects.
These cards are easy to handle and the lines that make the letters are a good width for little fingers to trace.

Most tactile or sand paper letters are more expensive, so they are great for the price.  I wish that the letters included handwriting arrows.  I would have given 5 stars for this, but it's easy enough to do this yourself.

As a mother of five homeschooled children, I have always been a fan of AOP.  My three oldest are now in college, but my youngest still use SOS for PC.  I only wish they had a MAC version.  Years ago, I used the workbooks.  I was thrilled when they came up with the computer version.  Every year, it gets better.  Again, they just need to make a version for the MAC.  Reviewer #2 may not realize you can set the program for easy spelling, then it will only deduct points on a mispelled problem and not count it as completely wrong.  YOU set up how harshly it grades your students.  Go into the teacher mode and where you set the grade percentages, check EASY SPELLING.As for their customer service, they used to be in Chandler, Arizona and they were wonderful.  The techs stayed on the phone with me for hours when I had computer issues when the programs first came out.  They were wonderful.  I haven't had any issues in more than a year, but I have had to talk to them a couple of times after they moved to Iowa.  Again, they were great.  Offered me free shipping and everything.  Sweet girls.I also LOVE the curriculum itself.  Vocabulary words for each lesson, spelling words, review mode, games, and just all of it.  I rearrange it a bit by placing the spelling lessons FIRST, then the regular lessons, quiz, spelling quiz, and begin again with the next spelling lesson.  Otherwise I don't think it gives the students enough time to learn the spelling words each week.  But, I have the option of moving the lessons around how I see fit.  Awesome!I would recommend Switched on Schoolhouse to ANY homeschooler.  I've been doing this a LONG time and Alpha Omega has been with me all the way.  I was a math major in college and I love the math more than Saxon (I know there are Saxon die hards out there, but move out of the last century already).  Science is packed with experiments, videos to watch if you CAN'T do them yourself, lists of things to purchase so you can; History covers the basics, all you need; Language has it all; there's even a Bible that isn't too over the top and can be used by the majority of Christian religions.All in all, I give AOP and A+ and their program a high score as well.  Only being Mac friendly could make it better.
Shipped on time. I liked the product. My son loves it. They are durable and don't wear off, long lasting and good for kids as they dont care too much on careful handling. Recommended.
These were exactly what I expected.  The only thing I wish they would do is have the vowels a different color than the rest but it isn't that big of deal.

I paid just under $15 for both upper and lower case cards.  The letters are not abrasive, but do have enough texture.  I brushed off excess sand from each card with my finger before the first use and haven't had any issues with loose sand.
summary: simple, good tool for the price

reviewText: I used these sandpaper letters in my K class. They are affordable. I don't think they last more than 1-2 years because they are on cardboard, but they are a lot more affordable than the durable sandpaper letters I've seen.

the idea is a good one, as many of our students need the tactile stimulation to support their learning.  but the letter cards are not well made and some of the letters were not glued on well and promptly fell off.

We just recieved the tactile letters in the mail. I was a little stumped, I guess they were smaller and thinner than I had imagined. I guess I had read the description and dimensions wrong, but for the amount you pay versus the other brands cost, they are worth what your paying for.

These letters are great for the price.  They are by far less expensive than the other types I looked at.  They are not good for children playing with unsupervised because they are not super durable but are great for parents to work with their kids together.  I have a child with learning differences and they are great for tracing with his finger and saying the letter and sound out loud while we trace.  I also liked the fact that both the upper and lower case come with this package.

My children enjoyed tracing the letters at 3-1/2 to 4 years of age.  At 4-1/2, they have moved on, so I got about 6-9 monhts of use out of these.  The cards are high-quality, made on card stock with sandpaper-like material where the letters are.  I would hold their fingers and trace along the letters the first few times, then they took over on their own after that.  Using the cards was a good foundation to help them learn to write their letters later.

These are great practice cards for the price.  They are made of a heavy card stock, and come with both upper, and lowercase letters.  I first looked at sandpaper letters geared toward montessori teaching, and while they were of higher quality, they were also of a much higher price.  Which if I were using them in a classroom, that would probably be the way to go.  However I am using them at home with my five year old, so they don't need to last forever.The card stock is much heavier than I expected from other reviews, and has held up great to moderate use.  The letters themselves did have excess sand on them, put after a weeks use, they are perfect.  I think the cards are a nice size to hold and trace, build words, or play matching games.

I teach first grade and bought these to use in my classroom with some children in mind that are not able to write the letters and spell the words with the same speed and accuracy as others in the class.  These are great because they are very tactile and different from writing with pen and paper or whiteboards.

my kids like them, and I like them.  better than the cut out letters, these have that sandpaper feeling, but my kids seem to enjoy tracing these letters more.  maybe its because when on a board like this, you can hold the board in one hand, and trace in the other finger.

I bought these to use at home with my son. The price was great compared to other tactile letters. The quality of the card itself is fine, but the sand on them comes off very easily. It's a mess every time we get them out. More sand comes off every time we use them. They work okay for us, but I don't think they'd hold up well in a classroom.

reviewerName: Stay at home mom to three toddlers
reviewText: These are great tactile letters for learning the alphabet. They are made out of cardstock so they bend very easily. These are good for mommy and me learning time not independent play. You cannot beat the price on these... The school supply store was charging $10 for just the uppercase letters.
This item was not at all as described. It was two sets of lowercase letters, not both upper and lowercase as described. Also the letters were white not blue.

I think these will be useful for us but are smaller than I had expected.  I should have read the product description more closely so that's on me--they're just smaller than I was picturing.The cards themselves are about 3 1/2 by 2 3/4 inches.  The letters are 1 1/4 by 2 inches and fairly narrow--the sandpaper is only about 1/4 inch wide.  They are made out of cardstock, but it's a heavy duty cardstock and feels fairly sturdy.  They're heavier than what you'd get on a playing card or a flashcard.  The quality is reasonable for the price.At any rate, I think they are a good tactile tool for learning letters and phonics.  My son likes tracing the letters with his finger.  Today we played memory with the capital and lowercase letters.  I was also able to get a good crayon rubbing with them. Although they are smaller than I had thought they would be I think they will prove to be worth the purchase.  It's a good choice if you don't want to invest in the higher quality but more expensive Montessori style letters.

As a montessori teacher I was looking for something that would be a cheaper option to the sandpaper letters. These are just ok. They are a little smaller than I was hoping for and when I got the package it was so full of sand. We've been using them and some of the "sand" has been coming off but it seems like it's getting better. I think it was just the loose sand from when it was made and than shipped.
Cute little book for beginners in German.  Very helpful, easy level.  Our professor uses this in his German 1 class.

In German class, we read this, and it was really cute! Even three years after we initially read it, we're still joking about this book and finding "Fritz" inside different stores. It's really neat. While it may seem a little silly, it'll stick with ya!
This educational movie does an excellent job of explaining Islamic religion through the eyes of several different young adults with various perspectives. It stays interesting throughout.

I loved this matching game for my granddaughter who is two even though it may say for ages 3.These are thick card board and she really enjoyed looking at the extra cute pictures and matching pictures which are exact matches. We are starting with a few sets and will add sets as she is able.These are larger than the normal matching game cards which is fun for her to view them. They come in their own storage box which slides out like a drawer.
Marvel Classic Super Heroes: A Collector's EditionThe full color book along with the 4 super hero toys made a great educational gift for the children and also added to my spouse's collection.

I bought this box while on vacation in New Orleans. I went through the entire deck and realized the book does not contain descriptions for two of the cards in the deck: Justice and the Emperor. Needless to say, a bit dissappointed. I'm glad I discovered this missing information now, that the book is missing some pages before I did a reading and was embarrassed. I'll have to check online I guess for these two orphaned cards.

Was really looking for the cards to be with a box set. Was told that it said in small print that the cards were not there, but sent as a gift and now have to re-buy this with the card included. It got there fast and good shape but missing the important part.Thanks.Buy have to buy this again 😕

Instructions are very vague and leave many important intermediate steps out, leaving the builder to guess how the paper was to be folded or which parts glue to where.Mfg age recommendation is 6 and up. No 6 year old would be able to do this without the grownup scratching their head trying to figure out how it goes together.

The Sharman-Caselli Tarot is one of my favorite decks.  A superb creation of Juliet Sharman-Burke and Giovanni Caselli, it combines the best features of the popular Rider-Waite-Smith (RWS) Tarot with elements of classic decks such as the Visconti-Sforza Tarot and Marseilles Tarot.  However, how does the mini version included in the Tarot Box fare?  Not as well as I would have wished, yet if you loved the Sharman-Caselli Tarot you may still consider to give this kit a try.As I hinted, the transition of the Sharman-Caselli Tarot to the mini format (3.375 x 2 inches) was not the best it could have been.  For example, there is a very small blurring effect in the art's line work.  But the most glaring mistake is on the cutting of the cards, as it seems that the face and back of some are off centered in my deck.If you are not familiar with the Sharman-Caselli Tarot, this deck is based on the RWS Tarot, with inspiration from older decks such as the Tarot of Marseilles and the Visconti-Sforza.  Like the RWS Tarot, the imagery throughout the Sharman-Caselli Tarot depicts the renaissance era, but done with seemingly realistic art filled with soft colors.The Major Arcana is mostly inspired on the RWS Tarot, with a few exceptions.  The Wheel of Fortune shows a wheel with four people at the top, bottom and sides and a blind-folded women in its center, definitely drawing inspiration from the Visconti-Sforza Tarot, while The Lovers shows a finely dressed man deciding between two women with cupid floating over his head, an imagery more akin to the Marseilles Tarot.  The Minor Arcana are fully illustrated and inspired on the RWS Tarot.In a nod to the Visconti-Sforza tarot, the Major Arcana are unnumbered.  If you pay attention to the order of the Major Arcana you will find the following:  The Fool, The Magician, The Empress, The Emperor, The High Priestess, The Hierophant, The Lovers, The Chariot, Justice, Temperance, Strength, The Hermit, The Wheel of Fortune, The Hanged Man, Death, The Devil, The Tower, The Star, The Moon, The Sun, Judgement, and The World.  This is the order to study the Tarot recommended by Sharman-Burke.  This was included inThe New Complete Book of Tarot, but missing from the mini Tarot book included in this kit.The book in this kit is titled Tarot: Learn How To Read The Cards.  This is a small 3 x 3 inches pocket book, but at a count of 336 pages I doubt anyone would carry it in his/her pocket.  The book is divided as follows:What is Tarot?Getting to Know Your DeckThe Major ArcanaThe Minor ArcanaHow to Read the CardsYour first ReadingsTaking it FurtherIn all, this book is a larger version of a Little White Book.  You get a brief history of Tarot and then some.  To my surprise, there is even a description on how to play Trumps with the cards.  I never considered using a Tarot deck for playing games before, but at the smaller size, the cards are very well suited for playing.Three pages are spent for each card: one page for the image and "Key Issues", another for "Symbolism" and the last one for "In A Reading" use.  The final sections include layouts such as The Pyramid (5 cards), The Horseshoe (5 cards), and the Celtic Cross (10 cards).The silliest part of this kit is the 9 puzzle pieces Layout Board.  It includes The Pyramid in one side and The Horseshoe.  Honestly, with a few bucks, I think you could do better with a fold out plastic coated photocopy of well decorated layout of your own preference.This is not a bad kit to start with.  However, if your budget is tight or you are just testing the tarot waters, you may also considerTarot to Go!.  If you are a tarot collector or reader, you may want to spend just a bit more and buyThe Sharman-Caselli Tarot Deckinstead, but beware that the card stock on this deck is of a slightly inferior quality than decks from Us Games Inc, Llewellyn or even LoScarabeo.

This kit offers a great introduction to dinosaurs for little boys. The six glow-in-the-dark dinosaurs roam our Lego landscapes, scale the sofa and are frequently "contraband" at bedtime -- our boys love how these dinosaur skeletons glow.The folding dinorama has plenty of information for beginners and intermediate learners. The ilustrations are colorful, too. We bought this for our 4-year old and 5-year old boys. While we spend more time practicing our dinosaur roars now, the kit has plenty to offer to keep it interesting as they grow older.
summary: Two boys' review: Glow-in-the-dark dinosaurs?!?  Yeah!!

reviewText: I am a librarian and Mercy Watson is a pig in a story. The students in first grade really like the story. So, for my special friends I have given them as a gift the book and the pig.
summary: Mercy Watson stuffed pig and book series

reviewText: I believe it is easier to buy a kite than make one. It was fun making it. But the kite wouldn't fly.

Did research on Robotix products and thought I could pick some up on Amazon.  Saw this product, and as listed in the Robotix catalog is supposed to come with a large bag of parts.  So when I saw the price I thought it was a real bargain. But when it was received, in fact it was just the book -- no parts.  When I called the Robotix company to tell them the story I got the real deal: ends up that in fact there is only ONE distributor of Robotix items -- Robotix itself.  Any other time you see them for sale -- like at Amazon -- it's either a re-sale, something is missing, or the company selling will be "suddenly out of stock" and then they will steer you towards a similar item, but not genuine Robotix.  So, yes, this was listed under BOOKS, but as sold by Robotix it was *supposed* to be more.  So while not entirely a cheat, this sale was not entirely on the level, either.
REALLY MAKES THE BOOKS COME ALIVE FOR MY THIRD GRADERS. THE BO0KS ARE GREAT FOR USE IN THE COMMON CORE: COMPARING THE SAME OR SIMILAR CHARACTERS BY THE SAME AUTHOR.
The quality and colors look good.  My mom is  huge Frank Lloyd Wright fan and she is planning on completing the puzzle and framing it.
We always do a family puzzle @ Christmas and are fans of FLWright's work.  This puzzle was reasonably challenging, with bright sturdy pieces.  Definitely recommend.

This puzzle is very pretty. I'm even debating trying to get it framed somehow. Overall, the puzzle is well made (thick and sturdy pieces) and the color vibrant. For those who like difficult puzzles, this was fairly challenging and took a bit of time to complete. Of course, it wasn't impossible either so I was not discouraged while completing it. I would recommend this to anyone who loves art and puzzles.

My 5 year old granddaughter loves the Mercy Watson books.  On a recent visit, we gave her this Mercy Watson stuffed animal. She just hugged it and carried it around and took it to bed with her.  She had it right beside her when she was reading one of her Mercy Watson books.  It is a good size and made of very nice material.  It looks like Mercy is smiling.  I would purchase this again and highly recommend it.  I'd buy a book to go along with the stuffed animal if your grandchild or child does not have the books.
This is a great puzzle.  It's challenging but fun, is very well made, and the colors are bright and beautiful.

Positive:  Colors were true to photo and of good quality.Con: (this was a biggie)  The cardboard layers were delaminating and splitting.  Puzzle was abandoned due to poor quality before it was complete.  This really took the joy out of it.Puzzles by other companies (Pomegranite and Ravensburger) have been better quality.May order from this manufacturer again hoping that this was a 'fluke'
Nice quality, very fun to do.  Actually had this one hanging on my wall for a long time until it was lost in the move.  So, had to purchase it again

I got this puzzle for my boyfriend for Christmas. He is a huge Frank Lloyd Wright fan. He loved this puzzle so much he glued it together and framed it. It was a fun puzzle that moves right along. It isn't super challenging, but it does have a few twists. I think any person that enjoys puzzles would enjoy this one.
summary: Wonderful puzzle with high quality finish and materials

reviewText: The boyfriend and I have been looking for a puzzle to work on during breakfast every morning. We were thinking a piece a day, but it turned into a wonderful activity for every meal! We had that puzzle laid out on our kitchen table and worked on it for about a month (we are busy grad students!). We enjoyed every minute of it and now it is framed and hanging in our living room. Great activity to do with your significant other/family -- you won't be disappointed. The pieces are sturdy, so great for kids (or messy boyfriends)!
summary: Challenging and beautiful design and product!

reviewText: This puzzle is great!  I was planning to glue this to hang as art but managed to lose a couple of pieces while putting it together! :(  I may end up purchasing another down the road so that I can do that.  The colors are gorgeous and I feel the material construction of the puzzle pieces is high quality.  I would definitely purchase this brand of puzzle again.

This puzzle is really nice. can't wait to put it together. it loos difficult but it will be a challenge. but I used to do jigsaw puzzles growing up. so no I am going to start them again. they are relaxing to do.
This is a great quality puzzle. The pieces produce very little dust and lock together nicely. It's a great puzzle and will hld up for years.
we received this item fast, nice packaging. and my daughter was so excited. now she has mercy what's in your arms as well as her books.

Very challenging. Pomegranate excels at puzzle making. The pieces cleanly and tightly fit together. You can actually lift the entire puzzle up off the table when complete. Most excellent craftsmanship. I only look for the Pomegranate name now. Art is wonderful!!
Only a 1000 pieces but quite challenging and a great picture when completed. Give it a try.  You won't be disappointed
I SENT IT TO MY DAUGHTER AND SHE LOVED IT HER FAMILY PUT IT TOGATHER IN 3 DAYS IT Was a tptal success
All Pomegranate puzzles are exceptional, and to have one offered as a Edward Gorey selection was a gotta-have!!! Thank You
this is a ton of fun and keeps my brain active and busy !  the art work is so much better and prettier to look at and enjoy than the regular puzzles out there -

We got this puzzle as a present and it was the perfect for the whole family.  We all got to working and put this put the puzzle together over the next few weeks.  We all worked on it from my 9 year old to my teenager to my 84 yo grandmother.  We enjoyed the beautiful vibrant colors, the good quality cardboard, the precise cuts.  This was a quality puzzle with a beautiful picture.  It was addicting and we all were able to fit the puzzle pieces.  When we were ready to finish the puzzle, we found that we had lost one piece.  We were heart broken.  We contacted the company and they replace the puzzle piece.  We loved this puzzle and we loved working with the company.
summary: great quality, great fun, great company

reviewText: great fun. Well made and fun to have different sections ( read dogs) for 3 or more people to work on at once. Great for holiday times!
This was a fun puzzle to do.  Best quality puzzle I've run across, too.  Love it, love it, love it.

First of all, Pomengranate Puzzles create a very high quality product.  The pieces are sturdy, the finish on the pieces is high quality and I bet it would last forever, or close enough.  This is a great puzzle for intermediate jigsaw puzzlers - lots of different areas to focus on, no endless blue skies to drive you mad, and regularly cut pieces.  It's good fun for an experienced person, too, simply because it is so amusing.  Close up, it's an astonishing painting and a fantastic puzzle.  It's my favorite puzzle I've ever done.

We loved assembling this puzzle because first of all the Pomegranate puzzles are very thick and interlocking and the cool dog image was challenging but fun. The border was enjoyable to put together and the large variety of bright colors allowed our family to separate the pieces into big areas on the table where individuals could work on the puzzle together. We are buying more Pomegranate puzzles now, Amazon has a great selection!
This is very colorful with lots of patterns...there are easy areas and difficult ones which made it fun to do.
Hard as all get-out, but a fun puzzle to do! Get this one if you want a challenge! Shipped in 2 days. No complaints here.

Every one of the 1,000 pieces was there.  I worked on it for a couple of months, a few minutes a day, my son helped me a LOT!  Anyways, we finished, felt REALLY good about the success, then I pasted it together, placed on black foamboard, and display on a shelf in the bedroom.  Love it!  I'll never say, "wish I hadn't done that puzzle."  Nope. Always proud that I did.
This is such a fun puzzle. Our family loves all of Carl Larsson's paintings so it is fun to work on a puzzle with his art!
This puzzle is made with great quality.  Pieces are heavy duty, thick, and lock together very well.  Worth the spend.

We have numerous Pomegranate ArtPiece puzzles.  My daughter and I loved our first one and added many to our collection.  This puzzle is of very high quality, beautiful printing and pieces are thick and durable.  Can definitely recommend the quality of all the Pomegranate ArtPiece puzzles.  On the other hand, this particular puzzle is very challenging, more so than all the others in our collection.  We had been actively working on it for a couple of weeks, but reached a point where we had almost 1/2 of the puzzle completed but then got frustrated and took a break.  So there it sat all splayed out on our dining room table for more weeks to come. The difficulty lies in the pink/white flowers.  Like most painting puzzles, the colors blend together or change quickly so it's hard to discern the pieces when they all look alike.  We're back to it again and hope to finish it in the next few weeks. And although we always take apart our puzzles (after admiring our handy work for a few days), this one we're contemplating framing because it took us so long to assemble.

I love this puzzle.  But then I love Larsson's art.  I would have gone 5-stars but some of the pieces were incompletely cut which leads to a few tears (that is the ripping kind, rather than the dripping kind) on the edges of the pieces.  I found it to be a moderately challenging puzzle and am basically very happy with it.

I was thrilled to find a puzzle of a Mexican artist like Diego Rivera, so I didn't thin twice about buying it.  Overall this puzzle is a lot of fun because the image has a lot of detail and many pieces are unique.  Some parts are also challenging especially the dark areas.  The puzzle is made of good quality materials and has a nice matte finish.  It will be hanging on my wall soon.Puzzle size when finished is 29 x 20 in. / 73.7 x 50.8 cm.
summary: great puzzle and only of a Mexican artist that I've seen.

reviewText: Beautiful puzzle. I am going to save it and hang it. The quality is not as good as ravensberg but still a great puzzle. I wish there was more puzzles of the great artist. I would like to see some salvador dali or friada kalo.

reviewText: I concur with the description provided on the box containing this puzzle.  This is a  "thoughtfully conceived and engagingly intricate" puzzle.  The interlocking, non-glare pieces are precisely cut and easily manipulated.  I would have no hesitation in buying any other Pomegranate Artpiece puzzle within the featured artists series.

I got this for my Mother.  She enjoyed putting it together.  I loved looking at this work anytime I went to the D.I.A
summary: Best part of Detroit Institute of Arts .

reviewText: It's as simple as that: Edward Gorey equals wonderful nonsence.  I've been a fan for 40+ years and will remain so for another 40 if I last that long.
Great artwork and the puzzle piece quality is very good. Good interlock, tactile feel, good stiff board and little or no crumbs.

This is my second Charley Harper puzzle from this manufacturer. I love Mr. Harper's designs. The puzzle was much more difficult than the first puzzle I worked. All the blank blue space makes it a real challenge. Luckily, it's so good looking I don't mind having it sitting out in my room.
The pieces fit perfectly and it's quite challenging, especially because the blue sky has no different hues. The finishes product looks great!
This Charley Harper puzzle is very challenging and it has all the birds listed and identified on the back of the box. Love this puzzle!

My wife and I are working on this 1000-piece jigsaw puzzle and it's tough!  Lots of blue background and stars.  We're having fun with it, but it's going to take a while to finish it.  The Charley Harper original is beautiful.

Harper's illustrations are detailed and beautiful in their simplistic design. Lots of clear lines and detail with a good mix of open space. This is the second puzzle i've bought with his designs and I couldnt be happier with how they look.The puzzle quality on the other hand left a lot to be desired. The pieces are cut with such small margins that when i received the puzzle many of the pieces had "appendages" that had broken off. This leave holes between the pieces and makes it really difficult to a) find the right piece match & b) get the pieces to stay together.I'd be okay with a couple here and there, but i've counted a couple dozen so far. Bottom line: Great illustration, terrible quality. Maybe wait for Harper to use someone else besides Pomegranate.
Loved the puzzle.  It came quickly and was exactly as described and pictured. I'd recommend this puzzle to anyone looking to pass the time on a rainy day.  It would look great framed as well.
although it was a real pain to do the totally blue sky, it came out really nice and now it is framed and hang on my living room wall!
I love Charley Harper, and Pomegranate puzzles never disappoint. Very high quality. I love the matte finish. I always order this brand.

My family really enjoyed working on this one together. It has a good mix of easier sections (birds) and really challenging ones (nearly monochromatic sky). The only disappointment was finding that the original artwork had been cropped- probably to fit a conventional aspect ratio for puzzles.
This is a really well-made puzzle. Pieces are sturdy and the cuts are clean. The artist's graphics are beautiful. I have bought several puzzles by Charley Harper and love them!
This is a super gift, though now I want to keep it for self!  Great opportunity to share the artwork of one of my favorite artists, and particularly adaptive to a puzzle.  Glad I bought it.

This is the only puzzle I've ever given up on!  Once we finished about three quarters of it, the blue background made it difficult, having to try hundreds of pieces for each spot because there is no variation in the color, but the real difficulty came when we realized that there was not just one piece for each spot - multiple pieces could fit.  We got to the point of having an open spot, but not a single remaining piece could fill it.  This meant that incorrect pieces were snugly and perfectly fit somewhere else.Pomegranate Puzzles did a terrible job when they cut this puzzle!
summary: Love Charley Harper, but this is poorly designed puzzle.

reviewText: Great fun, putting together each new bird drove us on to finish!  The art is great as well, love Charley's stuff.

This puzzle was such a joy to work on because it was challenging.  By the time you get to the all blue part, you realize the challenge has just begun.  But, in my opinion, the blue background only adds to the time you are able to enjoy putting the puzzle together.  Instead of the usual threshold that you reach after which putting the pieces into place gets easier and easier, this puzzle remains difficult to the very end.  Many of the pieces are similarly shaped, which adds to the difficulty, but, really, only the correct piece fits properly into place (giving you that subtle snap that lets you know you have the right piece in the right place).  In fact, the puzzle seems very cleverly designed in regard to making sure that all of the pieces fit properly.The added benefit too is that, in the end, the puzzle is a beautiful piece of art.
It was the best choice of my life to buy this puzzle. Very good condition of the product. Im very happyJACKSON POLLOCK 1000 PIECE JIGSAW PUZZLE

I agree, a lovely puzzle to work on, although the span of blue is large,which is what you might expect for a large puzzle, but the fact that incorrectpuzzle pieces fit together, makes it nearly impossible to want to finish.We spent more time taking the puzzle apart and trying to refit with the correct piecesthan we did just completing it and enjoying our work. We solved the problemby using a sharpie pen and drawing some small dots on the blue expanse so the next time wework the puzzle we won't feel like throwing it against the wall!
Fun puzzle. A bit more challenging than most because of the splattered colors. It was hard to locate a pattern at first but after a while it became a fun hunt.
I thought this would be the culminating puzzle in my collection, and it wasn't. The quality of the pieces is poor. Buffalo makes the sturdiest puzzles and this was very disappointing.
Fun puzzle to put together. Nice thick pieces, definitely good quality puzzle. We are going to frame this one for sure!
Saw this puzzle in a little store in downtown RVA and founder it here for less. Looks great and is very challenging.

I love jigsaws, and this is a beautiful, challenging puzzle. Bissell's images are haunting and mystical (I wish I could afford his art) and the puzzle is very high quality printing.  I wish there were more.

This puzzle I have wanted to do for a long time, hard to find. I have been doing puzzles for five years now and I know this will be my biggest challenge yet. I can assure you it will be framed and on the wall. It's going to take a while.Thanks Amazon.  The Puzzler!!!!
Its a great puzzle piece of the antique world map. The colors, I have to say, are a tad bit difficult.
The box picture is much clearer and lighter than the actual puzzle. A tough puzzle that our group of adults could not finish I a week of several hours of daily effort. We got 80 percent done.

I have never owned a puzzle of this quality.  It is really top notch with respect to how perfectly the pieces go together and the thickness and quality of the pieces too.  I glued this one together and have plans to frame it.  It is that gorgeous!  It is not a real challenging puzzle though, so that makes it better for those who are intimidated by a 1000 piece jigsaw puzzle.  No problem finishing this one, and you will want it to hang on your wall because it is simply gorgeous!
This was a gift for my aunt. When I saw the packaging in person, I was very pleased with the quality and complexity of both the puzzle pieces and the image. Very nice!

My daughters and I worked on this puzzle over Christmas break. What a joyous way to spend time with the family. We all really enjoyed this challenging puzzle with amazing art work on it. We completed the puzzle after three days, and now we love it so much we don't want to take it apart!
The art work was wonderful and particularly fitting for a puzzle. Gave us hours of enjoyment. Was almost sorry to finish it.

This is a beautiful puzzle and a chance to enjoy Charley Harper's whimsical scene.  This puzzle is both challenging and enjoyable. The colors are vivid and the pieces are sturdy!  I definitely recommend!

Husband and I have had this puzzle for a little over 2 years now. After receiving it around Christmas time in 2010, we ended up moving to another country. Needless to say, it was partially finished up until this morning. This puzzle was such a pleasure to work on! I wanted to work through the night! It wasn't easy, nor was it extremely hard! I loved working on this puzzle. The artwork is fantastic, and I will be framing it! -- Unfortunately, a piece had been lost (an edge piece) in the move between S.Korea and Germany, so we decided to just take off all the edge pieces and frame it that way! It looks really great!

As a fan of Charley Harper's work, I really love these Pomegranate Puzzles! I really enjoy this brand of puzzle, for the pieces are crisply cut and the puzzles have a nice finish. This image in particular is quite nice. For serious puzzle people, it will be easy to put together. Nonetheless, it makes for a very fun project!

The picture was originally one of a series that Harper did for the US Park Service.  Most of these posters have sold out.  The artist has become very popular among certain groups of people.  This puzzle is now mounted, in a frame on my wall.  Buying the puzzle was the most affordable way to get the picture.
summary: Charley Harper: The Rocky Mountains 1000 Pc jigsaw Puzzle

reviewText: This puzzle is a panoramic puzzle measuring 32.5 inches in width and 16.25 inches in height. I would say that it took me, alone, about 12-15 hours to complete the puzzle. The pieces are thick, but small, and do not fit together very well. The picture side is finished in a nice matte so that it is easy to see the color on the pieces from any angle. Compared to White Mountain Puzzles and Ravensburger, I am not impressed with Pomegranate. While I do like the matte finish quite a bit, I don't like the size and shape of the pieces and the overall size of the puzzle. I would buy from Pomegranate again if I found a puzzle that I really liked and if it was also a non-standard shape.Pros:- colors are true to the picture- matte finish on colored side makes it easy to pick out pieces without having to be straight above them- panorama shape makes for an interesting and different shape particularly if you hang your puzzlesCons:- I didn't like the picture as much once I got to see all the detail- pieces are small and make a small overall puzzle- pieces are standard shape which make putting it together boring AND, most importantly, pieces can be put in the wrong placeI will try to add a picture of my finished puzzle.
This puzzle was fun to put together and not so incredibly challenging that I became fed up or irritated with it.

So much fun putting this together. The design is so cute and so clever - I was still discovering things long after I'd been working on it awhile. I love Charley Harper designs and want to do the rest of the puzzles commissioned by the Nat"l Park Service. What a great thing.

I will never buy a puzzle from anyone besides Pomegranate. The pieces are very thick and very sturdy and (THANK GOODNESS) a matte finish. Once this puzzle is put together you can carefully pick it up and move it without the whole thing disintegrating. That's how high quality the pieces are.I absolutely recommend Pomegranate. And this puzzle was was really wonderful. You can't go wrong with the Charley Harper images.
Harper is an absolutely fantastic naturalist and artist.  He is so clever and creative. It was an honor and delight to assemble this puzzle.  It is of the best quality.
An excellent challenge for individuals and friends. I liked it so much I'll be gifting it to friends that enjoy puzzles and games. (Already gifted one satisfied recipient!)

These puzzles are so great- Pomegranate makes high qualtiy thick pieces and vibrant colors. This one has a matte finish which is great to avoid glare. The image is wonderful and was fairly difficult to put together.

They are just difficult enough to hold your interest - not so hard that you want to 'throw in the towel'. Charley Harper's art is so colorful and whimsical that we have done 3 of his puzzles, had them framed and hung them in our family room.
Great fun but challenging. Enjoyed the unusual subject matter. Loveall of Charley Harpers work. Have most of the puzzles and plan topurchase others.

This puzzle is just beautiful. The colors are vivid, and the art work is fun. The puzzle pieces are high quality, almost as good as Ravensburger. However, there is more puzzle dust than I would like. I plan to buy a couple more of the Charley Harper puzzles since this one was so much fun.
Love Charley Harper and his unique eye for nature. This high quality puzzle will not disappoint. A challenge but not overwhelming for puzzle lovers.

The excellent quality of the puzzle does justice to the amazing work of Charley Harper. This is the kind of puzzle one hopes for, one which is challenging and yet can be enjoyed by even then littlest participants. This artist if unknown to you will not disappoint; the modernist symbols of the Rocky Mountains delight with whimsy. The color saturation of the pieces is wonderful as is the quality, promising years of carry with you entertainment for family reunions, and vacations, or set up at home for anyone dropping by for some entertainment that becomes engrossing.
Another great Charley Harper puzzle. His graphics are beautiful and the puzzle is just difficult enough to keep it interesting. I'll be keeping this one!
I love the art of Charlie Harper. The puzzle let me really see details. I love to do puzzles, it takes me out of everyday stress.
Pomegranate makes puzzles (and note cards) of exceptional quality.  This one is no exception.  Love the Charley Harper picture as well.

This beautiful puzzle was lots of fun and very challenging for me and my 90-year-old mother-in-law. We had several false starts when putting the outer edges together because some of the pieces seemed to fit in more than one place. From then on we were extremely careful to make sure each fit was the right one, and even then we had to redo several areas that had seemed right at first. We enjoyed it and felt quite proud of ourselves when we finished it in one week, but it is not for those who are impatient to get it done quickly. A lot of patience and perseverance are required.

I got the Charley Harper Glacier Bay alaska puzzle last week and before I was even finished with it I had ordered 2 more, the Missing Migrants and Rocky Mountains. They are filled with nature - shells, dragonflies, birds,etc.. It was just right for a puzzle - challenging but not frustrating. Can't wait to start the other 2!
I love charlie harper's artwork, so it was natural that I would buy these fantastic puzzles. I hope they make more of these puzzles of his art

This puzzle is definitely beautiful. It is my second Charlie Harper puzzle, and I've got one more to work. I love the vivid, bright colors of his puzzles. If I could change one thing, it would be the amount of puzzle dust that sticks to the pieces. There is so much dust that it's actually difficult to see the true color and picture on each piece. Once you're all done you can wipe it down with a damp cloth, but that doesn't help while you're working it of course. Otherwise, highly recommend!

I wouldn't really consider a jigsaw puzzle to be a toy, but if you enjoy puzzles, you'll love working on this one.  Every piece has beautiful color all on its own, and when you've finished you've got a displayable work of art, as only Charley Harper can create.

You can't do better than to experience putting together, as  a puzzle, a Charley Harper artwork. No bland blue skies here overlooking a national park photo. Life and environment are interpreted whimsically and beautifully in these puzzles which the whole family can enjoy putting together over a leisurely vacation at home or anywhere they choose. The pieces are well cut and vivid; this is a lasting entertainment for anyone or families who enjoy that getting together means actually getting together no in front of something, but with something. So thankful someone gave permission for these art works to be put into puzzle form.
This was a great puzzle. This probably the most difficult puzzle I have ever done. My one complaint is it was missing a piece.
If you are a Van Gogh fan or even if you're not, I think you'll have as much fun as I have had with this puzzle.  When you're finished you'll be pleased at how much it looks like the real thing.
summary: A Treat for Van Gogh Lovers

reviewText: I always want to visit Italy but i cant so i decided to buy a puzzle because in that way I can see a part Italy which is my favorite country of Europe.L

Difficulty: IntermediateOn this one, the floor area of the picture took as long to assemble as the rest of the puzzle.Pomegranate puzzles are the best quality of any of the (MANY) brands we've worked on. Of course, we like the unique pictures, but the thing I like best-- since I work sections of the puzzle to one side of where we're assembling the picture -- is that the thick pieces stay together when they're joined together.  With most other puzzles, when such groups are moved, they collapse. Pomegranate's pieces truly lock together.
summary: One of Pomegranate's easier puzzles, but hardly a cake walk

reviewerName: Johnny on the Spot "Johnny on the Spot"
reviewText: Really nice quality puzzle great for any age group. Great fun for any Kliban lover. A must for any collector. Good size, would look smart framed.
Colorful and educational.  There are many other beautiful Marley products. Note cards, posters, books, one of my favorite things.Try it

This is a fabulous kids' puzzle.  We purchased the 1000 piece Christopher Marley Beetle puzzle first and it was too much for my kids (ages 7 and 9).  This one was much better with a little adult supervision/suggestion.  A lot of fun!  I highly recommend it! It is very challenging and beautiful once put together! Two thumbs up!

Wasn't going to review this Pomegranate puzzle, but since I panned the Spanish Holy Week one, I wanted folks to know I usually enjoy their puzzles, beautiful artwork and challenging puzzles.  I do them to relax and to improve my ability to discern nuances in colors for my decorating business.  I now know every shade of black.
summary: Not as Hard as It Appears with the Black Overlay

reviewText: I love the picture. Wanted to do this puzzle myself, but gave as Christmas gift to a friend who is a passionate advocate for improved services and support for people with mental illness and their families. I think this would be a fun puzzle to glue together and hang in a casual spot like a sun room or girly bedroom. It is very pretty. A lot going on in the picture. I would give it higher rating but did not open or put together myself so can't comment on the quality.

My 9 year old son and I did the puzzle together for a little while on a rainy afternoon.  It was VERY nice and not cheap or flimsy.  We love Charley Harper.  He is a great artist for children's imagination, and this puzzle proved no different. Our family highly recommends this puzzle and others in the series!
Makes a great gift for kids...but my husband and I love to play it too! Beautiful pics of arthropods for kids learning.

First, Pomegranate Jigsaw Puzzles are consistently great quality and great cut, very fun and doable, usually a piece gets in only where it's supposed to go.Second, Charley Harper is a great american artist. His paintings are beautiful, fun, easy to interpreted, at the same time they have depth and they teach something. They are great for children.This puzzle in particularly, even though is 300 pieces, because is so diverse, a 6 year old like my daughter can enjoy doing it with some help. The whole family have fun around this puzzle.
We have done multiple Charley Harper puzzles between us but this was the first with our grand daughters.  It was fun for all of us
I highly recommend this sticker book of Kliban's cats. It is most enjoyable and sent quickly. Thank you so much.

My husband purchased this game for our two sons, ages 4 and 5, a year ago.  I was instantly impressed with the quality of the cards and the beautiful insect artwork.  My boys LOVE playing this game, and it has been used at least once a week for the past year.  The cards and box have held up perfectly.  As a bonus, we now know the names of many insects.  Highly recommend for any bug lover.

This is a wonderful game for anyone.  I like the fact you can play the game with kids and adults at the same time. Good family or household fun. And not a bit of technology in sight. Also, it can hone memory skills.

was a birthday present/joke my aunt loved it, and she is 63 with a small memory issue, she got a kick out of it. UPDATE: I got to see this in person, and I was really amazed at the quality and several different designs of the cat they had. A lot of them were new that I have never seen before. Great product.
If you like memory games and you like cats, this is great.  Especially good for fans of Kliban cat fans.

Humphrey the Invisible loves Kliban Cats! He says, "the game is challenging, but do-able. In many of the cards, I recognize the behaviour of my friends, Jesse Alfalfa, Edward Edward, Minou, Percy, Wilson, Max, Eric the Pink and Pinklepurr. We have a deep affection for its creator, Mr. Kliban, who must have been a great lover of cats."
summary: Humphrey the Invisible loves Kliban Cats!

reviewText: If you are Kliban fan, you must have it.  If you are a cat collector, you must have it.  It's a simple little game that is a great conversation piece.
Yeah, I've been a fan of Kliban Cat's since 1970!  This is a basic game with pictures of some Great Kliban Cat's!  Just enjoy!
A Beautiful and challenging puzzle!
A dream come true! I have been search for this puzzle for a long time. It is incredible, but, be careful, it is NOT for kids! It is very difficult

This is my 4th Charley Harper puzzle. I love his playful and colorful graphics. The puzzle is challenging, but not so difficult that it becomes frustrating. My only complaint is that Pomegranate puzzles have a bit more dust than I like. They should really vac clean their puzzles before they package them. Still very worth it and a fun challenge.

These are absolutely the highest quality puzzles made. The matte finish and printing are beautiful, even if they are not usually as difficult as some with more classical subjects. But they are fun and challenging enough and perfect for framing if that's your thing.
If you are interested in a challenging puzzle that has a rewarding end result, this is definitely a puzzle for you. Really, any Charley Harper puzzle is the best. Great product!
This is the third or fourth Charley Harper puzzle our adult daughter and we have completed on vacation in Colorado.  We love the challenge, but even better, we love the picture when it is completed.
These cards are fun.  Kliban's cats are delightful.  My nieces and I love to play with these cards!  They have 4 cats and are charmed by these cards.
good quality puzzle and fun to put together...nice quality of thickness and pieces stayed together.  i would buy more of their products
This was our second Charlie Harper puzzle, and we had a great time putting it together.  The colors are beautiful and vibrant and the pieces are very sturdy and well-cut.

I love the picture on this puzzle.
