It is interesting to play with but going back to price, I just would not have paid over $15 if I had seen this in person first.

This was a gift for an adult tinkerer and I think it was a big hit.  It is for a curious intelligent person who loves to manipulate pieces and make this into an almost 3-D puzzle. Ideal for anyone who loves legos.

Bought these for my son and daughter for Christmas and it is still their everyday go to toy.  As a parent and in these tough economic times, it is such a joy to know that your money was well spent and the toy is used and not just sitting on a shelf.  It's really fun and simple to use.  It can also be quite challenging to make some of the ideas in the book.  Really a great purchase for all ages.
summary: Best gift I ever gave the  kids!

reviewText: At first, i didn't know what to make of my new impulse buy. It was just something i got to have a toy on my desk for distraction, and perhaps a conversation piece. People always ask me what it is, then they pick it up and they love playing around with it.The weird part is that after ignoring it for a while and then coming back to it weeks later, i begin to dream up all kinds of weird new inventions, ideas for shows, coffee flavors...Lots of these things are bogus or impractical (in this dimension perhaps XD), but occasionally i sit and ponder while just playing with the magnetic pieces and it helps me think clearly.The item itself doesn't hold any magical properties or really hold up well as a throw and catch toy (Ive tried throwing it up and down while lying on my couch, with messy results...) but its definitely interesting enough to hold my attention every once and a while. Makes a nice gift for an inquisitive middle-schooler or budding entrepreneur.
The Ball of Whacks is not quite creatively open-ended as I had hoped.  It could use stronger magnets, too.

Magnets are just plain cool.  We have our Ball of Whacks sitting on the coffee table and all of my son's friends pick it up and start messing with it.  The challenge is to come up with a new design - it's not easy!  There's a flying squirrel in the book, but we've not even got that far!
My 13 year old grandson loves this ball of whacks. It's well made I would buy it again. thank- you
we leave this out and about for visitors (and ourselves) to play with mindlessly. it is a great little conversation piece.  made well, definitely recommend.

"A Creativity Tool for Innovators" is great marketingspeak, but it's a lie.After making a few patterns over the course of a few days, you and your kids will grow bored by this thing. It's more like a toy you'd buy on a lark at a dollar store; "It looks fun, and it's only a buck."At this price range, I expect some longevity or some real true fun, and this thing provides neither.***EDIT (three years later)*** -- my two year old boy  is now turning five, and he can't get enough of this thing, mostly because it's a BALL THAT "EXPLODES" when you throw it or drop it.
summary: great marketingspeak, but it's a lie.

reviewText: I hesitated to buy this after reading some of the reviews and because the price point seems high for this product, but my two boys, ages 12 & 13, love this thing! They can't put it down. I guess it has to fit a certain personality and in our house we have plenty of people who like to create and manipulate these kinds of toys. It's fun and it doesn't get old or boring, and it doesn't run out of shapes to create.
My seven year-old grandson loved it.  He made a space ship, a cat's head, and many other interesting shapes.  It is very versatile as all the pieces are magnitized.
not bad for couple days after that my kids lost interest now they lost some parts anyway it's ok for a week or two for kidsevery piece was functioning good i mean magnetic

I bought this for my husband and he loves it!  He put it in his man cave and says it's a good tool to help de-stress.  He's the kind of guy who enjoys gadgets and games that require strategy, etc.  This was perfect for him!  Shipped quickly and package was unharmed.  Thank you!
Kids can't put in down. Great doodling toy for the entire family. Only thing is that you have to be gentle with it because it falls apart if you squeeze just a little.
This puzzle keeps my 12 year old entertained as well as my 4 year old! We got a blue one maybe I should get a red one for the 4 year old!
summary: Great toy for kids of all ages

reviewText: A Christmas gift for my son who is into puzzles of all kinds.  Since he has a habit of solving the smaller puzzles so fast, I thought I would try this.  A great challenge and a fun way to kill a little time when you are having lunch or waiting at the doctor's.  He is enjoying it very much.

If you only employ one creativity-enhancing resource for the rest of your life, make that resource the Ball of Whacks!Breakthroughs in effective creativity-inspiring methods seldom occur.  Most "new" methods are simply restatements or reshapings of ideas that flourished among the ancient Greeks (such as Heraclitus, a favorite source for Mr. von Oech) or before.  Those who are familiar with the earlier work usually don't gain much from the newer approaches.  The Ball of Whacks is a happy exception.  Heraclitus would say that you can never interact with the Ball of Whacks twice in the same way.  And he would be right.The most valuable creativity-enhancing methods I've experienced usually require having a team work together, with one of the tasks involving making little models or prototypes of creative concepts.  I often find myself wishing I could have those experiences more often . . . but seldom having the right people and time to pursue that desire.Then, I discovered Roger von Oech's Ball of Whacks. Wow!My frustrations are now behind me.This is day 8 of working with the Ball of Whacks.  It's been quite an education.  I can hardly wait to find out what I'll learn on day 9!When you first see the Ball of Whacks, you won't quite know what to make of it.  Open the box, take out the ball, the magnetic stand and the workbook.Then, let yourself go.  Discover what the ball is.  To the geometrically inclined, you'll notice that it's a rhombic triacontahedron (try saying that 5 times fast!), a ball-like shape with edges formed by 30 rhombi (a rhombus is a four-sided equilateral with two pairs of parallel sides) that resemble scaled-down versions of an Egyptian pyramid done in red.  The ball feels somewhat alive, however.  It gives when you squeeze it and resumes it shape when you stop squeezing it.  As soon as you take out a piece, you'll discover that the ball is composed of 30 design blocks that use magnetism to adhere to one another.As you take the pieces apart, the ball disappears and many regular and irregular shapes occur. Usually, that's the end for me.  I can never recover the original shape (my Rubik's cube is still a mess!), but the ball is easy to reform (if I can do it, you can too).I like abstract shapes and I was pleased to find that the magnets act both to attract and repel the pieces. Unlike Lego pieces, connections can be made in all kinds of odd ways.  I also noticed that the pieces often reshape themselves, almost organically, as they choose a different connection than the one that I initiated. The casual results are often better than my planned ones.Based on a suggestion in the workbook, I began mixing in other objects that could be held by the design blocks.  The results were infinitely more interesting and rewarding than anything I'd ever created before.  I felt a great sense of peace from the experience.  Many people had told me I would like sculpting, but I lacked the confidence to try.  With the Ball of Whacks, I felt like a super sculptor . . . but without any lessons.After several days of working on abstract shapes, I decided to try geometric shapes.  These were paradoxically harder to do in many cases.  The magnetism sometimes fought me.  I had to design clever solutions to create the regularity I wanted to see.I also left the Ball of Whacks out to see what others would say.  Everyone noticed that I kept changing it.  Without thinking, rewarding new designs would emerge in a few seconds.  I gained confidence in my creativity involving forms.At the same time, I was working on a number of non-physical problems.  Soon, I began seeing metaphors in the blocks and my designs for those problems.  New and better solutions began to flood my mind.Feeling like I should read more of the workbook, I now found myself intrigued by the directions for how to use the Ball of Whacks to expand my creative repertoire.  I began to see huge gaps between the methods I prefer to use, gaps that I could easily explore and understand with my new appreciation of my creativity habits.Best of all, the lessons are deeply ingrained.  The human nervous system is mostly made up of connections between the hands and eyes to and from the brain.  By both holding and seeing what I was working on, the exercise connects more parts of my brain and experience.  I find totally different memories being stimulated, especially those from the sandbox and while playing with modular toys.Today, I went back and totally redid a book proposal I'm working on.  I was astonished to see that my mind was connecting those little blocks from The Ball of Whacks into new ways of assembling the pieces of the proposal.  I would never have expected that.What does the name mean?  I don't think there's just one meaning.  It obviously sounds like "ball of wax" which is something that warms and becomes malleable in our hands.  I'm reminded of the red wax that you peel off of Edam cheese to form shapes.  At another level, a "whack" in von Oech's vocabulary is a way of getting you to let go of artificial assumptions.  In that sense, this is a tool to give you lots of whacks.  And it does.I haven't done all of the exercises yet, but I plan to.  Each of the ones I've done has been quite an eye-opener.Here's a tip.  Turn off the TIVO while you're watching television and use the commercial breaks to play with the Ball.  The baseball playoffs are excellent for this purpose because you get all kinds of short delays.Be smart.  Give a Ball of Whacks to each of your children rather than purchasing another toy.  You'll inspire genius that will constantly fascinate you.

It hasn't made a single hair appear on my bald head, and it has not revealed the secret of life to me.  All I can tell you is that it is amazingly fun, and the possibilities of what you can do are endless.  I bought two, and my son stole one.  The other is on my desk at work.  It has attracted a lot of attention from colleagues, and several have ordered their own after just a few minutes of playing with mine.I'm a strong admirer of Roger von Oech's books and blog, so when I saw that he was associated with this "toy" I had no hesitation buying it. It is very well made, and the accompanying guide book is interesting and helpful. I highly recommend you get your own!
reviews hype it as a creativity must have. In fact, not really. Fun wears off in less than an hour.
summary: ok but not up to the hype

reviewText: Given to a relative, under the Recommended Age, but in no risk of hurting himself with it. He likes it a lot. I think the educational aspects are overstated, but that's what marketing is for. It is a toy, and a good one at that.

We bought one of these for Christmas for my youngest son, we'll be buying another soon for his older brother.  They both have enjoyed playing with this.  It's great for the car, quiet and so many things to build.  A great toy!

I put this in my husband's Christmas stocking. He loved it and found it quite addictive. He keeps it on his desk at work and his co-workers find it and play with it when they come into his office. It was a big hit!
This was a gift for my grandson just turning 12.  He had so much fun with it making different shapes.  Us grandparents enjoyed it too but had a hard time getting a turn!

My partner purchased the ball of whacks last year for our family and we enjoyed playing with it.  I currently am directing an undergraduate residential program that explores creativity and engineering, and I thought our ball of whacks would be the perfect "toy" at a recruitment table this fall.  Prospective students very much enjoyed the toy until a toddler knocked it on the floor and all the pieces went flying.  I am continuing to use my incomplete ball of whacks for recruitment this year, and I purchased a replacement ball of whacks for my partner, since we lost pieces of the one I borrowed.I find the ball of whacks both relaxing and engaging.  The ball is well constructed, and the  magnets are strong.

I've had my Ball of Whacks for probably 8 years.  It is one of those things you can pick up and fiddle with a bit.  I find it fascinating for my mathematical mind.The amazing thing about it is that kids can find fascination in it to.  My 3 year old son loves to whack it apart and put it back together again.  Older kids 6-10 love it too but seem to prefer the x-ball and y-ball from the same company.  I have yet to get the star ball but it looks cool too.

im not sure what i was expecting, but when i got this i was disappointed with the quality. each piece does not feel very sturdy. they are made out of red hard plastic with some magnets glued inside. i feel if one piece fell off a kitchen table onto a tile floor it would shatter. that hasnt happened yet, but its just what it feels like. the patterns you can make are pretty cool though, but i would like it if the magnets were stronger.
Good product.You can construct a lot of shapes with this product.Good for educational purposes!!The only complain is the magnets are slightly weak.
MY son loves this item. He has tons of fun making all sorts of shapes with it. when his friends come over immediatly they become intrigued with it and use it also. hghly recommend
We ordered several Whack balls for a teambuilding event and used the accompanying book to do some creative exercises! We still have them at our desks and challenge eachother.
summary: Inspires creative thinking in a profeswsional environment

reviewText: My 14 year old son got this for Christmas. He and his brothers (and cousins of all ages) played with it all day on Christmas. It was a big hit. The pieces are magnetic so they "pop" together in all kinds of shapes. Overall, great toy and fidget widget!

The first thing anyone who sees this for the first time is going to say is "WHAT IS IT ?" You'll quickly come to the conclusion that's a question much easier to ask than to answer.I guess the answer really is,"It's what ever you want it to be."I went to my Synonym Finder and here are just a few of the names I came up with.They are all names we have used,most aren't even in the dictionary,and any one of them could be used to describe this "thing". Doohickie,dojigger,gizmo,whachamacallit,thingumajig,flumadiddle,widget,thingumabob,are all pretty good names;but the inventor chooses to call it a "Ball Of Whacks";so I guess that's what it is.The pictures and descriptions describe it as well as anything But what to do with it is the question.It comes with a small book of 96 pages that describes how and why Roger von Oech invented it and what you can do with it. He describes the very interesting mathematics that is the basis of the shapes of the pieces or "whacks".To mathematicians,the Golden Ratio,the 30 sided rhombic triacontahedron ,and such have always fascinated scientists and are found many places in art and nature,and in this ball.The inventor also explains what great creative qualities can be found with the ball.The book shows the inventor with a young Buddist monk creating a sun sculpture.This ball will fascinate anyone who picks it up,be they young,old, inquisitive or simply someone who likes to hold,handle and play with things.As soon as one realizes that reassembling it is not nearly as difficult as one might imagine;then the creative juices start to flow and they try to see what they can form.The book gives a lot of sculptures or forms to make;but in no time ,one wants to try their own ideas.My ball has all the same colored "Whacks",(red) ;but it comes in several colors and even in multi colors,where the various colors would add a whole other dimension to the creativeness of "Ball Of Whacks".This product is excellently made,will provide endless hours of enjoyment,relaxation and creativeness for anyone who picks it up.

I received my Ball of Whacks about a week ago and have trouble putting it (ok, them) down.  Interacting and playing with it is extremely addictive and I have hooked my boss and another coworker by giving them each one.When I was younger I made crystal models out of marbles and geodesic domes out of cardboard and remember the excitement of uncovering different relationships between the shapes.  The Ball of Whacks is bringing back that feeling of exploration and discovery and has quite a few patterns built into those 30 pieces.  I forgot how much fun I had doing those explorations as a kid and can't figure out why I ever stopped.  The Ball of Whacks includes the symmetries of all five platonic solids if you play with it long enough.I would suggest getting a couple of them - at least one for your desk and one for playing at home.  You may need extras to share with family and colleagues and they are fun to combine into larger constructions as well.In creative problem solving sessions with coworkers I like to bring in various toys both to stimulate their playfulness and to change their environment a bit.  I am looking forward to trying out the BoWs in my next session although I am a bit worried that I might not get them back readily.Awesomely fun and gets the brain juices flowing too!!!
I had 3, know I have four. the more you have the more you can do. Shipped in a timely manner, would buy again all that jazz.

We bought this for our son for Christmas when he was 12.  He is into Legos, WII and math.  He played with this longer than everything else he got, and all the friends that are into math and building love it.  I wouldn't give it to younger kids who will lose the pieces, but it is a great toy for traveling.  We kept it on the coffee table and you wouldn't believe how many adults picked it up and played with it.  It feels really cool in your hand, very solid.  We now look for more toys like this.
summary: Kids who like math and Legos love this thing

reviewText: gave this to my 88 year old other.  says she plays with it constantly.  wants me to order her a couple for her to give to some of her friends. what better endorsement is there.
My kids love this toy.  There are so many ways to play with it -- the magnets add an extra dimension to the creativity.
Many hours of fun for several different ages and grownups, too.  Shared and enjoyed by many.  My husband and I got it for a Christmas present for the 12-year-old grandson.
I bought this as a present for my brother, but I ended up getting another one for myself. I find it relaxing to take apart and put back together. Recommended for anyone.

I got this last week for my birthday.If you don't have imagination or creativity, this toy will probably be boring for you. But if you like to create different wacky shapes, it's a lot of fun. If you like magnets, it's a lot of fun too. And if you're nerds, buy it!My 3 year old son loves it and he can reconstruct the ball shape from scratch! Wow... I was really impressed.My wife thinks it's a great present to give to others. So we will most likely buy more of this in the future.
summary: Let your imagination and creativity run wild

reviewText: After playing with the Ball of Whacks for about a week, I seem to have a greater sense of urgency in my life ... and better direction too!  I don't know what it does for sure, but I feel more comfortable with my surroundings, and more in touch with nature.

And I loved it so much that I bought one for home!  It's fun to just see how many different shapes you can make.  At work, someone will build something and I'll smash it so something new will be built.
Unleash your creativity!  Wish I bought more than one, because everyone wants to play with it at the same time.You can make several interesting designs with the magnetic triangles.

Does this do everything it's advertised to do?  Well, I can't prove to  you if my left and right brains are communicating better, but I can tell you that the ball of whacks gives you an often much needed literal and figurative "timeout" so you can contemplate the big picture and the little details.  From a sensory perspective, it's fun to manipulate the pieces and I like to leave myself signals (sharp points or rounded symmetry) of my mood on the table.  Shapes change as do my moods; a good tool for developing EQ.  The use of magnets/magnetism as part of the problem solving or creative exercise comes close to the "stacrobats"  concept, but instead of soft figures and balls, you have all these wonderful points and pieces that reward the auditory and tactile sense with a satisfying "snick".  Enjoy - have a ball!

I have a 14 year old that I didn't know what to buy for at Christmas. He really enjoyed this product. It's simple yet very complicated at the same time. There are endless possibilities and each turn at it is a work of art.
Everyone had fun making many different shapes out of this puzzle.  It became a challenge to see who could make the most elaborate shape.  It was a big hit with all age groups.

Absolutely love this toy! Saw one of my coworkers had one in red and I just HAD TO HAVE ONE. I'm a magnet fanatic.. this is just the ultimate. =) I can't take a conference call without it. It's when I get the most creative.If you buy it, you'll enjoy it. I promise!
I bought this product for my special education classroom.  My kids love it! It is something they look forward to playing with every day!

Simple concept. Lots of fun. My 4 year old is obsessed with it. He even loves it in the bath. You can stick them to the edges of the bath for a spiky bath or when floating them, the pieces attract together. Lots of fun.
summary: Ball of Whacks has my boy obsessed

reviewText: I'm a high school math teacher who can't keep my Ball of Whacks on my desk at school for long.  I bought it last year, and my students went crazy over it!  This year's students love it, too.  Two comments:a) The kids make any pattern they choose; in other words, they all ignore the booklet that comes with it.  However, they drop pieces (accidentally) often; one piece was lost last year under an immovable object . . .  Having 29 instead of 30 pieces has made no difference in the popularity of the Ball of Whacks, however.b) The dang thing is so popular that pieces of it have begun to disappear this year.  I honestly think, unfortunately, that people are stealing 2 or 3 pieces at a time, to fiddle with in their pocket or whatever.  I did not have that problem last year at all, but so far this year (and it isn't Thanksgiving yet!), my 29 pieces have shrunk down to just 20 pieces.  I've considered buying a new Ball of Whacks because the kids like it so incredibly much, but I hate to encourage stealing . . .  Now that Amazon has it on sale, however, I may break down and buy another.Also: I just received an e-mail from a parent of one of my students, asking for the name of Ball of Whacks.  Apparently he has talked about it so much at home that she wants to get him one for Christmas!

Bought this and the Y-ball for our grandson who likes mazes and puzzles.  He absolutely loved them!  Played with them "constantly" for the whole two days he stayed at our house.  At first enjoyed trying to build different designs with them but then got the most enjoyment out of rolling the balls across the floor and over and under objects and watching them crash and explode. Never seemed to tire in putting them back together.
summary: Big hit with 8 yr old grandson

reviewText: I got my nerdy, fidgety husband the X-ball, Y-ball, star ball and ball of whacks. He likes the X-Ball and Y-Ball the best. They were totally worth it. They all seem like they will hold up over time.He still likes the ball of whacks alright, but it is not the favorite.
summary: Try the X-ball and Y-ball first.

reviewText: What a great thing to own! Our teenage son hangs out at the table more just playing with it and talking with us. I have found that this little ball of whacks has indeed brought everyone to the table to see who can create the coolest creation!  Must get more in this series!

What can I say, magnets are awesome. My parents have one of these at their house, and after playing with it there I had to get one of my own. My 3yo granddaughter loves how it seems to explode when dropped on the floor, although I do NOT love how it feels to step on one of those points with bare feet in the dark! It's a hard toy to put down; if you're one of those people who can't resist playing with magnets, you really need one of these. Better yet, get two, because then you can make the awesome-looking star shape. :)

I only wish I had bought two of these, because everyone likes to fiddle with it and sometimes we have to wait our turn.  My sons first encountered this at a friend's house and couldn't stop taking it apart and reforming it into new configurations-- I knew we had to get our own.
This thing is fun when you first get it.Although you get bored after a while.But definitely offers respite when you are having a mental blockand need a quick diversion to clear your head.
summary: Nice to have on the desk..

reviewText: I got this for 5 year old niesce when she came to visit. We had so much fun with it, we had to get more. Great toy for kids to get them doing something other than playing on your iPad
I bought one for him and he loved it so much that he asked for another.  It's the one toy he continues to play with even after all others fall by the wayside.
summary: Son loves it!  Asked for another!

reviewText: My son has enjoyed hours of creating different designs with the Ball of Whacks - Here was the cheaper (at the time) we could find for BoW. So glad we purchased it
These were a big hit at our Christmas celebration. Everyone wanted to play with them. They are kind of addictive!
Always at hand.  Good for creativity and design, plus it feels good. I would reccomend this toy for young and old

This is one ingenious toy because it makes you use your imagination to create different shapes, and designswith your own hands. You can also take it with you anywhere any time for entertainment.Outstanding product, A plus, I definitely recommend it.

Everyone around here loves this thing!  It seems to attract you when you see it, and you can build a ton of different shapes.  The pieces stick together very well, making it easy to shape and play with.  Definitely a great purchase, would buy it again if I lost it.

Roger von Oech's Ball of Whacks: A Creativity Tool for InnovatorsThis is one of the best toys I have found in a long time. I bought 5 for x-mass presents and found my two boys 3 and 5 yrs old had opened 2 of them and were so engagued with playing with them how could I get upset. The patterns are  great and there is no wrong construction. Young kids need a little supervision so pieces dont end up all over. Highly reccomend this toy/puzzle
Bought this for my 11 year old who loves puzzles and Rubik's cubes. Would be great gift for someone's office. Terrific magnets. Well made and worth the price.

The Ball of Whacks can be a valuable tool for distraction and refocusing the mind during pain due to illness and disease.  My teenage son has suffered a condition that causes him intermittent pain, anxiety and distress.  I am continually looking for something to occupy his attention during such painful times.I have noticed that in mild to moderate pain, playing with the Ball of Whacks beautifully distracts him.  His face relaxes, and he is engaged in creativity more than reactivity to pain, which seemingly allows his body to regroup as the pain often dissapates.I suggest that the Ball of Whacks be more broadly considered a tool in 'pain management' for certain people and conditions.  I could also imagine its usefulness in a hospital or clinic setting, like for individuals waiting to undergo chemotherapy.  We are very grateful for this addition to wholistic care for our son!
summary: Ball of Whacks very useful for pain management

reviewText: The Ball is an ingenious celebration of natural beauty.  Playing with it is like being in touch with a higher intelligence so powerful it's truly inspirational.  It will transform you life.
summary: THE BALL OF WHACKS IS TRULY INSPIRATIONAL

reviewText: My husband is an avid puzzle person. Our grandkids love many of his toys. this one is a favorite for all of us. I do not mind picking up the pieces because it is fun to put it back into the original "ball shape." I highly recommend this Ball of Whacks.

I bought the Ball of Whacks for my daughter and she just loves it.  It seems to be pretty durable and she really enjoys being creative by making new shapes.  In addition, it was 30% cheaper on Amazon than in stores so that made it an even better buy.
summary: Whacky for the Ball of Whacks

reviewText: This is just a fun, creative toy.  It starts as a ball and comes apart into mini "pyramid-like" pieces.  From here, you can use your imagination and create new objects (animals, stars, etc.).  It also has a strangely soothing feel when you are putting it back together.The only drawback is that the magnets could be a little stronger.  Sometimes it is hard to get your new creations to stay together because they slip.  However, overall this is a really cool toy.  Good for kids and adults.
summary: A fun, creative toy for the person who has everything

reviewText: My kids (ages 12 & 14) loved putting the pieces together in different ways to make various shapes. Something they actually wanted to do instead of play video games!  I wish they weren't as expensive, so we could buy more, but they are very well made and worth the cost.

I heard things about this being a revolutionary creativity toy, and I was born to fiddle with stuff like this. On receiving it, the pieces feel and look really cheap. I know it's a toy, but it's not something I'd be proud to have on my desk.As for the creativity aspect of the toy: I had a few hours of fun with it, but don't feel there's as much potential as people say. The magnets do not make strong connections unless you have the pieces aligned in a very specific way, which means that more precarious creations will fall apart. I'm having 1000x more fun with my NeoCube, which I ordered at the same time.

This is an amazing toy! My 10-year brought it to school and everyone was obsessed for weeks. Probably the only toy that has held his interest for such a long time (over a year now!). Endless creative ways to play with this. Great for Lego fans who like to build.
summary: Creative, smart, toy with long-lasting appeal.

reviewText: This was okay, but it seems to get boring after a while. It's kind of like doodling, but costs a lot more.
It looks pretty good ,and it has very good quality.  It is a very interesting toy, kids love it .
My son loves playing with this toy. He cherishes it and fights over it with his siblings, i finally had to break down and buy one for all of them. He calls it the Diamond Ball
My 12 yr. old son played with it all of Christmas vacation.  He kept making things with the guide and on his own.

A good idea but not well executed and expensive. The magnets are not as strong as expected. It kept the kids entertained for about 1/2 hour. They tried to create all the designs in the book but found one that was impossible.Better to stick to the buckyballs.

Between them, my two daughters played with the Ball of Whacks for more than three hours today. It's a huge hit.  Smiles all around, and they kept coming to me and showing me their creations.  New parts of their brains are firing up, and I love that :)
fun to play with and we use in our hands on science center as an exhibit for visitors to use.

I bought this for my Mom for her birthday. My wife and I saw it at a Natural History Museum and seeing that it was really colorful, thought, mom would love that! I just love putting it into a ball and then dropping it on the ground and making the kiddos pick up all the pieces, then do it all over again!
summary: Kids love this thing and so do I

reviewText: I bought this toy when my 8 year old son was intreged by it at his counseling session.  It is helpful to distract him when he is upset about something.  It is neat to see him make different shapes with it.  the only concern is getting all the pieced back together... haven't lost one yet but I'm sure we will.

I got this ball of magnets for my husband but my 9 and 13yo sons love it too and invent all kinds of shapes and games. Very sturder and this would make a great present for someone who has everything. The price is also lowest at amazon at about 18-19 dollars.

I was looking to get an unusual item for my son. he likes interesting things, and is 15yrs old.. i thought the ball of whacks looked kinda cool. it is magnets you can assemble. i guess the limited things you can make with it is a reson to buy another one. but i am not gonna spend the money on more magnets. the company should send a coupon to get another at a discounted price. it had good reviews. but overall i was not very impressed, for the price..you can buy any kind of magnets and arrange them in different shaps & patterns with just as much fun. overall not too happy with the purchase price of a simple magnet table toy.

PROS:* can make many fun shapes using magnetized pieces* very colorful* child gets some sense of 3-dimensional geometry* pieces are large enough that they would be hard to swallow* easy to clean up after (just smush the pieces together)CONS:* lots of pieces means if you lose one the toy is less fun* debatable on how educational the toy really is* the price is somewhat high
summary: My child likes it but pieces easy to lose

reviewText: Should have made it with prettier colors... booooring. And not sure there's really that much to do with it.  I don't see where it matches up with the description of being this creative tool.

This is a great toy to use to familiarize yourself with the rhombic triacontahedron, especially if you buy the six-color edition. Actually, I recommend buying two, because that way you'll have 10 pieces of each color.  This allows for symmetrically 3-coloring the "ball" as well as 5-coloring and 6-coloring it, which are all interesting problems.  There are also some nice but less symmetrical 4-coloring patterns you can make.My whole family has been enjoying playing with this toy.
summary: great geometry toy, lots of fun

reviewText: I have to admit to being a bit disappointed in the Ball of Whack. The concept is great, but after you take it apart and put it back together a couple of times, there's not a ton of other stuff to do with it. I had envisioned creating all sorts of different shapes with it, but was never able to do so.  My 10-year-old has spent all of 20 minutes tops with it since she got it for Christmas.

I bought this for my grandson, who was 10 at the time, on a visit to Falling Water last summer.  He loved it and when he got it home, so did his  5 year old brother.  Since it was still in regular use 6 months later, I ordered another one for the younger grandson, and it remains a hit with both of them.  Expensive, but well worth the money for the play and problem solving value.
I bought this for 12 year old nephew and I think adults loved it more than him. it is very interesting brain challenging toy.

I bought this gift for my nine year old son. Every child...and adult in my home has spent hours playing with this super simplistic yet complex toy. Every other gift has been ignored this year because of how awesome this is. I recommend it for everyone at every age! By the way, it's great fun to use it as a bowling ball and watch what happens! ;)

Both I and my seven year old granddaughter get a lot of enjoyment out of manipulating these shapes into many different forms. I like this better than the one color ball of Whacks as it allows us to form patterns and do some sorting.

I like this new magnetic Ball even more than the original red Ball of Whacks. It has visual as well as tactile appeal.I found it a challenge to put it together with no same sides touching- not even at the points.Then, I challenged myself and my kids do put it together  again even faster.But ultimately, the best part of playing with the X-Ball is being creative; inventing new shapes and designs.I also noticed that people can't keep their hands off this thing. When they walk by my desk they pick it and begin to manipulate it without thinking.I think that's what the creator, Roger von Oech probably had in mind.
summary: A colorful way to whack open creativity

reviewText: I gave a few of these out as xmas gifts. People loved them. Hard to put down once you start playing with them.The Y and X ball are also very fun. The star ball is great, but more difficult than the others.
summary: Very fun, people love playing with it

reviewText: Wow! I don't usually write reviews but felt compelled to for this toy. Simple design, beautifully made, durable, and tons of fun! In all honesty I actually bought this for myself. When I got it my two boys aged 3 and 5 were unable to put this down. It is a really, really cool thing to see your little guys smash up this geometric puzzle and figure out how to put it back into it's shape without help. The magnets are perfect strength allowing the thing to stay together, but not too strong that little hands can't manipulate it, a delicate balance well-achieved.  I got it out today and every time one of them actually put it down, the other went and swiped it, with me getting a turn every once in awhile ;) If you are on the fence about this, don't be, you will have a lot of fun with this, not to mention anyone who happens to pick it up at your home. Do your homework with price comparison, I found mine as of feb 2012 at a major online retailer based out of Arkansas  ;)  for nearly half the price listed here.

I received this as a Christmas gift after reading other reviews touting its ability to facilitate creative thinking (something with which I often struggle). I still hope to experience this, but at Christmas it was constantly in use by my 14 and 17 year old relatives. They spent literally hours with this toy studying it, designing shapes, and organizing the pieces in different ways. In the limited time I've had with it, I find it to be challenging and forcing my brain to be stimulated in new ways. I should mention I'm currently 35!I chose the six-color version to increase the variety of options and to hopefully make me think in colors as well as shapes. I think that was a good choice.
This puzzle is great for my child who likes math manipulation, but says she "hates math."  We are still looking for the multicolor IZZI she used in math club.

In a rush, I bought this toy for my 5 year old grandson's birthday.  He is intrigued with mechanical things and I love magnets.  However, when I got the toy, the warning was 'not for children under 14' because it contained rare earth magnets.  And, if it was thrown, it might be damaged and should be disposed of.  That immediately excluded my grandson.  I still think it is a facinating toy, but I haven't opened it.  Therefore, my ratings are not terribly relevant.  But, my review couldn't be summited without them.
This item is a lot of fun for both kids and grown ups! I gave it as a gift for some friends' child, but I plan to buy one for me now.

We bought our son this product for Christmas after he became enthralled with it at the local toy store.  He loves that you can drop it, the pieces scatter and then he has a blast finding all the pieces and putting it back together.  As he gets older, I am sure he will enjoy making all kinds of fun creations with this great learning toy.Shortly after he got it we did lose a piece.  I e-mailed the company and told them what had happened, hoping I could buy a replacement piece and not have to replace the entire ball.  They sent me a replacement piece (free of charge) along with a nice letter and a thank you for my business.Kudos to Ball of Whacks for providing such excellent customer service and for marketing such a great toy for young and old.

Outstanding "thing" to have on your desk or coffee table or window sill.  Kids of all ages find it irresistible, not only for the design possibilities, but also for its tactile aspect.  The pieces "feel nice" in your hands.  Kids like the way the intact ball feels in their hands and the way the pieces slide apart and together.  A great "fool around with" item.
This is a great toy for car trips and plane rides.  Magnets are a lot of fun to play with and our sons friend like playing with his so much we bought him one for xmas

My boys love it yet there is not a container it comes in so find a home for it before and after use.  The patterns are fun to do and the boys just love to stick the pieces together in their own ways too.
great little ball, can make all sorts of interesting shapes.  great for kids and adults. should not be left w/ toddlers, the pieces of kind of small

This has been a wonderful tool and great way for me to interact with my children. Though this is not suggested for children under 14, it is a fantastic toy for sharing with my younger ones. My 3 year old daughter loves to make red stars with a blue border... and my 1 year old son loved to hold the ball, regardless of the color pattern. He would emphatically say "BALL!" once I put all the pieces together. I can't wait to buy a second ball so we can do more color combinations.One of the black pieces was unfortunately lost, and I didn't use the ball for a couple months. I ended up contacting customer service, and the Vice President followed up with me. He had a new piece sent to me, free of charge. I really feel so much happier about my purchase because of that. I will definitely be buying more products from them.

I bought two of these last Christmas for my boys ages 7 and 9.  I had no idea they would still be playing with them a year later.  They still find them fascinating, and they continue to find new ways to play with them.  I would recommend the multi-color ball over the single color ball as it adds to the fun of making different shapes with different color combinations.
Back yard flying has changed greatly since the book was written. I have not seen a book that covers the subject well, but still this book isn't useful.

This was a very informative book which contained much useful information on all phases of how to choose and fly a radio controlled airplane. The book covers all that a person needs to know to get started. It is very well written. The author is very familiar with the subject matter.
I purchased this for my husband who thought it was interesting but not a great book about RC flying.  Maybe it is more for beginners.

My daughter and I purchased a Park-Flyer 2-Channel plane this past summer.  This was an easy to learn great first step that required little set up and flying ease, but we wanted to move up to more advanced equipement.  I looked on the Internet, but could not find enough information to be comfortable understanding what we needed and we found hobby personel sometimes lacking knowledge or giving bad information.  This book provided step by step information regarding what to look for and the different pieces of equipment that was necessary to purchase RC Flying equipment separately.
Brilliant, well written and illustrated, must have reference book. Will serve me well in my hobby, for years to come.

I was looking for a book to help determine what engine to use on a certain size plane and the different engines available both 2 and 4 stroke. This book did not answer that or at least I did not find it. The book has lots of pages telling how each type of engine works and way too much information about glow plugs. Everything is way more technical than I expected from the decription.I agree which the other reviewer and will probably just throw the book away.
Book is fine, but the fact that the purchase is still sitting (like an incomplete purchase) in my account is annoying. Why is it there?It was purchased and received a long time ago.

This book/magazine barely covers the subject.  Most photos are of subject airplane on cover.  If you are looking for information on giant scale "warbirds" you might look else ware.  Seller supplied item quick and arrived flawless.
Good, but get Air Age Getting Started in Rock Crawling Guide instead.  It covers more and is therefore, more helpful.

Short book. Expensive. Touted as a tool box accessory. Why do I want three pages of commercial ads in my tool box (after having to pay for these ads , no less) Lacking a considerable amount of practical knowledge. Some information is not for quick tool box reference but rather belongs in your "how to" book shelf at home.
I devoured everything this book had, but still wanted more.  Great information either way.  With as fast as technology and new products are becoming available, it will soon need to be updated.
summary: Very good, but even more would have been nice.

reviewText: The product description leaves a lot to be desired,,, B4 we purchase this book it would be nice to know what it is about?  We are looking 4 a guide to convert a glow engine to an electric motor.  Is that what this book is about?  Give us a hint please,,,,, !
summary: OK, we give up,,, whats this book about?

reviewText: Fancy book, full of glossy pictures and crawler reviews. In terms of starting in rock crawling this book makes a fatal error. It assumes you are already knowledgeable about RC cars. Upon reading I was left with many question unanswered. Most of the book deals with product reviews. If you like a particular car then good luck as many of the cars reviewed are no longer in production. At best this is a glamorous book providing great 'gloss but little substance. I have not found much published about this subject thus leaving one with little choice but this book. Do yourself a favour, save your money and find an other way to gain knowledge. It is a costly book which offers little of what the tittle promises.

Love this game, I was introduced to this game by a group of friends and thought it was great.  I liked it enough that I thought I would share it with my family who are big euchre players. They loved it also! We keep sharing the game with family and friends.  It's definitely a game of strategy that can change at any moment!
This is an excellent card game. My family plays it regularly and we have gotten quite a few friends on the bandwagon. Excellent for any type of gift or if you are just wanting a new game to play.
It's a great game that we've had difficulty buying in stores.  Everyone should order 3 or 4 copies; one to keep, the others to give as gifts!  Wonderful fun game for most ages! maryann jacob
summary: It's a great game that we've had difficulty buying in stores

reviewText: Arrived promptly.  This is such a fun game.  This is the 3rd deck that we have purchased and is a gift.

Definitely not a game for young children.  It's more geared for adults.  And, it is kinda complicated.  Make sure you have 4+ people to play, otherwise, it isn't too much of a game.  But, it is SO MUCH FUN once the group knows how to play.

First came across this little gem in the 70s as an Ariel game. Ariel made some of the cleverest games in print at the time and this was arguably one of their two best offerings (the other being Diplomacy).I bought the Avalon Hill first edition version, played it keenly, but had to sell it in lean times. Later I bought this one.The game is a light-hearted (but not comical) look at the Wars of the Roses. Players construct factions of Nobles, give them titles and jobs that grant them physical and political clout using cards, and storm all over England grabbing Yorkist and Lancastrian heirs to the throne, killing off the opposition's heirs when possible, trying not to get sieged, ambushed or plagued to death and scheming to be in possession of the last legitimate Heir to The Throne - at which point the game ends, typically with demands for a rematch sometime soon.Games last from an hour to maybe three hours depending on player familiarity and in-game factors (summoning parliament can cause long pauses in action as players lobby for favor in the form of titles and offices).The playing pieces are made of sturdy card and feature very well printed heraldic designs identifying actual noble families involved in the Wars of the Roses.The board is the usual three-part bifold affair for Avalon Hill. I use plastic clips to hold the board sections together.There are no dice involved in the basic game as the combat is a very abstract "turn a card" thing.One thing not mentioned in the Avalon Hill Version is the ability to "deal in" a late arrival and have them join the fun even for a game that has been running some time. Once seated at table, no player can be eliminated, as if they lose all their nobles there is a mechanism for giving them new ones. All in a game sold years before so-called "European Games" "invented" that concept.This Johnny-come-lately deal-in might seem an untenable position, but even the most established force on the board can be lost to plague if they enter a town or city and they will have to at some point, opening the game up to the smaller factions.Not only that, a large and powerful faction can be split by the demands of office in an eyeblink. Creative use of jobs can hamstring even the best player as his faction is robbed of the Warden of the Northern Marches - who has to go to the Scottish Border to quell rebellion - and the Warden of the Cinque Ports - who gets called to Dover.Avalon Hill also used to offer a variant event deck for this game that was oodles of fun. I have no idea if it can be sourced today.This is avowedly not a simulation (though Avalon Hill made a gallant try to introduce a simulation element in the "Advanced Game" it isn't worth the effort and sorta misses the point). It is, however, more fun that a dose of the plague while visiting York with two bishops and an heir with a coronation in mind.Highly recommended.
summary: One Of The Best Games Ever Invented

reviewText: We got this game for Christmas from in-laws and loved it.  It takes some strategy and a little luck, but our whole family can play together (kids ages 8 - 14).  It has become our "go to" for gift ideas, and we've spread the fun to friends and family members.
This game is a lot of fun for adults and if you like betting its even more enjoyable.Also great for older kids but adults will like it better.
This is a fun game for adults and children. The set includes a score sheet which is very helpful.
It's a very interesting game, everyone who has played it with us seemed to want to more than 1 game. Enjoying it

This is a great card game.  Everyone we have introduced to this game loves it.  The Jester and Wizard cards add some fun twists to the outcome, and if you fall behind initially, you can still catch-up as the number of cards per hand increase at the end.My only complaint, and the reason I only give it 4 stars, is that the cards tend to get sticky with extended use, and given you can shuffle the deck 15 to 20 times per game, the cards get a lot of handling.  A plastic card surface would have been better.  The best solution I have found is to purchase more than one set.  I am sure the manufacturer, with whom I am not affiliated, loves me for saying that.By the way, my family sometimes shortens the game time by choosing a subset of the total hands used to play a game.  So for 4 players, instead of dealing hands with 1 to 15 cards, we will play hands of, say, 2, 4, 7, 9, 10, 13, and 15 cards.
Great fun for gatherings.  Easy to travel with.  Very challenging yet extremely easy to learn.Warning!  Game can become highly addictive !for more info, check out  wizard cards dot com

for many years now my family has been enjoying WIZARD its our very favorite card game.  At least once a year I order replacement decks for all of us as we wear them out due to frequent usage.  Its a game even the younger children have learned to play.Love the game!

By far my (and now my families) favorite new card game. Living in IN we are accustomed to playing Euchre. This is a whole new twist on trump. Easy to learn and fun to play! Love Love Love this game.Cheers

This review is about the Product Description.  It's misleading because I thought I was purchasing the "Deluxe Edition with six individual bid indicator wheels".  Why does the seller bother to write this, only to confuse you?  The description should say, "this edition includes only a 60-card Wizard deck and Scorepad."
This game is incredibly fun. Even after many rounds the game can be fun frustrating annoying and funny each time.

This is a great old card game which is currently sweeping the country once again.My cousins in Arizona have been passing this on, and now lots of people are having Wizard parties!Not a simple game, takes strategy.
summary: This is a great old card game which is currently sweeping the country ...

reviewText: This is probably my favorite card game (and we play a lot of games at our house).  Interesting mix of skill and working around the cards laid by other players.  If you like strategy games, you will love Wizard.It is also easy to learn and in my experience even "non gamers" pick it up quickly and have enjoy it.  I highly recommend giving it a try.
We have been playing this game for a few years.  I have given many games to others as we have taught them how to play it.  I always keep a spare one on hand.
if you like card games, this is a fun one, a little similar to rook but you don't play in teams.

This IS a great card game, although be aware that it is almost the same game as one that we called "oh h*ll", which we played with a standard deck. (It's a game with trump, and first hand is 1 card each, second is 2 cards each, etc., and players have to bid exact numbers of hands they think they will get.)  Main difference is that this has 8 additional cards: 4 jesters who are at the bottom of the rankings, and 4 wizards who are at the top; slight difference in rules.  My kids, 9 and 11, who have never played a trump game before, were able to understand it relatively easily. One reason this is a great game is that it doesn't depend entirely on getting great cards and then playing them well, but you can still earn points with a "bad" hand if you can bid and play it correctly.  Have fun!
Wizard has been a instant hit in our family. Three generations eagerly compete with each other at most of our get-togethers. We have purchased two more decks for gifts.
summary: Wzard has dominated our family get-togethers

reviewText: This game has simple rules and play is all about strategy.  Game is fun to play and moves quickly.  Just as fun with 3 plsyetd as 6.

This is a fun easy to learn game for up to 6 people.  It helps if you are already familiar with card games that incorporate "trump cards". We took it to Costa Rica with us and had a great time playing it.  It's portability makes it a great travel game. It is a card game, so the cards will get spots on them, especially if you are eating or using sunscreen while playing...which of course we did.
This is a great card game! Similar to "Screw Your Neighbor" or "Up the River" but with the added twist of Wizards and Jesters which definitely makes the game more fun and exciting.

This game is very similar to a card game we used to play years ago.Highly recommend this game to those who like card games that challenge.You have to have skill with the luck of the draw of the cards.
summary: Great game for (in my household) ages 12 to 94

reviewText: We have played this game often since buying it on Amazon.com.  We always have a great time and several of our friends have ask how to buy it!

It's lots of fun.  What is really nice about the game is that you can have hands dealt to you that are not very strong but still end up winning.  The trick is to bid the hand correctly.  Another great thing about Wizard is that the number of people playing is fairly flexible. . . 3-6.
Wow can this game be frustrating.. but thats what makes it great! Definately will make you want to throw your cards at other players(hehe). Fun and Challenging trick taking card game.

We just recently learned how to play Wizard and have been teaching it to others.  It is more mind provoking that ordinary card games so it has educational and thinking properties.  We are planning on playing it with our 21 year old granddaughter tonight!  PS:  You can play this game with 2 but 3 or 4 are more fun.
Great game...lots of thought, strategy and some luck.  We play it often with players from 10-80. Our new go-to game.
A friend introduced us to the game and we had to have our own set immediately. Easy to learn and great fun to play. Good service and reasonable price.

This isn't really a game as much as it is a slightly modified deck of standard playing cards.The quality of these cards are barely a step up from the 2-decks-for-a-dollar set you can get at Deal$ or the Dollar Tree.  The only unique thing about this is the rules (which you can find online for free) the scorepad (which can be downloaded or use scrap paper) and the Wizard cards.  Instead of 2 Jokers, you get 4 Jokers, and 4 Wizard cards, (which are used in the "Wizard" game).Some standard card decks come with 4 Jokers instead of just 2.  And there are plenty of other games / decks that have more than the normal number of cards.  (Two2Six, 500, 5Dimension, Sticheln, Zing!, Raj, Nicht die Bohne!, Clubs, and many other games/decks all have at least 15 ranks in at least 4 suits - and most are better quality cards.)The most frustrating thing, though, is that the Jokers and Wizards are unsuited.  Or more accurately, each of those 8 cards has their own suit which does not match the standard suits or any suit on the other cards.  So it is not a simple task to assign them to a suit for use in other games.In conclusion:  There are plenty of better uses for you gaming dollar than this game.
summary: It's an overpriced cheap deck of cards.

reviewText: Really fun game, I ordered this for my friend in Florida; it arrived on time and as advertised.  A bit complicated but really fun once you have the rules figured out.  Includes score sheets,  but you don't need them other than as a guide.
some card games are dorky. this one is good for adults and children. it's fun to play. would highly recommend.
This is a card game that has the challenge of proper bidding and the challenge of being both on the offensive and defensive while playing the game after the bidding is over.
summary: Great card game fo rpeople that like to play Bridge and Hearts

reviewText: The box was broken and damaged on the corners which not what I expected because it was in a larger secured box. So the game itself must have been damaged before being packaged and shipped. I hope in the future this does not happen again.
More fun than poker!  Doesn't matter how well you play cards, those extra trumps trump you everytime!

We love this game.  We play Wizard every other weekend with friends and family.  We bring it camping, on vacation trips, anywhere we can.  It's a lot of fun.  It almost becomes addictive.  Great price for such a fun game.
summary: Wizard is a fun (almost addictive) card game.

reviewText: We originally picked up Wizard in a bookstore and started to play it with family and friends. To date, we have probably gone through at least 6 decks, because we play so often. We have bought decks for friends and family who now play it with their friends and family. My monthly card groups meets just to play wizard ( and eat an socialize)! And my grandsons can not get enough!
Friends come over for a card night and want to play Wizard.  Fun, fast and easy to play.  Glad we bought it.
We bought two of these, it is great for 3-6 players, and is a favorite in our family.  I would recommend it to everyone.

I originally found this card game at a Goodwill store, and we played it with our adult children at a family gathering. Everyone loved it, and we play it nearly every time we get together. While it's an easy game to learn, there is a lot of strategy involved. I looked at the department stores to buy it for gifts for others, but couldn't find it, so purchased 2 more games on Amazon. It's small, so easy to take traveling. I took it with us on our trip with another family member and left it with them to keep, as they really enjoyed the game, too.

Wizard is a fun card game that takes the game "Oh Hell" to another level by the addition of eight extra cards.  It can be played by as few as 3 or as many as 10 (or more).  The more players, the fewer the rounds.  It's easy to learn the basics, but depends on skill as well as luck.  A great game for a group of friends.

I bought this game for the entire family. Now, it has become one of our favorites. From our youngest player aged 6 thru all the adults we really have a fun time. Family time is so important and a great way to enjoy each other.
We enjoy playing Diminishing Rook. This has the added dimension of Wizard and Jester cards. This adds new challenges the variety is good.
Played this game with the in-laws on a trip to Florida and had to have it. Great game that is a lot of fun!
Fun card game. We play with several people, have two tables going most times! Everyone gets into the game and a good time is had by all!

I bought this as a replacement to a deck that got worn out.  We love this game.  It's simple but still has some strategy.  If you like quick 3-6 player games that you can hang out and play this is a good card game to consider.  Don't be fooled by the name "Wizard", it's not a role playing game.  It's a normal 52 card deck with 8 extra cards that play like wilds essentially.  If you like cards games this is worth checking out.  I've played another version of the game without the 8 special cards (just a normal deck) which is fun but the special cards are nice.

I'm the co-organizer of a Meetup group that is focused on games.  We play both card and board games.  This game gets brought out almost every single time we meet, and it never fails to entertain.  We've found that even 7 or 8 people can play at once.  (If your choices are to add another player or two, or to play something else, the choice is easy!!!)  I highly recommend this game.  I just wish I were better at it.  :)
summary: Our Gaming Group Plays it All the Time!

reviewText: My son brought this card game home from Canada.  My married kids loved it especially.  It is a VERY FUN game!!!

We love this game!  It can get very competitive with more players.  You will have hours of fun making bids and outsmarting your competitors!  I highly recommend this for all card players.  Easy to learn!  Bidding is almost like spades or hearts but this is much simpler.  Lots of fun!

Friends recommended this game..it's fun easily to learn and play...we like that it's small we keep it in our RV!~ Wizard...is something I'm glad we discovered...play it for hours and never get bored!~

Since purchasing this game, we have taught a lot of people. Everyone we teach goes out and buys the game.  Everyone loves it.  My husband tells everyone "it's an easy game to learn but a hard game to win". We have the best times playing. I recommend it to all.
Perfect game for the whole adult family.  We've already worn out one set. Married kids game of choice when they come over. Highly recommended for hours of fun.

A fun game you can play from three to six players.  I love competitive/strategic games and this is one of the best I have played.  Me and my wife play it all the time when we have new friends friends over, its a great way to break the ice and we have always had a blast playing it.I highly recommend this game.
Love this game.  Easy to learn and lots of fun for ages 10 and up.A nice feature to this game is that an odd number can play.
summary: Fun Game and Easy to Learn

reviewText: AS a family we have played this game many times. It's fun for ages 8-80. The rules are simple and easy to follow. One does not have to be a card shark to enjoy this and it works for any number of players from 3 to 6. I would highly recommend it for those who enjoy having family around the table.
summary: Wizard is fun for the whole family

reviewText: This card game is very fun and ever changing with each hand dealt. There is much strategy involved. It seems to be a combination of hearts and Euchre.
Wizard is a fun card game for adults with or without much card playing experience.  It is a nice way to spend an evening with four or six of your friends.  You should try it!

Have played this game in the past, but wanted by own deck.  We just played with THREE players and it was just as interesting as with four, only there are more hands to play and you have to hold more cards near the end of the game.  The cards are coated so I think they'll last a long time.  The score sheets are a nice touch, but the print size and spacing are a bit problematic for these older eyes.  Think we're going to put a sheet on the printer scanner and enlarge it.  Overall, a fun game!
summary: A Wizard of a bidding game!

reviewText: We have been playing this game for several years with friends. Love the game. Everyone who plays it - wants one of their own. Have purchased several and given them to friends. Highly recommend game - fun for entire family.

My parents had asked me to play this and I found it pretty enjoyable.  It is definitely one of those games that is "Easy to learn and difficult to master".  It only takes a few minutes of explanation before one can begin playing.  The most interesting thing about it is how the player isn't just thinking about his or her own cards, but instead about what cards the other players have.  Who has spades? Why would "John" decide to play an Ace in this situation? etc.  It really gets your mind going as you struggle to collect tricks that coincide with your bid.  There are also a lot of surprises where you expect to lose and you win a trick etc.  A lot of fun!
I bought this for a friend's children, but they never said a word about it.  I don't think it was a real hit with them or they would have told me all about it.

Was visiting my parents - they had this game from my Aunt and Uncle - we played it and... Totally loved it! You actually have to think, plan, strategize... You start with one card and work you way till they are used. Only one winner per trick - so you have to bid correctly to win or loose each trick. Trump cards will win - unless someone plays a Wizard card which automatically wins that trick. Jester cards help you pass along the lead card to your neighbor - or - help you retain a trump card that your neighbor is trying to flush out... Fun game. Highly recommend it.

This is a fun card game! Hard enough to be enjoyable over time, but easy enough to be played by most people and older kids.It is a bit like Spades and Hearts in that you take tricks, but it has the added wrinkle of Jesters and Wizard cards that are more than just "wild" cards. A very good game! The only thing stopping me rating it 5 stars overall, is that you must have at least three players, which isn't always possible for us.

A friend had a Wizard card game that my wife and I had played several times with them.  We got hooked on the game and wanted our own deck.  Naturally, we are very pleased with the product and the timely delivery.
Thoroughly enjoy  the game.  It has just the right mixture of luck and skill.  I strongly reccomend it to anyone who enjoys a good card game.
Fun game to play, but you also needed to think. Friends enjoyed it too. Will take to play at the clubhouse.
The game is inexpensive and addictive.  Talent plays very little part.  Anyone can win.  YOU should buy it.  You will be amazed at all the people that will enjoy it with you.

This game is so much fun -- introduced by some random boy our daughter brought home for dinner (another story); it took me months before I quit calling it whiskey . . . by which time, we were totally hooked on playing wizard; it usurped cribbage at the game table. Lots of fun, two to six can play. It's quick, it's fun; try it today!
GREAT card game and lots of fun along with lots of laughs.  Everyone we have introduced this game to loves it and have ended up buying their own deck.  Would highly recommend it.

Was introduced to this game several years ago. Have since purchased copies for friends. It is an instant hit - because it is for all ages, easy to learn the basics, hard to master. Recently gave it to a game playing family including Mom who rarely wins games against her college children. Mom has won and the "house college guru" has been shut out. He's taking it back to school to "work on" in his spare time. A real winner.
summary: Fantastic: novices can win; stumps experts

reviewText: Six of us couples meet once a month to have a Wizard Tournament. We play at 3 tables (4 at each table) and rotate after 5 hands (the 2 Losers move to the next table). Each person keeps his own score. We've taught the game to everyone in our community and it has really caught on. We love it. It's easy to learn, but different every time we play, which is often.Wizard Card Game UGS WZ5
This game is really fun...just wish I had more people to play it with....much like the card game called Rat Fink or Up the River, Down the River.
Better than spades or euchre. The Wizard & Jester cards make gameplay alot more challenging and fun
Our family has enjoyed many hours of fun playing Wizard.  Whether the college kids home for the holiday, or young grandkids, we haveall loved the challenge.  We highly recommend it.
great game, friends all play at Lake Placid NY, and the local store no longer carries it.Bought several to give to other friends who are hooked !
summary: love the game, and unable to find it in Lake Placid NY

reviewText: I played it at friends house & when I got home from vacation had to buy my own deck. You will enjoy it.
Best card game ever!  Takes skill but the Wizard or Jester can mess you up royally.  Even when I lose, I laugh and if a game doesn't make me laugh, I don't play.  Joan
We love this game. Play it a lot with our camping friends. It is easy to play, and a lot of fun too.
This game is needed by all families-young and old.  My 9 year old grandson learned it as well as other guests during the holiday season.  Everyone loves it.

I got this for my husband for Father's Day and we love it!  We had played it with my family and loved it, so we wanted our own.  It is a really fun game, but not too complicated.  I would recommend it!
This is a great card game.  I appreciate the prompt service with which my order was filled.  Thank you.

We have a Wizard cult growing in our town.  The game seems as much luck as skill, but somehow my husband seems to win more often than I, so I may be wrong about that.  Wizard can be played by any number of people that divide into 60 evenly.  We like to play with 4 or 6 people.  You play as individuals and every game is different.  Lots of laughing as we play.
WIZARD is a game that is not all chance.  It takes planning and sometimes trying to lose a trick.  Good for young adults to seniors.
The game is tons of fun!  I was thrilled to find it on Amazon for such a good price because the game isn't sold in many stores and it is rather expensive IF you can find it.

Played this with the kids when they came to town; and some friends! We normally play Skip Bo, Phase 10, etc. We had a riot with this game; highly recommend! You have to get the exact number of books that you bid on; it's a riot! Also, game came with a postcard to order a free scorepad; and they sent out, free; a nice huge scorepad! Very impressed with the game; and the 'extra' from the company that came very fast! Highly recommend!...oh, the 'kids' are ages 27-33!!

The upside, so much fun for ages 8-100.  The downside, someone has to be strong enough to exit the game so that the group will get fed!  Honestly, we play over every holiday weekend when grandparents, cousins, aunts and uncles gather.  Easy to learn and easy to pack!

This game can be played by young and old alike and is great fun for a small group.  Our family has been enjoying it for a couple of years and each time we gather someone suggests playing once again.  Young players learn bidding strategies, score keeping and take great pleasure in being able to be on an equal basis with the adults each and every hand.
We have had a lot of fun playing this game.  I usually play with my husband and 12 year old son.  It is enjoyable.

Every year for Christmas I try to find a good family game.  This is 2008's great game.  We love that any number from 3 to 6 can play.  There is a lot of strategy and changing course in the middle of the game as you try to take the exact number of tricks bid before the play starts.  Two quick tips:  The score sheet is a little small as we found it easiest to put the hand score/total score into the little square.  Also, write down the side of the score sheet either who is dealing (we use deals) or who leads for each hand.  It is important to know who is leading the round.  The first game we played (3 people) took about 1-1/4 hours.  Each subsequent game was quicker, even though we had up to 6 people.  I would say the game would be better with 12/13 years old and up, but a precocious 10 year old would be ok.Follow up 3 January 2009 -- I forgot one tip.  We gave pennies to each person based on what they bid.  That way, each person could remember what they bid and everyone could see everyone else's bid.

This game is great because you can play it with an odd-number of players and partners aren't needed. It moves quickly and the rules are easy for first-timers to learn. The only problem is the score card is poorly designed.
summary: perfect game for evening of fun

reviewText: We enjoyed learning and playing this game (for 2 to 6 players).  It is a standard 52-card deck PLUS four Wizard (wild) and four Jester (worthless but valuable) cards.  Everyone receives one card the first round, two cards the second round, and so on.  The object of the game and the way to receive points is to win EXACTLY the number of tricks you bid (you deduct points if you don't).  You receive points even if you bid and get zero tricks.  My 17-year old daughter said she wanted to play it with her friends the next time they come over.  I highly recommend it!
We play this game with our grown children and friends.  We always have a good time as the game requires a combination of luck and skill.
summary: Lots of fun, some luck and some skill required

reviewText: My Aunt loves to play this game  & I was soooooo happy - when I finally found it on Amazon!!!! Came right to my door.... stopped looking for it in the stores - cause it's NOT there........ which - could be a good thing, but they'd sell soooooo much more if they'd have it on the shelves of Walmart.......Great game - love playing with my Aunt.....
summary: Many memories playing with my Aunt!!!!! love this game!!!

reviewText: It's a trick taking game with extra card twists. I really love this and bought my first one at a garage sale years ago. I've bought several replacement sets since and given it out as a gift.I wish they would sell just the deck for cheaper.
summary: A fun family game for all ages

reviewText: I could not find this Wizard Card Game anywhere in the stores. Thus, I was happy to find it on Amazon for Christmas gift giving. It's a fun and challenging 'Bidding Game'. New and arrived in A+ condiotion. Thanks.

This game is a fantastic trump card game with a twist...a Wizard trumps suit, so you NEVER can be absolutely sure you will win the trick.  Hilariously fun and unpredictable, you don't know who will win till the last hand is played.  You will have hours of fun with this card game.
Great game with easy to understand directions. Easy to get hooked on this fun family game.  This could become a tradition at our home

This game is ideal because it's simple to learn, quick to play, and very entertaining. Even my father, who really doesn't enjoy cards or board games at all, can easily be persuaded to join us for a round of Wizard. We've found that 4-5 people playing this game makes for the best setup because there are more chances for missed bids (and thus an added drama factor!) and the game doesn't last too long. You'll be surprised at how attached you can become to a card game--whether you miss your bid or trump everyone else, you're likely to become emotionally involved, and that makes this game an intense but fun way to spend an afternoon or evening. Five stars for sure on this product!
We bought this as a birthday gift for a family member. We always play it when we visit our daughter and are always asked to bring it to family gatherings. Allot of fun!

We are enjoying this card game.  We have young adults from our church come over and they want us to teach them and also bring other young adults over to play the game.  I will be ordering more to give as gifts.
Love this game!  Can only hope nobody plays a wizard on your aces. Lots of fun for adults of all ages
This is an amazing game. great for a huge range of age groups, easy to learn, and SO crazy addicting!
My grandson who is 11 years old loves this game.  This is his second deck and we would recommend it as a fun card game for anyone.  Makes you think, and stay focused.
summary: My grandson, son, and I stayed up until 1 a.m. playing this game!

reviewText: This is my favorite card game. It works equally well with three or with six players. It's easy to teach new players and all of our friends seem to like it. It is challenging yet simple. Highly recommended.
Love this game. Easy to understand. You can play with just a few people or with several people. Not hard to understand the rules. Can be quick or last for hours.
My whole family is crazy about this game.  I bought it for a present for my nephew. A great game because it can be played with an odd number of people.

Each year, my family searches out games to play at Christmas. This is my pick for this year. Friends introduced me to this game of trump, with surprising twists and turns, a few weeks ago--- and I was hooked! I only wish I would have purchased a few more to have on hand for stocking stuffers!

I bought this game to suplement a Spades group I run. When we have 6 people, 2 have to sit out while the others play. So now with Wizard accomodating anywhere from 3 to 6, I can have everyone play, no matter how many people! We've had 18 playing - 12 at Spades, and 6 at Wizard. It's a lot of fun.
summary: Fun little card game for up to 6 people

reviewText: I'm a big fan of card games.  This one is definitely addictive.  We altered the game's rules a little bit so it wouldn't be so long....but it's definitely a fun game to play...If you like Pinochle, Oh Hell!, or any trick playing games....you'll definitely love this one.
We think this card game WIZARD is the best, soooooooo much fun.  We play Wizard all the time.  This deck I just purchased is my 3rd, the other two are worn out!
Fun for all ages; easy to learn, and great for all ages. We enjoy playing with teenagers, grandparents and great-grandparents.
