Most of our family enjoys this game.  Some, not so competitive people do not seem to like it as much.  It is especially fun with 5 or 6 people playing.
We are having lots of fun with this game. Fast-paced.  Rules are a little confusing at first, but not if you actually take the time to read them carefully and play the first couple games slowly.
This is a great card game to play with multiple people. It is very fun and is a game of chance. Good for kids 9 and up. Is a super fun family/friend game!

We are a large extended family who enjoy games this one was a big hit this Christmas. It is a good combo of many other games it keeps you on your toes all the time the lead can change in just one hand.  Not a game for the timid player.

Friends of ours introduced us to this card game & we were instantly hooked.  We prefer trick-taking card games & we think this has to be one of the best.  We used to play a lot of spades & euchre but this is better.  It is based on the card game "Oh hell", which we didn't used to play for whatever reason.  The addition of the wizard & jester cards to the deck makes the game that much more strategic & interesting.  It's also nice that you don't need exactly 4 people to play this game.  It's unfortunate this game can't be found at major retail stores so everyone could easily pick up a deck.  Thanks to amazon for carrying it!  If you like card games, esp. ones like euchre, don't hesitate, buy this game now.  You won't be disappointed!
summary: One of the best card games ever!

reviewText: Fun card game for two to six people. Can talk while you play but you still have to pay attention. Cards are made of quality material.

We love this game and have introduced it to all our friends.  Even the ones who don't like playing cards, like this game.  We needed to buy a new game, as our old one is just to old and worn to use again.

This game evolves as each round is played, which keeps it interesting. You can't rely just on skill, because the game and your location of play in each round can totally change what you expect to happen. Everyone who plays ends up purchasing the game! Can play with just a few or many players.
I have been looking all over for this game.  I used to play it with my family when I was a kid.  Its amazing!

My co-workers and I love this game. Great for playing during our lunch break. We've modified the rules slightly such that when we pass the number of cards in hand as there are players, the last person to bid, has to bid 'off' of the number of tricks. So if there are five players and you have six cards in hand, the last player's bid can't make the total 6, it must be greater than or less than six. It can be a punishing game, but rewarding :)

This card game is fun to play.  My family enjoys it.  It is more fun when you have more then two players.  It is not difficult to understand and follow the directions when you are first learning how to play the game for the first time.
The packaging was great and was arrived in a good time. We like playing is game and I hate these things that I have to write stuff.  Thanks
summary: We like the game and have been playing it for years, the cards were very used, so got new ones.

reviewText: This is a great game and it shipped to me quickly and I will order another one when this one wears out.  We play it often.
Recommend this game.Took it away for the Xmas holidays and played with family.They all loved it!They all want to get it now too!
Wizard Deluxe Edition Card GameThis is a great game with no sure winners.  It has become our favorite game for our RV group.  It is easy but competitive.  Probably good for kids but great for adults
This game is a lot of fun and once you play, you will be recommending it to your friends.  I have gotten my sisters and my in laws both hooked on it already!

I love this game. If you like hearts or spades, you will love this game. It is a little complicated so my 12 year old son struggles with it. I have had to help him figure out how to bid properly. My son does not really care for it because it is so complicated. This would be great for adults or teenagers who were willing to play.
summary: great card game for the family

reviewText: Super game - lots of fun.  Recommend it to all, especially those who love Euchre.
I found that the interaction to be quick, friendly and professional!  Thank you for being so easy to work with!

We were first introduced to the game of Wizard by some friends and immediately liked it.  We then taught our grandkids how to play.  They range in age from 6 to 13. They all love to play it.  We had to help the younger ones at first but they quickly learned how to play. Now they beg to play every time they come over. I highly recommend this  if you like to play games and cards.

We love this game!  It's similar to the card game Spades, but the addition of four wizards and four jesters changes the bidding and strategy of the game.  If players don't make an exact bid, they lose points. This makes the game more exciting.  For less than $6, it's a great game for ages 8 and up.
We always get lots of games for Christmas, but this one outshined the rest! It was easy to learn and fun!

reviewerName: Robin, PT "Robin, the book and movie lover!"
reviewText: This is a fun game that is great to play with 2 to 6 people.  It's not difficult but it is challenging enough to keep you interested.  We had a gas when we played with friends.
Young and old, card sharks and recreational card players can enjoy this together. It's better with 4 or more people.
This is the ultimate party game. Get 4 or more people to play. I was hesitant at first that it would be just another card game like Uno, or Gin. It's very fun.
This is a fun game.  The strategy changes a lot based on the number of people playing.  It is like Hearts, but less frustrating to those of us without much luck.

If you like card games with trump and strategy that are extremely easy to learn, you'll love this game.  It is similar to "Up the River, Down the River" and a little like Euchre and Pinnocle, except much easier with much more strategy. Also, you can actually win a given round by taking zero tricks, you can win by loosing all the hands. Highly Recommended for all ages.
summary: Wizard Card Game (The Game of Ultimate Trump)

reviewText: Similar to Spades or Hearts but is an individual game verses a team game.  The great thing is you can play with anywhere from 3-6 players.  We have enjoyed playing this with our friends so much, I bought one for each of my family members for Christmas.

Wizard was a good card game that can be played by up to 6 people, we tried this on New Year's day for an hour and was pleasantly surprised at how fun it was.  While the rules are basic, it is open to interpretation - during my experience some people had an idea in their head what it should be like and started incorporating other card game rules. After several goes the game becomes addicting and the rules are easier to follow as everyone starts to understnd the concept.  We will definitely play this again during another family get together.  Highly recommended purchase.

This game is one that does require you to do some thinking, so if you are tired, you may not like playing it.  But once you get the rules down, it is a very fun game and can become addicting when you have competitive players to play against.

This card game is our friends and family favorite! We use to play spades all the time but Wizard takes card playing to a new level. In spades there are people who bid high and or low..Wizard takes all of that away and really makes a person think and "play" the game.This Christmas I gave Wizard as a gift and the funny thing is that the person who opened the gift was so excited and actually said they loved this game and have been wanting to purchase it!The only thing I would tell people to do when you buy the game is read the directions and take notes. The game isn't hard but you can get confused on how the points are awarded.
We have a game night with my daughters and sons in low every week.  We love this game, it's a lot of fun.

I love card games and I really like strategy card games. I have heard this is like Up and Down the River except that you have Wizards and Jokers. We enjoyed playing this game very much. Now if I could just beat my husband and son.
A great game for several people!!!!  It is like the game Oh Hell but with a fun twist!! Ordered it and received it very quickly!!
This is our favorite game.  Needed a replacement deck of cards. I would definitely recommend this game.  Tons of fun!!!
Love this game and our family has been playing this for years. It is a game that more than 2 can playl

Wizard is a very easy game to learn and yet is challenging and fun for all.  We have played the game with a 3, 4, and 6 players and had a blast.  Great for family get-togethers after dinner.  Anyone can quickly learn to play.  Great for both novice and hard core card players. Highly recommended.
Game is a lot of fun very for a number of people, alot of strategies but very simple to learn.
My husband and I love this card game.  We have introduced it to many friends and that's why I ordered 5 games ...to give as gifts.
summary: If you like to play cards, you'll like the game of Wizard.

reviewText: My son who is a game person had this.  It was a little difficult to learn at first, but so much fun.  I like that it is not totally all about strategy although there is some in it.  Anyone can win.
This game is enjoyed by all.  The wizard card adds a whole new dimension to the play strategy.  It makes great, cheap gifts.
The design of the game gives everyone an equal chance of winning - even if you are consistently dealt "bad" hands.  This became one of my favorites after the first time I played it.
This is a fun card game especially for families with older children (10 and up).  It's a trump game that requires concentration and confidence, but not difficult like bridge.

I bought several board games along with this game but this game is a big hit. Entire family is now hooked up to this game and is a lot of fun. In our case, we let the kids do the math and remember the scores (thus helping them in addition).
I was expecting the large size cards like the original version. I saw the large box and when i opened it it was a reg. size deck.
Great game.Easy to learn, but there's a lot of strategy if you try.Anyone over 5 should be able to play.

We bought several card games for Christmas and this is by far our favorite when playing with our older children and their spouses. The game constantly changes and scores go up and down all the way to the end. We would recommend this for anyone who likes thinking and luck with their cards.

Great  strategy and fun card game.... played this first in Ecuador  in the Amazon jungle while we were camping...an older couple brought the game...finally found it on Amazon..fun game to have plan a strategy yet.. you can converse as well.

We love this game. This is the 5th deck we have purchased because we keep wearing out the cards from massive use. We play as a family with 3 or 4 of us, and with friends up to 6 of us. Everyone enjoys this game. The Wizards and Jesters make the game very interesting. Sure the Wizard takes all can be used instead of following suit. But the even bigger difference in this game to other similar Trump type games is the Jesters which can be played anytime you want, instead of following suit, and can't take anything. This really adds strategy to a card game.
This is a great game for those who like a challenge.  We started to play this a year ago and now have several of our friends involved
This is a fun game for our entire family, we can all play - no one has to sit out. We love the bidding challenge.
This is an awesome game.  We had great fun over the holidays.  There were many laughs at all ages that were at the table.
Everything went OK, no problems .  We got exactly what we wanted in the time we wanted it.  Would recommend to anyone.
My family loves this game.  It takes some strategy and some luck.  Great game for 4 to 6  (possibly 7) players.

I was introduced to this game when I was on vacation and met some Canadians. They taught us how to play and we had a great time. I love that there are rules and then there are canadian rules. I've been looking for this game and couldn't find it in local stores. Thanks to Amazon I am able to enjoy the game with my family and friends.
We have played and enjoyed the Wizard card game with friends.  I've looked in stores for it and never found it.  When I went to Amazon, it came up on the first page.  Now we have our own cards.

A great game - simple in rules but a real thinker when it comes to strategy - so many ways to reach your goal and so many ways to get thwarted. If you know how to play trump card games this is one you will really enjoy. Wizards and jesters are worth their weight in gold.

My 9 year-old son says: I got Sherlock Holmes and it was amazing! It was a bit hard but it was very fun! It comes with a directory of London,which has bank and golf clubs etc. It has more things that go with it. I recommend it for ages 9 or 10 and up.

We recently found this game in a vacation cabin we were renting for the weekend.  It was so intriguing and a lot of fun.  It's definitely too advanced for our 7 year old (but he does well with the other S. Holmes game).  What I love about this game is the way it really stretches your deductive reasoning skills.  It allows you to follow a logical trail through the use of the directory, case-book, clues, and even a newspaper archive.  Also! It can be played against or with the other players (or alone) which makes for really adaptable entertainment. Very clever and rewarding game.
These are really fun!  We found that they do work best if you wait for a really sunny day.  Inspired lots of creativity in my girls.  They are talking of buying more with their own money!

The kit said the exposure time was between 1-5 minutes.  I made my prints on a very sunny day and the paper turned white in under 2 minutes.  Bringing the paper in from the sun as soon as it turns white is really important, or the sun will leak under the objects and expose the whole piece of paper.  I had a blast with this kit and I'll probably buy another.

This product works well. After putting in the sun the paper went from blue to white pretty quickle, only took a couple of minutes. If you don't use water to stop the process though, the paper will turn back to blue. So if you don't like the original exposure, put back in packaging for a couple hours and try again.

This is the somewhat controversial module that introduces fighters into the Star Fleet Universe. Personally, I'm not too keen on the idea of fighters, seeing as how any kind of fleet action clutters up the board tremendously already, not to mention brings the speed of the game down to a screeching halt. Nevertheless, these are an important part of Star Fleet Battles, and are worth giving a chance.They do represent the logical outgrowth of how ship battles in this universe could have evolved over the years. I know then in my own SFB games, I very much like launching every shuttle I have and using their little Ph-3's as a swarm of insects to attack my foe's downed shields. This module allows for that tactic, except on steroids!In a lot of ways, the Fighter battles in SFB reminds me a lot of the ship-to-ship / fighter battles you see in the newest Battlestar Galactica show. This came out long before that show, though. You almost get the feeling that the writers of BSG liked Module J, at least subconsciously...Also, this module has some neat scenarios. Who can not like the scenario called "Tomcats Over Leebyah"? Featuring a fictional planet called "Leebyah", ruled by the evil dictator "Klodhoppi". Haha, that is just too funny. And no, I am not making that up! Who said the creators of SFB can't have a sense of humor?So yes, the inclusion of fighters does underscore the concept that this is Star Fleet Battles, not Star Trek. That part is a bit jarring, given how seamlessly most of the other SFB units would fit into the Star Trek universe. But the idea is still cool. And it is something different. I'll have to play some of these scenarios before I can really pass judgment on them.Thanks for reading!
summary: Well sir, you can't get the toothpaste back in the tube!

reviewText: came on time, great gift idea, loved the product, wonderful service, nice to have around when you need a ;quick science experiment

I bought this kit and couldn't be more pleased.  It's very simple to use, the prints turned out great, overall it was a lot of fun and I highly recommend this kit.  It was shipped very fast although I had picked standard shipping, which is always appreciated.

This product works well on a sunny day.  I did not use an acrylic sheet over the paper, and found that it was necessary to lay flat items on the paper in order to get a clear print.  Overall, this paper is fun to use!  (I do not recommend using on an overcast day.  Although it does work, it does not work as well.)
These papers are interesting, fun and easy to use for kids of all ages.  I am a young 55 and had a great time making designs on them to use for pictures and personal home made cards.

I bought this solar paper to make leaf prints with my Bear Scouts.  We didn't get a kit.  I just bought some cheap frames and we used the glass and the back of the frame to sandwich the paper (that I had cut down to size).  It worked perfectly and the boys thought it was pretty neat.

We ordered this as an outdoor thing for summer. The kit was as promised and worked perfectly. We had a few kids get over excited and rinse their paper too early which ended up with a very light image, but they were still in awe and happy.
This puzzle was very challenging and worthwhile.  There are several different shapes of pieces which make it fun.  The photo on the box is accurate which helps.

Do you like Scrabble? Then you'll love this game. It's a quick card game where you make words each round, going from three letters to ten. There's a solitaire version too. This can keep me occupied for hours!
Played this game for the first time a few weeks ago and highly recommend as great entertainment for kids and adults.
Great game for all ages.  We played with the family during the holidays.  Our grandchildren love it.  It is kind of a combination of gin rummy and Scrabble.
Spent a lot of time looking for an interactive adult game that wouldn't make you fell stupid playing it. No luck here!
summary: Forget about finding a fun adult card game

reviewText: This game is an expensive and very additive hobby.  Like anything additive don't try it or you'll be hooked.  The back cover of this Intelligence Handbook says it better than I can, so I 'liberated' it for your use.  This handbook covers the Western and Eastern Fronts during 1944.The Western Front.As 1944 began, the British and American forces in Great Britian were preparing for their return to France in the D-Day landings.  At the same time the Fifth and Eighth Armies in Italy looked towards Rome, planning the battles that would capture the first Axis capital to fall in the war.  "Festung Europa" contains Intelligence Briefings on the German, British, and US forces involved in these dramatic campaigns to liberate Europe.  These give you everything you need to field these forces in a "Flames of War" game, including the up-gunned M4A1 Sherman (76mm) and Firefly VC tanks, the speedy M18 Hellcat GMC tank-destroyer and Cromwell tank, the deadly Churchill Crocodile flame-tank, and the M16MGMC with its quadruple .50 cal machine guns.The Eastern Front.While the western Allies planned, the Red Army was fighting the brutal battles that would take them from Leningrad in the north and the Dnepr River in the south, to the borders of Poland and Romania, clearing the Motherland of the Fascist invaders.  "Festung Europa" contains Intelligence Briefings on the Soviet and German forces fighting the epic battles for the Ukraine and Western Russia.  These give you everything you need to field these forces in a "Flames of War" game.  In these battles the Red Army fielded the up-gunned T-34/85 medium tank and the powerful IS-2 heavy tank with its 122mm gun capable of penetrating any German tank, even the new Konigstiger!  On the other side, all of the German equipment that appeared at Kursk is now in full production and available in quantity.
summary: The Western and Eastern Fronts 1944 'Flames of War'

reviewText: My beau and I love word games and are very competitive with them.  We are always challenged to find a word with more letters or fewer vowels.  The game is never dull!

A card game for those who enjoy playing with words.  It is easy enough for children, and should promote the ability to see different letter arrangements and spelling. I like it as a travel game - more portable than Scrabble.  It will never develop the following Scrabble has but it's a good addition to the family entertainment collection.
Lot's of fun for get togethers with friends. Easy to carry with you on trips and small parties. Helps to keep your mind sharp.
This is a game for young and old to play together or independently. Can fill the time in many situations. Waiting for flights, hospital recovery or a snowy evening.

This is a great game for kids and adults. It's easy enough to play that you can talk while the game goes on, yet challenging enough to be fun.  It's educational for younger children to practice spelling and thinking of/creating words.
Fun game to play with friends even if they can't spell. :-) Helping each other out is half the fun.

Anyone can play it, anywhere.  It also is educational.  We do NOT use a dictionary unless we want to challenge and sometimes we even penalize and incorrect challenge ... just like in Pro Football. The artwork on the cards is also interesting.  This has been a terrific find.  I have also bought it for family gifts.

Our cousins gave us this game while visiting.  Everyone we have played with had so much fun, most of them have purchased this game for themselves.  We also purchased a couple to give as gifts.  Everyone has loved this game.
My son loves to draw comics and write stories. He loved being able to creat something that would last and that he could share!

First, kudos for service. I ordered this mid afternoon on 8/20/13; received it 8/22/13! I use Quiddler to break up the monotony of English class.  The kids play in teams of two or individually. The game is easy and students can use a dictionary. It's all about seeing words in the cards you're dealt.  I 'd bought my first deck at Target years ago but the chain stopped carrying it.  I'm so glad I didn't throw out the surviving 60 cards from that first deck and, that I thought of checking Amazon.  Quiddler will  certainly be in my lesson plan for the first week of school!  Thanks again! VRF/Teacher/Mount Holly, NJ
summary: FAST SERVICE; FUN BUT CHALLENGING SPELLING GAME!

reviewText: Great idea and I am looking forward to using it. Be wary though, Amazon sent me one that has clearly been handled and returned and I can't give it as a gift as intended. If it's a gift, you might want to buy it elsewhere.

We first bought this as a gift for my oldest son when he was five.  We all still enjoy looking at that book, as well as the others we have purchased and have had published since then.  My kids ask for this kit for their birthdays and Christmas and it's so easy to do.

I ordered the Illu-Story for myself.  My kids have used this in the past and we loved how the colorful illustrations came out.  I want to write children's books so I ordered this for myself.  I was able to write and Illustrate my own books.  The hard cover design is great.  I want to let everyone know that adult's can use this also.  I wrote two books for each of my children that they treasure. It is great to have a book written by their mother for their own.  THis product is great.

My daughter made a book about her 5th birthday.  I feared sending it in, thinking it would be really difficult and would take an enormous amount of time.  But when I finally got online -- it turned out to be incredibly easy.  Now I want to do more!!  The book is something she was so proud to show everyone and we read it at bed time for weeks.  It truly is a great gift you can give any child.
summary: Incredible way to make a keepsake

reviewText: The product itself is fantastic -- my child was just thrilled with her final printed book! However, you should know that the company is going through a transition, and the company is very backlogged. It took close to 3 months to receive the book. The company was responsive when I contacted them, so I know they are trying. Hopefully they will smooth things out soon.
summary: Great product -- be aware of delays

reviewText: My daughter received an Illustory kit for her 7th birthday, and it was probably her favorite gift that year. She spent about a week working on her story and illustrations, and then I scanned the pictures and typed up her text for her.I was also very impressed with the customer service at Creations by You... when the book arrived, the pages hadn't been bound correctly and were loose inside the cover. I was afraid to try to fix it myself and risk ruining my daughter's book, so I called the customer service number, and they apologized for the error and sent us another copy that week! I was thrilled that they were so helpful; so often, you can never reach a live person on a customer service line, or they ask you to send a defective product back at your own expense. Creations by You handled this kindly and quickly, and my daughter and I both really appreciated it.It's been over a year, and my daughter still gets her book out often to show off and to read to younger relatives. She's a great storyteller, and her illustory book has given her a lot of confidence in her abilities, as well as a keepsake that we treasure.As an added bonus, it's a great gift that doesn't become another quickly-forgotten toy at the bottom of the toybox.

My sister bought this book for my five-year-old daughter.  I thought she was too young for it, so set it aside for about 6 months.  While it took quite some time to lay out the story, it was worth every second.  She really loves her book, took it to school and went to each of the classrooms to read it.  One teacher called me and asked for the information so that she can do it with her entire first grade class.  It's a great idea and was a great gift!
I created several of these as a child, and still have them to this day.  They are a great memory of my childhood (and the kind of stories I used to write and pictures I used to draw)!

This seems like a great idea, and my daughter had a terrific time writing her book, but the ordering process and customer service have been simply horrifying.  We tried placing an order in mid-January, 2014, had trouble with the website, emailed for help, and never heard back.  I tried again a week later and we managed to place our order.  It has not yet been received, so I contacted the company for help.  It took days to hear back, and when I did, they said that they are looking into the problem.  It's been days since that happened and I have not yet heard a thing.  It's not worth the hassle, particularly as I'm not confident we'll ever get my daughter's book.

My 6 year old daughter got this as a Christmas gift and she and my 8 year old son decided to do it together. He was the author and she the illustrator. It was a great family acivity and the company was wonderful. My son spelled his cousins name differently on 2 pages and they caught it and actually called me personally to check. The finally copy was adorable and it made a wonderful gift for their grandfather who cried when he recieved it. I would definitely do this again!

Bought this for as a gift for my 6 year old daughter, since she loved stapling together my notepaper to make her own "books."  We had so much fun planning the book, and she was thrilled to write her own story and see her illustrations in print.  She also got a kick out of the "about the author" feature.  Very user-friendly, and my daughter was able to complete the pages more or less independently.  We also received the finished book quickly!  It will remain a treasured keepsake for years to come.  My experience was so positive that I have since purchased several more books as gifts.

Illustory is a wonderful way to preserve childhood memories. It's easy to use and comes with everything you need to write and illustrate a simple story. My six year old son and I had a blast putting it together & can't wait to see the final product (the bound book).
summary: Great fun for parents and children

reviewText: I bought an illu Story two years ago for my daughter as a Christmas gift.  At first she thought it was going to be like doing homework, but once she got started, she was hooked!  She was so proud of her book and has asked for another kit this year.The kit is easy to use.  You do need to help a bit in keeping the pages in order, but other than that.... Let the creative juices flow!I would recommend this for ages 7 -12.

We bought the first of these for our son when he was 3 1/2 and helped him create his first book.  He loved it and would read it to us daily.  He's five now and has 'created' 5 additional books (this time without our help).  He loves this and has decided that he's going to become a writer when he grows up (after he becomes a pilot). As a result of creating the ILLUSTORY books, he's started keeping a journal (which we thought was a big endeavor for a 5 year old- but he's managing to write in it every day about the perils of kindergarten, of course!) Kudos to the makers of this product for keeping children educationally entertained!!

Last year for Christmas our family decided to give eachother all homeade gifts.  Our daughter Liberty acted very secretly for the next couple of weeks.  She asked my husband and I questions about our past, and we caught her looking at our old scrapbooks when she that no one was looking.  On Christmas day under the tree was a present for my husband and I.  It was a illuStory about are courtship.  It was so sweet.

This has been a wonderful incentive for my [...]to write a book.  The only negative is that in order to get the whole book in the alloted space, you have to type in on-line.  If you type it on-line, you can't actually draw the pictures, you have to draw it on the computer.  Other than that, it is a wonderful idea.

What do you give a child who loves arts n crafts and has just about everything??? an Illustory Kit!  After running out of birthday/Christmas ideas for our 9 year old, who asked for only art gifts, we found this kit. This kit helped to bring a story that was written in school to life in a fun, readable and visual keepsake.  You can write 12 pages (or more but you will pay extra) and illustrate on every page.  I wish you could add more then 20 words on a page, but for a young child, this is perfect.  The process was fun as your child learned to create a book from start and send it away for a finished product... And it even comes with a "about the author" page!
summary: For the kid who has almost everything.....

reviewText: I recommend this product highly for it's creative value and the bright look on my daughters face (9 years old) that she created something so cool.  This is just a really great product and I wish there would have been something like this when I as a kid.
summary: Very cool for imaginative, creative kids!

reviewText: Item was delivered on time and in great condition. My only complaint is that there was no information included regarding who it was from and that it was a gift.

I have now purchased 6 of these books.  It is a family tradition to give each grandchild a book about the fun things they experience when they  come to our house. Now that we have older grandchildren they get to add a page about family fun in their younger cousins book.  This is a book full of family love and memories. I can't say enough about how wonderful this book is to our family.

I thought this would actually be reprinted and bound, but the pages in the book were (it looked like it, anyway) the actual pages we had mailed in.  The pictures bled through the pages and there were visible lines everywhere.  Maybe it would have been better to do it online, but I think we could have probably done a much better "publishing" job here at home.
summary: Not as good as I expected...not worth it.

reviewText: This was a Christmas gift for the grandparents from our 7 year old daughter and 4 year old son.  It was so much fun to do and it held the attention of our very high energy kids that love to run around outside the entire time.  You can choose an option of having their handwriting - mistakes and all or have the company type it up for you.  We chose the handwriting so we can watch how they improve over the years.  Before we began, we chose a plot and what to draw on each page.  I cannot tell you how many times we laughed while they were developing the story!  The materials and mailing was high quality and simple to do.  We received a call from the company a few days later stating that some of the writing went outside of the lines on one of the pages.  The representative gave me a few options to fix the problem.  I was concerned that we would not get these gifts out in time for Christmas since we began the project so late in the season.  We were thrilled that it came earlier than expected and gave us enough time to mail it to the families.I must state that I was super impressed with the quality of the end result.  For the price of the kit and the cost of each book (all of which I considered inexpensive), I assumed the books would be just 'okay.'  I was comfortable with that since it was a great bonding experience.  However, when the books arrived I was blown away!I highly recommend this product and company.  We have started a new family tradition and each year our kids will be creating a new story.  I have looked at other similar products on the market but with the great customer service I received, I will not risk going elsewhere.
summary: Fun, Easy, Great Quality & Exceptional Customer Service!!

reviewText: This is an awesome product.  My daughter was 5 when she wrote her 1st illustory and we can't wait to do it again.  She took her finished book to school and read it to her kindergarten class and her teacher plans to order it for her own children.  We have given our neices illustory for Christmas gifts and they loved it too!

Update:After posting this review, we received a follow up email from Customer Service.  After many months of waiting, going back and forth, we received a new book with the text corrections and no pages bleeding.  This second book is the quality we were expecting.  While it took a very long time, we are pleased with the end product.************************************************************************************************Our first experience with the gift was wonderful.  Although my daughter is very proud of herself, I am greatly disappointed and will cease giving this as a gift.1.  Despite providing our email address on the order form, we never received any updates or information during the manufacturing.2.  The finished book is missing pages, has a ton of spelling errors and there are huge white spaces between words in the book.  My daughter's name is spelled wrong.  On the order form, we did not ask to keep any "creative" spelling.  Makes you wonder if there is a quality control issue.3.  Pages bleed through.  We did use the provided markers.4.  The worst part of this entire experience is the customer service.  We tried calling a telephone number on the back of the book.  The recording says all messages will be return within 24 hours - that was 3 days ago.  We sent an email - nothing.
summary: Lack of Customer Service and Quality Control

reviewText: My 6 year old niece loved this gift.  Her own book - how can you beat that!  And it is something that is creative, simple and does not involve the television or other technoligical gimick.  No batteries, no repeditive strange noises!  I am going to remember this gift idea for the future.  A great product I can feel good about spending my money on.

My girls loved making their books. We mailed them in on Halloween and FOUR WEEKS later (after Thanksgiving) they finally processed the two books and cashed my check. Now another month has gone by and I still haven't heard about them being completed yet. So much for Christmas presents... hopefully I will like the finished product when it finally arrives. Customer service responded quickly once I finally found an email address, but didn't have much to help me with, and the website is offline indefinitely. So the moral of the story is: mail them in September and you should get them before Christmas, but don't count on October. I'm still hopeful that they will be great books and this hassle will not be the only memory I have of the process.Update january 12: I searched and searched and found a phone number for customer service and left a message. O finally received the books after New Years but with a big error on one (typeset instead of the handwritten words by my daughter). I finally got to talk to someone in customer service (the school publishing side of the business, ironically), and they promised to fix the error and send me new books. Customer service on the phone was absolutely great, now we're just waiting for the fixed books to arrive. One person did say they are transitioning right now to focus on their school publishing so things are a little messed up right now. I plan to try again next year, hoping for the best.
summary: Sat in the warehouse for four weeks before they even processed the order :-(

reviewText: I wirk for a great company that has a mentor program with a local elementary & middle school. The school picks children that have "unique" living situationsand may just need another adult role model in their lives. These are good kids that have to keep their grades up to continue in the program.The schools bus the kids over to our office every Tuesday for an hour and each mentor/mentee does their own thing. We eat lunch together, talk, we can go walk around campus, play board games, cards, draw, play on the computer etc. some kids even get help with their math homework.I had bought this book kit for a special occasion about a year prior to mentoring. I did not end up needing the book for that event so it sat in my closet and was forgotten about.Then I started mentoring 9 year old Kaitlyn. We started a book about our year together. We started it about halfway through the year so we did a couple of pages each week. I let her do the majority of the writing and we drew the pictures together. It helped us bond that first year because coloring/drawing can really promote conversation.When the year was over so was our book so I sent it on and ordered us each a copy. I thought that the price of the second book wad not too bad so it was worth it.We are 3 years in to our time together and that book still os displayed in my office. Next year is the last year we can do the program together so I am thinking about doing another one to see the difference in them in that 4 year period.Thanks for giving us such a great product to remember these days forever!!!!!
summary: A girl and her mentor and a keepsake forever

reviewText: This was a gift for my neice, and she rather enjoyed creating her own book with the kit.

I purchased this product for my daughter for Christmas one year. She was eight years old. She loved it. She was able to write and illustrate her story quite easily.  It was such a joy to read her book when it was complete.

Illustory gave us "Grandparents" a Treasure to give "OUR 5 GRANDCHILDREN FOREVER".  From toddler to adult  we had so much fun teaching building & creating projects with Poppy & we were able to scan pictures of them & express all the love & fun in these books.  Even now the scanning of  pictures  & the story involved them bringing back loving caring memories.

I purchased Illustory for my 7 year old daughter.  We had so much fun creating her book.  She came up with her imaginary story all by herself.  Then she decided what to draw for each page.  She still has the book 3 years later and wants to create another one.  It encourages creativity and seeing the finished product inspired her to write more!  We love Illustory!

We had purchased this same product for my son when he was 5 and now did the same for my daughter.  The product itself is a nice self-made book that is way overpriced but a precious one-of-a-kind keepsake.  We live on a military base overseas and use the base USPS for all of our purchase from the US.  When we did this with my son, we got the product back via USPS in about 8 weeks.  The customer service was wonderful.  About 2 months after we sent in my daughters book to be published, we received an email stating they could't ship it to an USPS military address.  For those that don't know, military USPS get shipped to a place in CA and from there the military takes it to whatever destination in Asia.  It is a normal 5 digit zip code in the zone of CA, so there is no special work that needs to be done other than a customs form.  I asked them to look into it again since they had sent it this way before and were utilizing the USPS…it took over 2 months for any responses.  The delays in the emails continued.  Supposedly, 6 months after we purchased this, it is in the mail to a stateside relative that we will have to reimburse to send it here.  No where does it say it will not ship to any military address or we would not have used them.  The company says they are going through some internal changes right now.  Not a company I would use again for any of their products due to their poor customer service, poor handling of issues, and poor shipping policies that are not clearly stated.
summary: Worst Company!  Don't Purchase From Them!

reviewText: My daughter, although she had a hard time settling on a single story, loved writing and illustrating her own book.  It was like a brand new present when the book came back in the mail to her, and she likes to read it over and over because it is her special story.
summary: It's like two gifts in one!

reviewText: I purchased this gift for my great nephew who loves to write stories.  He is so creative.  I can' wait to see the end result.

We live in the UK and were very lucky to spent 6 months in the USA. My then 8 year old daughter made her own Illustory memory book full with pictures and notes of all the things that happened and she had done. It is beautifully bound and she regularly grabs it to go back on 'memory lane'. She did not want to write a story as such but there is plenty of space to describe events, trips we made and to put down the names of all her new friends. We made the book online, and after I set it up she quickly got the hang of it and needed little help, as a result it is truly her book and she is very proud of it. My daughter brought it into school when back in the UK to share her stories. She got many positive comments, not just from other parents but also several teachers have asked me where we got it from ... unfortunately I have not been able to find it in the UK :(

This kit was amazing! My 4 and 6 year old loved the idea of having their own hard cover story- written and illustrated by them!It comes with markers, worksheets to plan out your tale, drawing space, and lots of options for cover colors, text, inscriptions, and more! It was very easy to complete and mail in. The books arrived very quickly and in perfect condition. The kids love showing them off to friends and family : )

I just purchased my 2nd illustory gift. These are great, b/c kids love to make their own REAL books. They can always save it as a memory. It is just the best gift idea ever. I'm sure I will buy another one next year too!!!
summary: Great Gift for kids 5 and over.

reviewText: We purchased this for our neice and it is soooo adorable.  We are so excited to have this for her when she gets to be a parent herself.  Meant to be a creative, fun, and free from stress.  Let the child lead the way and you will enjoy every moment.

We purchased this for our kindergartener for Christmas.  She enjoys creating her own stories and this allowed us to capture that process for a keepsake - mis-spelled words and wild illustrations included. The binding looks great and the colors of the illustrations were bright. The final product was not a disappointment. We plan to have her create a new book at the end of each school year to chronicle her creativity and development -until she gets too old to be willing to do it. I gave it a "4" for fun because it required us to assist with the process - and that decreased her sense of independence in the process.  Next year it will be a "5" because we won't need to help her.  I purchased several extra kits this week to give as birthday party gifts for her friends.  We love that this gift reqires no batteries and is limited only by her imagination.

I bought this product for my six year old daughter for her birthday. We enjoyed every minute creating it. Not only was it fun for her to write and illustrate, she also learned a lot about the creative writing process, especially how to organize her thoughts. The final book turned out very professionally and the turn around time was quicker than we expected. I'm showing off her first publication to all our friends and family.

With this kit you or your child(ren) can write up to 12 pages of text, each with its own illustration, send it off to the company, and receive a professionally printed hardbound book in a few weeks.  There are even options to get gift books, each with its own unique dedication page!  An 'About the Author' section really personalizes the experience.Everything you need is in the kit -- instructions, paper (including practice sheets) and pens.  There's even a postage-paid envelope, so when you're finished writing you can just drop it into a mailbox.  We could not be happier with this product.  It was fun and easy, brought out the kids' imagination, and the product we received was beautifully finished.Highest recommendation.

So, I got these for my brothers as Easter presents this last year. It was tons of fun and they enjoyed writing their books. However, when I got the books in the mail my brothers' names were spelled incorrectly and some of the words were not what they had written. I contacted customer service and told them what had happened with the books and the person that I had talked to was very nice. She asked for the order numbers and page numbers and the corrections for the books. The company corrected the books and sent the new ones (free of cost). I was very surprised that they were willing to correct the books and send new ones, especially for free. I would definitely recommend this product to teachers, friends, and relatives. This company is very willing to work with customers and the books come out great!!! The next time I use this product I think I am going to have them keep the actually writing (yes, there is an option on the order forms for keeping the original writing on the pages!).I hope this is helpful!!!
summary: An Honest Review- I had gotten books that had the wrong spelling

reviewText: Great project that helps parents teach their kids how to finish what they start. Once the child knows they can get a finished book back it is up to the parent to guide them along their way, helping them start and complete their story. I think then getting back a finished book in the mail is very cool.

I am a grandmother and I was babysitting while my daughter and her husband went on vacation. My granddaughter who is seven often pastes sheets of paper together to make a "book."  So this is the perfect gift for her. She titled it "Mom and Dad Go On Vacation." Each page reflects a memory of the activities and events that happened during the week. The last page is the Artist's bio. We are still finishing the pages so it hasn't been published yet. All we need to do is put the pages in a self-addressed envelope, postage paid. It couldn't be easier.  This book will be a wonderful memory of our week together that I know she, and her family will cherish.
summary: IlluStory was the Perfect Gift for the Creative Child

reviewText: As a retired teacher, I appreciated the creativity and fun this kit provides to young writers. I bought two, one for a 10 yrs old and one for a 12 yr old. We haven't created the books yet but I checked out the kits and and was impressed. They are of fine, professional quality. I am as excited as the children are to make these.

Wonderful product! I did this with my 4 year old, who dictated the story to me and drew the pictures. He was absolutely delighted and enchanted when his real book, beautifully bound and with a fabulous author page, arrived in the mail! Makes a terrific gift. And when the basement flooded and we lost the book, customer service was great about helping us get another reordered.
summary: For older kids, but younger too

reviewText: Love this kit! I used it to make a daddy do you remember book for my father who is in te military

I would not order from these seller.  They said the book was shipped.  I did not receive the book keep waiting.  The response was very slow.  They were nice.  I don't know if I would order from these seller again or not.  They did give me prompt credit.  I have not seen it. But I will know when I paid for the bill.  Use your own judgment where you would order from these seller or not read more reviews on how they were with other shipment.  They did say they was sorry I had a bad experience.  However that does not explain why their was poor effort in handling this transaction.  This was a birthday gift for my grandson.  I had got him more gifts.  But wonderful if this would have been the only gift. All I can say it would not have been a good experience.  So be your own judgment of whether you would do business with these seller.  Read more review does help in some cases because anything can happen.  But the transaction could have been handle better.
Ordered for granddaughter. It's benn a while since I ordered this-do no actually remember what the book was all about

I have bought this three or four times, although I have yet to see anyone use it. So why do I keep buying it? Because when people do get it, they intend to use it, and part of me hopes that one day they will see it sitting there and just write the book they always intended to write. I think this purchase makes a perfect gift for anyone who says that they have always wanted to write a children's book because it's like, "Bam. Then do it."
We received them as Christmas gifts and both of my Daughters immediately got to work drawing, writing and even asking us about events they were writing about.  Both books are Family Keepsakes now.

For the budding artist that is interested in coloring, this is a great keep sake. To publish your own book is really neat. My Grandson thought so too. He was ready to send it in the first day but his Dad wanted to add some words to it about the pictures. Anyway it is a lot of fun that will keep my Grandson happy for years.

My Grandson Brendan, loves to write , and has already won one 'Young  Authors" award at age 7. He opened this gift Christmas eve, and amidst all the bedlam that accompanies Christmas Eve At Grandmas , He got out the pens and pages and began making up a story right there and then. He absolutely loved this gift.

It's been almost two months since my son completed and submitted his book online.  The website's FAQ section says it takes 2 to 3 weeks to receive your book.  I waited 3 before emailing and was then told that it would take 4 to 6 weeks.  After that came and went, I emailed again and have not heard back.  They have no phone number.  They cannot provide a tracking number.  This company is a joke.  If you have a child who is very excited about showing off their creative side, please look elsewhere, because what you'll have is a very upset child who runs to the mailbox everyday after school, only to find that this company will take their money but could care less about a child's dreams.  This the first negative review that I have ever left.
summary: Believe the Negative Hype!  Don't waste your money.

reviewText: This was a gift for our "Grandma" who is a retired school teacher, book lover, book giver, book collector.  She has told us about story ideas she has and wanted to "publish".  This is our chance, as her (grand)children to have her personal stories.  She got it at Christmas and loves the idea.  Wish I had it first!

I bought two of these Illustory kits as Christmas gifts for my almost 5 year old niece and almost 4 year old son.  They have plenty of other toys and clothes, so this was a perfect choice.  It will allow them to use their imagination to create and publish their own stories. (and boy are they full of them).  What a wonderful addition to their library of books.  I can't wait for them to open their gifts so we can help them create their own special published story!

For my daughter's first birthday, I wrote and illustrated a story for her about the day she was born.  I'm no artist, mind you, but she loves it. (If you want to, I believe you can use the computer to make very simple sticker-like illustrations instead of drawing.)  It was especially meaningful to her when her baby sister was born this last year.  I am buying a new one for the little sister as well.  I think it's a terrific idea for making a personalized keepsake FOR your child or grandchild.The only drawback, you do have to be a little creative regarding the words per page limit.

We ordered these for our children for last year's Christmas, it was about the best thing they've ever recieved! It challenged them to come up with their very own story, using thier imagination and when the books arrived, they were so proud! They gave a copy of their books to thier teachers at school and copies to thier Grandparents. We will be ordering more of these for the kids and also to have on hand for birthday parties, or other gift giving occasions involving kids. I highly recommend these.

My 7yr. old is sooooo excited about writing and publishing her OWN story!  My daughter has always wrote/drew stories since she could hold a crayon in her hand.  So, when I saw this for Christmas I just HAD to buy it for her.  I love everything about this activity, free postage paid envelope, no extra costs (unless you want to add stuff)step by step instructions, a package of markers (package of pencils would have been nice too! ;) ) the option to write the story online  . . . I could go on and on about how wonderful this product is!  Would definitely recommend it.
My 8 year old grand-daughter loves this gift! I expect to see a great book from her soon. This product came quickly and great quality.

My daughter loved writing her 2 books.  She read it to her brother's first grade class, which made her feel so grown up  We do show the book off quiet a bit. The book is a  big hit in our house and I think my 7 year wants to write one now too.  I love this item  and recommend to many people.
Bought for my grandson, he loves to write his own stories. Wonderful gift that is different and stimulates kids mentally at the same time.
My son created a IlluStory when we was 7 and two years later, we cherish this book on our shelf!
This was a gift for my 10 year old grandson, and he actually liked it. My daughter thought it was a perfect gift for him. He likes to draw and likes stories.

illuStory is a great product for elementary age students. I used it for a Who Wants to be an Author contest at school. The child that wrote the best story had an opportunity to publish their story with illuStory. The children loved the end result. When the book came back it was awesome! It looked like a real book and the children like the fact that they could see the author's picture in the book.

The online portion didn't work and the mail in portion is too young for my daughter. They only allow you 20 words per page which she says is not enough to write a story. And you have to pay extra if you don't want them to just cut out your pages and stick them together.

My son is 13 now but he loved writing his own story and drawing pictures for his very own book. This is a great confidence booster which also encourages the child to continue reading, writing, and drawing. We have two paintings he made when he was young, framed and hanging in our home. I recommend this for any child. It is a great gift or a project they can work on worth their parents.

My daughter was only 5 but loved to create stories so I wrote the story and she drew the pictures to go with the story.  It came out so cute!  She brought it to preschool to "read" to her friends. She was  sooo proud of that book because it looked like the ones she gets at the library. Very professional and very fast.  I was surprised how quickly it came back to us after sending out via snail mail.  Now that she is 8, I would love for her to do it again all by herself.

I bought th is for my daughter .  She was 7. This was a great way for her to be creative and encourage her to write a story.  I was happy with the amount of money I spent for this. I feel it was a good value and quality.
Got this for my 5 year old niece who's very artistic.  She's able to draw well with it and is enjoying it so far!

Each of my three children have made one of these books for their favorite teacher as an end of the year gift.  EVERY time they did it, it was so wonderful!  It was a great project to do together, very easy for young ages and older ages, and the quality of the finished product is amazing!  The last book we did was with my first grader for her teacher.  She made each page about different things they did as a class, and also some personal things about why she thought he was a great teacher.  It's definitely a unique gift for any teacher, grandparent, parent, aunt, Sunday School teacher, anyone really.  It's a cherished gift that they can keep, and it's so personal that everyone loves getting it.  The kit comes with very easy instructions, and you can either write with your own penmanship or go online and have it typed.  Either way, the book is a wonderful project and gift for a GREAT price!  I highly recommend this to all!

This appeared to be a great gift to give to my young godson who is keen on reading and writing. Unfortunatley I am unable to give a review on the product as once it arrived I happened to notice (whilst wrapping it) that it was not for sale outside the US. This being a problem as I live in the UK! Amazon seem to be quite happy to ship items to anyone anywhere regardless to whether you can 'use' the product or not. I have received a full refund which I am gratful for, however it still leaves me quite bemused as to why they will happily sent this gift to outside the US when clearly it shouldn't be and also do not offer reasons for doing so.The 3 stars represent what I think of the product having not even 'used' it. I went for a happy medium!
summary: Unable to review product - review of amazon

reviewText: My boy and girl 5 1/2 year olds both enjoyed writing their own story and coloring the pages.  They could not wait until it arrived in the mail.  I will keep this and give to them when they are older!
summary: Lot's of fun and a keepsake!

reviewText: This make-your-own-book kit is way cooler than we initially thought. My daughter got one as a gift when she was 8. She requested it (and got one) again this year. It's designed perfectly for a kid 5-10 years old who's creative.We love it because she can take her time and create it at her own pace. The extra pages let her change the story around and correct mistakes. Artists can be tempermental! So it's handy to have all the time in the world to make what you want.The emphasis in this kit is on the drawings for each page. There isn't as much room for text. For my daughter, this has helped her develop the skills of moving the plot along, continuity, cause and effect, and so on, in a fun way. It also helps her understand the need to plan ahead.The kit comes with pages outlined to draw/write the cover and pages of your own book. You send it to the company in the mail and it gets bound into a (seriously) hardcover book and mailed back to you. One book is paid for by the cost of purchasing the kit.The book she made is really professional looking. She actually goes back and reads it. So do we!When relatives ask what to get her for her birthday, it's this!

I bought this for my granddaughter who LOVES to write and I had hoped this might be her introduction to publication (as it is advertised).  However, there is FAR too much involved and if you don't already have the right connections, there is NO WAY this will get any further than just a project to keep.  I would not recommend this for any reason other than personal development.

I would have rated this lower, but the idea is so great.  My 7yo loves his book.Be careful w/ the pages you submit.  We ordered two books and the first book contains the original submitted pages w/ artwork (except the cover which was scanned and reprinted on "glossy" paper).  The 2nd book was, of course, all photocopied pages of the first.They simply take your submitted artwork pages and someone (or possibly an OCR), prints your submitted text just under your drawings; then binds the pages into the book, with the title page , dedication page, etc.Not as sturdy a book as I thought it should be, but as I said, my kid loves it, so that's what matters most. <grin>
summary: Great idea; watch out for the pages you submit w/ artwork

reviewText: My kids received their first IlluStory kits from my parents when they were 3 and 5- too little to really use them I thought.  They proved me wrong by creating adorable books of drawings and kid-isms that we cherish today.  (I had to help them write the captions, but they end up typed)  What a great time-capsule of how they thought and drew!  My younger child asked for another kit for the next birthday.  When it arrived the older child cried that she had not received a new one.  I think that speaks to how great a gift it was! :) We've been through six kits now and will probably get a couple new kits from the man in red with the beard come December.  The kids have so much fun and I love having a useful "toy" that leaves us with precious memories years later.
summary: Would buy again and again.  Actually, we have.

reviewText: Beware! -- this kit only allows 20 words per page and only contains 12 pages.  I returned it because I wanted something where my 10-yr-old neice could write a short story.(I think this is why it's recommended for ages 5-9.)
summary: Watch out -- only limited text is allowed!

reviewText: We have purchased 3 books for each of our 3 kids. 9 books total. We had them all create their books at the same ages, Kindergarten, 3rd grade, and 6th grade.  We have the collection proudly displayed in the living room, and are amazed how often we enjoy reading these and comparing their writing/drawing/interests at their different ages. We have also used the reprint option for Grandparents and purchased sets for other families.  I would recommend this item highly and suggest a similar tradition in your home!
summary: 3 books each for 3 children = 9 Family Treasures!

reviewText: My 8 yr old granddaughter loved this. She was amazed she could have it published even. This was a big hit.
summary: Christmas gift was a big hit

reviewText: Illustory is a fun, educational, wonderful family keepsake we will cherish for years on end. I bought this for my 7yr old daughter and she was thrilled.  She decided to make a book called "All about Olivia."  She drew a picture and wrote a couple of sentences describing a special event that had happened in her life on each of the 8x11 sheets of paper.  She also drew the cover of the book on a sheet of paper, wrote the title and picked the background color. The last page contained her school picture we had sent in plus a description we wrote about 'the author.'  She took great pride in telling her story and creating her book.  When we completed the pages and mailed them in the pre-addressed, postage included, envelope I don't quite think she understood how awesome her book was going to be.  But a couple of weeks later when she received a package addressed to her we were so surprised at what we saw!  It really is a good solid 'real' book.  The pictures and writing were exactly how she had drawn them.  We read this book night after night...and we couldn't be more pleased with this product.  It is the perfect gift for any child to make for themself or give as a gift.  We are planning on making a book for my daughter's new baby cousin this Spring titled "All About Our Family"  :)

We bought this for our 10 year old grandson last Christmas and he LOVED it.  He is interested in animals and he wrote a book about 'dangerous' animals.  He had a great time doing it. The finished product is great.  His parents had another copy of the book printed by the seller and sent it to us as a gift.  We will always cherish it!

We bought this for my friend's daughter who likes to write stories so she could have one of them published for Christmas. She was over the moon with it and immediately started writing. Inspires creativity and imagination. A must have for any budding writer.

We bought this for my son a few years ago.  He was 6 at the time. He absolutely loved it! He enjoyed writing the story himself. The layout was a little confusing at first, but we managed to figure it out.  They included extra pages in the kit and we were so glad because he had quite a few mess ups.  It was fun getting to sit down with him and help him create this.  It is a treasure we look back on frequently.  It was by far his favorite gift he has even gotten.
My 8-year old daughter has received an Illustory kit for Christmas each year since age 5, and she will get another this year! She is so proud of her published books. A great product.

My daughter purchased this gift for her little brother not knowing the memories it would enable us to keep. At three years old, Sammy was diagnosed with Chiari Malformation and just weeks after my daughter's wedding he would undergo brain surgery to relieve his pain. To be honest we put this unique and special gift on the shelf and forgot about throughout Sammy's recovery. Then one day we found it on the shelf and thought it would be a wonderful way to remember what Sammy went through and how his doctors and nurses at Walter Reed took such great care of him. We wanted the story in Sammy's own words as much as possible, so we took care to ask questions and record his answers. We took our time and over a few weeks obtained an interesting and very special story. This product allowed us to capture it in a professional form. After friends and family saw the book, we ended up re-ordering many more copies. Now books about Sammy's Chiari are located at his school, at the hospital and in the hands of many friends and family members. This is a fantastic gift limited only by your imagination.

Both my kids have had the opportunity to build their own books with Illustory.  I found out my daughter's interest is much more enduring than my sons!  They also have written and illustrated books for their younger cousins.  A great introduction to writing and illustrating, it's a very straightforward process to getting a quality bound book without even a typewriter.  We received our first Illustory kit as a gift and went on to order several more.  I'm glad we know about this product.  It's somehow still kind of an underground sort of thing.

My five year old daughter loved writing and illustrating her own story. It is such a wonderful encouragement for children to write and create.  She wanted me to rip open the box when the book arrived at our home.  I can't begin to describe her excitement when she saw her words and illustrations bounded in a smart, hardcover book.  To top it off, the back cover included an About the Author page along with her picture.  She took the book to school the next day and her teacher helped her read the book to her first grade class.  Apparently her classmates were so excited and wanted to make their own books. The teacher actually sent a note home to all the parents because apparently the children requested her to share the information!  This also makes a great gift.
I purchased one of these for several several years.  My young daughter made a book with photos and her own story.  I now have amazing keepsakes that I will always cherish.  I highly recommend this!
thought this was a book with pages to illustrate for my 7 yr old son but no it is loose pieces of white paper with no binder to put together a book. very disappointing

My husband, two children (ages 6 and 10), and I used this product as a way to memorialize our cherished family pet cat who recently passed away.  We wrote a story as a family and then each person illustrated several pages to go along with the text.  In the end, we received a book that we will keep forever in her memory.  Not only was it a great way to encourage the children to write and draw, but it also allowed us to share our memories of our cat as a way to productively process our grief.  I would recommend this product!

I have had each of my 5 children complete an Illustory kit.  My youngest recently asked to do another.  It's a quality kit, with all of the supplies needed to write your own story & illustrate each page.  I had my children complete them around the age of 5-7, but you could use it for a younger child, and definitely for older children.  It's one of those projects that they take pride in, and pull off the shelf for years, either to read it themselves, or to show friends and relatives.  I was a little intimidated with my first one, just fearful of it being a lot of work for me, but the instructions are very clear, and it really isn't a lot of work, once the child has written his/her story.  This makes an awesome gift.  I've given them to my nieces & nephews throughout the years.
summary: Love this personal keepsake for my children!

reviewText: If you have a little artist, this is the project for you!  Our little artist loved making this book of personal artwork and telling her own story.  And everyone in the family absolutely loved getting their own copies for Christmas! My man and I love looking back at her book since the first one is two years old now.  It gives us such memories.  She now makes one every year!  We are in the process of one right now!  it's a wonderful product.

I bought 3 of these for my three little girls for Christmas. They all loved making their own book....writing the story and drawing the pictures themselves! We had lots of fun during Christmas vacation and the girls were so proud of their books when they arrived in the mail. They looked professional and my girls were proud authors & illustrators. It's a great way to get kids interested in writing and storytelling....plus a great memory. We love making a new story every year and see the growth over the years!

This product is wonderful!  My son loves writing and illustrating his own stories.  He just wrote one entitled "If You Give An Elephant Some Peanuts" and was able to order an extra copy for his older sister who is a first grade teacher.  She loved it and is using it in her classroom to inspire her "story writers" to write and illustrate their own stories in the classroom.  Thank you for making a product that will get children writing and creating!

I bought this for my nieces and nephew and they love it.  I love the fact that it is something they can hold onto and cherish for years and more importantly, it is fun and educational at the same time.

my daughter worked on her book for a few months actually.  Ordered back in august of 2013.  Had not heard anything as of october so I contacted the company who responded in november  said they had located my order and to remember that it takes 2-3 weeks...ok we were already past that but anyhow.  They said they would contact me with further status updates but I haven't heard anything else and it is now march of 2014.  DO NOT THROW YOUR MONEY AWAY.  DO NOT WASTE YOUR KIDS TIME WRITING A BOOK FOR THIS COMPANY TO NOT SEND.  HIGHLY disappointed in the entire process.  and you'll see there are several reviews with the same complaint and the response is this is not typical...well it seems to happen way more often then it should based on the reviews.  Its an awesome idea but you need to improve the way you do business before you continue running this business
summary: they say it's not the typical experience but these reviews suggest otherwise

reviewText: My daughter and two granddaughters received this for Christmas.  There ages are 10, 6, and 4.  The little ones need some help from their mom but it was a great experience anyway.  My 10 year old is hiding the book until she gets it published; to surprise us with her life story..  The kids of all ages really enjoyed it.  High quality, will purchase it again.  Can't comment on the publishing stage as we are still in the "writing the book" phase.

I know this is meant for children, but I decided to buy it for myself.  I am  writing stories about my childhood that I am sending to my grandchildren.  It is a wonderful way for them to get to know a little about me and have something to keep to remember me by.  I love it.
summary: Write and Illustrate for your grandchildren

reviewText: Absolutely one of the best gifts I've ever given.  My daughter loves to write and draw and we were thrilled when her story came back "published!"  She brought it to school and impressed all her classmates and teachers. She was so proud.  It's easy and fun.  The customer service is fantastic and unlike other toys, you'll keep this book forever. It's very professional looking. I highly recommmend it and will purchase another.  You'll love Illu Story
summary: Perfect For Children Who Like To Write or Draw

reviewText: My daughter loved creating one of these books as a 3rd grader. She had written a story at school that her teacher loved, so we turned it into a book as a teacher gift. The teacher got a huge kick out of it, and my daughter loved seeing her story as a real book. We made a copy for ourselves, too, and it's a great memory of how much she loved the teacher, how much she loves to write, and where she was as a writer at that point.
summary: Great project (and it made a great teacher gift!)

reviewText: Can only review the fact that it came quickly and was a good price. Gave it as a gift so I don't know if he enjoyed it. They did'nt ask for a receipt so I guess it was fine
Great product. My 7 year old loves to read and write stories and she is reallt excited about getting her own book printed. We look forward to finishing the process.

My granddaughter and I worked on this project together. It took several days. And we loved every minute of it. Her brother was envious. I guess I'll be purchasing another illustory. :)Illustory - Write and Illustrate Your Own Book Kit

My kids received these for Christmas and they LOVE them!!  They are working on the book now and once it is finished, we will mail it in the postage paid envelope and wait for the hardback book to arrive!  What a great way to learn about what it takes to write a book (without the rejection!)  Great item for anyone really!
summary: IlluStory Make your own Story Book

reviewText: i got this for my granddaughter on her 9th birthday.  She loves writing stories so she loves the gift.....it was a perfect gift for her...elizabeth

My son (age 7) got this kit as a gift. He decided to use it to write a story from my dad's life, and to give the gift to him as a present. My son spent hours carefully crafting the story and the drawings. The whole kit was completely easy to use, and it unleashed his creativity. It's very simple to put in the text and do the drawings.The book came back today, and it's BEAUTIFUL. The production was fast and the book is hardbound in a high quality binding. Because I published a book in hardback, my son really wanted a hardcover binding---and you'd be hard pressed to tell the difference between this one and the one that came from my university press! I was in tears when I opened the package, it is so gorgeous. My son is going to be so proud, and my dad is going to be so choked up when he gets this Christmas morning.It's a great kit, and it's worth every single penny. It gives kids the pride of authorship. What could be a better educational experience?

In  May & June 2013 my son worked really hard drawing and hand writing the story he created.  The book came back beautiful except he was supposed to have the handwriting version. He spent over an hour rewriting before we sent it in and we got the typed version. I called customer service and they told me they would look into it and never got back to me. I was willing to pay for a new book too with the hand written version to capture the 8 Year old's handwriting, but I sill have not heard back from the company.

My daughter received this as a gift and when I first read the directions, it seemed to good be true (free shipping! hard cover book!). But it wasn't. My daughter is 5 years old and had a great time dictating a story to me and then illustrating the pictures. This would be a great gift for kids of all ages because every child has a story to tell. Younger children can dictate a story, while older kids can write it by themselves. I plan to have my daughter do one of these every year, so we can see how much she learns and progresses from year to year. The hardback cover is very durable, and we enjoy reading her book with others at night before bedtime. After mailing the hard copy to the company, it only took a few weeks for the book to be produced. You can include a picture of your child and information about him/her and it has an About the Author section, just like a "real" book.

My son is in 3rd grade now and has completed a book every summer vacation since the summer after Kindergarten.  He takes such pride in trying to make a 'better' story each year and seeing visible evidence if increasing skills in storytelling and drawing.  It is a great parent/child team project for summer break.  Over the years my level of involvement has shifted from hand-holding every step of the way to sitting back and voicing appreciation for my son's work.My one concern about this product is the on-line option.  We don't have a touch screen electronic device so when my son tried ot create the book on-line, he became frustrated very quickly.  I think using a mouse to draw on a screen requires more advanced fine motor skills and only leads to frustration for younger children.
summary: Great activity to encourage an appreciation of books and a joy in story writing

reviewText: My 8 year old son received this as a gift.  He had so much fun making up a story with his own pictures.  The hardest part was waiting for the hard back book to come in the mail!  He loved it!!
summary: Great for kids of all ages

reviewText: There's nothing quite like being the author of your own book! I know, because I spent 12 years writing a book myself.
