When my daughter (age 6) received this book-making kit for her birthday, she was so excited to write a book just like mommy did. She wrote "The Kids Go to Neptune" about her journey to Neptune with her little brother and dog. She is so proud to be able to read it to her brother, and feel the confidence of being an author of her very own book. Every child should have the opportunity to feel this sense of pride and accomplishment by writing something they can keep, share with others, and read over and over again! I can't think of a better gift.
summary: Every parent should buy this for their child!

reviewText: We bought this for our granddaughter and she published a story she wrote for school and the teacher was inspired by having the story bound in a book. Great stuff, will do it again and again.

We ordered this kit so my daughter could make and "publish" ( make a hard back copy) a book. We loved it!  The directions were clear and helpful in writing the story,  and made the process easy for both my daughter and myself! The book that resulted is a treasured keepsake book that is sturdy enough to last forever! The price was very reasonable and the option to buy additional copies was a plus. We highly recommend this product!!!

This was such a wonderful product.  My son had written a story and illustrated most of the pictures.  He had difficulty drawing people but we were able to use their website to generate pictures of people for his story.  We were also able to use his drawings by scanning them onto the computer then up load them to the website.  It was fast, quick and extremely easy.  Their website takes you step by step with the process.  The best part is when the hard cover book arrived and my son was proud of his accomplishments.  This product encourges kids to be creative.  Kids get to practice their writting skills (captilizations, punctuation, tenses) and art skills.
summary: A Wonderful Way to Get Kids to Write

reviewText: I'm sure this product is fantastic, unfortunately I will never know.  I had to send it back unopened. The company that makes 'Illustory' confirmed it should not be sold or used outside of the USA.  Amazon, PLEASE stop selling this product to International buyers.  It is a waste of time and money for everyone!
summary: PRODUCT FOR SALE AND USE IN USA ONLY!

reviewText: I had heard about this product from another mother and decided to try it. My son is now 11 yrs old and is autisic with ADHD. He loves to writes stories about one specific character, but had a hard time with spelling. Illustory is a wonderful product that allows you to do your book draft on paper that is provided in the kit or you can do it online. He loves his book and we love this product.Mom of 3
This was a great gift my daughter loves it! So easy for a child to use and she is really enjoying herself doing it and it gives us something to do together.
I love giving this as a gift.  The kids are always excited to find out that their story will be turned into a real book.  I've given this to kids between the ages of 4 and 9... all love it!

We first received Illustory as a birthday gift.  Since then, we have bought a few more and have also recommended it to other parents.  I make a living as a published author and this gives my son the opportunity to build his own library "just like Daddy."  It allows me to take him through the same process I go through when making a book: write it - edit it - divide the story up from the first page to last - design characters - illustrate it - add the text - and finally receive a hard bound copy!  It gives us the opportunity to either create the book online or upload artwork.  He likes to upload the artwork he draws on paper.It's also rewarding to see the progress he has made from his first book to his most recent.Highly recommend this product!

I bought this for my mother.  Strange I know.  She wanted to write a book her grandkids could enjoy that would be written by her.  Not sure how it will turn out. She said the info was little hard to follow but she's 63.  Since we're not really using it for a child, I'm giving it 4 stars because I'm sure a child would really like this.

I purchased the Illustory book kit on 12/10/12 as a Christmas gift for my son. We waited until his summer break to open the kit and being working on the book making pages. My son finished his book kit and we mailed it to the company at the end of Aug 2013 in the prepaid, addressed envelope the kit provided. The company's website said it will take 3-4wks to print and return the book. I waited until October to reach out to the company to give them adequate time to follow through on the product. I emailed their Customer Service email address on 10/15 requesting a status on the book. I received a reply within 24hrs saying they were looking into it. I did not hear back, so emailed them again on 10/22, and then on 11/7, and again on 11/18. I still didn't hear anything from their CS, so on 11/21 I tried to hunt down another way to contact them. The ph# on their website referred me back to their website and their FAQs. Their website refers you to their Customer Service email address, which had already proved fruitless. The website provided an email for Erika Brooks for media inquiries, so I forwarded my email string to her. Then I located the domain owner (David McCullough), and I emailed him. I also forwarded my email to the email address of their former CEO (William "Chip" Brunk - according to his LinkedIn profile, he left the company in 2012) hoping that it was still an active email. Finally, I received a reply from their CS within 24hr of sending those three emails. They apologized for their delay and said they would keep me posted. Fast forward to 12/4. I still have not received a reply with any information on my son's book! I read through several reviews on Amazon where other customers were complaining of the same result - no book! An employee of StudentPublishing (Kurt Henninger) replied to a handful of them and provided his email address, so I forwarded my entire email string to him asking for a status on my son's book. It is now 12/16, and I have not received a reply nor have we received the final product. I am severely disappointed and frustrated! Not only is this company stealing people's money by not delivering on their product's promise. They are stealing people's memories!
summary: Do NOT buy! No final product. No adequate response from the company. Complaint filed with the BBB.

reviewText: I've been waiting 3 months for my completed books. Two months in I received two absolutely unacceptable copies - riddled with errors, totally unprofessional looking - so I demanded two more revised copies. If I could fire up the Flux Capicitor and go back in time to a place where I never purchased my son this book making kit, believe me, I would.

I bought an IlluStory for my daughter when she was 10 years old. She had such an incredible time creating a special story about her grandmother and her cats! I remember the thought she put into drawing the pictures and writing the captions. It was like a gift for me too, because we spent time together on it, and I got to be part of the process. It was truly one of the BEST GIFTS I ever gave my daughter, and in turn - that she gave to her grandma. To this day (my daughter is now 20 years old) the IlluStory book she wrote for grandma sits proudly on the mantle above the fireplace, for all to see who come in. My daughter had a sense of accomplishment and pride when her book was finished. IlluStory is more than an activity or craft - it is a memory maker and gift that keeps giving.:)

Nothing is more rewarding and exciting than children seeing their own creative work in print. A few months ago, four of my fifth grade art students created and designed their own story along with their own illustrations. The first two classes they wrote a short story that depicted the relationship they had among themselves. The whole process was a self -discovery when they realized they liked each other more than they thought! It was well organized with a beginning, a plot, and an exciting finish. Then they divided the book up into five pages per person to illustrate each written page. Under my guidance, the four of them took pride in their creative drawings. We loved how the directions in the Illustory book kit were so easy to follow. Each step was explained in detail and the students had a blast choosing their book cover and design. There was tremendous satisfaction when we mailed out the package which comes with a handy stamped envelope. How nice is that! The books arrived promptly with no errors and the girls lit up like a firecracker when they saw their books. This company gets an A+ for instilling pride in children's accomplishments. We are quite anxious to get started on another book as my students have proudly displayed their work at home and at school. With publishing being so costly, this company offers an excellent alternative at a reasonable price for something equally well done if not better. Thank you for your quality products.

I bought IlluStory from Amazon for my granddaughter. Then together we made a book with my poem and her art.  Tara drew a picture for each line of my poem, i.e. a river, mountains, rain and sun, etc.  The attractive, bound books are our treasures. We spent precious time together, discussing our creation as it evolved.  I will cherish my book forever and know that she will cherish hers long after I am gone.  Our names are proudly displayed, together, on the cover.  Thank you for giving us this lasting gift, not only the book but the time we shared working on it.

I love the concept of having your own story published and after reviewing the kits contents, I think my grandson will be impressed with his final product.The features are limited as to what you can do. It only allows 20 words per page, you can only draw in a very small space and can only use a certain marker. It evens limits the number of pages that you can write. If you want more than one copy, each book costs almost as much as the initial kit. I'll wait until I see the quality of the finished project before I request more copies.All in all, I think any child would be thrilled to see their own work in a published book and would love to show it off.
My four year old son had an idea for a story and this kit helped bring it to life.  Final product was very nice.

Illustory is much more than a toy, it is a perfect way to document family history.  The activities and tools included in the kit made it easy and fun to construct a good story, and taught proper writing techniques in an entertaining way.  As a former teacher, I appreciated the story boards and step-by-step process so much.  It is one of those activities that trick children into learning while they are having a great time!My Granddaughter and I worked together on the project when she came to visit me during her summer break.  Together, we created a wonderful story about her experiences as a younger child and she made them come alive with her original drawings.  It was a perfect way to spend really quality time working together and at the end of our week she had completed her draft.It is impossible to fully explain her excitement when she saw the finished book.  She has shared it with family and friends and her teachers.  She loves to read the book to anyone who will sit with her and proudly shows us all the illustrations.  She keeps it in a special place in her room and I know it will be treasured even more as time flies by.
summary: Absolutely perfect way to have fun with your Grandchildren!

reviewText: My daughter loves to write. She sat down and wrote her own story with pictures. She was so excited to show her class that she wrote a real book. She loves rereading her story over and over again.As a parent/educator I loved that she was able to use inventive spelling and that was able to stay with her book, as you can mark keep spelling and do not edit. Or if you prefer they will correct spelling errors. The book comes back and her pictures looked just like she drew them. (Be careful streaks do show up in the finished product, make sure coloring is done neatly)We sent out book in in the beginning of August and did not receive it back till the mid/end of October. So it takes quite a while for processing. But the wait was worth it.
summary: Love the book, but takes forever.

reviewText: While I was shopping in a bookstore with a friend, she pointed out an IlluStory Book Kit, knowing how much my grandson liked to write his own stories.  He was 7-years-old at the time.  When I explained what he could do with the kit, he immediately sat down and started writing a story.  Over the next few months, whenever we had time together, he would write, create illustrations, edit, add to his story.  It was a wonderful experience for me, as a grandmother, to be so closely involved in his creative activities.  When he was sure his story was just as he wanted it, he supervised my transferring it to the website.  The wording of his autobiography and selection of his picture were so important to him, and the cover was another joint project.  Once his project was in the hands of the Creations By You people, he checked the mailbox every day.  When his hardcover book arrived, his joy was contagious.  The first few nights, he slept with the book under his pillow.  He is now 11-years-old and he keeps the book in his "special place" with his other most precious possessions.  He has now gone on to create scripts and videos for school projects and for fun, but he still talks about the fun we had together creating his "first" book. IlluStory Book Kits are now my favorite gift for other budding authors!
Better than traditional toys!  Great way to get kids to write.  Price includes printing too! I gave it as a gift, so not sure of exact details of how it works.

I purchased this for the 6yr olds in our family.  They really liked the idea, but it was a bit much with all the prep work.  They really just wanted to write and draw, not fill out forms.I would purchase this for children older than 6 years old.

Purchased five of the "IlluStory Make Your Own Story Kit" projects for Christmas.  Two kits for my own children and three for my nephews.  My children were very excited to get started on theirs and we already have the finished product (the actual book) back from the Creations by You company.  They LOVE their storybooks that they personally created and I will cherish these forever!  Thank you "Creations by You" for coming up with such a wonderful idea!

My daughter, age 8, enjoyed making a book for her younger brother as a gift. Product was well-made and looked like a regular library or store bought book. Exciting for our whole family as the book contained both pictures and text of our daughter. Great exercise in writing, too, for young authors.

Fun activity for school aged kids.My kids enjoyed doing their own illustrations and seeing them in print.For the extra fee, it's worth getting the "archival" finish for the pages.Otherwise you just end up with the original paper that your kid drew on, bound in a hardcover book, which doesn't have the same cachet as the more professional finished look & smooth feel.I was a little bummed about that the first time we did it, not realizing that by cheaping out on the extra fee I was just getting the same paper, bound in hardcover.I loved the "about the author" feature because it is just so cute having a little bio and photo at the end!  A simple wallet-sized school photo does the trick, so you don't have to feel bad about sending off a more expensive passport photo, or whatever.It's also cute having the author dedication at the beginning.
summary: pay the extra for the additional archival page finish

reviewText: I bought one for my 7 year old daughter who absolutely loved it, so I bought one for my 6 year old son.  She loves showing it off with family friends and even at school.  My son is just starting to work on his but is excited after seeing her finished product.The hard book cover seems durable but only time will tell if it says in good condition, so I gave that catagory a 4 star.I have since bought my now 8 year old daughter more of these and she still loves it.  It never gets old for her.

I bought this for my 8 year old niece last Christmas.  It was a HUGE hit with her and everyone who has come in contact with her finished masterpiece.  Everyone wants to know where I got it. This really helped my niece become more sure of herself and she now loves to write!

We have used IlluStory for the past two years. My son starts the project by selecting a topic for his story, and then he picks a friend who he thinks will enjoy that topic also. He goes to work creating the illustrations and words for his book. We usually do this over a few days so that he can really focus on the illustrations, doing a good job with those. By far, his favorite part is the dedication page...because he gets to write about his friend who he has selected to dedicate the book to. Then, he enjoys picking out which color  book cover will be for this particular story! We order an extra book so that his friend is presented with one dedicated just to him. You would think we were passing out gold - I mean, both times we have done this, the friend is always so surprised and thrilled to receive the gift! So, we absolutely love this product because it is both a learning tool and an extension of friendship! We highly recommend IlluStory.
summary: A Learning Tool and An Extension of Friendship

reviewText: I purchased IlluStory for my daughter to make a lil gift for her arriving twin cousins. I got into doing this just as much, if not more than she did! Hey grown ups can play and create too. Such a fun product and very simple to use as a rainy day family project. The company has great customer service and the entire process was super fast and easy. We now have this amazing book that we made for the twins. We did a page about every family member and the boys just love reading it...and my daughter and I can see our drawings and cute words right in print...it's a real book! We have purchased five or so since then and I have been satisfied every time.So happy with my purchase, I am definitely a returning customer and I tell many family and friends about IlluStory. It is just such a cool idea and with the company's awesome customer service we are good to go! I have worked with children for over twenty years now and this product is an excellent way to get the creative juices flowing all the while having an awesome finished product to hang on to for years. We love books of all kind, but we especially love our IlluStory books. Very very cool indeed. Thanks IlluStory for an all around great experience! You rock!Heather from Ohio, USA
summary: This kit creates an amazing family heirloom and is oh so much fun for the entire family!!!

reviewText: 9 year old loves this!!!  Instructions included to create books online too.

Our daughter is using hers to make a book about her daddy since he just deployed to Afghanistan for the second time. It's giving her an outlet to show what exactly she's feeling and what she misses about spending time with him. It will be something special for the two of them to share when he comes home. I wish it had a little more info on story boards and planning your story but we used notebook paper for planning and I printed out a free lesson online. We have bought 2 of these now because I think it's a good way to spend one on one time with your child while teaching them too. I almost want to make one!  :)

My daughter got this as a gift when she was 6, and she absolutely loved using it.  She loves to write and draw, so it was a perfect gift.  We bought her another one last year, so she now has 2 of her own published books. :-)  These are wonderful keepsakes to have to show your children's creative sides.  My 5 year old wants one now too, even though she is only a beginning writer.  I have also purchased several to give as gifts, and they were all well received.I think overall this is a fantastic gift for a child, and am planning on purchasing more in the future. Much better than the same old plastic toys that get used for a day and then never played with again.  These would be my only recommendations/constructive criticism:-The last book that we got didn't have an area to check off and pay for the 'About The Author' page.  It was included in the first box, which was why I knew about it. That was one of my daughter's FAVORITE parts!  So glad that we still got to do it, since I called and asked if that was still an option.-The order sheet could be less confusing.  Perhaps it has since been improved, but I thought the last one wasn't very clear. Just seemed confusing.-I would make it VERY clear that all of the pages that are included with the book are NOT pre-paid for.  Perhaps have 2 separate packs of paper: one that includes the pages that ARE included, and the rest could be clearly labeled that they are extra (fees) if used.  With the first book, my daughter immediately wrote out her story using all of the papers, so I was pretty much forced to pay for the extra.  It was fine, but if they had been in a separate plastic wrapping, that would have prevented her from using every last page.  I completely understand why it's done that way, however.Either way, my daughters love these books and in fact I just gave this site to my inlaws as a Christmas gift idea for my girls.  As their mom, I will love having these books for years to come!

We purchased illustory for our daughter for her 10th birthday. At first she had no idea what this was, but was we explained that she could write and illustrate her own book, she was ecstatic. She completed the book within 2 days. She brags to everyone that she is a published author :)
summary: Daughter thinks she is a published author

reviewText: This product was a great gift for my daughter.  She enjoyed writing short stories and this inspired her to be more diligent and thoughtful in her writing.  As homeschoolers, we used it to compliment her writing curriculum and are VERY pleased with the results!  The option to include her handwriting and illustrations was a fabulous bonus as it definitely makes it "her story".  We shared the finished product as Christmas gifts to grandparents and my daughter was proud enough that she took our copy to show our librarian (we thought later that it would have been fun to give a copy to the library to put into circulation).  I will be using this again with my son this year.  He is looking forward to it!

Wonderful product. We bought this as a gift for my son's 7th birthday as a fun incentive to get him a little writing and spelling practice.  He loved to make his own books at home with computer paper and the stapler, so a real book was a huge hit.  He thought this was great because it is a real bound book with his own words and pictures.  His book will be a cherished keepsake and I'm sure it will be great fun to look at when he is grown.

I gave my nephew an Illustory Kit for Christmas 2010.  He didn't finish his book until Oct 2011. After speaking with customer service, I discovered that unless you pay extra to have an electronic copy made, the original pages the child draws on are simply bound into a book. The markers provided in the kit bleed through on the back so you see this when you turn the page.  It takes forever to get the book back which I can't understand if they're simply binding the existing pages. I've made quite a few books on Shutterfly and Winkflash.  From time to time, they have promotional offers where you can get up to 100 pages for under $20 (less than the cost of Illustory). You can upload photos or scan a drawn picture and upload that.  Also, with either company you don't have a word limit of 20 words per page.  Depending on the size of the font you choose, you can type in 200 words or more per page with either service.  The other drawback with Illustory that I didn't discover until speaking with customer service is that if you don't pay extra, they will auto correct the misspelled words. My nephew made up some crazy character names and I had to write a special note with the order stating to leave the text unedited. Good concept but too many rules and limitations.  More options and quality with Winkflash or Shutterfly.
summary: Good Concept but Lots of Drawbacks

reviewText: Santa got this for Christmas for my then kindergartner. He specifically asked for it because his big sister had done it and he wanted to be a published author too! This is such a valuable tool. I loved seeing him get into the creative process of figuring out the plot and developing the characters. In a fun way he learned a lot about setting up a story, creating the tension or drama to make it interesting, and bringing the story to a conclusion.  He did it over several weeks,which was fine- a nice after-school project.  Best of all for him was that when he got back the finished, published version, he took it to school and the teacher had him read it to the class at story-time! That was one of the highlights of his kindergarten career. I highly recommend it- fun learning tool for kids.
summary: Great experience for my 6 year old

reviewText: My son LOVED creating his story so much that he wanted to create a second story within the same kit. I was very pleasantly surprised how easy it was to have both of his stories published--the customer service was great. This product really does foster an appreciation and love of reading, writing and storytelling; and it provides a great outlet for children to express their creativity and individuality. And as an added bonus-- the final product, the books are really very well made. I can't find a single flaw with IllusStory. Highly highly recommend!

To date, I have purchased three Illustory from Creations By You and I logged in today to purchase my fourth set. The first two I purchased were Christmas presents for my nieces who were 6 and 8 at the time. They are very crafty and love telling stories and I thought this set would be a great way to begin a family tradition of writing their Christmas story or memories that would be published. They absolutely loved it. Both girls sat, mapping out their stories and pictures to have the best final draft possible. The third Illustory I purchased was for my daughter (6) to write a book for her father for his birthday last year. Her published copy brought him to tears when he opened it. Now, I'm buying another copy at the request of my daughter (7)  to write another book for her dad as a present for Christmas. What I love, besides the published book, is the documentation of the child's handwriting, pictures, and creativity from year to year. It is such a great keepsake for the future.Creations by You does a fantastic job with clear directions to follow for a mail in order verse an online order as well as completing the entire book process by hand or digitally. They also provide plenty of extra book pages in case the kids made a mistake and needed to re-write or re-draw one of their pictures. Which happens quite a bit at this age. They also allow for digital pictures to be uploaded or sent in if you want a picture to be included in on the page about the author or have the child complete the book digitally.Finally, the final project. I was apprehensive about mailing in my child's work and even took color photocopies of it before sending it to not loose all the hard work if something went wrong. It was an unnecessary precaution because the book came back in the designated time and the pages were perfect. The final product is well crafted and my child's work was showcased beautifully. I would highly recommend purchasing this kit for the avid writer or creator or as a way to give a beautiful present or keepsake for the future to document a child's creativity.

My 7 year old has done one of these each year since she was about 4.  We've created a 'library' where her sister checks the books out and has used them to develop her own reading/story telling/drawing skills (she's now 5 and reading beyond everyone else in her kindergarten class and our 7 year old is beyond her class in reading skills, too).These have already become a tradition in our family, and our 5 year old is going to begin her set this Christmas.  We think these products alone have dramatically helped our kids become early readers who enjoy reading, story telling/development, planning, attention to detail, drawing/coloring and even inspired our 7 year old for a possible career.  Yes, they've had THAT much of an impact.Yet another benefit of the product is that book comes later in the mail, which is like anticipating/getting another present all over again (excitedly checking the mail and asking 'is it here yet?!').  The books are well-made and don't peel apart like you might think.  The hard-covers are bright colored and have a good feel, as do the pages/colors of the books.  One of their favorite aspects is the 'About the author' section - it makes them feel like 'grown ups' who actually wrote and published a book.The kit includes a postage-paid envelope so it is super-easy to ship out the pages - you don't have to mess with stamps or anything.  Zip it and ship it!Easily one of the best gifts of my kidos early lives and great keep-sakes for them.  The pride they have in showing off the books to their friends and relatives is really inspiring to watch.A few tips -1) work with your youngster to plan out the story on your own paper - even though there are plenty of extra 'pages' included in the kit, I find it is better to draft it out a few times.  If your child is really young, you can have them simply 'tell you the story' and you write it down on the pages.2) use some of the extra pages to let them practice and get the idea3) consider having the kids write the words/story on other paper and then you proof/copy the words onto the pages to avoid any 'oops'4) These are top-quality products; however, don't let the kids go crazy with the markers before they actually use them to make their pages.  My kids started using the markers for 'everyday use' and we needed to nip that so they didn't run out of ink.5) Our 7 year old has proudly taken them for show-and-tell and the other kids love themYou will simply not be disappointed with this product.
summary: Growth and development SUPER-GIFT for kids!

reviewText: Like the others here, my 6-year-old son spend HOURS creating his book online.  Three months later, we have no book.  I have sent three emails, and each time I have gotten an automated reply saying they would contact me in the next 24-48 hours with a status update.  NO REPLIES were ever sent to me.  Their customer service phone number from the "Easy Student Publishing" website just gives automated recordings referring me to the FAQs on their website. This is what I call "customer dis-service," not customer service.  WHAT KIND OF COMPANY DOESN'T HAVE A CUSTOMER SERVICE DEPARTMENT THAT REPLIES TO EMAILS AND ANSWERS PHONE CALLS?  This one, apparently.  My son is extremely disappointed.  The grandparents that gave this gift to my son are just out the $25, I guess.May 6th update:By reading other Amazon reviews, I found an email for an actual person who works for the company that makes this product: Rachel Braynin (Lulu Jr. Customer Support)rbraynin@lulu.comI emailed Ms. Braynin last evening and received a personal email from her this morning telling me that my child's book went to the printers on 4/30 and will be done within the next week or so.  We will see.
My creative pre-teen granddaughter jumped right in to create her story, and seemed to enjoy the format and ideas in it.

My daughter received this for her 6th birthday and had so much fun writing and illustrating her very own story! She was so excited to receive a hardback book of her creation in the mail a short time later, including her very own author picture.  She is almost 10 now and has asked for another illuStory for her birthday this year!  This is a great product for budding authors of all ages.  A fun, quality gift.

I bought this item for Christmas for granddaughter who loves to draw, and is exceptionally good at it--she  is 7 years old.  She enjoyed it so much, I have ordered her a second one.  I plan to do this about every 6 months, so she can make her own library which she can keep forever.  This is a great product, and I highly recommend it.  We ordered the upgrade extras that you will learn about when you buy this kit.  Grandmothers, this is the perfect present for our precious grandchildren that they will enjoy reading over and over again.  It is also a fun way to document their growing talents over the years.
Ordered for granddaughter's birthday.  She loves to write stories.  Had ordered this item before for another granddaughter and she also loved it.

I purchased this product, my child loved putting the book together.  We mailed it back for processing and in return received the wrong book.  I contacted customer service on Sept 9, 2013 via phone and was instructed to email more information. I did the same day and got no answer.  I resent the email on Sept 19 and again on Sept 25.  Finally on Sept 26 they answered me and said "We have placed the replacement order in the system, and will have the new copy sent out to you as soon as possible."  Today is October 26 - one month later and still NO BOOK.  I tried to contact Creations by You/Easy Student Publishing again on October 23 and they have not replied to my email.  So, while the product is fun and kids like it, the company sets poor standards and is even worse at customer service and communication.
summary: Product is Fun - Watch out for customer service

reviewText: This is an excellent product for children to be creative, understand process and become confident.  I love this product and give it as birthday gifts.

I was amazed at how motivational this product was for my 2nd grader.  The thought of "I am going to get published" helped him to concentrate and focus... trying his best.The finished product represented his best work of the entire school year.  The finished book was very professional-looking and will become a lasting showpiece of his work.I would definitely use this product again in the future.  Way to go!

My 7 year old niece loved this gift.  She made a book about her family with illustrations and everything. You can pay more to have an "about the author" page with a photo. And you have to pay more if you want the illustrations to look like a real book. The book she made was soooooo cute and she was extremely proud of it. She's turning 8 this year and she wants me to get her another one. That's why I'm on Amazon right now.

I bought this for my seven year-old grandson and it provided all of us with an amazing experience. It was so much fun watching him envision, create, revise, proof and perfect. The end product was extraordinarily well put-together and is a source of pride for all of us, but especially for my grandson. I couldn't be more pleased and I'm sure I'll buy one for my granddaughter, too.
summary: I Simply Cannot Rave About It Enough!

reviewText: Easy and fun to use! I drew the pictures then uploaded them and designed the book online. It turned out really well and got to me in two weeks. :) I'm very excited to see what my fiancé thinks of this Christmas present.

I was so happy with this product a few years back when my oldest son made his book.  The instructions were simple and the final product was exactly how he had illustrated it.  Unfortunately, I think the level of paper or the production of it has slipped since then.  My other son made his and the pictures from one page show through to the next page!  He was a bit disappointed because it didn't really look like a professional book because of that.  It's still nice to have as a memento, but still a bit disappointed.
summary: Not so great second time around

reviewText: I had no idea my kids (5 & 7) were such great storytellers!  They worked on the book together and got amazingly creative, editing and reworking until they were satisfied with the end result.  They were THRILLED when we received the printed book, and it looks amazing.
summary: Kids had so much fun with this!

reviewText: This is a wonderful to allow a child to publish their very own book!  I loved the product, it was very easy to use and the finished product came quickly in the mail!  It was a great experience!!!!

My 5-year-old enjoyed making her book.  I did not realize, however, that the sheets we mailed in would be the same sheets bound into the book. I guess I thought they would be color copied and bound.  Because they are the same sheets, the marker bled through the back of each sheet and looks pretty cheap.  We also had a misspelled word.  I would have done it online if I had known. It is definitely fun to do, and quite educational, but it wasn't quite what we had in mind. I may be too picky.  I guess for under $[...], this is what you would expect.1/6/10: After contacting the company, they paid for the return, correction, and archive of the original book.  Great customer service and finished archived product!!
summary: Fun to do; not that impressed with finished product. Update!

reviewText: This is a perfect gift for any school age child. School's are promoting writing skills and what better way to reinforce your child's writing than with their very own published book. My child received her first kit as a gift and loved it so much she asked for another one. We have done both of her stories online which allow more words per page. Very nice for my child who loves to write! The website has a great variety of clipart for her pictures or she could scan and upload her own pictures (which we did not do). She found plenty of clip art on the website to go along with her story. When her order was placed, the confirmation told us 10-14 days and she had her book by the end of the week (less than 7 days!) She was so thrilled to have her own book and brought it to school where she shared with everyone. We loved the additional features of adding a bibliography so she could brag about herself!

This product is a wonderful was to get your child involved in reading and writing as they create their own story. It is great for the lil artists out there as well. As a teacher, I taught a story about an artist. We then created a collage for every page. The best ones made the book. Last, we sent it to the artist. The artist loved it!Its very easy to make!The price gets cheaper with the more you make when we did it.
summary: Awesome rating from an elementary teacher!

reviewText: I bought several kits for my daughter, who took her sweet time finishing her first book-- I was the impatient one! She was 4 when she started it and 5 when she finished. We used the markers provided with the kit, but also Crayola's Pip Squeaks washable markers, which came out fine.After she finished each drawing, I uploaded it to the website. I liked this option because it enables you to write and design much more-- you can control the layouts (picture on top or bottom? Text or no text? All handmade drawings, or add "stamps" and online design elements?). You can make the fonts bigger or smaller and get far more words in per page than if you send in the kit by mail and have a small word limit.There were no additional expenses whatsoever beyond the cost of the kit. A couple of reviewers seemed confused (or paranoid) about that... the company doesn't try to "get you." You pay for the kit, they'll mail you a book. If you want extra copies, of course you pay for that. But aside from that, we got back a beautiful book with an author photo just by typing in the tracking number that's inside the kit on the online order form. It took 2-3 weeks to arrive, which felt like a long wait, but it was a very exciting day to see that box on the doorstep!I love this both as a gift for my own daughter and as a thoughtful gift for her friends' birthdays.I'm an author, so it's especially meaningful to me to preserve my daughter's "first book" this way. Who knows? Maybe she'll follow in my footsteps... in which case, "Cat at the Beach" could be worth a fortune on eBay someday. A fortune, I tell you!
summary: We Scanned The Kit Pages And Did It Online

reviewText: We purchased this kit for my step-daughter for her birthday since she is always drawing and loves to create her own books. We paid twenty dollars for it thinking that she would draw and write the story and we would mail it out and get a book in return. SURPRISE! You have to buy the kit and then pay another fee that costs as much as the kit to have the book "published" (along with other nominal fees to add things to make the book worth owning). I think the thing that bothered me the most is that you are able to go online and DO THE SAME EXACT THING WITHOUT PURCHASING A KIT! You pay 22 dollars and draw your book online! I wish I would have known that so we could have avoided the rip off of purchasing the kit. For what it's worth, my step-daughter LOVES creating the book online. Before you buy this, check out the website and save yourself twenty bucks.
summary: Why buy the kit when you can do it all online??

reviewText: My wife has given these for B-Day gifts and the kids absolutely enjoy it. We got one for my daughter and she had a great time with it.

I have four children and the two older children (8 and 9 yr olds) have created their own books using illuStory! The kit is easy to use and directions are spelled out clearly. I had the kids write their story out on regular paper first, then when it was how they wanted it and proof-read they were able to transfer the text onto the official pages in the kit (20 words per page). After that point they were able to add their illustrations to each page to go along with the story.You have an author page that will give some information about your child's interests that you submit. You also have the option of adding a picture of your child in the book (for an additional cost). I did this for both kids and they LOVED having a "published" book with their picture in it as the author.My son took his book to school and the teacher read it to the class (both last year and he took it in again this year). He was so proud when the other kids were excited about his publication adn asked him how he did it.The quality of the finished copy is fantastic, and it is durable. You can also purchase cover protectors and additional copies of the book as gifts for others.Creating your own book will delight your child for years to come!
summary: Excitement and accomplishment for your child!

reviewText: My 6 year old Autistic son finds solitude in reading and illustrating his own books. Thus, I have never seen him so excited when we gave him the Illustory product and told him that his book would be turned into a real book. He spent the whole day on it and insisted I mail it that night. Well the was THREE months ago and my son has asked his mother and I EVERY day when is it going to come. Saying that he did not want any other gifts this holiday but to get his book. We have contacted the customer support email several times and only get a form letter response.

We loved this product. Both of our daughters made one of these books. It's a great way to save their drawings and stories . My daughter loves books and was so excited to have one of her  own. After the book is made, it's a great gift for grandparents. The girls will be able to share their books with their own children .

I thought this product would be a wonderful idea for the creative child who likes to write stories and draw pictures, so I gave it to my 8 year old grandaughter.  However, for some reason, she just was uninterested in doing the project.  You have to write your own story and draw your own pictures, which she has done before.  I guess she just wasn't in the creative spirit at the time, because the kit is still in her closet unused.  I still think it's a great idea, but it probably takes a lot of parent participation and encouragement along with the child.
summary: A GREAT IDEA, BUT DIDN'T HOLD CHILD'S INTEREST

reviewText: This is our third time buying this.  My daughter has written two books.  She especially loves the 'about the author' section with her picture beside!  Great keepsake

I have made 4 of these books with each of my Grandchildren as keepsakes. They and I both loved the experience. They were so excited to see their work in the final book. Once we sent it off they asked every day until it arrived. They proudly share with everyone. You will not be disappointed. Love this product, and when I had a question the staff was so helpful.

My 8 year old daughter received this as a gift.  She was very excited about it and drew her own pictures and printed text clearly with the markers provided.  When we received the book, the pages were clearly a very poor scan of her drawings and writing.  We were unable to read her writing due to the poor quality and many of the photos had lost their fine detail.  Fortunately, I had scanned her original pages into pdfs before I sent them to the company, so I was able to use my own scanned pdfs to create a new book with Shutterfly photo album (which ended up being a great product).  So save yourself the trouble and just make a book with any of the many photo album companies.

We bought this product as a gift for our daughter. She diligently completed it over several weeks and sent the script to Creations by You. Even after 4 months we have not got the book.No telephone number on their website to contact them. The only way to reach the is through emails. Sometimes they give a canned response to the email. Many times no response at all. We still do not know the fate of the book.We would not recommend this product to anyone.
What a great idea this item is. It encourages literacy, while making it fun and creative. Not bad for a child's self-esteem. They can tell their friends that they wrote a book.

My 6-year old daughter received this as a gift and she loved it.  When she got her book back in the mail, she couldn't wait to show it to everyone she came in contact with.  She was so proud of herself and her accomplishment.  The dedication was especially helpful, as she had just lost her grandmother and dedicated the book to her.  She felt really good about that and all the relatives made a big deal about it. She took the book to school and shared it with her class and the teacher was really impressed.  Thank you for giving kids an outlet for their creativity at a young age.  Its definitely a confidence builder.

My kids absolutely LOVE these books!  They enjoy writing their own stories and drawing their own pictures and then receiving the hardbound, professionally bound book in the mail brings more smiles... and THEN reading their book over and over provides even more fun.  As a parent, I love how this project gets my kids excited about writing and reading-  it's definitely a winner all-around!!
summary: An educational gift they will love!!

reviewText: My daughter, age 9, received this as a gift.  We had great fun putting it together.  We used the online version and it was very simple to use.  It took us a couple days to get her book just they way she wanted it, scanning in her drawings and typing in the words to her story.  There were several page set ups to choose from.  When the book arrived she was very excited and loved reading it to her little brother, whom it was dedicated to.  (She loved making the dedication page and the about the author page.)  After that, she decided to enter her book in the fair and received a first place and special mention ribbon!  My favorite thing about this product that it encouraged her to write and edit a story, which is sometimes difficult to get her to do.  A definite home school plus!
My boy is so very excited to receive this.  He loves working on each page.  His creativity is amazing, and I love it.

I bought this for each of my kids (6 & 7) and they love it! We have purchase several Creations By You kits in the past and this one does not fail to amaze like the others. My kids LOVE writing stories so to have it printed in a real book is so fulfilling to them. It was so easy for them to write their story on the paper that was provided and mail it in the provided envelope.  Everything you need is contained in the box. Just open it and let the creativity flow! The best part is seeing their faces when the completed book arrives in the mail. They are so proud of themselves! (And so am I) what a great gift for any child. It really boosts self confidence too.
It was a little beyond my grand-daughter's ability to get all the pages filled out.  We are still working on it.  Good idea, but hard to finish.

This is a nice idea, though basically they take the same paper that you draw on and bind it.  We wanted more pages, and better quality paper than the thin paper they provide, but that cost us an additonal fee to upgrade when we sent the pages in. It did come out very nicely, and my 7 year old is very proud of her work.  Overall we were happy, and unlike many other presents, this one was fun and left us with something she can show her friends and look back at later in life.
summary: Nice Finished Product.  Perhaps A Bit Expensive

reviewText: I can't say enough good things about Illustory. We first used this last year with my oldest and the book he made is adorable. I love that it is hard bound just like a regular book is. This year, my oldest and middle child each did a book and they had so much fun making it. We love it!

I purchased this for my 7 year old daughter and see loved it.  We did the book in her own handwriting to make a special keepsake.  The author page and picture is a wonderful idea.  My daughter took the book to school to read to her classmates.  The company also had great customer service.

I have had each of my children make their own book using the IlluStory kit.  They love to look back at their art work and story year after year.  It is a great keepsake.  We now give them to friends for birthday presents so that they can make their own books too.

We bought our first IlluStory for my daughter When she was 8. The creativity and excitement of seeing her stories turn into real picture books inspired her to complete a four book picture book series by the time she was 10.  Her IlluStory series are now shared with her little sisters, and have become one of a kind magical stories and illustrations they will never forget.

I purchased this for my niece as she was born on my Mother's birthday.  Madison is going to write the book and call it : "Grandma's Present" ~ and it will be about HER being born on her Grandma's Birthday!  So, it's not only a gift for Maddy, it will be a re-gift from Maddy to her Grandmother!  I think this gives a child a wonderful opportunity to not only use their imagination writing the story ~ but to illustrate the story and see their own work in print!  Now, how cool is THAT!?
My Granddaughter age 9 had so much fun making up her own story, she is still working on the art and then we will have it printed.

My little guy started writing stories when he was four and I was excited to find this kit. Contrary to what other posters have said, you CAN use both unlimited words AND your child's own drawings. We typed the story in the online tool, giving us unlimited text (and making it more legible than a four year old who was just learning to write). For the pictures we scanned in his own drawings for half the book, and he spent hours making computer illustrations in the online tool, which he thought was fantastic. So don't be turned off by the limitations, as you're only limited by the effort you're willing to put in. There is a limit on the number or pages, but you do have the option of purchasing additional pages at check-out, which is fair. You aren't paying $20 for the privilege of self-publishing a novel. We ordered multiple copies of his book and distributed them for Christmas gifts to the family.My one complaint and the reason I can't give it 5 stars is the books themselves. The hard bound covers are excellent but the pages are held in with a metal binding that has been clamped down on loose-leaf pages. Since we ordered multiple copies, we had some arrive with the pages slipping out just a bit, and once they do that, you really can't slip them back in. However, I emailed the company to tell them, and they immediately shipped out two more replacement copies with no questions asked, so I was impressed with their customer service. We would definitely use this product again or give it as gifts.Incidentally, you can publish books through the website WITHOUT buying the kit. My daughter saw what my son was doing and wanted to make her own so we just used the website and paid as we published. If I remember correctly, however, it's quite a bit more expensive to do it this way, especially if you can get a good Amazon discount.

I bought this for my daughter when she was 7 years old. She wrote and illustrated a story on the paper provided using the included markers, and we sent it off in the POSTAGE PAID envelope as the directions indicated. A BEAUTIFUL hard-cover story-my daughter's story-came back to us. My daughter was so proud. Now we have a wonderful keepsake of her writing as a 7 year old. This kit is educational, fun and meaningful. I am buying it again for my daughter now that she is 8, and when my 4 year old son learns to write I will buy one for him too. And, I will buy this item again and again. It makes the perfect gift. It is well worth the price. And, what a wonderful way to encourage a child's creativity. This is a quality product. I'm glad it's out there!
summary: This is a Must for All Children

reviewText: Got this for my 6-yr old daughter's birthday.  It was easy for us to do together.  The great fun was getting the completed, hard-bound book back in the mail!  She was so proud to be an author!  She even took it to school to show her class.  It's a great gift & a great keepsake.
I have used many  Illustory over the years, The book is good quailty and with a strong binding. I will use this kit for as long as I can. Thanks

I bought this item for my almost 5 year old daughter for Christmas last year, after seeing a recommendation for it somewhere on the Internet. She loved creating her own story and illustrations. We initially intended to only use the story sheets included in the box, but it was difficult to stay within the word limit. Instead, we used the sheets as our template. She drew the illustrations, and we wrote the story as she wanted it told. I then scanned her illustrations into the computer and created the book with the online tool, so that we could use more words per page. It worked out wonderfully.The book was delivered within the time frame promised, and the hardcover book is of great quality. I think this product is a tremendous value for what is provided, and would recommend it to my friends and family.

My 3 children (ages 13, 10, 7) have made both the IlluStory books and plate.  They are good for a range of ages. The older kids benefit mostly from the book. It simulates the entire real book publishing process. The kids wrote one book together about their Grandparents home. The worked together as a team and had a very positive experience. It's a gift that keeps giving- they read it over and over both at home and at their Grandparents home. The process was clear and efficient. I like how you an order multiple copies at a discount. Overall - a great gift and experience!

I can't wait to read how our adopt a special needs family through Adam's Christmas Joy is going to write their story. This came  and I actually wanted it for myself. I am going to order one for our family. MORE than I excepted. .
summary: Adam's Christmas Joy - this is a must for children, tweens and adults who want to write a book!

reviewText: My mom bought this for me when I was 5 years old, and I'm now 16. At that young age, I remember how excited and happy I was to get a book published, especially since I had been reading since I was 3 years old. I proudly display my book  in my library, and still feel excitement and pride when I touch and read it now. It has also encouraged me to be an author when I go to college. It is something that I can hold on to, and share with my children one day.

My son makes a book for his dad every year for Christmas.  IT has been so much fun to look back and see how his writing and drawings change over the years.  He started by receiving one of these kits as a birthday gift in kindergarten and is now in fourth grade.  The first few years i did the writing and now my son does it all.  We have also done the plates and the mugs.  So much fun and awesome keepsakes.  I wish i had something like this when i was growing up so that I had something to look back on. There is also a spot for an author's page and i always send a wallet sized picture so they also have his photo.  So worth it!!!

As a homeschooling mom of 8, I am always on the lookout for great products that will enhance the education of my children. IlluStory has passed the test 3 times already and I expect it to pass for the rest as well. In our family, we give IlluStory as a Christmas gift for our 7 year olds. It is an extra special gift because the books created by the older children are such special keepsakes that when it is the next one's turn there is always much excitement.We don't rush through the steps of storywriting, illustrating, and publishing; but instead, take it slowly and really let our children create something meaningful to them. IlluStory is a great tool to bridge the gap from easy readers and copywork to creative writing. In fact, it is the very first creative writing exercise I give to my children. And because it is such a positive experience and produces such quality results, writing goes on to be a pleasant and enjoyable activity rather than the drudgery that it can be for some.I encourage my children to do the illustrations themselves, but the drawing made one of my sons anxious, so the digital option was a great benefit. We also like the fact that it is possible to order multiple copies as gifts. We look forward to many more years of IlluStory in our home!

I have two children (6 and 10)who fight over who is going to write the next story!  I have purchased 4 kits so far and they are clammoring for more.  It is a great birthday/Christmas present and it keeps them busy and their minds working.  They are both creative and love the kits.  Thank you!
Wow, this product got here before I was told...It is going to be a wonderful surprise for my little girl...Thanks for the prompt service.Kim Blanchard
summary: Great Job in Delivery and the product was in excellent condition (brand new)

reviewText: The littel girl I bought this for LOVED IT, she is constantly writing these adorable stories on paper and hanging them everywhere for everyone to read, so the thought that she could write her own book she was speechless! & Its awesome because you can get mulitiples made, send them to grandparents, aunts, god parents, etc... Just another great item that lets kids imaginations grow, I loved it.
On our second one, that is how much fun kids who love to write have with this.  Give it a try.

Illustory is, quite possibly, one of the BEST "toys" you will every purchase for your child!  My 7 year old son has now published THREE books and is so proud and ecstatic every time a new book arrives at our doorstep!  The entire process is extremely user/kid friendly.  If you choose to do so, you can write the story and illustrate the pictures on the included sheets of paper and then mail it in to Student Publishing.  Although we purchase the box set (it comes with lots of great fiction and non-fiction writing tips for my son), we choose to upload the story via the website (studentpublishing.com) rather than mailing in the hard copy of the book.  My son writes his story on the included paper and I type the words into the program for him.  Once I have typed in the words, I will show him each page and he draws an illustration for that page.  We upload his images and presto, we have a completed book in no time flat!  If you choose not to upload your own images, you can use pre-designed pages and "color" them online in any way you wish.  You can also add "stickers" and clip art images to the background images.The online program used to feel dated and it would take me forever to upload images, etc.  However, for our last two books, the program has been running very smoothly.  I'm guessing they have made the appropriate updates to accommodate the nuances of the program/volume of customers utilizing the online option.The quality of the books really is fantastic!  The "About the Author" page is simply adorable and the illustrations that we upload are beautiful and maintain every bit of detail!  My son's drawings look exactly like my originals in both quality and scale.  We also upload an illustration for the cover.  It is just as beautiful as the pages inside of the book.  The binding and quality are superior to anything you could get through an online photo company.To address what previous reviewers have said about word and page limits, this is not an issue if you choose to type the story online and upload your illustrations.  By typing the words (I let my son write them on the included sheets and I type it into the program online for him) you are allowed more characters per page.  Also, I'm pretty sure the page limit is 18.  This is quite sufficient given the characters you are allotted per page.  My son's first book was 12 pages, his second 15 and this most recent book was 17.To address other negative reviews regarding this product:1)  Yes, you can pay for the kit or purchase the book online.  If you get the kit, you DO NOT have to still pay the $ for your book to be published.  Your kit comes with a # that you enter at checkout to get your "free" book.  You can choose to pay an additional 20-something dollars to order extra copies of your book.  My son gives his books as gifts to grandparents, so I always order a copy for myself to  keep.  Also, your books are saved in your online account and you (or another family member) can go online at any time and order additional copies. 2) As I have said before, we have purchased three books (over a year and a half).  All have arrived within 2-3 weeks of submitting our order and the pages have NEVER bled at all.  As a matter of fact, the pages are very thick and high quality.  Much nicer than any of the other books we own from "real" published authors!!Illustory really is a phenomenal product and I intend to use it with my two boys for years to come.  I love that we have a library of THEIR publications!  We haven't yet used the comic book creator, but we intend to buy each boy one for Christmas!  You can't go wrong with these products!!!

I used the Illustory kit to make a children's book with my nephew about him going on a trip to outer space. He dictated the words and I did the drawings- it was really fun to work on it together! The book itself is nicely made- I still have the Illustory book that I made when I was 5. That was almost 20 years ago- it's held up remarkably well, even after many readings. A great kit for a creative kid, or for anyone who wants to make a nice-quality children's book to give as a gift.

I purchased this Book Kit because, truthfully, I wanted my daughter to want it.  She showed no interest and it was unused.  At least two and a half years and I thought I had wasted my money.  Suddenly, she needed to write a book for a school project and I remembered the kit.  I seriously didn't think it would still be valid after such a long time had elapsed since the first attempt.  However, we opened our account and proceeded to make the book using a variety of different illustrations from many sources.  Some she drew herself and she asked some other people draw others.  Some she found on line.  Some she scanned from books.  It was lots of fun and she wrote a FANTASTIC story and had a lot of fun using the programme.  When the book arrived, we were ridiculously excited.  Many family and friends wanted to buy copies.  The results greatly outweigh how much effort was required.  The whole experience of using this kit was really EASY and fun.  As keepsakes go, this is right up there.  I have highly recommended this without hesitation and had nothing but thanks from those who went ahead with it..
summary: Excellent product, excellent and surprising service!

reviewText: I purchased my first book 9 years ago. I give them to my girls every year. They look forward to getting them at Christmas. They are so easy to do..everything is included. Just write the story, illustrate and drop it in the self addressed stamped envelope. The design and quality of the books keep getting better. My daughter loved seeing her picture on the back and the title on the binding just like a real book in the library. In fact, my younger children are choosing the older children's book as their bedtime stories! Great value and a wonderful keepsake! You won't be sorry.
summary: Easy, fun and a great keepsake

reviewText: I love this product!  I created a story with my kids and all his cousins and gave it to them for Christmas.  It will be a great keepsake. We bought it again and created a book for the grandparents- What I like about going to Grandma and Grandpa's.  Each grandchild wrote a comment and drew a picture.  Grandma and Grandpa loved it!  These will be great keepsakes for years to come!

This was a gift to our 5 year old son for his birthday and the finished product is going under the Christmas tree for grandparents this year.  What a wonderful and creative idea.  My son had so much fun creating his story and we spent a lot of quality time together in the process.

I can't comment on the quality of the book as it is a Christmas gift. I do however have an issue with the fact that I can order it to Canada but I have to ship the published book to an address in the US.I don't see anywhere on the site that explains that the finished book can’t be shipped outside of the US, not even on the product itself. I had to open the sealed package and read the instructions inside the box to find this information. I e-mailed the company but have not received a response.We will let our son finish his book and get it back from the US at some point as we have family there. I'm just glad I didn't purchase it as a gift for anyone else in Canada.Very disappointing. I'm hoping that the book itself will be worth the trouble.

My nine year old daughter recieved this for Christmas 2007. (today)I am impressed how well it is set up to help her to write a great story.In fact, I am going to buy one for my daughter-in-law as her brother recently passed away and I think she could use this as a tool to heal AND create a wonderful book about his life.

back when I was an aspiring author, my parents bought me one of these for my 7th birthday. It was probably my all time favorite childhood gift, and I still have it somewhere. I look back and laugh over the funny things I wrote and my terrible artistic skills. It was about a girl whose mother left her in an orphanage that locked her in the attic.I can't wait to give one of these to my own daughter in a few years! :)
summary: I did this over 15 years ago, and I still have it

reviewText: This project is a GEM!  My son loved writing his own story, illustrating his own story and then receiving it fully bound, professional in appearance!  The section entitled "about the author" is hilarious.  Ours read, Carter is a 6 year-old kindergarten student attending ..... elementary.  His enjoys trapping squirrels and playing soccer in his spare time.  It made for such a great gift for grandparents.  We plan to do one a year until my son leaves the nest!

My girls and I absolutely loved this product. They created the cutest story (there is an outline included and storytelling ideas that help guide you along too) and I helped them with the story so that it really was cohesive. When we got the book back, we were thrilled and ended up ordering more for both sets of Grandparents! You can pick out color of the cover, if you'd like it dedicated to someone, and an "about the author" paragraph. Too cute. We will do it again!
summary: We made Christmas presents for Grandma and Grandpa!

reviewText: Finally, a toy that fully engages my kids and showcases their creativity skills, unlike the video games played today, which may be fun, but have little to no educational value and will be surely forgotten by next season. This will be cherished for generations to come! Plus, my daughter may have discovered her true passion for writing with this gift! One of the best toys ever, along with the calendar kit.
summary: Reading books is cool, but this kit lets ur child be the author of his/her very own!

reviewText: My eight year old nephew was delighted with his 'Illustory Make Your Own Story Kit' that I gave him for Christmas.  It was the fact that his story would be published that intrigued him the most and got his creative juices flowing.  I recommend this kit to anyone who wants to encourage a positive outlet for the creativity in every child; an outlet that requires no batteries, no game platform, no viewing screen and no produces noise.  This kit teaches planning and execution in a way that is fun for the child and provides tangible results in the form of a published book.  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!
summary: Illustory is a Dream Come True

reviewText: I chose to create a book online. The program there could use a bit of maintenance and tweaking, but the fast and ultra-friendly customer service more than made up for that. Best customer service I've encountered in a LONG time!

I am a homeschool mom who loves to encourage her children to be creative and enjoy learning. Illusory has be a wonderful way to do that. We end our school year by writing stories to publish. It give the kids a fun way to apply what they have learned in writing through the year and gives me  and them a wonderful way to look back and see how they have grown and developed their writing skills. I also love to see how their drawings have developed too. They are proud to show the books off to friends and family.

We received two of these kits as gifts, which was perfect--one for each child!They were fun for the kids to use, everything you needed to create the stories (title pages, story pages, markers) was included in the box, and the turnaround time from sending in the pages to getting the book back was pretty reasonable.I believe that there is an option to submit your story online, but for both of ours, we used the included, postage paid envelope to mail in our pages to be turned into the books.My kids are VERY happy with the result, and enjoy reading their very own stories. There is the option to include some "about the author" information, which is very fun for them. The books that were returned to us are nice, high quality hardcover books.The biggest suggestion that I would make would be to include an extra title page or two, in the event of a mistake! My daughter changed her mind about hers, and then had nothing else to use for the title page. I called customer service and was told that some additional ones were going in the mail that day, but after several weeks, there was still no sign of them. I called again, and was told that we didn't need to use the title specific pages, as long as we included particular information (they told us what to include) and used a story page. That is what we ended up doing (those extra title pages still haven't arrived!). The cover does look a little bit different from my son's, who used an actual title page for his, but it is still nice.
summary: Illustory for My Readers and Writers!

reviewText: We did one of these 3 years ago, and my now 7-year old daughter still loves to read the book she made then, so we bought her another one along with ones for her now 5-year old twin siblings and they all had a great time. To get the most out of the kit my advice is to help your kids plan their book first on draft paper, and then take your time making the final version (possibly spread over a couple of days, although I know it can be hard dealing with the impatience factor.) Use the writing utensils and materials provided in the kit for the final copy - as some other reviewers have mentioned here, if you use your own pens, there may be ink 'bleed' in your final version. When you order your published copy, be sure to use the prepaid envelope to send it in, or if you are online, use the code that comes with your kit to get your included version. You will need to pay extra for any additional published copies that you want. My kids preferred making their kit in the physical rather than online, but that will depend on the child.As long as you follow all these steps, you and your kids will have a great time with this project, and they will be beyond excited when they get their final 'published' book.
summary: Excellent Gift, Do Follow the Directions Though

reviewText: I purchased this for my four year old (2 1/2 years ago) and when I was pregnant, we decided to write a book for the baby.  The first misstep was that Grandma let the 4 year old open this up on his own and scribble all over the two "cover"s.  So, our cover is a total scribble fest.  When I tried to order a new cover sheet, the online cost was $.20  totally reasonable.  But, they would not give you a PDF file so you could print it, you are required to have it shipped to you for $5.  Then, there are quite a few rules/guides/limits about how many words and drawing with only the provided markers within the box.Why not have your child draw pictures, photograph them and make a photo book at shutterfly or other photo site?  That would be much more flexible and easier, if you ask me...

As a teacher, I had to buy this gift for my seven-year-old niece.  She loved making her own book, and the finished product that they send you is very professional looking, like a book that you would purchase from a store.  They even included some tips and activities to help children write their stories, including diagrams for pre-planning and brainstorming.  My niece loves her book and shows it off to everyone - she even took it to school and got to read it at storytime.  This is a great educational activity that really gets children to be creative, and they love it.  Buy it for all of your favorite kids!

My 8 year old seems to love it until he stopped working on it and went back to it a few days later,  When we signed back on everything was there but he could not edit it anymore.  the only thing he could do was press a button to approve the project an order the book.  He only did 6 pages and has a lot more to go.  Well, I can not find a company phone number anywhere.  All I can find is a customer service email address.  In the pass week I have sent 2 emails explaining the problem and my husband also sent 2 messages.  All we get back is just an email saying they are busy and will get back to us soon.  A week is to long when you have an anxious 8yr old who wants to get going with it.  Seems like a great product but if you need any technical assistance your out of luck.  Right now we feel we wasted $30 because we can't complete the story.

Our daughter loves to write and illustrate her own stories. Her collection of notebooks and folders was growing so quickly that we could hardly contain them. Then we found illuStory! We now have a way to capture all her ideas in a beautiful presentation, that can also easily join all the other books on our shelves. No loose papers or different sized journals. It's as if she's creating her own colorful library on her own!Our experience with illuStory has been completely positive. The pages are crisp and white, providing a box for the illustration and lines for the text. The markers are also brilliant in color and an ideal size for this type of project. We especially appreciate the option to choose between her own handwriting or a digital font.The finished book was lovely: clear, colorful, hardbound. Our daughter was ecstatic to read it and share it with everyone who came to our home. She proudly took it along to every family/friend outing so that they could enjoy it as well. It now stands on her bookshelf, proud and accomplished, with all the others.Our daughter has often asked for more of these kits so she can continue the process again and again. We look forward to this, as well! The entire process is a delight: the writing/illustrating, waiting, viewing, and sharing. We highly recommend illuStory!
summary: Busy for Days & Treasured for Years!

reviewText: I have bought this for my kids for the last several Christmas's. I absolutely love the idea of the kids making a book that we can enjoy for years to come. Not only is it easy to do, but you also end up with a great quality book.  It was the best gift I've ever given them. Making these books is very simple & the kids just love seeing their art work & story become a book. We have even bought these to make books for their grandparents.( this was one of the best gifts we ever gave them) I will continue to buy this product. I highly recommend you getting one .
This was for the children enjoyment. Brought some creative designs from unbeknown little artists. Will purchase again. Kept the children busy for hours. They were so proud to see their work in print.

I can't say enough about Illustory!  My daughter is 6 and in Kindergarten and loved to make stories on paper stapled together. So, Santa brought her an Illustory kit and we did it together as she can't write many of the words yet.  So, she drew all the pictures and told me what she wanted to story to say.  We got our book in the mail yesterday, and she was so thrilled to see her story bound like a real book!  The quality was great, and it even had the dedicaton page and an "about the author" page with her picture (which I provided).  We even ordered an extra copy for grandma with a dedication to her!  I highly reccomend this kit!

LOVE THIS IDEA!!  My daughter has already published her 1st book with Illustory and keeps asking for more.  It's a great way to have your child put together her thoughts on an event, subject, etc and put on paper, illustrate it with pictures and get a "Real" book mailed back to her.  She's already shared it with her classmates and teacher. I highly recommend this!

I bought this kit for our almost 6 year old granddaughter, who likes to tell me what to write for a story.  When I saw the kit on Anazon, I knew it was for her.  She absolutely loved it.  She told me what to write and then she drew the pictures to go with the words on each page.  I then ordered four books - one for my granddaughter, one for each set of grandparents, and one for her teacher.The quality of the book was excellent.  She just finished kindergarten and told the teacher at the end of the school year that she wants to write another book this summer.  So, I purchased two more kits for future projects.  First book has a yellow over.  She wants to write a book each year and will probably choose a different color for the cover of each book.  She is so proud of her book that was authored and illustrated by her.
summary: Great book writing kit for kids

reviewText: They absolutely loved this concept.
