They both are veryartistic and enjoyed putting this book together and then sending itoff to be printed., They don't read the book now, but they still have it andtheir mom plans to give it to them , many years down the road at their babyshower, for them to be able to read one of their own works to the baby,I thought that was a very sweet idea for this book!

I purchased this item for my 6 year old and she just loved it. It allowed my daughter to express herself and create her own story and drawings. Her book title was named, "All About Cats". She was THRILLED when it arrived in the mail and to tell others that she has a "published" book. (wink wink) Most importantly, she continues to read thru her book 6 months later and is extremely proud of her achievement as an author and illustrator. It is definitely an added boost to your child's self-confidence.Overall the quality, ease of use, and product is outstanding.  They provide you with ample pages (we only used half of the pages provided to us) for your child to create their story on.  At the top of the page, there is an area for drawings and then below that, an area to write a sentence or two. My personal preference was to have my child use her own handwriting to draw her pictures and write her story. However, illuStory provides additional choices of using electronic images and typed written words.  So you have many options to choose from as you explore your creativity.  When your done creating all the pages, just use the enclosed envelope and mail them in.  In just a few weeks, you will receive your personalized hardcover book.This year, I am having my daughter create one page at a time.  That way, we can capture the entire year thru my daughters eyes as we have vacations, celebrate holidays, go to the beach, etc.  I also plan on having her school and sports teachers complete their own page, along with Grandma and myself and have that added into the book as a surprise for her. I can't wait, this will be the best Keepsake EVER!!From one Mom to another, this is a great item for children. I will continue to buy this item from Amazon for my family as well as gifts for birthday party's.
summary: Let your child become a writer & illustrator!

reviewText: Our daughter has received three IlluStories from her Gran and they have been a hit!  One of them was written for her little sister for her 4th birthday, which meant the world to little sis.  Then, for my mom's retirement gift after 28 years of teaching, our daughter wrote a poem and we published it through an IlluStory kit.  It is my mother's prized retirement gift and she shows it to everyone!  IlluStory has been a blessing in our daughter's life, as she loves to read and write stories!!  Thank you, IlluStory!

This is a fun thing to do. I purchased it thinking I'd do it with my daughter. We never got around to it and believe it or not, it's still in the box on a bookshelf. Maybe one day! I have seen a completed one by a friend and it is really nice. That was the reason I bought it, so I do recommend it!
Bought 3 of these as gifts for kids age 8 - 10!  It was a complete hit.  What a great idea!

We created our book online (you use the code from the kit to get your online book.)  My daughter loved picking out all the colors, backgrounds, clipart, etc.  We spent a couple weeks creating it, a couple pages at a time.  When it was shipped to us I was pleasantly surprised with the quality.  One page had some colors that were wrong (not what we had created) and I called them and they immediately fixed, reprinted, and sent us a new one.  I was very pleased with the customer service! I just ordered two more to give as birthday presents.

Ordered the kit so my 7 y.o. son could transform a story he wrote into a keepsake book.  He loved the process and the final version is exceptional.  It is possibly the first step on a long and successful career.Lucy Adams, author of If Mama Don't Laugh, It Ain't Funny

I bought this as a gift for my nieces this past christmas!  (ages 9-12).  They LOVED IT!  The three of them are very crafty and enjoy this type of things, so we are very excited to submit their story and all get a copy of it in hardcover book form!  Super neat and definitely a recommended gift!

A great gift for a child who adult who wants to publish their own book. Contains art work or you can submit your own. Book is very nicely published and a source of pride for whoever writes it. Easy to create following the instructions.
summary: IlluStory made one girl very happy

reviewText: I bought Illustory as a gift for my parent's 45th anniversary. I wrote a poem about their life, their children and grandchildren and had all of the grandkids draw pictures to go along with the "story." The book came out great and they absolutely loved it. It was a wonderful display of each of the grandchildren's creativity and made a beautiful keepsake. This makes a unique gift, especially for grandparents, who are often hard to buy for!
summary: Makes a one of a kind gift

reviewText: Good for my creative eleven year old grand daughter. She is excited to publish her own book. Fun and challenging. Teaches good skills.
summary: A fun and easy way to develop writing skills.

reviewText: As a homeschooling mom of 5 we have used many of these book kits over the years. They are fun and educational. They are a great addition to your art curriculum, language arts curriculum, and creative writing (can be a story or a book of poems or an autobiography.) They can also be used for science (think book on human body, plant life, animals, etc.) or history (think historical fiction or retelling an historical account) or Bible lessons (book of verses with illustrations, book of Proverbs with illustrations.) The possibilities are really endless. They can be used as young as preschool with help from an adult. All through the elementary years, children grow more independent in using the kits. The books end up being family favorites at story time and children enjoy seeing their progress through the years. Kits also make a great gift for a child who seems to have everything. The finished books also make a great gift from the child for grandparents and other relatives. Can' say enough good things about them...especially for the price.
summary: We homeschool and we love them!

reviewText: There is nothing quite like seeing your name attached to a professional book. My son is constantly creating books, comics, and stories adn IlluStory allowed him to take his love of art and story telling to create a book that he'll be able to show his children.The creation process was simple, and fun! They provide extra pages for any mistakes that might happen.When the book is finished and ready to send off for printing, you just put it into the packaging materials provided and wait a few weeks for the finished product to arrive at the house.The finished book makes a great gift, but so does the IlluStory packet. If you have a child who loves to create and write, they won't be disappointed if you get this. They'll be thrilled to show off to everyone their professional book.

This was a gift to my five year old daughter, who looooooves books and making pictures and was thrilled at the idea of authoring her own "real" book, but has turned out to be a heart-breaking waste of time and money. After days and days of creating and writing and editing her story, and illustrating the pictures - many of them - we carefully put everything in the included pre-paid envelope to Creations by You and posted it in early September 2013. After not receiving a confirmation of receipt email, I began to email customer service with repeated queries and providing details of our order (the toll free number gives only a recorded message with no option to speak to a real person): after weeks of silence and multiple attempts, I have received one or two messages from "Tracy" saying "we apologize for the delay; we are experiencing an unusual number of requests and are processing orders" or "we are trying to locate your order". This has continued for over TWO MONTHS. Meanwhile, I am left with no holiday gifts for proud grandparents and a heartbroken daughter. I wish I could give this product zero stars....
summary: Buyer Beware - waste of time and money

reviewText: I had gotten this for my daughters 7th birthday, she was always finding bits of paper around the house and trying to write stories on them. She absolutely loved the gift. I had her start writing the story out on regular paper and then I helped her get it going when she was done. I made sure to count all her words and after we got the story down on the papers I told her that all she needed to do was draw a picture of what was happening in the story on that page. She did a great job. I finished filling out the paperwork and sent it in. I received an e-mail letting me know that they had gotten the story and that her book would soon be here. When she got the book she said was very pleased with how her book turned out. There were no miss spelled words and the pictures looked great! It looks absolutely beautiful, she brought it to school and everywhere. I plan on getting another illustory for her this year as well.On the topic of miss spelled words...there is a box that you can check to have them keep the spelling the way it was written (in the case that your kid wrote it out and spelled something in a very unique manner and you wanted to keep it that way forever!)

My 6 yr old daughter loved this gift. The kit was simple and easy to understand. She wrote her own story one day, and we mailed it the next. There were no additional charges, not even for shipping, because we only wanted 1 book. The turn-around time was reasonable - I think around 4 weeks. The final product was beautiful and very solid. She ran around the house saying, "I'm an author! I can't believe it!" We will definitely buy this product again in the future and we recommend it to others.

My daughter received the book kit as a gift. It's a really great idea and I'm sure many children have enjoyed the finished product, but my daughter isn't one of them. She worked hard for weeks crafting and illustrating a story for her book. It included some of her friends as characters. Their families gave us money so we could purchase additional copies for their children.It's a great idea. In theory. Only, there is no finished product. After a few emails, none of which received a reply, my wife finally received an email from the company claiming there's no record of my daughter's packet (with its pre-printed label guaranteeing the address is correct) ever arriving. This despite the fact that we have the USPS tracking number and confirmation that it was delivered on 14 August at 9:26 AM.Maybe this will not happen to you, but be warned that it could happen to your child after he or she has worked hard on their project. If nothing else, scan the pages before mailing so you'll at least have a copy of your child's original work. They might be just a bit less heartbroken that way.
I purchased this for my 10 yr old son who has had trouble with reading in the past. Thought this could help him & be fun at the same time!!

If I could rate with no stars, I would.While my kids treasure all of their past IlluStory books, I regretfully urge you NOT TO SEND YOUR CHILDREN'S BOOKS to this company any longer.Both of my children sent in their hard work FIVE MONTHS ago. We did receive my daughter's book--with her school's name instead of her own on the back cover/author's page. My son's book never arrived at all--we received another child's book instead.Since that time, I have tried to reach customer service via email (there is no person on their phones as best as I can tell). They replied at first, and even told me they were re-sending our whole order--though we have never received it. Ever since--months worth of emails to customer service go unanswered.Avoid this disappointment for your own kids...mine still ask about their books regularly, and I sadly neglected to make a copy before sending.

For the past few years, I have gotten Illustory kits for my kids for Christmas, and they get so excited about them. My kids have used their kits both to write fictional stories and to write their own autobiographies. The kit is so user friendly: i love that I can sit down with my kids to make them, and everything we need is right in the box. And after sending the kit in, we get to look forward to the excitement of getting the book in the mail and then reading the book and showing it to friends and family. The kids feel so proud of their own "real" books.This year for Christmas, the kids decided they each want to make an Illustory book for their new baby brother for his Christmas gift. These gifts are perfect, because they are fun for the kids now but also serve as mini time capsules and capture this part of their childhood for years to come.We have made at least six Illustories, and one came in that wasn't bound properly. That was disappointing, and we never got around to sending it back to get fixed. But it was only one time.i'm excited to increase our collection of more and more books written and illustrated by our own children. These are a perfect gift!
summary: My kids' favorite gift to get and give!

reviewText: I bought this book for my daughter. It was great to see her inspired to write her own creative story. The directions are easy to follow and the finished product exceeded my expectations. I ordered additional copies which made great gifts for her grandparents. I would highly recommend this as a gift to give or to receive.
My daughter and I spent a rainy weekend completing her very first book. The finished product is so authentic and makes my daughter incredably proud of her abilities!
summary: Fantastic gift for my 6 yr old girl!

reviewText: My daughter loves making her own book. This is hours of fun and also helps with her learning to write. She has made 3 over the years and we plan on buying more in the future. We have also given these as gifts many times. The whole process is fun for the whole family and going back and reading them years later always brings a smile to our faces. Customer service for this product is also great. The first book we ordered years ago we had an issue with and they fixed it and sent us a new one right away. This is a first rate product and company that I would highly recommend to others.
summary: Love this! Have bought many over the years.

reviewText: I love this product. I have bought 2 in the passed and loved them. It's a great gift to give and the child you give it to have a treasure forever. It shows the creativity of the child. Love, love, love this book.
summary: Great gift for kids of any age.

reviewText: This is the second one I have purchased.  My daughter loves doing this.  The first one she did was when she was 8 and now she is 10.  The box includes paper that you can write out your store and color the pictures.  You can also do like my daughter and do it all online from the comapany's website.  You dont actually need this kit.  You can just go to the web site and do it but I have found that is is cheaper to buy the kit and use the code from it.  The book that you recieve from publishing looks great and is very well made.

I have been purchasing these kits for years. My daughter has a very vivid imagination and loves to write.  These books are fantastic!  The books are well made when they arrive.  I would recommend this book kit to anyone.

My 8 year old daughter is not the princess/fairy/doll type of girl.  She'd much prefer to write a short story, complete with her own illustrations.  After having a few completed masterpieces sitting about the house, my daughter lamented that she wished she could have it published 'like a real book'.  So my search began, and ended, with this product.  She received it as a Christmas gift, and almost immediately began working on her story (titled 'I'm a Superhero!').  Following the simple, clear instructions in the package, we were able to send off our manuscript for publication.  It did take a little bit to receive the completed product back; in fact, I even emailed the manufacturer to inquire about it as I was worried it may have gotten lost.  Never fear, though, it arrived shortly afterward, and my daughter was thrilled with the hardcover book which she had written, illustrated and designed (by choosing the book color, fonts, etc.)  I love the 'About the Author' page too, and it's so worth it get it printed with your child's picture.  Imagine her face when she sees it!  We even purchased a second one to give to her on her birthday, and this time we tried the internet option.  The advantage here is that you can make the text of each page as long as you want, instead of the rather restrictive 20-word limit per page on the mail-in version.  The drawback, though, is that the drawings will not have that kid-drew-it innocense since the illustrations are also made on the computer.  Having done both versions, I think we'd stick with the internet version from now on, so she can write more and more complex stories as she gets older.  For a child who loves to write and draw, what better gift could they receive than the ability to publish their very own hardcover book?  Something that they - and you as the parent - will cherish for years to come!
summary: Your little author will have a ball with this!

reviewText: My children have received 2 of these each over the past 2 years as gifts. Wonderful, creative art project that allows for drawing, writing and imagination - my youngest at 3 loved it, and my 9 year old.
summary: FABULOUS GIFT FOR KIDS UNDER TEN

reviewText: We have given Creations By You to our daughter for Christmas for the last two years. It is now a total family tradition. She is in 2nd grade - and we love to see how her writing, her story-ideas, her illustrations come to life and how they change from year to year. It is the perfect format -- allows for so much creativity and individuality, but it also pretty much guarantees a great, polished finished product that your child and you will love forever. She even brought it into her school librarian to show her - and the librarian asked for a copy to keep permanently in the school library. Other kids have even checked out her book! She's like a real published author/illustrator. We'll be buying this for years to come.
summary: Amazing - we love this! Perfect present, excellent product!!

reviewText: Product provides hours of fun and enjoyment / entertainment for our 1st grader.  She hasn't finished her story, yet.  But, we are looking forward to her finishing it up so we can send it in for the final product.

I am a 45 year old mom of three:  13yrs/10yrs/2yrs.  College educated education major, now I am a stay-at-home mom.  With one income coming in; I search high and low for a bargain.  I shop yardsales, and thrift stores to get gently used items rather than ever pay retail.  However, I NEVER have a problem putting Illustory on the 'pay full price and get this thing' list.We always get these for our kids because it is a wonderful way to share time with them as you create a story together(my daughter like to have me illustrate a story she writes - and trust me I am no Picasso). It is also a wonderful way for your kids to express who they are by...get this...actually writing and drawing.  NO ELECTRONIC GADGET is ever going to give your child the satisfaction they get when their very own creation comes back in a beautiful printed book.Can you make your own book at home?  Sure, but it's not the same and I can't make a hardcover book, can you?In my humble opinion, this is a home run gift for any ocassion.  I also suggest more board games as gifts.  You can't beat spending time with your kids as an antidote to all the garbage competing for their attention in the world.By the way, why not have your kids use this 'book' to write and draw about a family member and give the published book to that person.  For ex:  a book about the things they love to do with Gram/Gramps or an uncle, or even an teacher!  There are so many ways this product could be used!  Yes, definitely check out the Illustory web site.
summary: Skip the Electronics - BUY THIS ITEM!

reviewText: My young son really loved making his book.  It came nicely bound with vibrant colors.  We ordered a second for the grandparents and they were thrilled.  He really liked the "about the author" part in the back.  It was an enjoyable project for him to do and I have a nicely preserved momentous from his childhood.  I think the standard option is great for a young child only, because of the twenty word limit per page.  I really thought that was limiting.  He always had more to write.  Their is an option for more words, but it has to be done online.  Also, the pages are printed on one side and the backs of the pages are visible as they were colored.  That means that the marker shows through on the opposite side of the page.  Still, would recommend this product. ( we didn't finish the project when we first purchased it. Probably two years past and we had no problem getting our book)
summary: Standard book great for young children

reviewText: My 5yo received this kit as a birthday gift. The kit contains about 30 or so pages, each with a designated space for the illustration and lines at the bottom for the handwritten text. It included markers, a postage paid return envelope, directions, and a guide on how to write a story (who are your characters, what is the conflict, how will the story end). To avoid having to pay for additional pages, since only 20 words are allowed per page and the whole story must be 12 pages or less, we storyboarded my DDs story on our own.This is a big project. My DD spent 4 days, maybe an hour or so each day. I don't know what the average time spent would be, but she put a lot of effort into the drawings. She and I enjoyed the project from start to finish.I was impressed with the completeness of the kit and the email contact from the company from start to finish. Illustory sent emails when the manuscript was received and when it was shipped. We received the book in less than 2 weeks from when we sent it in though based on the info included, this was a very fast turnaround.My DD was so pleased with the result. The book is made of the actual pages submitted which surprised me (though I think there is an option to upgrade). Some of the marker bled through to the back of the pages but this didn't bother my daughter or me. The cover is well made and the typewritten story exactly matched the manuscript with no typos. The dedication page and author bio page are great and included free.I totally recommend this for other new short story writers. When 20 words per page won't cut it anymore we'll probably look elsewhere to create books. For beginners this is an excellent product put out by a great company.

I loved the story that my kids put together about our family vacation so much that I ordered a published book for their grandparents too.  We were able to easily use the online submitting program.  They were able to write out their story and even draw pictures that I scanned into the book.  They could choose from lots of decorations and colors as well.  The project got them to work together and plan out their story, a great accomplishment for a 4 and 6 year old!

Got this for my nephews years ago for christmas and they loved it so much that every year they ask for another one. They love coming up with the story and then drawing all the pictures. Then once it comes in the mail they are so pleased that they made their own story they take it into school, they show everyone who comes over and they will have it for the rest of their life to show their kids. This is amazing and i love doing it every year because it shows what they liked at the time and keeps them interested in learning.

My daughter has written an IlluStory book every year for the past 4 years and we have never had any trouble.  She finished one in August of this year, we mailed it in, the check we sent has cleared the bank but it has been 7 weeks and we still don't have the book.  I have tried emailing and calling the company for the past 2 weeks and get no answer from either.  Has anyone else had this problem? Any ideas?  My daughter is heartbroken that she may not get her book :(

Illustory is really awesome!  Last year we did it for the first time and it turned out so cute!  We gave one for a gift and kept one. It is a little costly but worth it!  Def. send in a pic of your little writer because that is so neat how they write "About the Author" and your little one's face is in the book just like a real author and they describe his or her likes or dislikes. This cost extra but really made the book.  I def. recommend this.  You will see how your child gets better at writing each year if you do it yearly like we are doing.

Got this for my grandsons-ages 6 & 8.  Have not received the finished product yet, but they enjoyed creating and illustrating their book.  This is a great teaching tool.  With the included work sheets, they were able to figured out a plot for their story, decide on the characters in their book, etc. And markers were included for illustrating.  It took them through a step-by-step process so the whole project was not overwhelming.  I just think this is a great product for kids and would definitely recommend it.

I've used this twice and I love it! I've always loved writing, and it's awesome that I can see what I've created come to life like a real book! The quality of the book is really great, it looks so professional! My only problem is that there weren't enough pages for what I wanted to do, but it's perfect for little kids to make a picture book. I think it would make a great gift- would totally recommend it!

I am disappointed that the status inquiry I emailed this company on my son's behalf regarding the book he had worked hard on is not important enough to your customer service department to bother responding. It never came!  I was afraid I would be met with this type of response. Every year, since my son was in kindergarten, I have bought him an Illustory and he has created some wonderful books through the services Illustory used to provide. I am able to see his development as a writer by reading these books and he has so much pride seeing works he created on his shelves beside authors such as Dr. Seuss, Jeff Kinney, and E. B. White. My point is, to say we enjoyed Illustory products is an immense understatement. I am also an elementary educator and have used these products as classroom activities in the past. Unfortunately, I no longer feel Illustory is taking a child-centered approach to their dealings with clientele and they are causing more harm to children than good by taking the stories, written by young children, and ignoring their families when they ask where the product they paid for and were eagerly waiting for is. Once an award-winning product, Illustory seems to have fallen into the hands of the careless and incosiderate, and that's the best case scenario. What these children create may not be on the NY Times Bestseller's List, they are of no less importance to us. I will be seeking any future book creation services from your competitors. Please reconsider your current practices. I urge you all to stop purchasing their products!!!
summary: Do not buy from this sham company!

reviewText: I gave this as a Christmas gift. My nine-year-old grandson likes it. He draws very well and he also enjoys writing his own short stories.

I would like to highly recommend this product.  You see purchased my first one to give as a finished gift to my 17 year old daughter.  When she was in 2nd grade is wrote a very long but wonderful story about a unicorn.  I edited the story and hired an artist to illustrate her story.  The company was so very wonderful about rushing this so we could have a great surprise for her on Christmas morning.It was the greatest feeling to watch her face and the faces of her brothers.  They were so excited for her.I also made a book for my 2 year old grand daughter.  This was a picture book from birth to two years of age.  I only wish I could get enough photos so I could do my grandsons.I have also use illustory at school.  My afterschool class made up stories and we made them into a book.I also had three students that made up a school about the three of them and me as the three little students and the big bad music teacher.  I had them made up for them when they graduated from high school six years later.I have one for Halloween (and I was tired of illustrating especially a purple and orange pumpkin).But the latest was when my husband and I got to babysit while the parents were away.  This was fun.  We did a book abouttheir family and surprised them with the book as a Christmas gift to their parents.I would encourage everyone to use this a fun, as a keepsake, or whatever.  This is a wonderful idea and I am glad thatthere is a place that you can "book" you memories.

Thank you for carrying this terrific product. My kids love to read and one day my son told me he wanted to write his own book someday. I saw this kit and thought I would give it to him to try. The process was simple. He wrote his story, added pictures and we dropped it in the mail in the postage paid envelope (which was great-by the way) that was included in the kit. My son actually forgot all about it and about 2 weeks later our mail carrier knocked at our front door with a package addressed to my son. I can't even describe the look on his face when he took out his book. He looked at every detail and couldn't wait to show everyone his masterpiece. He has written several books now and I enjoy seeing his progress unfold. I highly recommend this kit to any parent that has a child even remotely interested in reading or writing. What a value!

My niece is very creative - loves to draw and make up stories.  She really loved this and created a her own book with pictures and a story, then they sent it away as directed and it came back a real book. She is thrilled and this is going to be a repeat gift every chance I get.  What kid does not want to make their own book - a real book? Great product, educational, fun and a lifetime family heirloom.
summary: Major hit with my niece and its a real book

reviewText: This is a great opportunity to engage your child in an uninterrupted discussion about a particular topic. Your child will learn to organize his/her thoughts on paper; thus creating a story.  These are excellent skills for beginning readers and writers.I am using this opportunity for my 6-year old son to create a book for my husband's 40th birthday.  He has to think of a title and the sequence for a story entitled, "Why I love my dad". It was also my gift of choice for Chanukkah and Christmas to other 5 and 6 year olds.
summary: Great to Teaching Reading and Writing

reviewText: I enjoyed putting together this book with my daughter. She is 7 so I helped her with difficult words and how to form her sentences, etc. It was a project we enjoyed sitting down together and doing. I think it was a great learning experience for her to write her very own book, putting together the characters, the plot, the dilemma and the ending - not to mention the pictures to go with it! It is something I would love to do again with her in the future and with my other kids.
summary: Great activity to do with my daughter and awesome keepsake!

reviewText: Amazon just raised the price on this within the last few days.  Go to your local bookstore where it lists for $19.99.  Awesome product, kids love it!
summary: Buy this one at the store!

reviewText: what a nice change.  A fun toy that you can use your own imagination to create something.  Used it to create a narrative story and sent it in for the book.  All went well and we are pleased with all facets of this toy.

I have no qualms about the quality of this product. I just wanted a durable book, and it's durable. It's perfectly fine.But you misspell my kid's name on the cover and first page? You got the name right on the back credits, why mess it up in front of the book? And multiple misspellings inside too. On one page, the word "hear" appears correctly the first time it is used but then reads as "her" the second time. I made sure every single word was spelled correctly, but Illustory just botched it.My kid wanted to show off this story that she created herself but now she's embarrassed that her name is misspelled.A waste of money.
summary: Spelling the child's name wrong? Really?

reviewText: This is such a great item and worth every penny. We'd love to do these every year and get duplicate copies for our families. This is a great way to capture the different stages of creativity in your children - and rewarding to them when they see their story "published" in a real book. Highly recommended for all ages!
summary: Great item and worth every penny.

reviewText: I loved using the Illustory Kit to put my story "Living with Autism" together a couple of years ago!  It was an amazing product to use, and I must say that a lot of people were interested in ordering my book from Creations by You (my therapist Irene gave me paperwork from Creations by You, and the rest is history!), which is a very good company to self-publish children's books.  I recommend anyone who is interested in self-publishing a children's book to please use this Illustory Kit!  It does wonders!
Great idea! The bound book is sweet, not cheesy at all, nice quality. Makes a great gift for grandparents. My teenagers even enjoyed making them.

I bought several of these kits and made my own animal paintings with simple poems for each of my five grandchildren.  Each book was personalized with each grandchild's name and picture on the cover.Nothing was more satisfying than seeing their expressions when they opened their gift, made especially for them!I created my books all online.  The  paintings and pictures were sharp, colors were vibrant, couldn't have been happier with the quality!Can't wait to create my next project!
summary: Just for me from Grammy Pammy

reviewText: Get one of these kits for each of your children!They love to write their own stories, draw pictures and send it all in to receive a hard cover book that you (and they) will always treasure! My 5 yr. old is working on hers  now!The quality and ease is excellent.

The time this activity took to create was a priceless memory to my daughter and me. The detail and thought of our story, making the pictures together and anxiously waiting the final product was a great experience. This is something that is fun, interactive, an excellent language arts, reading and spelling learning activity with your child. The instructions are simple, the finalization of the book is easy and mailing it off was a snap. I was thoroughly impressed with the Illustory employees as they contacted me to ensure that they understood exactly how we wanted the book to look. I can't say anything else more about this product other than it is wonderful!
summary: Priceless activity to creative a memory with your child

reviewText: Great for promoting self-esteem and creativity for your child. My child felt very special having the opportunity to write her own book. I hid the stickers until we came up with a plan about how to use them along with my child's written words in the story. She continues to put together her own shorter books with paper and staples. Great practice for hand writing skills. Patty - Mom of 6 YO
summary: Very Special - Child can author own book

reviewText: We love this story making kit! My daughter writes one book each year and then we can enjoy her progress.  She loves to think of her story, hand write the words and draw the pictures for each page. It is an amazing experience for a young person to see their work published!

This is a great product!  It encourages children to use their imagination.  I ordered this for my son a couple years ago and he loved it when the actual hard covered book arrived!  I gave to my niece as a Christmas gift this season and she had it out of the package and creating her own story once the wrapping paper was ripped off!

Everyone is trying to get a jump on the new Common Core Standards, and here's a fun CC aligned way to improve your child's ability to produce and publish a their writing.My son has created an Illustory every year since kindergarten, and we use them as keepsakes of how his writing skills and interests have changed over the years.  The kit comes with everything that you need to create the book: worksheets for the brainstorming and outlining process, a place to record the author's information and dedicate it to someone special, pages to create your story, and a special page to design a cover with your own artwork.  Your child writes the story (HINT: you can use more words per page by creating a word template with the correct margins and typing the text yourself), draw the pictures, and send the completed packet in to the company.  You can pay extra for special features and additional copies, but if you just want a standard, hard cover copy of your book, there is no additional cost after purchasing the kit.  The book arrives in your mailbox looking like something you'd see in the library, except that it's your child's special work!We use an Illustory every year as a homeschool project during the spring semester.  My son's stories often revolve around something fun that happened during the year or something that we studied.  Each year I can see how his sentences grow more complex and his vocabulary improves compared to his previous books.  I can also see the development in his fine motor skill through the details in the illustrations on each page.  We love looking back at the books that he's made, and we always order an extra copy to give to the person that he chooses to dedicate his book too.We highly recommend Illustory for any child who struggles with writing and needs a fun and creative way to make writing a positive experience.
summary: Fun Way to Track Writing Development

reviewText: This is by far the best gift I have ever given my daughter. She loves her book so much and loves to read it to other people. We had copies made for her grandparents and they treasure her book also.

We ordered this kit for our kids last year for Christmas without knowing much about it. Were we ever pleasantly surprised! It is the greatest! It really made the kids use their imagination to write a story and draw pictures to go along with it. Then we mailed the pages in (in the paid envelope that comes in the kit--excellent idea!). When the books arrived, the kids were so excited and SO proud! We had to order extra copies because they wanted to give one to their teachers (for the library) and to their Grandparents. We will definitely be ordering more of these kits. And they would be great for birthdays or other gift giving occasions. A five star recommendation!!

We bought this off of Amazon back in November for my daughter to create a unique gift for family members for Christmas. We LOVED the whole process and were so excited to receive the product! We ordered online in November to allow adequate time for production and shipping. Once your order is placed you do not receive any kind of confirmation in regards to the book being made or shipping. Mid-December I reached out to customer service (email is their only way of contact) and was told my book was being printed as of Dec 12. This still allowed enough time for Christmas delivery.It is now January 9th. I have heard nothing from the company nor have I received my books. I emailed them TWO more times and have not heard anything back from the company. I ordered 4 books total (one comes free) for family, and not only was my daughter devastated she didn't have Christmas gifts for everyone, I am out 100 dollars.I reached out to the company one last time this past Monday alerting them that if no one responded to my inquests in 48 hours I will be reporting fraudulent charges to my bank.Alas, I still have not heard a peep.My daughter and I had a great time coming up with creative ideas and creating the book and we were really looking forward to seeing the final product. Unfortunately, I would steer fellow consumers clear of this company and look for similar products elsewhere.

My daughter spent a lot of time creating her book.  Almost four months since we sent it and have no book.  They don't answer phone calls and all the emails I sent were basically ignored.  It sounded like a great idea.  Service is terrible.

Bought this for my kindergartner and she loved it!  She drew the pictures, I wrote the story words, we mailed it out and got the finished product back within 2 weeks.  She loved it and asked for another.
great product, great price, great sellerI would recommend it to others but its always better to check around first for better deals

I would recommend this kit for ANYONE, ANY AGE who wants to write a short book or compile artwork for your own enjoyment or to gift a few copies to others.  Okay, if you are a novelist, of course, go to self publishing for greater production numbers.  But, if you are intimidated by the whole process of publishing your short story, poetry or artwork, this is a way to do it-low risk.  I think you can do up to 50 pages at a reasonable fee per page beyond the allowed amount. An older child may not get excited about the kit until you show them what they can do with on-line publishing. The company's website has some sample books you can view.I bought the Creations by You Illustory Kit for my son who was about 10 at the time.  He was more interested in cartoon drawing (which they now have a kit for which I bought), so I decided to use it myself to create a book of inspirational sayings for my Goddaughter.  I communicated by email and phone with a representative when I didn't know how to create what I wanted to do in their on-line format.  The representative was patient and easy to follow.The end result was a beautiful 50 page book with a painting on the cover, text in various fonts and colors, and, artwork or photos on each page (double-sided.) I was able to use as many words as I could fit in a Word document which I saved in PDF in order to be uploaded.  Photos can also be easily uploaded. You can also superimpose words over images or anything else you can do in a word document, before uploading to your book. The system allows you to move the pages around as often as you'd like and add and delete as needed. You do have to pay for additional pages and books, but the cost is reasonable.  I was working on a deadline, and, even though it was their busiest time of year, the company worked quickly on my order and I got the books in less than three weeks.  After a few months, I did have trouble with the binding on one of the books, but I sent it back and they repaired it satisfactorily. When you get your kit, read the instructions carefully, particularly if you want to publish on-line. I'd also recommend you buy an extra copy for a keepsake if your child will be using the book a lot. The books aren't indestructible. They do sell plastic covers for them, but I can't comment on the covers since I did not purchase them.Overall, these kits are awesome and the company is very customer friendly.  It is an American company who also has a publishing program for teachers and their students to help advance literacy.  I would recommend the kits for any age, especially when using on-line publishing.
summary: I would recommend this kit for ANYONE, ANY AGE

reviewText: My 8 year old son received this for Christmas and eagerly got started writing his story.  He enjoys writing stories anyway, so we knew this would be a good gift.  I lvoe that it takes him through the steps of writing, so has great educational value.  It will be hard to keep him limited to 20 words per page, so may have to go with the online option.
summary: Perfect Gift for a young writer

reviewText: Our daughter received this kit as a gift and she was thrilled to be able to write and illustrate her own hardcover book. She still likes to pull it out and show it to visitors because she is so proud of the book she was able to create with IlluStory.
summary: Great way to get published for the first time

reviewText: My seven year-old received Illustory as a gift and it was by far one of the best gifts she's ever gotten.  She worked for many days on her story -- writing, drawing, coloring.  After she was done, I scanned her work and submitted it over the internet.  There is an option for mailing it in, but I wanted to include a photo of her in the author section.Online, I found that many more options for  fonts and formatting are available.  Only twenty words per page are allowed when submitting by mail.  We can exceed that limit by submitting the work online.The book is limited to twelve pages (unless one wants to pay additional fees), but it comes with lots of extra pages for drafting or fixing errors or just making a longer book.  My son was intrigued by the process and took some pages to make his own book.The hardcover book that came in the mail today was small, but my daughter loves it.  She's been reading it over and over and shares it with everyone she knows.DETAILSThe Illustory price includes the cost of mailing in the story pages and the shipping fee of the final product.The company proofreads the story and prints it.  One may opt to have it printed with the child's misspellings and even in the child's own handwriting.Online, the illustrations can be scanned in and uploaded or else the child may choose from the available illustrations.  We used my daughter's drawings, so I did not peruse much and don't really know what they offer.NEEDS IMPROVEMENTFor the same price, one could print the same book on Snapfish.  It would be bigger and come with twenty pages instead of twelve.  It would take less time to process and arrive much sooner.My daughter's book was submitted April 24 and didn't get here until today, June 2.  That's a long time for an anxious little girl to wait.Of course, Snapfish charges shipping and handling, but they do have coupons.CONCLUSIONDespite the pricing, my daughter was inspired by the Illustory layout, which showed her where the pictures go and where her words would be.  That helped inspire her more than a blank piece of paper ever could.This is a parent friendly gift.  I appreciate it so much more than any toy.  My daughter now has something that will last a lifetime -- her very first book!  She is so proud of it.  This was fun, educational, and milked her creative juices.P.S. FOR TEACHERSIllustory does give free books to classrooms.  They are soft cover, but the whole bookmaking process is the same.  Details are on the company website.

My son received this as a gift for his seventh birthday. He was so excited to create his own story. He drew all of the pictures and I helped him write down the words so they would be easily understood by the staff at Creations By You.It turned out wonderfully! He had so much fun and it is a beautiful product!
summary: Wonderful present for my 7 year old

reviewText: Do not waste your money on this product. It basically comes with a bunch of papers and some markers. The papers where the child is supposed to write are far too small, there is a limit of words for each page and to top it, their website is down. I feel so cheated and angry. And the features presented on the box- yes, you need to pay extra for them. I wish I had read all the reviews before I got it, but I saw it was rated so highly I figured it's all it's supposed to be. I was so wrong.....

This is such a wonderful idea and can be passed down for generations. My daughter can now put some of the drawings she has done together with an interesting story for the family to enjoy. Price is Right!

We bought this for my daughter who loves to create stories.  She had a notebook full of them and we encouraged her to pick her favorite and make it into her very own book.  She lit up at the idea.  She made a book and when it came in the mail, she was so excited and wanted to show all her friends at school.  That was almost 2 years ago.  Now her writing has greatly improved and it is fun to see the growth over the years.  We will definitely keep it as a keepsake for her and someday she can show her kids or students.  Definitely a gift for kids and parents as well!!
summary: Great gift for kids and perfect keepsake for parents

reviewText: Being a Speech Pathologist, I am always looking for games/activities to make learning fun for my students. the IlluStory book kit proved to be a great product. I used it with an 11 year-old client, who had difficulty expressing himself in writing. The notion of having his work published in a book really excited him! And he loved expressing himself by drawing the pictures! This is a great product for both speech pathologists and parents! Children love creating their own stories, drawing the pictures, and then seeing their work in an actual book. In addition to being fun, it also helps improve children's expressive language and writing skills.
summary: Great product for promoting self expression!

reviewText: We did the online version in April 2014 so we could scan in my sons elaborate artwork.  The finished product is beautiful and was delivered quickly as promised via FedEx in May 2014.  I do feel the product is pricey and you could just as well make your own similar product using any other Internet-based image publishing service (i.e. Shutterfly).Be careful of the year your kit was made (copyright date on back of kit) and the expiration date (inside of the kit).  Per the manufactures' website "Illustory kits sold before 2010 are no longer supported and are not redeemable. Illustory kits produced between 2010 and 2012 will be supported for a limited time and books are redeemable until 12/31/2014.  Illustory A+ kits produced in 2013 have an expiration date of 12/31/2015 and books are redeemable until then. Kits currently shipping [made by LuLu] carry an expiration date of 3/31/2016."

They include a set of markers and paper.  Be aware of the extra fees associated with writing on too many pages.  Read all their papers carefully and count everything.  They added on fees, contacted me by mail which slowed down the process, and they should allow more pages for the price.  My daughter did this years ago, and now at 11 she did again and still loves this.  This is a great idea and I am not sure if anyone else offers such a product.  The first book went smoothly.  The second book they spelled her name wrong, and the return process was really awful.  They reprinted the book, and although they fixed the typos throughout the book (ones that my daughter didn't spell incorrectly, ones they did), the condition of the book when they shipped it back was beaten up a bit on the spine, but I don't want to go through the process of returning again based on the experience the first time.  If they improve their customer service with the typos, improve the marker set, and shipping situation, this company would do much better.  I doubt I would do this again even though my daughter loved it.
summary: Second time buyer - daughter loves this.

reviewText: They Loved it and couldn't wait to write their own stories. Haven't seen the publishing yet but looking forward to it.

I have 3 kids 2 of my children have used this product.  It is so much fun they write their own story.  I let them write whatever they want and let their imaginations run wild.  They draw their illustrations with lots of color.  After they are finished we put it in the envelope it came with and drop it in the mail.  Several weeks later you get an amazing book created by your child.  It's something you will never get rid of.  My daughter is 15 years old finished one when she was younger and still has it.  She wants another one describing her teenage years.  I love this product. It's a memory of your child's imagination that you can look at over and over.
I have brought this product before and grandchildren love writing their own book.  This will be the second time for them to write and publish.

My 6 year old son absolutely LOVES Illustory. He has published a 17 page book which he wrote, drew and designed. The best part is that it takes his photo and the "about the author" section is right on the back cover which tells about him. He  was SO Proud, that he brought it to show all his teachers, coaches, principal, librarian, the list goes on. This program inspires him to keep writing books and now he wants to write funny comics. LOVE LOVE LOVE IT!!
summary: Exciting tool for my aspiring 6 year old writer!

reviewText: both grandaughters asked for this item - very educational and they are learning the process of wirting.  brings out their creativity
Great item Thanks.Item shipped fast.since it was purchase for a xmas gift don't have an ooutcome. Thanks Thanks Thanks
I gave this as a birthday gift to my grand daughter.She loved it, and so did her mother.The were both very excited about the idea.

My daughter loved it. Her book arrived in the mail and she could not be more thrilled. Her story was about her trip to Disneyworld. I had tried other Creations By You products and was told they are no longer in business except for Illustory.
summary: Excellent learning tool for my daughter

reviewText: My 8 year old daughter absolutely loved getting this. We had never seen something like it before. The materials are high quality and the instructions are clear and easy to understand. We haven't had a chance to send it in due to the perfectionist working on it but we can't wait to see the finished product.

This was a gift for my 6 year old son. He loved creating and illustrating his very own book. Timely turn around from when we mailed the manuscript off, until the return of his very own hard-bound book. He is very proud of his creation and has read it to every member of the family.

I bought this book for my grandughter that is 10 years old and loves to write stores. It was a wise pick for me , as it is right at her age level. Easy to understand , Easy to follow directions . For any child that loves to write stores, or to encourage a child to write it is a great book.
I should have bought several.  All the other granddaughters preferred this to their own gifts.  Will order more next Christmas.
I definitely recommend this activity!  It is a long lasting memory for a child, parents or grandparents and gives the child the opportunity to be individualistic.  Definately recommend.

I have used these kits in many different ways over the years. Read all the way to the end to get an idea of the possibilities!I have created social storybooks for my son with autism since he was about 8 years old. He loves to draw the pictures for the books (he actually draws all of his pictures on the computer using Microsoft Paint). We then upload the pictures online and create the entire book online, place the order, and it arrives in the mail! It's easy, fast, and fun! And, you can't beat the price on Amazon! You don't even have to pay for shipping on your finished book! My son enjoys going back and reading the books that he has written and illustrated over the years. They are great keepsakes since they are professionally printed and hardbound -- just like a "real book." You can also upload a picture of your child for the "About the Author" page and include a brief bio. The quality is great!My son does at least one Illustory book every year (he always asks for a new kit for his birthday). If you have a child who is creative, likes to write stories or draw pictures, or just wants to upload photos to make their own photo scrapbook, then you will find the Illustory kit to be the perfect gift for any occasion. Home school teachers can use them to encourage creative writing, and therapists can use them to create social stories. You can also make memory books for boyfriends, girlfriends, parents, grandparents, or friends. These aren't just for kids! The possibilities for these kits are unlimited! I better order another one now!
summary: So many options! NOT JUST FOR KIDS!

reviewText: My son LOVES the Illustory kit! I order one for him for almost every birthday and Christmas. It is perfect for a child with imagination!!!

My son is now working on his second book - after last year's success, we will be doing a book every year (he's 6 now).  The book takes time to do properly, and certainly needs an adult's help at this age, but the end result is more worthwhile than virtually any other gift he's gotten.  The look on his face, seeing his name and story and pictures put together in the beautifully bound book...  I'll never forget it, and I never have to.  It happens every time he reads HIS book!  Highly recommended
summary: Great for Memories and for NOW!

reviewText: In 2008 I purchased the kit thru fundraiser ..my son was 12 and it gave is some bonding time making this book and finding pics to put in ..I would love to purchase another one to make for my boyfriend little girl who is 10..treasured memory

I purchased 10 of these  book kits from someone else and then needed one more and ordered from this site. this one was for several less pages and I was somewhat disappointed about that. the packaging and delivery timing was good

We bought this for our 9 year old so he could write a book. To see the excitement on his face was priceless. He was so proud of himself!This is a great overall activity to instill your child's creative side and to also boost their self confidence. The idea that they can write their very own book is such a great idea!I too decided to use this to give to my spouse. I wrote a small story about how we met and made it a story about our life. Trust me, grown ups love it too!
summary: For kids and grown ups too!

reviewText: Being an author and reviewer when my grandchild asked for this kit as a present I was thrilled.  It's always nice to see a child want to follow in your footsteps.  Was it worth the money?  You bet it was.Inside is everything that was needed for her to use to create her first book.  The instructions were easy to follow and she got right to work.What a great book was made.  Her illustrations were exactly as she drew them and she was thrilled to see her very own story come alive. She loves being able to share it with others and it has given her great pride to see she has a book just like her Grammy.This is well worth your money and will bring a lot of joy and happiness to any child that receives it. I am proud to recommend this product.

I bought this for my 6 year old daughter who loves to write stories. She worked on it with her father, we sent it away in the prepaid envelope, and the look of joy that she had when she received her professionally bound book was priceless. It contains the pictures that she drew printed on each page, and the words have been typeset. We even paid the extra $2 or so to have her picture on the author page and that was the icing on the cake. It was a fun project for my husband and daughter to do, but I think that it might have been a little difficult for a 6 year old to do all on her own due to the requirements of staying within certain lines. Otherwise I think this product is AWESOME!

This was a gift for an eight year old girl.  Most little girls love to express themselves, and this gives them an opportunity to be both artistic and expressive.  She will create something that will give her a sense of accomplishment and pride.  Years later, she will look at the book and enjoy a glimpse of her 8 year old self.  Wonderful.

My daughter wrote her own story at 6 years old! It was a great experience to have her create her own story and illustrate it. She felt very proud to have completed this project from beginning to end and was so excited to receive it in the mail. She is proud of her work and loves to share it with her teachers, friends and family. She is already looking forward to writing a new book!

I got this for my 5 year old grandson for Christmas. He, with his dad's help, work on this one full day.  They mailed it in and he got it back yesterday (less than a month).  He had to call me and tell me all about it. He read HIS book from cover to cover and excitedly read the page naming him as the author. My grandson is in kindergarten and loves to read and draw. So this was the perfect gift for him.
This is the second Illustory we have got.  The only bad thing is that it takes a LONG time to get the book back but if you are not in a hurry this is a great idea!

My 7 year old daughter was always dreaming of publishing her own book. When her pet frog died she was devastated and wanted to write a book in her memory. First i wasn't sure how to go about it. Luckily i found and bought the illustory create your own book. It was very easy, my daughter drew the pictures and wrote the story on the included pages. We sent it back and after a short time my daughter was holding her first own hardcover book she published herself!I would highly recommend this product for everyone, it's very simple to do. It comes within extra sheets in case of mistakes and it can also be done online.It's a great self esteem builder for all ages.

We bought this item for our son a couple of years ago (he was 7 at the time) and he absolutely loved it.  It was a great project to work on together.  He did all the illustrations and dictated the story to me.  All I did was write the words and send it off.  He still gets the book out and reads it.  It's a great for those who like to write or those who like to draw.
My daughter loves to write and draw so this was a gift that was perfect for her.  She was so excited when it came back all printed in the mail.

Our son has written 2 books with Illustory already!  He loves seeing the words that he writes typed onto the pages (by the company) and the drawings he does come out beautifully printed on the book. He is so excited and proud of himself when he shows his friends, family and teacher his publications!  The book even comes with an About-the-Author page just like real published books!  Everything that you need to write and draw is provided in the kit and the instructions are very easy to follow.  In just a few weeks you get back a real hardcover book!  The experience was so terrific, we plan on having him write a book each year so he can see how much his writing changes year after year.  And just as soon as his new baby sister is old enough, we'll start her writing books with Illustory too.  The books are a great family keepsake.  We love them

Our grandson is nine years old and a great artist and writer.  It will be nice to preserve his work to enjoy over the years in a "permanent" way-and perhaps, if he becomes "famous" some day, we will have a record of his early work.

I bought this kit for my 6 year old daughter.  She couldn't wait to start drawing.  She dictated the story for each page and drew extra "love notes" on the remaining pages, and even deticated it to her Nan Nan.  We opted to add the "About the auther" with a photo!  My daughter did get impatient waiting for the book to come back,.. but since Katrina the mail has been very unreliable.  Finally, her package arrived and she LOVED it!  We rushed it right over to her Nan Nan.  It is a perfect little book, that will be cherished forever.  I've already bought 2 more!!

UPDATED REVIEW AS OF 1-27-14I'm giving this a 2 star instead of a 1 star ONLY for the fact that we FINALLY did receive our books. But I'm only giving it the extra star because of that. I'm still overall unhappy with this company and our most recent books. I won't reiterate the issues that I've already covered. But soon after I wrote this original review I was contacted on here by someone from the company who told me to again follow-up with their customer service dept. So I did. They did get back to me but had no new news for me - my books were still unaccounted for and they'd be in touch. But I never heard back anything.... until a couple of weeks ago when they emailed me to say both of my kids' books had been found and that they were being printed to be delivered soon. I am still uncertain how the books went missing for so long, but FINALLY - five months after sending them in - we received them. But here are the problems I found with the two books:-- Three typographical errors between the two books (such as printing the word "The" as "T he" with a space between letters). Even my seven-year-old quickly noticed the errors.-- The author photos on each book were distorted, though the pictures I sent in were perfectly fine. One picture was quite blurry, the other had lines going across my son's face, as if the ink didn't print correctly.-- No note of apology, follow-up correspondence  or any kind of offer of compensation to try to make up for their losing our books for several months. Granted this was not a necessity but it would have been in good business practice to do so.Bottom line: I'm glad we finally received our books. Despite their errors on the part of the company, they will still be keepsakes of my kids that I will cherish. However, I plan to research other kid-publishing sites for our next round of book-making. I will not order from this company again. And that's too bad.(ORIGINAL REVIEW:)I am giving this a one-star review based on my recent experience with IlluStory. We had two of these kits, one for each kid, and they took a lot of time coming up with their stories and illustrations. We did everything we were supposed to do to put our kit together (this is not the first time I'd completed one of these so I knew what I was doing.) We chose the option to use the kit and have the kids hand draw their pictures (not to create the books online). The books are limiting in the sense that you can only have 20 words per page and a 12 page limit. This is NOT a lot of words to put together a story. But with a lot of time and editing their words down, we managed to do it. Past kits gave you the option to add pages for a price but this latest kit did not give you the option. I took the time to get pictures of each kids for the "author photo" and have the correct size printed & picked up at a nearby store. After ALL of this (weeks and weeks in the making), we shipped out our kits using the pre-printed envelopes they provide, guaranteeing correct address. I sent ours off in August 2013. By October (and many "Where are our books?" inquiries from my kids) I began to really wonder, too, where they were. I went back through my emails and realized I couldn't find a confirmation email. I tracked down an email address from somewhere on the Creations by You page and wrote to them, explaining the problem. They got back to me within a few days, but unfortunately with no record of our packages arriving. NEITHER of them (we shipped them in their separate envelopes). I exchanged a few emails with a person from their company but to no avail. I have them book titles, descriptions, kids' names but they said they don't have record of them. The emails on their end seem to have just ended. I received no compensation, no coupons, nothing of any kind of to help re-coup the loss of money, time and completely bummed-out kids on my end. Now maybe this was a fluke. Maybe the post office lost BOTH of the envelopes we shipped out. But then I get on Amazon and see that a couple of the most recent one-star reviews since Nov. 2013 sound very similar to my own problem. So what's the deal? The post office is just losing giant Illustory envelopes, ones that are really big with the IlluStory company name, address and logo emblazoned across the front? I had hoped it was a fluke, because I had used one of these kits a few years ago and we DID get our book back. I still have the same gripe about it being limited in my child being able to tell a story (I paid an extra $11 to add pages so she could finish her story! This was on top of the $20-25 originally paid for the kit.) But in the end she was so excited to be "published" that it was a worthwhile keepsake. This is what led me to buy the kits again, this time two of them. So, IlluStory, you tell me ... are you running some kind of scam where you "don't receive" just enough packets to fly under the radar or is the post office reaaaallllly losing all of those envelopes?

My granddaughter has written many "books" on her own but there was nothing like seeing her face when she had her first "printed" book. Very well done and nothing changed from her original work. She wanted the spelling corrected, which they offer and I would suggest having that done. Her third grade teacher hadn't heard about this offering and shared it with the rest of her class. I will be doing this on a regular basis because I feel that seeing her words in print and they were exactly her words really inspires her to expand upon her talent. The price is unbeatable so please do this at the very least once in your child's life. What a keepsake.

My oldest son used to make his own books out of loose-leaf paper and I would staple them together. With this kit, he had all the right tools to make a "real" book, complete with his photo and biography, that we can keep forever. So easy to do, looks so fantastic. Now I like to give it as a great birthday present to my kids' friends.
summary: Great product and amazing childhood keepsake

reviewText: More fun with the grandchildren.  You will learn more about them and enjoy their incredible imaginations.  It is a great way to spend time together.

My 7 year old received this as a Christmas present.  She was so excited to write her own book, we added the about the Author page and she wrote and illustrated the story.  We bought one book for our family and the second book we dedicated to her school teachers and gave it to the school on Teacher Appreciation Day with a note that we wanted the book to be placed in the library.  Now all of my daughters friends and others can check the book out of the library and they love it!I highly recommend this as a gift to anyone.

I got this for my daughter in kindergarten she is now in 2nd grade and still talks about her book! She gets everyone excited about it by sharing and encouraging others she has been writing stories ever since! She never stops asking can she get another one so she can write another book. This will be on christmas list again! That's why its the gift that gives all year its educational and fun!
I bought two of these for two very different grandchildren -- one boy, one gift.  This was a huge hit with both of them.
summary: Great for the budding young writers

reviewText: My ten year old son got this for Christmas from his grandparents...he LOVED this so much!  Not only the fun of creating his own story (which of course was based around Star Wars), but the anticipation of receiving his book, to finally getting it and reading it to us as a family and then taking it to school (which he ended up reading to his school's second grade classes cause they thought it was so cool).  There were kid's in his school that thought he was famous...he thought it was cute.  Anyway I highly recommend this toy...very educational, kids get to use their imagination and have a finished product to share and cherish for years to come.  Can't go wrong here...in fact I may end up getting some kits for my other boys.
Excellent project for kids - My daughter created her book based on our vacation, she will have it for years to come. Highly reccommend

My son was very excited when he received this as a Christmas gift.  He loves to read and draw and is quite imaginative.  I thought this would be a fun project for him.  I let him create his story and illustrate at his own pace.  It certainly wasn't something we completed in one sitting.  He really enjoyed the process. Once we sent it out, we received his bound book about a few weeks later(a lot faster than anticipated).My son was over the moon and thanked me profusely when he received the final product.  It looks great! Nicely bound with wonderful reproductions of his artwork and accurate text. He is so proud of his work.  He took it to school to read to his class and we've read it at home just about every day since he received it.  He is especially tickled by the "About the Author" feature at the back of the book with his photo and personal information - just like in a real book.I can't say enough about how much we enjoyed this project and what a great creative, educational and self-esteem building experience it has been.  He's dying to do another one... how can I say no?

I used illuStory to create a book for my 2 year old niece about her family.  It contained pictures of her family members and short notes about each one.  She loved it!  The book was hard cover and of good quality. Being able to order several copies was very beneficial, because I could have a copy for myself. Educationally, it helped me to stay on track and make decisions. The time commitment was very large. You needed to allow some period of time to download pictures and change you location, even if you just went on to the next page. Other wise it was an excellent experience, and an easy site to navigate. Thank you for the experience! Great job IlluStory!

Last year I bought seven of these kits for all my neices and nephews who range in age from 4-13.  It was a big hit!  No matter what the artistic or writing level, they all made wonderful projects that they will have to show their kids one day.

I have bought this for three different girls ages 6-8. They have all enjoyed creating their own book. It also comes out really nice when it is printed. A wonderful little activity for a girl or boy in that age group.
My 8 year old is a budding author, constantly writing her own stories.  So this was the perfect gift for her.  She has already begun writing her "book" we can't wait to see the finished product!!

I bought this kit for my grandson for Christmas.  He & his mom spend hours drawing pictures & creating a story.  He enjoyed it so much that his mom bought a second kit.  The first kit was sent in to be made into a book in Jan & the second kit was sent in Feb.  The instructions said it would take 3-4 weeks after it was received to be completed but after 3 months & nothing she contacted Illustory by e-mail as there is no phone number to call customer service which is also very frustrating.  She was eventually e-mailed back that they had record of receiving a kit in Feb but not the first one that was sent.  After several more e-mails (not to the same rep) she was finally told a completed book was shipped.  My grandson was so excited when it finally arrived (nearly 4 months later) but that quickly turned into dissapointment .  It looked like they had just photo copied the pages that were sent in, the writing wasn't type set, sentences were cut off & the pages weren't squared.  I had given this kit to my daughter years ago when she was young & she had a wonderful, professional looking book returned.  I don't know if they have undergone major changes to their product but would not recommend this to anyone!  If I could give this a Negative star rating I would!!

My daughter has bought three already! She wants to be a writer and by saving her own money from chores she buys her own book kit. She learn the value of money from these books and feels great about her self when she completes her books and gets them back in the mail.  She is 8 and loves them!
Looks like it will fuel the imagination and creativity...hoping that since we live in Canada we will be able to make it work...otherwise not worth it for us:(

We adopted our daughter from Colombia in 2010. I have two biological boys and one had a project in first grade for school  We decided to write a book about adopting her and how much we wished for her.  We bought the illustory  kit and it was AWESOME!!!!! WE created our own color book in a matter of around an hour.  It was so easy my first grader caught on immediately and within a few minutes was writing and illustrating our book.  It is one of the most special things we have ever done.  We read it to our daughter often and each time she feels so special and she says that is about me.  I can't tell you enough good things about this product !It was easy to use and came as a hard cover book that we have read over and over.  For anyone who wants to try writing a kids book this is definitely the way to start...

My daughter received this as a gift and has asked for it every birthday and Christmas since.  She loves to write, so this was right up her alley.  The process was easy to follow and the end result was of great quality.  We read the book often and it has held up through the years.  We love, love, loved the online creation of the book.  We easily scanned in our pictures and I typed up my daughter's words and the book was sent right to our door!  Illustory is on our Christmas list for both kids this year!  I also love this product as a teacher and look forward to using this with my young authors in my classroom!

I bought this for my niece who was turning 9. She loved it. She has begun to write her book and I can't wait to see the finished product. It was delivered way ahead of schedule. I ordered it on Friday with standard shipping and she received it on Sunday, which amazed me, but was just in time.

This product gives a child the opportunity to practice his/her writing skills and use his/her creativity and imagination.  I gave this to my nephew and his parents worked with him on it.  The bonus is to have it return in hard copy.  It can be treasured for years to come.

My children (ages 11 and 9) and I love this product.  They love it because they get to see their writing and illustrations combine in a beautiful book that makes them feel accomplished and like "true" authors.  I love it because it makes them want to write and create stories.  This product includes a sheet that helps your child develop their writing skills by thinking about characterization and plot.  This is basically a writing class for chidren in a box.  My children ask for these every Christmas,and it has become a tradition to create their yearly Illustory.  My son took his to school, and he was able to read it to the class.  My daughter does not like to draw, so she puts photographs from our vacations in it and creates a story around our vacation.  I also purchased one of these for my Girl Scouts to create together, and they donated it to their school library.  These are beautiful books that you will treasure.  I only wish I would have known about these sooner when my children were little because it would be neat to see how their stories and pictures have evolved.

I got this item to be a Christmas gift for my niece.  When it arrived in the mail, I could tell all of the pieces inside the box were all loose and falling around inside.  The only reason I'm going to give this to her is that I know my sister will be very understanding and will not judge me poorly.  But this package arrived in very bad condition.
summary: Sounds like it's in bad condition

reviewText: My daughter and I absolutely love this product. My daughter loves to write stories, and dreams of one day becoming an author. A few months before I heard about this product, she would tell me all the time, "I wish I can make a real book." I bought her a special journal to write her stories in, I tried special binding, but it was never like a real book. This product made my daughter's dream a reality.
