summary: Fun game, easy to learn and play

reviewText: We love this game! It is easy enough to teach the entire family but has some great strategy behind it to keep you thinking. This is sure to be a classic.

I love this game! Everything game in mint condition and no missing pieces.The only reason I gave it 4 stars and not 5 is because it only comes with 5 game pieces, which is a super weird amount considering most people play games in couples or pairs of people. I would of preferred 6 game pieces.

After seeing this game played on Geek & Sundry's Table Top hosted by Will Wheaton, I decided to buy it.  This is a very easy to learn game and extremely fun to play.  Check out the video on youtube.  GREAT!

I really enjoy playing Ticket to Ride! If you are a fan of Settlers of Catan and Macao, you will definitely enjoy this game. Ticket to Ride is fun for a couple of even a small group. It's easy to learn and explain to others. I would definitely recommend this game to friends and family!

High quality game. Very quick to pick up for the casual board game player but it has the feel of a deep strategy game. Great addition to any game collection. If you like Catan but are looking for a shorter game or just something different this game has what you want.
This is a great game. Easy to learn and has great re-play value.  It is fun for me, 32 year old male, my parents and my teenage nephews and niece.  This game isn't good for my 5 year old son.
Just discovered this game a couple years ago and it is very fun and addicting! Great for game nights with friends!
Really fun game - keeps you on your toes.  Game of strategies!!!  Awesome Christmas gift.  Can play this game in 30-45 mins.
We love it. Great with children as well. Added benefit of helping kids with their geography of the united States.

I had played the game settlers of catan and was excited to try this game out. It is fun and a good game to play with those who do not like to play strategy type games. That said there is really not much to this game just collect colors and place the tiles on the board. Games like Settlers allow a little more variety by having you collect multiple items and being able to trade with others. I would like to try to Europe version which is said to add more variety into the game. Overall a fun game that is very simplistic in nature.
summary: Fun Game but not too exciting

reviewText: This was a gift for my son and daughter-in-law for Christmas.  They loved it and play it often with friends while they are at college.  It arrived quickly after I ordered it!  Thanks!

I just stumbled on the "Ticket" series of games.  Bought it without ever playing.  Good family game - with a little competition thrown in.  You can make it less aggressive by ignoring other player's routes or go for the kill by blocking a route off.  Easily adaptable for many ages.

I purchased this game on request for my husband for his bday. We have already played it several times and love it. Anyone new we played this game with has also loved it. It is a great family fun game. Must have for your collection of board games!!
This game is fun and exciting for the whole family for hours on end.  A littly pricy at the stores buy got a good deal on amazon.

Quick and easy to learn, I've had fun playing with the rest of my family.  There's a bit of suspense as you try to sneakily connect lines without anyone noticing, and even when you're foiled, you're not out of the game.  Recommend for those looking for something new to try.
This game is so much fun!  As a young adult, my friends and I have a great time with it.  It might be too complicated for a young child, but is one of my personal favorites.
Great game, great gameplay. Light hearted, great for a family or group play. highly recommended by many people, good for most ages
Our family loves this game! It is so much fun, and a very easy game to play with your children. Definitely was a good purchase!!!
I ordered this gift only a few days before Christmas. The gift arrived on time and in great shape! I could not have asked for more. My family (ages 5-31) all love this game.

This game is great for just about all ages.  It teaches (some) geography with the states board layout, and also teaches how to stratagize.  Players must decide on each turn to collect cards or play cards.  Great family play.
summary: Geogrophy and strategy in one game!

reviewText: Great family game!  Easy enough for younger kids 8 - 10 yr olds to play!  Not as boring as some of the usual family games!
Our family loves this game.  The only down side is that only up to 5 can play.  Great family game!
Our adult children introduced us to this game.  We all enjoyed playing it.  It is easy to learn.  We added the 1910 expansion pack which gives more routes.
Gave this to my son for Christmas.  He has his friends over and they play this game quite often.  He has even said he may bring it to work and play the game with the gang.

It is perfect for both kids and adults to challenge one another's strategies and cleverness.  It's not overly tough, yet it keeps everyone engaged until the game is over.  One can finish a game within an hour and play again if so desired!  Helps people with their Geography skills!  That is a bonus!

I am what you would call a "board game enthusiast", and this one fits the bill with gusto in my opinion as a challenging, exciting, competitive, straight-forward game for even those of us who are not age 8. I'm 23 and my parents are +30 my age, and we all love it and find it enthralling. I wish there were more games like this. If you enjoy monopoly, you'll enjoy this one. Also, it has the added benefit of not taking as long to play as monopoly. I give it 6 out of 5 stars. Enjoy!
Absolutely great game.  If you like Settlers you will love this game.  Easy to learn but lots of  complex strategy.

We bought this game for our children for Christmas.  I was surprised that even my 8 year old can play this.  It's a great game for the family game night.  This is a special one for our family since everyone loves it, so keep it locked up against the smaller children as their are little pieces to eat and to lose.
summary: Can you create the longest train?

reviewText: Great game for family game night.  Kids enjoy it as well as the parents.  My husband and I have even played against each other and had a blast.

Our adult son and his family introduced us (the grandparents) to the game. We all had fun, kids and adults alike. We had to have our own game to play at our house when the rest of the family came over. We choose this game over cards most of the time now.

This game is quick to learn and fun to play. You can play with 2, 3, 4 or 5 people so it's good for varying group sizes. The European version adds a few extra 'twists' but this is the basic version and the game play is very similar to the Europe version. So if you have one of them, that's probably OK - at least for beginners or casual gamers.
This is a well-made, well-designed game that is fun for the whole family.  I was concerned because the age range says 8-12 years, but the adults in our group loved it, too!
Fun game.  Not difficult to learn.  Best when played with 2 or 3 people.  Allow at least an hour, maybe 2 hours to play the game.
This is the best game to come out in a long time. Really fun, strategic but easy to learn. The extension make it even more fun.
This game is really fun, easy to play, and moves quickly.  We really like playing this with friends even when our kids are around because it does not require your 100% attention all of the time.

I seriously hate this game. Everyone in my group hates it. It's the most overrated game in the history of all games. If you are an avid board gamer, the most you will get out of this is using it to convince someone who hates board games to play with you. Why you would want to convince someone who hates board games to play with you is beyond me, but whatever. That's why it's a "gateway game" that is "fun for all ages"--there are barely rules, so lazy folks can get in on the non-existent action.Cons:You get to do one thing a turn.It's pretty much entirely luck based.People act like it's a big deal when you block them off from completing their routes, but it's almost always just the only thing you can do because this game is boring and its objectives are boring and only getting to do one thing a turn means you don't have time to sit around and troll people.The map is ugly and boring, the train pieces are generic pieces of plastic like Fisher Price toys out of the 90s.Zzzzzzzzzz.Pros:I guess you can get people who hate games to play with you.If you're still convinced that this is the ultimate game for you, at least don't buy it new.
When the kids come to visit this is one of the GO TO games we play. Great fun - we have played for hours.
This is a fun, simple game that anyone can pick up and play quickly.  It's a great two player game (which is why I got it) and a great game for up to five people.
Game arrived about one week from when I ordered and I was able to use it as a Christmas gift as planned.  It arrived in good packaging and game was brand new, and arrived as such.  Thank you

I've played this game before once with my family and it was a lot of fun, so I decided to purchase one of my own.  Once I realized there were other versions available, I started looking at different reviews for the different versions. I saw one review comparing the European version and the original version and the reviewer mentioned the original version was more competitive. Not having played the European version, I can't compare, but the original version can be very cut-throat and competitive depending on your opponents. The game does take much longer to play than listed- allow at around 1-1.5 hrs for 4 players. For our second round, we decided to speed the game up by taking cards and being able to build train tracks in the same turn as well- that was a lot of fun and sped the game along.
I got the game for my family and then immediately ordered an additional copy for myself after playing with them. Tons of fun if you are into strategy and don't mind reading the rules first.
This game is great fun for all ages.  I've played it with adult groups and with kids and everyone has had a great time.
A great purchase.  Worth the money. It is our "go to" game for just the two of us or the whole family.
This is a great family game as well as a competitive game. Each game takes about 45 minutes which is great.
It's easy to learn and play and so much fun!  Money well spent for sure!  I'm going to buy more of this game as presents for family and friends!
I bought this game after seeing it on Table Top.  This is a great game and my wfe and I have had many fun times with it and friends.

This is a great game because it's a simple concept (enough for young children to play) but still has a strategy component.Take too long in building a train, and someone else takes it, which ruins your entire game plan.Overall, it takes roughly 45-60 minutes to play, so this is a bit of a longer game.It's great construction and has held up well to a lot of use.  This is a game in our rotation that we play at least every few game nights.
This game is easy to learn and so much fun to play! It gets challenging the more people you play with, and you are sure to think someone is out to block your path on purpose haha

This game has been fun for the whole family.  It is easy to learn, so even the younger ones can play.  Strategy comes with practice.  We like playing in teams of two people, but found you need at least three players or three teams to make the game exciting. We have bought the game (and Ticket to Ride Europe) as gifts for several people because our family liked it so much. It is not everyday that you find a really good board game.

I was introduced to the game by my grandkids.. It is a fun game.  The purpose of this game is to go from point A.. Ontario , Canada (for ex) and try and make it to your destination.. , San Diego, Ca.( for ex). all along the way, hoping that your follow players do not block you...  That is a simplified explanation ... but the game is fun... and can get "cutthroat " if your grandson blocks you just cause he has train cars that he doesn't need... grrrrrrrrrrr.... fun game, worth the money
Smooth from start to finish...not one problem, nor any dislikes. I would recommend this to everyone. No other can compare.

We have the Europe version and have played this version many times.  It is a fun and fast game.  We play it with our younger kids by modifying it a bit and by helping the pick the way they need to go.  They ask to play it often.  Great family game and gave it as a wedding gift as well.  Great for something different the just the usual board games.  Would recommend to anyone.

Chica and I love to play games with our friends.  We started out our gaming with our all-time favorite,Carcassonne Game.  We progressed from there to such games asPuerto RicoandThurn & Taxis.  This Christmas, we received Ticket to Ride and although it wasn't released by our usual favorite, Rio Grande games, we gave it a try.  What a wonderful game!  It was refreshingly easy to learn how to play but the more times we play it, the more difficult the strategy becomes.  The strategy also changes depending on how many people are playing the game.  If you are a fan of Rio Grande games, you will love this one as well.  With so many fun board game options out there, does it really matter is there is a writer's strike going on? : )

Ticket to ride is a fun family game that is easy to learn. My family and I love to play it.The only thing I don't like about this game is the playing cards are small. If you buy an expansion pack they send you larger replacement cards. They should have done that in the first place.

I purchased this game because I wanted something more fun and challenging for my 11 year old than games like Apples to Apples and I'm certainly glad I chose this one.We played (with 2-4 players each time) several games on Christmas day and each game was fun for both the kids and the adults involved. The game rules are easy to learn and suit many different kinds of playing styles. The only thing that took a few rounds to get used to was the method of scoring and once we had that down the game ran smooth as silk.The only downside - at least when playing with children - is that you aren't going to be able to get a game in in under 30-45 minutes so make sure you plan accordingly!

This game will provide hours of fun. There is mild strategy involved, but not too complicated for your casual gamer. This is a nice game if you have a hour to kill. I have recommended this to friends and to my knowledge, no one has said "I wish I didn't play that game" after completing the game (unless they are a poor sport).

Very easy to teach to anyone, yet has enough depth to keep experienced players interested.  If you have not played a board game since Risk or Monopoly, pick this up and play it, then head over to boardgamegeek.com to learn about other great strategic board games!
summary: Great Game to Get into Modern Board Games

reviewText: I have thoroughly enjoyed this game! It is absolutely addictive! We got this game about 4 weeks ago and I have literally played it at least 30 times since then. And we have taught a ton of our friends to play as well. I would highly recommend this game to anyone!

I sought out a fun, imminently replayable board game that would be easy to learn and take less than an hour to play. To find such a game I visited the boardgame geek forums and found that for beginners of so-called serious board games, Ticket to Ride was the way to go.Pros:1. Easy to learn. My wife and I have not played many board games, but we picked up the basics of Ticket to Ride in under ten minutes.2. High quality product. The map is made of firm cardboard. The illustrations are artistic and fit the theme of the game. The trains themselves are solid plastic.3. Loads of replay value. There are different strategies out there, and depending on the destination tickets you receive, you have to adapt how you play that particular game. You can keep going back to the tickets to get the ones you prefer, but you always have to keep at least one card, so there is a bit of luck involved.4. Takes less than an hour. We have young children and will often play this game after the kids go to sleep. The game time length is perfect. We can finish an entire game and still be in bed early enough.We haven't played outside of just two people, but we can't wait to get our friends and family in on it.Con1. Only one con. The train and destination cards are rather small, which makes shuffling difficult. We plan to invest in the 1910 expansion, which should quell that complaint. Still, the game should come with standard sized cards.
summary: Best board game we've ever played

reviewText: Our family learned about this game while visiting family.  We have had so much playing it.  Whether with my 7 year old son or just my husband and I, we have a great time.  I would recommend it for any family that loves games.
summary: Great game, different from the rest

reviewText: This game is very easy to learn (I don't understand any of the negative reviews saying it's "too complex") and lots of fun, as long as you're not the big loser in any particular game. Imagine getting hemmed in and locked down in Settlers of Catan, multiplied by 100. That's how frustrating this game is if you happen to choose the wrong path cards which (unbeknownst to you at the time) conflict with someone else's ambitions. Satisfaction with the game is very hit and miss, as it can be VERY tedious when you have no chance of accomplishing your objections. Part of the appeal of the game is also one of its biggest drawbacks: you can easily see how well you're doing compared to everyone else, which means that you can also tell very easily when you have no chance at all of winning.
summary: Lots of fun most of the time

reviewText: This is my go to game that I bring with me for new gamers or gaming groups.  It's one of the essentials to own.  Easy to learn, fun to play. mechanics are rock solid, and the components all just work.
This is a very simple game to learn.  We play this more than any other board game we own.  My whole family enjoys it, from my six year old son to my 70 year old grandma.

A little simpler than the EuroRails series, but still has the strategic planning.  It has a solid game mechanic, and is extremely quick to learn.  A great choice for people just starting to get into "serious" games.

Ticket to Ride was relatively easy to set up and learn (particularly compared to Ticket to Ride Europe, which isn't that difficult in and of itself).  Despite its short learning curve, however, I continually return to the game for fun, interesting, and relatively fast-paced game play.  Strategies evolve depending on how many players, from 2 to 5, end up playing.If I had to doc this game any points, it would be for the materials- specifically, the cards, which seem excessively small.  Smaller cards are not only more difficult to handle, but also to shuffle.  (I think the 1910 expansion actually replaces the small cards with larger cards).If you are looking for a "gateway game" to go beyond Monopoly, Trivial Pursuit, or any of the traditional games into the larger world of modern board games, look no further.  This game offers a great combination of a short learning curve with interesting group game play and at least one expansion.
summary: Great family game, easy to learn

reviewText: I play this game with my 5 year old and 10 year old boys.  My 14 year old daughter also loves to play.  It's a game that appeals to so many ages.  And what's fabulous about it is that it requires strategic thinking (along with some luck) and doesn't take that long to play.  From start to finish it's about 1 hour for 3 players (who are experienced at the game) and maybe 1.5 hours for a more players.  I once played with 5 players and it took almost 2 hours.  But the turns go quickly so everyone stays interested and it's just so fun.  All in all, one of the best games out there.
We play a lot of games as a family and are excited to add this to our collection.  If you are looking for a game that can be enjoyed by all ages, this is a game for you!

This game is super fun. Me and three of my best friends (we're all 18 year olds) played eight rounds of this game in one night and we enjoyed it immensely. It's definitely a fun game to play. I would suggest getting it.

This is such a fun game to play.  I love it because their is strategy involved but it is easy to explain it and play it right off the bat.  Their isn't a lot of instructions.  We love it and also played it online for 6 month strait after we got it.  Great for all ages and learn about where the different states are and places.
Very simple and fun game.  I thought it would be more complicated but it really is not.  They say the best things in life are simple, this game is simple.
My teenage son asked for it. It was shipped quickly and we love playing it as a family.  Better than video games or TV.

I bought this game without having ever played it, basing my purchase on favorable online reviews and positive mentions here and there from others who also enjoy board games. I've played with 2 players a couple of times and 4 players once, and everybody I've played with seems to agree that this is a pretty fun game. The strategy is definitely kicked up the more players you have, since you obviously have more people competing for a finite number of routes.
This is a great game that you can pretty much play right out of the box. No pouring over rules while you play either, once you understand the three or four mechanics in the game, you're ready to go!

In all truth, there's very little about this classic game that I can say that hasn't already been written more competently elsewhere.  Gameplay is fast, simple enough that all but the youngest children can grasp it within a few minutes, and yet deep enough that even serious boardgamers will find it very enjoyable.  It even includes spare pieces and a number count (so if you lose certain pieces you can find a substitute and still have the required number.)  Numerous expansions can keep the game fresh for years to come.The only minor quibble is the huge size of the card deck, along with the decision to use 1/4 scale cards.  The tiny size can make dealing with a typical hand a bit awkward.  A full-size deck might add to the price, but would probably be worth it.  If it could be purchased separately, so much the better.
summary: A classic game with minor packaging quibbles.

reviewText: Ticket to Ride is an interesting game that uses strategies to make it to your destinations. Love the competition of it.

Board game creators assume that more rules make for a more entertaining game. What that usually makes for it a 30 minute segment before every playthrough of a game where you must explain every rule to those who have not played the game before. Thankfully Ticket to Ride is amazingly easy to learn how to play. In the amount of time it takes to set up the game, you can learn all the rules. All the game pieces seem very durable. Somehow Ticket to Ride manages to be both strategic and simple. This game reminds me somewhat of Risk, just much shorter (30 minutes to an 1 hour). It's not my favorite board game I've ever played, but it's well worth the price.
We received this for Christmas and this quickly became our family's favorite game. Our youngest is 9 years old. Highly recommended for families.

I only recently started getting more into board games and this one is great for almost everyone.  I have played this game with many different groups of friends and they all loved it and at least three of my friends went right out and bought it after.
Fun.  Easy for young ones. Like Monopoly only less complicated and faster and shorter play.  The whole family loves it!
This game is amazing!  Super easy to play and offers tons of hours of fun!  Very happy with this purchase.
summary: This game is a new family favorite!!!

reviewText: This is an absolutely wonderful game.  I own about 300 games, and would easily put this up in the top ten of them.  It's great for kids and adults, it's easy to learn and explain, it looks great, it doesn't take too long, it's a great combination of luck and strategy, it plays great with 2 through 5 people .... I could go on and on.  But why take up your time when you could be BUYING THIS GAME!!  Congratulations to Amazon and Toys R Us for noticing this gem.
summary: Outstanding Game, Can't Go Wrong With This!!

reviewText: Great gateway game components are build well not the aesthetically pleasing but still quite nice. I can easily play with my mom and my grandma or serious gamers and have a good time.
summary: One of the best gateway games out there.

reviewText: We are a game playing family and Ticket to Ride is fantastic.  My husband received it from "Santa" for Christmas and we've been playing every night.I bought it based on overwhelming postive reviews on Amazon and they were not wrong, this game is great and the outcome is different each time.  It's a perfect blend of change and strategy...a game that makes you think.We also have the expansion pack which adds some fun too.One bit of caution, my husband is color blind so some times it's a bit challenging for him but he still loves it.This game is recommended and highly suggested!Enjoy
Great game!Love that you can pass and play or plat solo against a bot. There are so many route cards each game is very different. It's also very easy to use and just a lot of fun.
My grandkids love this game!  A real winner. I must say that Duluth, MN is misplaced.  It is where Minneapolis should be.  It is really located at the tip of Lake Superior.
We have played this game with other family member and decided to get it for ourselves. It is a fun quick game to play with kids 8+
summary: Great game to play as a family

reviewText: This is a fun strategy game that is easy to learn and continues to provide hours of family game fun without being tediously long and drawn out.  While having fun you gain knowledge of geography as well.  The construction of the game is superior, like the other Days of Wonder games we have.  I highly recommend this "train journey".

This is one of the 4 pillars of Euro board games, to quote Wil Wheaton.After seeing him play it on Table Top on youtube I went and bought it for our board game night we have with our friends. Everyone loves it. Super simple to learn, amazing replay value!Thinking about getting an expac or 2!
summary: One of the best board games ever!

reviewText: My family loves this game.  We purchased some wooden card holders on Etsy that have made it much easier to play.  Instead of holding all of the cards in your hand, you can organize them in the card holders and see all of your cards laid out right in front of you.  This is especially good for children.[...]
A game worth having.  We have played at least twice a week since we bought it for Christmas and the strategy is straight forward enough for anyone.
This is a wonderful game for 2-5 players (best with more than 2 players), easy to learn, and takes 30-60 min playing time.  Never gets boring and moves quickly!
Takes a while to catch on, but a fun game. Scoring can be a challenge to master but I liked it.

it takes a little patience to learn; but once you get the hang of it, you'll be addicted! my husband and i borrowed the game from my parents because we wanted a new game to play with some friends. we ended up keeping the game for a couple weeks and played it almost every night (just the two of us) several times a night! we then finally bought the game for ourselves.the only downer is that you can only play with a max of 5 people. i like games that you can play with an even number (for couple's night).also, i rated the durability low because the board can be a bit confusing to fold back up. after we played with some friends, a friend was trying to fold the board back up and ripped it a little because she didn't know how to fold it properly.

Ticket to Ride is now one of my favorite board games. I won't go into detail about how to play the game as there are many other reviews here that do just that. I just had to comment that if you've been sitting on the fence trying to decide whether or not to purchase Ticket to Ride, just do it. Every single person that I've played with has really enjoyed the game. It's so easy to learn and the turns go quick. The game has a great combination of luck and strategy that appeals to gamers of all ages.I have yet to order any expansions or other versions, but based on how much everyone loves this game I'm hoping to explore those options soon. If you want a unique game that's easy to learn, fun to play, and will keep you coming back time and time again, Ticket to Ride is your game. The only minor gripe I have is that it caps out at 5 players. There have been several instances where I had 6 or 7 people wanting to play.
This was my first time on a train!!! It was an absolute terrific experience. The train arrived right at my doorstep and I have been riding it ever since!!!!
This is a fun game for families as up to 6 people can play.  My 8 & 9 year old sons really like it, although it is a little to difficult for my 4 yr old.
This game keeps us all occupied and happy. The only downside is that it has a maximum of 5 players.
This is a great family-friendly game. Strategic enough for adults, but still simple enough to include the kids. It's become a favorite!
I have two kids 16 and 7.  My 7 year old will play any game.  My 16 year old is a little more picky.  This does the trick.  It is simple to learn and we have played it almost 20x.
This is a great game.  Fun for the whole family.  We play it over and over and over.  We love it.  Great and really easy for most ages.

I brought a bunch of friends over to play board games and none of them had even heard of this.  Within only a few minutes, they all fully understood the game and a couple of them are planning to buy their own copies of it now.  It's a great game and worth the buy for playing with friends or family.
summary: Easy to learn, fun to play

reviewText: This is just a great fun game. It's different than the other games. Everyone that has played it lived it. Worth buying.

This game is totally worth the price. My husband and I play it at least once a week with our 14 yr old son and friends. It's always a challenge yet simple enough for everyone. Such a nice thing to have my son and his friends look forward to something other than video games and the computer. You have to love anything that brings back personal interaction between kids and adults.

This game is really fun and it is very easy to learn. A first time player can pick the game up and be competitive and an 2nd time player can win. This game is a good length ~90min per game and all players can continue to play and have fun without being eliminated early or knowing their going to loose early on in the game.
summary: Extremely Fun and Easy to Learn

reviewText: We play Games and this one is a favorite. Two can play but the fun factor raises as more people compete for roads. Highly recommended!

Despite being aware of this game's popularity, I would not have expected a game about train routes to be very entertaining. However, I was very pleasantly surprised. This game was easy to learn how to play and highly enjoyable, even for only two people. My boyfriend and I like to find games we can play together that don't require more than just the two us to play (or to be fun), and this game has quickly become one of our favorites. I would recommend this to adults and kids alike because it is easy and family-friendly, but it's also not so childish that adults couldn't enjoy it on their own.

Ticket to Ride is an easy game to learn but does require strategy to work through it. On average, it takes about an hour. We play this game every Sunday evening as part of family night. We plan to purchase other games in this series.

OK so I'm not into strategy games ( because I am horrible at those games) and I think their really boring.  And I was on the fence about this game but I was at a meet up and a group was playing it and their bragging how it's the best game....So I came home and researched it and had tons of great reviews.  So I decided to but it without ever playing it. Although I can't say it's the best game ever only because I am a into party games, but this is by far the best strategy game I have ever played. I am trying to get my fiance to play games ( not a gamer) and he loves it too. It is so easy to learn!!! The instructions are so overwhelming,  so what I do is go online and watch other people explain the rules and play,  because seriously instructions are hard to understand.  Definitely worth it and would absolutely recommend Ticket to Ride

My husband and I are in our 30s and we love this game and have introduced it to so many friends who have gone out and bought this game.  It's for people who like strategy.  It's easy to learn and entertaining.  Each game takes about an hour.
Great game.  Arrived in new condition and very timely delivery.  Highly recommend this game to others.  Takes several games to learn your strategy, but worth the effort.

If you haven't played Ticket to Ride, you  are missing out on a great inter-generational game. Fun, strategy and of course Lady Luck make for a fun but yet not too long game for all. It is the new Monopoly
summary: The perfect family game for all!

reviewText: With in two days had the family loving it! Easy to learn and good for young and not so young alike.

Not the best nor not the worst. From other reviews I was expecting more strategy but all it is, is basically picking up cards and laying trains on the board. Would not tell people go out and buy this. Definitely would not have spent that much money on it had I known that's all it was. Other reviews were misleading. My 4 years old grandson does enjoy playing with the trains laying them on the tracks. So I guess it was ok as it entertains him for a little while.

I purchased this game for my daughters for Christmas due to the high reviews.  We had never heard of it and we are pleased that the entire family loves to play.  It's a great "thinking" game and even teaches a little geography in the process!
We love the ticket to ride franchise!! Everyone we introduce the game to (even those who are self proclaimed not board game fans) love playing it. It's easy to pick up with tons of replay value.
It's a fun, easy to learn game that is different every time you play.  After you play it enough, you begin to learn which routes are on the cards, and then it's time to buy the expansion.
So much fun and 0 regret about this purchase.  It's super easy to learn and play but great depth in strategy.

Ticket to Ride: 2-5 Players, Ages 8+, Average Play Time = 45-60 MinutesThe average game plays out the same way ninety-nine percent of the time...draw train cards...draw train cards...make a connection and score points...draw train cards...draw train cards...make a connection and score points...draw train cards...draw train cards...draw train cards...etc. Players will sometimes draw ticket cards if they feel that they can make the new random connections the cards task them with before the game is over, but doing this is optional.Ticket to Ride is a great game for kids and adults alike, despite its repetitiveness. The gameplay is fairly simple and turns go smoothly...that is...all you're doing is either drawing to match like colors or placing like colors on the board to make connections. You aren't managing stocks or trying to figure out if the D-20 you rolled entitles you to a critical hit because someone else played an interrupt card. For this reason, everyone in the house (with the exception of the person who hates board games) enjoys playing this game. The thirteen year old says that this is her favorite game to play, because it is "fun." The ten-year old enjoys the whole "train theme" and making connections.As for me, I enjoy it because of the strategy element.  If I see one of the kids trying to make an obvious connection between two distant cities, for example, I may decide to make my own connections to block them. Players can't make connections over someone else's, meaning they have to make detours if they really wished to continue to make their original connection. Some city routes have dual connections to combat this. I enjoy the strategy of placing connections based on what my ticket cards require me to do without making it too obvious. Rather than form a long chain of trains, I'll place a connection here and a connection there so that my route isn't obvious until it is almost complete. By then, it's usually too late for anyone to block me.I highly recommend you give this a try, especially if you are looking for something new to play on family game night.
summary: Ticket to Ride Review by Dad's Gaming Addiction

reviewText: Ticket to Ride has all the hallmarks of a classic family game.  It's easy to learn, easy to play, and doesn't take a really long time.  But it also offers a myriad of strategy possibilities, so it has great "replayability."  I think this would be good for most kids as well, teaching them some math and geography skills.  (Just keep in mind the train pieces are small and not appropriate for very young children.)One other thing I appreciate about the game is that you can play with just 2 people.  But be warned - it plays very differently when you add more players to the mix!If you want a simple strategy game that's beautifully designed, this is for you.  I liked it so much, I bought it as a gift for my brother.
Awesome family game, strategy for all ages, geogrpahy for the young (and not so young ones)  Defined playing time.  Overall we love it!

Began playing this at a friends potlucks as an alternative to Catan and got hooked (despite losing most rounds). I bought this copy hoping my parents would enjoy it, and thankfully they were hooked the first night.
summary: Already loved it, and still do

reviewText: Excellent fun game that is easy to learn.  Everyone loves the game from the first time they play.  It is just as much fun with just 2 players.  You can make it a cut-throat game with 5 players.  Hope you enjoy it as much as we do!

My family and I love this game.  It is simple, competitive and only takes about an hour to play.  I do recommend the expansion pack for it adds a more diverse and unpredictable game.  this is a must have for any family that loves to play board games with teenagers.

I love strategy board games, but the worst part about them is not only finding other people willing to commit all that time to play them, but having to explain the rules of the game to the people who never played before. In a party, that is nearly impossible because nobody pays attention.Ticket to Ride is the perfect laid-back strategy board game. The concept is incredibly simple to understand, and even with 5 people playing, the game is over in less than an hour. The first time I played, only one person had ever played it before, but everyone caught on immediately.I highly recommend the iPhone app as well :)
summary: Great strategy game for people who don't have patience for strategy games

reviewText: Everyone that I have played with either wanted to buy it or wanted to play it again. real good game

Ticket to Ride is one of those games that is easy enough for a first-grader to understand how to play, and yet still fun, competitive, and completely re-playable for kids of all ages (I have a blast playing with my mid-twenties friends).  For people who have never played before, an explanation of the instructions can be given in under 3 minutes and the addicting game can get right on its way.  Stealing routes that are vital to your opponents mission makes for a lot of frustration, but encourages flexibility in planning out your full gameplan.  This is one of those games that everyone in my group has a good time playing, and it can be a nice quick play.
summary: Jump on Board this Entertaining Family-Friendly Game

reviewText: Got for son for x-mas, just turned 7.  He has always been thrilled with trains, and loves board games.  Opened up on X-mas, was so surprised when he seen all the contents, and mapping.  3 days after the shock of the Wii wore off we started playing during his winter break.  Now play at least once a week.  He is getting better with the strategy of the game and point scoring.  Can play in a short period of time, moves along fast once you learn how to play.  It is a little more expensive then average board game, feel that is well worth it.

I got this game because my girlfriend and I were looking for some more fun games to play together, and we both love it.To help give you context on where this review is coming from, I'll first describe the type of board gamers we are. If you don't want to read this, skip this paragraph. Until recently (~6 months ago), both of us had only been exposed to games like Monopoly, Uno, Yahtzee, Risk, etc...the typical Milton Bradley/Hasbro "family game night" run-of-the-mill games. We had a mutual like of Risk, but the other games were sort of "meh" to us. However, when we recently "cut the cord" and canceled our cable subscription due to a crappy cable provider, I did some research on other ways to spend better, higher-quality time together, and stumbled across a couple of Euro-style games (Pandemic and Forbidden Island) that we acquired. We were both hooked. Since then, we have added a handful of other games to the collection that we play semi-regularly.Ticket to Ride is currently our main game/addiction. The game mechanics are simple enough that you don't have to heavily to play, but there's enough strategy involved to keep things interesting. You can play either laid-back or cutthroat, conservatively or aggressively, etc. The number of pieces given to each player is just the right amount, too - you might find that sabotaging your opponent would cost you an opportunity to finish a destination ticket of your own, or that you don't have enough pieces to claim all of the destination tickets that you draw.This game takes approximately 30 minutes to play (great if you've got a busy schedule and can only spare 30-45 minutes), but it's addictive enough that we sometimes spend several hours playing it. The replay value is high, as is the "curse you, I want a rematch!" factor. This is a game that should be in everyone's game collection.
Great game play and makes a great family game. This game is super fun. Not hard to learn to play.

I have given this as a gift to a couple families.  It is easy to get started. fun to play, and teaches a bit of geography at the same time.  I enjoy the expansion that go with it too.  Totally recommend this one!
I had played it before - it's challenging yet easy to learn. A good combination of luck and strategy. I 've played with ages ranging from 10 to 83.

This is an addictive game which is fun for all ages and the whole family. It has been impossible to play just one game, even if it is just the two of us!This game requires  strategy, creativity, and luck.We will definitely be buying more maps!!
summary: Hours of fun for all ages

reviewText: This is a very fun board game, probably worth the 5 stars.  I give it that for my wife not so much myself only because I have yet to win a game.I would highly recommend it for 2-4 players.
summary: I like it... my wife loves it... she always wins

reviewText: After noting that Ticket to Ride continues to be one of the highest-rated board games at numerous board gamer sites, we bought a copy.The board gamers are right. This German-made game beats familiar games like Monopoly and Risk hands-down.OBJECTEach player must complete a series of rail lines spanning cities based upon destination cards drawn at the beginning (and throughout) the game. Each destination carries points related to the length of the line, so a New York to Los Angeles line would score more points than Chicago to Boston. Incomplete destinations count against players at the end of the game, so completing them, even through circuitous routes is a must. The exciting part of the game comes from not knowing who is completing his or her lines, plus the ability to overlap lines, stymieing other players.Game play takes between 30 and 90 minutes depending on the number of players and the speed at which they make decisions.GAME PIECESHigh quality throughout, the game includes:- A fold-out board of the United States and southern Canada, plus a scoring track around the edge. The cities on the board connect through colored track lines, each line between one and six units in length.- A set of destination cards showing lines that must be completed.- Five sets of forty-five train pieces. Each player takes one same-color set of trains.- A set of colored train cards that correspond to the colored lines that connect cities.- Scoring markers that correspond to a player's train color.PLAYEach player is dealt three destination cards in the beginning and must keep at least two. These form the basis for their lines. They also receive four train cards. To claim a line, players must create sets of the same color and number of train cards as the line connecting two cities. (The color of the lines has nothing to do with the player's train color, but the cards they have in hand.)Each player, in turn, can perform one of three actions:1. Draw two train cards per turn from either the set of five placed up for all players to see, or blind from the train card deck. (One card if one of the showing wild cards is chosen.)2. Play a set of matching train card colors to claim a line between two cities.3. Get dealt a new set of three destination cards, keeping at least one.Players score points when they claim a line of track connecting two cities, the length of the track yielding proportionately higher scores. Scoring markers are moved around the 100-point scoring guide on the board perimeter.When one player has laid all his or her train pieces, the other players get one last turn. Players then reveal their destination cards and add (or subtract, for incomplete lines) to their total. The longest continuous length of claimed track scores additional points, too. Highest point total wins.REVIEWPros:A gorgeous, well-made game that's easy on the eyes, Ticket to Ride combines simple rules and nail-biting game play with a significant level of strategy. You can't ask for more in a board game.All ages will love this game. Even children as young as six can play since the rules are simple.Will please folks sick of the usual board games everyone has.Game play is short enough to allow multiple sessions of play.The manufacturer has other games in the Ticket to Ride series that work off the same basic gaming system, though with differing degrees of skill (through additional rules and trickier city layouts). Expansion kits exist, too, so players familiar with the game can get an additional kick out of their existing set. Lastly, an online, multi-player, interactive version of the game can be played through the manufacturer's Web site.Cons:The manufacturer lists a game session as lasting 30-60 minutes. We've found it closer to 45-90 minutes.Ticket to Ride has been around since 2004 and is beginning to show some age when compared against newer European-style board games. In addition, other games in the Ticket to Ride series eclipse the base game (though some expansions require the base game for play). For a game that plays similarly to Ticket to Ride but adds more depth of play, consider Ticket to Ride designer Alan Moon's Airlines Europe.OVERALLAs someone who loves games, I found Ticket to Ride to be a great introduction to European-style board games. Nothing disappoints. Everyone who plays the game wants to know where to get a copy. Ticket to Ride has won numerous Game of the Year honors around the world, and it's easy to see why. Absolutely worthy of its stars.UPDATE: For enhanced play, consider the 1910 expansion. It includes larger, easier-to-read cards, additional destinations, and more winning conditions. It makes a four-star game into five!
summary: Outstanding strategy game that's easy to learn, tough to master

reviewText: My daughters (ages 8, 8, and 7) beg me every weekend to play this game. It is the right level for them: complex enough to be challenging, but not hard enough to discourage. And I am glad they are learning some American and Canadian geography along the way!

Who knew building train tracks would be fun?  In this game you have to build tracks around the US and secure the routes that you draw on your cards.  Its really fun to try to build your routes, and once you get 4 players involved the competition factor really ramps up because you will all be going for those middle spots.  Not much coop factor here unfortunately, but still makes a fun family game with no too much fighting or rule book checking.

I bought Ticket to Ride after seeing it on Tabletop. I thought it looked like fun to play with my family (all adults now)and it is! We all have an interest in trains and traveling the country but haven't purchased a new board game in years. Ticket to Ride was a great fit for us. It's partially about what cards you draw, but there's definitely a strategic aspect to the game. The nice thing is that it's not too complicated, so everyone can have a good time. This is a really fun game!
A really fun board game with tons of replay value, best board game since Settlers of Catan .....iPhone app is great too!

It only took us two games to get a handle on how this game is played and how the rules apply.  It was fun learning.  In the second game we used all the rules as outlined, I do not take games very serious any more, but still enjoy the setup, play and final results.We had not played with a group of people in quite awhile and brought back memories of when we did.  We intend to do more of this in the future.  Thank you for bringing this game to our attention.
summary: A fun and somewhat challenging game.

reviewText: It just might be. at least top 5 in my book. I would recommend this game to anyone, I bought this copy for my sister.
This is by far one of the most fun games I have ever played! It is competitive, enjoyable and easy to learn. Great game!

My sister got me hooked on this game, if you're a fan of settlers of catan you'll probably enjoy this game. some similarities and many differences but definitely a great game. and it's just as good with 2 people as any other amount.unlicke some games that need 3 or 4 to really be worth playing.Played this 4 times the day i got it.ONLY complaint is that the cards are kinda small and harder to shuffle. but getting the expansion fixes that problem completely, so problem solved.
I vote that this board game is the best.  It only takes about 1 hour or 2 to play.  You can hardly wait to play it again.
Great game.

I received "Ticket to Ride" as a gift for Christmas. When we broke out the game and played, all the players with varying level experience and preference. a direct turn type of player (chess/monopoly), games with simple rules with endless configuration type of player (fluxx, dominion), someone who likes games that are different every time they are played (dominion, san juan). this game was easy for all of us to pick up and play. After playing for a turn or two we were all able to play it well. The only complaint I have is that the small cards make it a little hard to shuffle.
This game is a lot of fun. Pretty good replay value, requires some strategic thinking. Works for as few as 2 players, unlike some other similar games, which is a bonus.

I purchased this game for my family after enjoying Settlers of Catan and reading some reviews.  I think it is even better than Settlers, because the game play is much simpler, and thus quicker.  Settlers always takes forever because of the trading aspect, but this game is faster paced without dropping the strategy.

Great game to play, even with friends or family who are unfamiliar with the premise. Like many other burgeoning board games, the mechanics behind this game are more obscure than your average Milton Bradley or Parker Brothers staple. This keeps the game fun, fresh, and (at times) frustrating--not because of its difficulty, but because PEOPLE KEEP BUILDING OVER MY ROUTES. Seriously, fights may break out over this game. Just keep the fighting constrained to gameplay.
This is a really fun game - the Europe version is slightly funner but both are great to play. I bought this as a gift but have played it with them.
Ticket to ride is a game my son wanted for Christmas. He has alot of fun with it and at a fair price!
Easy & fun game for awhile. But does get repetitive and boring. Catan or Roborally better choice for the money.
summary: Fun for awhile, replay value dwindles fast

reviewText: This was a gift for 13 year old son from relative and we loved paying so much (mom,dad, son and 9yr old daughter). We gave another copy to nephew who loved it as much.  Game was enjoyable
Ticket to Ride is a great game for two or five players. We laugh a lot and it dosen't take all day to play.

I've been buying several board games to get the family (parents and 2 kids, 10 years, 8 years) spend more valuable time together. Amongst several board games we found this a great game.Highly recommended.

Game arrived on the day promised and we immediately took it with us on vacation (just the contents, not the box).  We played it for the first time with our kids (20-26 yrs) and their friends and everyone really enjoyed it.  They even asked to play it in the evening when they were too tired to go "out on the town".  That impressed me.  We're slowly learning the strategic elements of the game, and I am definitely sharpening my US geography (this is a huge plus for me).
summary: Ticket to Ride Board Game - Family loves it.

reviewText: This is a great game of strategy mixed with geography.  Our family loves to play this game.  Wonderful family fun.

We love this game.  It is fun for the whole family to play.  The nice thing about it is that you can play a game in about 20-30 minutes unlike Monopoly that drags on forever.My 8 year-old son enjoys the game but my 11 year-old son really accels at it by developing strategies to win.  There is enough luck involved to keep it interesting and no game is ever alike.The game quality is excellent with colorful game cards, well-designed game board and a sturdy box.
summary: Ticket to Ride is a Great Family Game

reviewText: Fantastic game with an element of strategy and a great deal of fun!  Time and time again, it is the game we reach for first.  Always a good time.

I can't say enough good things about this game.  The rules are simple & quality of the game pieces is very high.Despite its recommendation of 8 yrs+, my 6-yr (train buff) son loves it.  If you are trying to decide:  The child needs limited reading skills, i.e., to read a city name on a card and associate with the name on the map (you can help them and the game still can be fun).This is the first adult-type game I can play with my son.  The 1st few games we played with open cards and I had to help him, but he soon learned enough to make his own decisions.  Game play is fast and we often play 2 games in a row.Although simple to play, there is much strategy to the game. My son & I continue to hone our skills (this keeps the game interesting, even for me).  The game actually has an element of excitement when your near the end and wonder whether you'll be able to complete all your routes.  We sometimes play day after day w/o getting bored.As a parent, another nice thing about the game is you can unobtrusively let your child win without them knowing you did so (it's not like most kid's games that are purely based on chance and are therefore are "hard to lose.")The main educational element is that game play requires thinking about the future and visualizing how to route your trains (how many games that a 6 yr old can play require such thinking?).  It also teaches basic US/Southern Canada geography. The only downside is that game requires much card shuffling.  Despite that the cards are laminated, we play so much we may wear them out.

If you are looking for a fun and rather quick game to play with one  or more people, this is it!  It is fast to learn, fun to play, and has strategic elements that make it more complex.  I recently learned how to play this game on a camping trip to Vermont after having heard about it for a while from family.  It was quick and easy to learn, but also slightly complex in some of the more advanced strategies you can employ to score more.I have been playing it for a while most nights with one other person, and most games take between 30-40 mins to complete.This is a great game, the board and pieces are of very high quality, and it's something you can play over and over and enjoy.

We have been looking at this for a long time but just never bought.  We finally did.  The game play is quick which keeps things moving and interesting and there are enough options to need some strategy.  My six year old even understands the game play and works through his own strategy to win the game.  We also have a family of five, so thankfully this works perfectly for us.
Bought this game for Christmas.  We had a great time playing with older and younger adults right along with elementary and middle school kids many times throughout the holiday week.
The game is kinda easy but yet interesting. Good time spent with the family - we played it several times in 2 weeks and it has not annoyed us yet.
great game; fast, always different...just enough thinking that better players usually win; USA game is the best, Nordic 2nd, Europe disappointing

My wife & I love playing this game. We had been playing on a nightly basis (a handful of game) and it was something we really looked forward to playing. Things have gotten busy lately but once they settle down, we will be back to playing this on a regular basis.We also picked up the expansion as well which we also liked.
summary: Great Game - Easy to Pick Up & Play

reviewText: I'm not a fan of board games, but I love playing this! It's a simple, but yet fun game. Good for everyone.
We love this game!  Unlike other "fancy" board games, this one is not hard to figure out.  The European version is great, too.

I've always enjoyed board games (played a lot as a kid).  It's been a long time since I've sit down and thoroughly enjoyed a brand new board game.I first sat down and played this game with my 12 year old nephew.  We were both able to pick up the game pretty quickly.  The game is very simple in concept with lots of opportunity for deeper strategies.I later played this game with my 60+ year old mother.  She picked up the game pretty quick and by the second or third game we were both thinking of strategies to winning that don't come out when first learning.  (Be careful to pay attention to how many trains you have left before making a master plan!).I've not played with more than 2 people yet, but looking forward to trying it out.Quality board game.
summary: Board Game fun for wide age range

reviewText: The game was fun for the whole family.  I have a 7yr old boy and a 9 yr old boy.

We purchased this for a Thanksgiving family gathering.Our 10 year old could play and stay focused.Our 8 year old played as a partner with an adult.We are curious to see the Europe one.Our extended family that really gets into board games and strategy and competition enjoyed this one quite a bit.
summary: board game family enjoyed this one

reviewText: Purchased this product for 9-year-old who enjoys board and card games (Gamewright, Monopoly, etc.). Similar to Gamewright card games, this takes 1 or 2 games to learn all of the rules and start understanding the strategy. The game is a good combination of relatively simple rules and opportunities for strategy. I can tell that my daughter is picking up on the strategy and starting to think through game options. Game also provides a bit of geography (who knew that so many cities are difficult to pronounce?). Games take about 30 minutes.
summary: Good mix of strategy and fun for 9-year-old

reviewText: This game, along with Settlers of Catan and Carcassonne, is one that I always use as a 'Gateway Game' to get friends and family who are not serious board gamers hooked on games.Ticket to Ride is easy to teach and learn, fun to play over and over again, and doesn't take too long to get through (most games lasting under an hour).  The game doesn't suffer from a lot of random chance (e.g. no dice rolling) and relies on player planning and skill to win.  There is the option to go after other players and have a pretty cut-throat game, but that is not necessary to gameplay if it is not your style.If you are already a big fan of board gaming but you haven't played any of the Ticket to Ride games, skip this one and go straight for Ticket to Ride Europe.  It has a few additional more complicated elements such as ferries and tunnels, and a more complex and congested map board.
summary: Great Introduction to Good Board Games

reviewText: We love this game and had played it so much, we wore it out and needed a new one.  Great family game, lots of fun, and as a bonus feature kids will learn a little geography.
summary: This game is even more fun with the 1910 Expansion.

reviewText: Played this first in Germany last summer while visiting our former exchange students. Interesting way to explore and discuss world travel and history (if so inclined). Clever game dynamics!

I have six boys, ages 4 to 19.  We got this for Christmas and everyone was hesitant to learn a new game with the electronics and T.V. calling them, but I pressed the issue last night for New Year's Eve.  We watched a couple YouTube videos to learn how to play it.  It does take a little bit of work to absorb the rules at first, but once you get them, they stick, and the game is easy to execute.  We had a blast!  Even the four year-old, who teamed up with Daddy was able to keep his attention on the game for the entire time.  When you first read the rules and approach the game, you might think to yourself, "How is this going to keep me entertained through the whole game?  I'm going to get bored."  Not so.  While everyone else is taking their turns, you are so busy planning your next move that you never have time to be bored.  I find myself getting excited, wanting my next turn to hurry up and get to me, and having trouble even staying in my seat sometimes.  It is an excellent family game.  Great for bonding and for doing something together besides watching a T.V. show or staring at the I-Phone.  My kids asked me if I wanted to play again tonight, and I'll bet they'll want to play again tomorrow night.  No wonder there are currently 483 five star reviews!
summary: A Great Family Game, Especially for Teenagers

reviewText: Purchased this game to take to teens in Mexico - they love it and I love playing it with them.  Excellent game.

My daughter and son-in-law wanted us to play a game with them, and I dragged my feet to the table because I don't like board games--I usually lose. But I love this game!  There's enough finesse to keep the game interesting, and a little luck too.  You have to decide when to collect the colored playing cards, when to lay down train cars, and when to pick up more routes. Now we've gotten my brother- and sister-in-law hooked on it.  We love, love, love this game!

My family loves it. I love it. Great bits. Nice big board. Easy to teach. Good balance of luck and strategy. My only real complaint is that once a route is built over, it leaves players blocked out. But I guess that's where the strategy comes in.
I haven't opened this game yet, but I played at a friends house and just had to have one.  I know I will get many hours of enjoyment from it. May give it to my family as a gift.
Love this game... My husband loves board games and I'm not always as enthusiastic but this is one I find I can enjoy with him.
summary: Enjoyable game, even if you aren't a board game enthusiast

reviewText: Nice quality, great game for the kids to play with us as a family -- they love it!  I highly recommend.

Our friends introduced us to this game and it is a very easy-to-learn and fun-to-play game that makes you think and strategize.  Very enjoyable.  I would rate this one of the best games to play since monopoly.  My suggestion to improve would be to make a bigger version where up to 8 people can play at a time. (current verison only allows for up to 5 max).
summary: Great game!!!  Top 5 in the world.

reviewText: This game was fun but hasn't been played much in he year that we've had it.  Not sure why.  Educational.

As the title says, this is easy to pick up and so it is a great way for gamesfolk to infect friends and family. It is educational in the sense that it teaches strategy, forethought, planning. Great game!!

A wonderfully elegant game that make play accessible to all players. Family members of all ages and gamers of all skill levels will find something delightful about this game.For more check out my video review:[...]
summary: Modern classic with much to offer

reviewText: Not too complicated for less experienced board game players. Excellent value and a relate-able theme that will get friends and family to play even if they have never played a board game before.

Our family loves to play games together (monopoly, Risk, Rumikub, Dominoes, Sequence, Apples to Apples) and this game has moved up to be one of our faves. It is easy to play and after a bit, you develop various strategies. Can play with 2-5 people. If you like games, get this one!
summary: One our most favorite board games!

reviewText: My family (3 boys ages 7,9 & 13) loves to play this game.  It has a lot going for it, strategy, luck and even some geographical learning.  Game play keeps all players attentive and thinking and it isn't too short or too long of a game... Although when we are finished, the kids always ask, "can we play another!"I have recommended this game to many other family and friends as well and they have all been just as happy with their purchase.  Highly recommended.

For years, the reviews have said this is one of the best games of all times. My entire family is in complete agreement. It's fast-paced, challenging, and loads of fun. We play it all the time. One of my favorite gifts of all time.

This is a wonderfully designed game.  Not only are all the components top notch (as are all Days of Wonder games) but the game mechanics are amazing as well.This game has a rare combination of easy to learn rules and good depth of strategy.  I have yet to have anyone who has played this game not enjoy it.  It doesn't take long for them to become totally engrossed.  There's educational value as well (geography).This game is great for four to five players.  For three players it's good but not quite as good.For two to three players there is an expansion game for Switzerland.  This game is great for two to three players.
summary: Easy to Understand, Great Depth in Strategy

reviewText: we've had a lot of fun playing this game. and we're learning the location of a few more cities also. my sister in law said "i'm hooked! i love this game!"

We liked the game Ticket to Ride because of the strategies involved in being the winner. If all players pay attention, the game can move very quickly; which we think is a big plus. It is not quite a classic as Monopoly, but very good indeed.

This is a great game that works equally well as a strategy game and a casual / social game night addition.  The premise is simple, fulfill your route cards by connecting trains from once destination city to the next.  The strategy all boils down to when do you start laying tracks and potentially reveal your goal, vs. how long do you hold back and keep accumulating cards to amass your avalanche of trains.  This game is very easy to learn to play for veteran gamers and novices alike.If you are still on the edge, check out the newly updated and released version by days of Wonder for your Ipad.  With the new retina display the publisher has used the same collateral used for their print runs on the electronic version, creating a very high fidelity experience to the actual board game.  I definitely recommend giving this one a try!

Ticket to ride is simple and fun. It is not too long and keeps people involved. This game involves making one of three simple decisions each turn. This makes the turns go very fast and keeps everyone involved. This game is fun for young kids, older folks, gamers, and non-gamers. I have played this with a group of board game folks and my inlaws. Each group also asked to play this game regularly.The only reason this game get a 4 is because I feel the 1910 expansion is a must to play. It include normal sized card, instead of tiny cards, and it adds train route options.This game lands itself as an instant classic.
summary: Simple and fun for all ages

reviewText: I first played the game with adults and we had a blast! It taught us how to get from different towns and cities in a very fun way. We, then, played it with a 4, 6 and 9 year old and they didn't lose interest because of all the colorful trains. The 4 and 6 year old had to have help to do the traveling and connecting, but the 9 year old did most of it herself. She loves games! It is a great adult game and fun to teach children through its trains and traveling.
summary: A game that can teach a 4, 6 and 9 year old in different ways!

reviewText: We purchased this game for our family of 3 generations to play together.  It is a lot of fun and makes our winter evenings together memorable.

My boys received this game for Easter and we have played it at least a dozen times the first week.  It's easy to play, goes fairly quickly and involves strategy that a 10 year old can really get into.
This was a present for my grandson and he loves it.  We had a great time over Christmas vacation playing it.

Bought this game for my 17 year-old son's birthday. He loves to play it with family and friends. It's quick and easy to learn, and doesn't take too long. Average time per game is about 45 minutes.  I'm not big into games, but I love playing this game with my kids.
So much fun!!!  ...and never the same.

I chose this game because I was tired of hearing grandchildren play Monopoly.  After playing several times, they became bored with it.  It was an expensive fail for me, but probably it's a good game for kids who love games.

Fun game for the family (10 and up?).  Mostly a good mix of randomness and strategy. At first it seemed too random for my competitive nature, but once we really understood the game, more strategies became apparent. I'd guess ages 10 and up would enjoy, perhaps some younger kids too. I don't think I'd enjoy playing with younger kids though because it's a long game (at least an hour) and I play to win. My son is 13 and can handle that (and beat me).

Very happy with Ticket to Ride USA. What a neat way to get a geography lesson. No two games are the same and no strategy works every time. We have introduced the game to many friends and they usually go out and get it for themselves. We will probably get the 1910 expansion which has the larger cards. The small cards that come with the game are not as easy to handle and seem to be less durable. The rules allow for a 2-3 player game which is just as much fun as with 4-5 players.

Our family is really into Settlers of Catan.  We heard this was similar.  We like it a lot.  It is very quick to set up and plays fast, so it is a good game to play instead of Settlers if you just do not want to or do not have time to go through all the setup that Setters requires.If you like Settlers, you should like this.

This is a fantastic game for family game night.  It's easy to play and learn and accessible to gamers and non-gamers.  It's a great way to introduce people to "real" board games.  If you like this I highly recommend trying out some of the other "euro-games".  Check out [...].  It's a great community and a good way to discover and become addicted to a new world of gaming.  I never new so many great games existed.  BGG blew my mind and now I'm totally hooked.  But beware, if you go down this road, be prepared to say goodbye to Monopoly, Life...etc forever.
love this game. we have made our friends learn to play it and have even bought on ipad for traveling.
This is a great example of a game that has simple enough rules that anyone could play. However, if you're playing with people who are really good at it, the strategy becomes really complex!
I purchased this for my adult daughter who loves playing it with her friends.  She says it is both challenging and a lot of fun

We play games with friends at least once a month, and this game is always on the menu (along with many others in our marathon sessions!). We even play a speed version of this at work sometimes during our one-hour lunch break! Love the game and recommend it to anyone who wants to play a fun board game.

My adult children and their children are always wanting me to play board games when we get together. I am usually not very interested. However, I find this simple game a lot of fun. I enjoy building railroads and completing routes even though I haven't yet figured out the scoring. But I really don't care about the scoring. I just enjoy playing the game.
Great strategy game. Relatively fast for it's genre.  And simple enough, with a quick learning curve.Awesome.
My husband loves this game and ensures everyone else will love it.  We got this for my brother's family and may buy it for my sister's too.

Our family has played the different versions of this game for the last few years whenever we get together. With different strategies that work it really makes you think. There is even an on-line app to practice up before the big game.

Great game! Train enthusiasts will enjoy this one as we have over the past few days. Had a fun time playing it- our 13 yr old niece really took to it, surprising even her! It was nice to have her 'unplugged' for awhile. She was the one who wanted to play over & over again!

At first I was slightly skeptical, this being a resource management game.  BUT, seeing my 7 year old nearly beat my 16 year old (we coached the 7 year old slightly to get the hang of it), AND then having both of them want to play it again... what a family game.  Easy to play, fun for all ages.  This game would be perfect for teachers also.  I won't spoil it by telling you how to play, it's easy enough to learn.  But if you are waffling between this game for your family and anything else in the resource management field (with the exception of possibly Settlers of Catan), get Ticket to Ride!!!!!!!
This game is best played on an iPad or computer.  It is the best game I have played, and do not get tired of it
This is a really fun game, very easy to learn and it doesn't take all day to play.The whole famy  an enjoy it.
This game reminds me a little of Monopoly, but it is very different.  It also has some similarities to the game of "Risk".  We are just beginning to learn the key strategies, and it is a lot of fun.

Fun game for many ages. Our family can all play and we are ages 7 and up. Sometimes having the 7 year old play with us makes it challenging as she doesn't use a predictable strategy, but we are all able to play. It is an often requested game at our house.
summary: Family Fun for most all ages

reviewText: My family is huge into board games, especially strategy based games. My children and I got this game for my husband for his birthday and right away we became addicted to it.It is for 2 - 5 players, but the more players there are, the more challenging it becomes because everyone is competing for areas on the map.There are cards you get that require you to connect your trains to 2 cities. You have to keep at least one in the beginning of the game, but can draw more later on. These become important for getting a lot of points. However, not connecting your trains between those cities means you lose points.It is a highly strategic game and players can cut off other players from continuing on their path, and with several players, the board gets crowded, making it a challenge to connect your cities, which is a lot of fun!My family thoroughly enjoys this game. It is good for both families with children as well as adults.
Great for family game nights! Easy for our third grader to understand and dynamic enough to keep the most savvy adult gamer engaged. Highly recommend.
Awesome game; just like I've always heard. Will always buy from DoWPlan on obtaining 10th; and any expansion pack I can get my hands on!
My grandson went bonkers over this game and now wants to play it daily.  He plots routes, knows cities, and just adores it.  As a grandparent and educational hound, this rocks!
summary: He's learning geography so fast and he LOVES IT!

reviewText: This is a great game!  Ticket to Ride We have played it singly and as couples teams.  Also enjoy the European version.  Educational and fun!
Ticket to Ride is one of our favorite games!  It is easy to teach others and it is easy to have a conversation while playing it.
hours of great fun for all the family.  It develops strategy skills and geographic concepts while having special family time.

We bought this game on a whim, despite it being over $40 at that time. Since then we have bought 3 or 4 games as gifts. Family members that have been forced to play with us end up loving it so much they go on to buy their own games. The game can be played with a maximum of 5 players, however those lucky 5 are bound for a good time. The rules are easy to learn and the game will become a family favorite for years to come.
Purchased as a gift for my son in law for his birthday and he was thrilled to receive and play the game.
Great game and arrived quickly. That is all I have to say about this product. I still have 5 words.

We had played this with some friends who were moving away, so I got it for my husband for Christmas. He and my siblings and brother in law played it 3 times Christmas Day.  It was the first time my brother and sister played it, and they said they were addicted.  My sister even called later to find out where I'd found it.My complaint is that the cards are very small, but you make due.  It really is a fun game.  It takes about an hour to play the first time when you have 4 or 5 people, but you can get the game down to 40 minutes, maybe less, when you all know what's going on.  It goes pretty quickly if everyone understands it.
summary: a fun game for up to 5 players

reviewText: This is another one of those games that is a fairly simple concept and rule set, but provides a challenge every time and never seems to get old.  It is currently our family favorite.

Originally posted at [...], a new idea everyday!Game- Ticket to RideProducer-Days of WonderPrice- $35-45TL;DR- Theme doesn't stop this train! 92.5%Basics- Around America in seven days!  In Ticket to Ride, you play one of five different friends who are obsessed with  Phileas Fogg, the man who went around the world in 80 days.  Based on Fogg's story, the players make a one million dollar bet to see who can make it to the most cities in seven days.
