reviewText: Great game!  Stop playing computer/ electronic games alone and play this with your family instead, you wont be sorry.  It is great fun, not too long or complicated. You can make it more intense and longer depending on who your playing.  Great way to relieve stress, have fun and enjoy more time with family and friends.  Also great learning tool for kids (and even adults!), get it, very inexpensive way to have fun.
Not a game I constantly want to play, as it's fairly simple, but when we do play, it's enjoyable.  Very nice board, pieces, etc.
A very good Christmas present . Played at Christmas and new Year family gatherings. Received one as a gift and ordered another as a gift. Challenging to play.

We started looking for a game that would be fun for my wife, daughter(twelve) and I (just barely forty, so, we're exceedingly young). We wanted something different aside from the various iterations of Uno, Monopoly, Sorry or the other 'staples' of American gaming that fill the shelves at Walmart/Target. So, after doing some research I decided that we'd grab Ticket to Ride since it reviewed so well here on Amazon. I believe it was the twelfth most popular purchase in the board games category when I selected it.What drew me to this game? First of all the reviews, as I mention above. Some reviews go all the way into game play and others, like this one, just talk about what made it great for our family. The next thing was easily the look and feel of the game. It has a very rich appearance in terms of how the playing surface, playing materials all were made to look and how they felt in your hand. The playing surface is beautifully done and is made from nice, thick stock. The train pieces themselves are plastic and seem to be in the middle of the road in terms of quality. Not cheap, but not expensive to make by any stretch of the imagination. The playing cards, while somewhat small (see comment below), are beautifully drawn and have nice detail. The instructions were also easy to read and comprehend, providing examples and ideas about game play.Upon opening the box my only disappointment is with the size of the cards used for the game. I think they are too small and I'm constantly afraid I'm going to lose one. They feel needlessly small and I don't think it was anything more than a cost-cutting move to make them this size, they are about a third the size of the average playing card. But really, this is a trivial complaint.It took my family only one session to figure out the rules and play a successful round. The rules are simple and the ways to win are varied. You can go for volume and lay down as many tracks as you can or you can try to win by trying to complete all the destination cards you can. Either way, the game is fun and engaging. I'm glad we added this game to our collection as it's perfect for us to play and bring in the occasional couple of guests to the fun as well. I'll look into the expansions, but for now this game hits a sweet spot for us in terms of time to play, strategy involved to win and ease of play.
This is a great game, I've wanted it for years and finally purchased it. The strategy is deep and makes a wonderful addition into any boardgame collection.
Am very please with this purchase.  Game arrived in perfect condition, in a timely manner and is being thoroughly enjoyed by the family.  Exceeds all of my expectations.

This game is a lot of fun for 2-5 players.  We have lots of board games that are just not very fun for only 2 people to play, but this one is just as great with 2 people as with 5.  If you want a fun game, this is the one for you.
Fun game.  Has some strategic thinking, some luck of the draw.  Can be played by just two people or with a larger group.
I love Risk and Settlers of Catan. This game is a hybrid of these two, with a little Monopoly theme in it as well.  Very easy to learn, but there is deep strategy. Would definitely recommend.
An awesome game that the whole family can enjoy!  Extremely well made with a concept that is easy to learn but hard to master!!
This is a fun game and with the Untied States version, a great way to learn a little geography of the country.  It's good for different ages.

This is a fun, fast paced game that doesn't get boring. It's great for family evenings and very easy to learn. I've also played the europe edition which is slightly more complicated but a great buy as well.
This is a game that can be played quickly, yet still can require strategy. Nice for even people who don't play board games much.

Better game than most.  Not that hard to pick up on.  I usually play with the 1910 rules substitution that the person with the most tickets completed gets 15 points instead of the one with the longest track, because it feels more thematic.  I don't have 1910, so it's just a house rule to my base set.Really, the game isn't that difficult to grasp and the strategy runs pretty deep.  The longer you can wait before you do something the better off you are, but at the same time the longer you wait the more likely someone else is to do it before you.  Sometimes the game can feel a bit slow when everyone spends turn after turn drawing cards, but on the whole it seems to go pretty fast most of the time.It is a bit frustrating when you need one specific card and you keep drawing over and over and never get it, but otherwise it is pretty rewarding to see how the stuff you are doing is directly accomplishing your goals as you go along.  Overall, luck doesn't have that big of an impact on the game and that makes it a pretty good game for serious game players.Serious game players aren't going to really care what the theme is, but the less serious game players do care and particularly the younger ones and I think the train theme can appeal to a lot of those sorts of players, so I would say that TTR makes for a pretty good mixed company sort of game or for a family to all play together.The most important things you want from a game, though, are going to be 1) doesn't drag on forever, 2) people don't hate each other after the game, and 3) that people don't feel their fates are completely dependent on luck.  I think that TTR does a pretty good job of avoiding all of those pitfalls.
summary: Arrived quickly, no damage, great game

reviewText: I have played this game for years on the Xbox and on iPhone. I had to have the original boxed edition. Fun for the whole family, even grandma.

It is a fun game, the only reason for the review is the fact that the game was wet on arrival.  The outer box was without a blemish and not wet.  The game was wet WITHIN the shrink wrap.  How that is possible, I'm not sure.  The board is slightly warped, and the instructions are damaged-box warped.  Should have bough in a store.

We love to play games with my brother, sister-in-law, and friends. A cousin of mine had recommended that we try Ticket to Ride, as she had heard about all the awards and high reviews it has gotten. I must say that we are happy with our purchase. It isn't hard to learn and has a simple, but fun and strategic concept. You try to complete train routes by building lines from city to city, and get extra points for completing destination cards. The fun and strategy elements come from the fact that you don't know where anyone else is trying to get to, so you have to try to guess their moves while focusing on your own, and can even try to sabotage their routes from time to time. They also make a great ipad app for playing this on the go, which I would strongly recommend. This and Settlers of Catan have become our favorite board games, because both provide lots of fun without getting overly complicated.
summary: Fun and simple game for groups

reviewText: I love this game and would give it a 5 star rating, but this set comes with REALLY tiny cards.  I couldn't find this anywhere in the description.  I have played other versions of this game and never ran into these small cards.  It's not a deal breaker, but it's really annoying while playing.  Just know what you are getting.  I haven't measured, but the cards are something like 1.25 inches wide by 2.5 inches tall... something like this.
summary: Love the game, beware the cards.

reviewText: Probably one of the best board games i have bought in recent past.  Got a good strategy feel without the learning curve.  Your friends who don't like strategy games too much are happy to play because of the simplicity of the game.  Good buy!

I've had this game for a few years now, and I must say this is one of the best board games I've ever played. I've introduced several people to this game, including family members that don't like board games, and everyone has loved it. The game goes by quickly, with a full session taking about 45-60 minutes. Each player's turn goes by quickly as well, averaging about 10 seconds for two of the normal actions (drawing train cards or claiming a route), and maybe 1 minute for the other action (choosing new destination cards-- a somewhat uncommon event), so you don't end up in a situation when each player is taking forever to play.The game also tends to be fairly light hearted. No one knows where anyone else is going, so no one can specifically choose to try to block a specific person (likewise, that never seems to be an optimal move anyway). No one's feeling should get hurt by the time the game has finished.The overall quality of the peices of the game are also quite good. The board is very nice (but large), the train peices are a light plastic that holds up (but try not to step on them), and the cards are pretty durable. The box also holds all of the pieces quite neatly, so you don't need to fumble around the box trying to find whatever piece you now need.I would definately recommend this game to anyone interested in the least. You won't be disapointed.
summary: Great board game for kids and adults alike.

reviewText: Its more fun than a barrel of monkeys. Me and all of my friends break night regularly with this game. I can't wait to get the expansion pack! WOW!

As long as your old enough to enjoy the easy rules of this game, this is a blast for any age!  We love playing it on our iPad as well as playing the board game and it continues to be one of our number one picks for games to play often.
summary: Great game for lots of people!

reviewText: Fantastic game, shipped quickly and at the right price, I can sit and play ticket to ride for hours on end and would reccomend to anyone..
My ONLY negative comment is that it is for 5 people maximum.  I'm thinking of making another color (out of balsa wood) so we can play a 6th person.  That way 3 couples can play.
summary: Fun game for the whole family

reviewText: I bought this game after playing it with my family over Christmas. Since buying it a week ago me and my friends have played it over 15 times. This is a great game to play with the family and with friends.

This is a very fun game.  It takes 20 minutes to learn to play.  A game lasts between 30 and 60 minutes.You will draw and play train cards in order to build routes connecting cities on your route cards.  Each turn you decide if you want to draw more train cards, play your cards to connect two cities (before someone else takes the route, but be careful that you don't give them the opportunity to block you), or draw more route cards (gaining points if you complete the route, or losing points if you are unable to do so before the end of the game).I prefer playing with 4-5 players, as there is more direct competition, trying to work around the trains that others have placed.  2-3 players is fun as well, but with 2 players, it sometimes turns into a game where each player is playing on their own side of the board with little interaction.For 2-3 players, I prefer theTicket To Ride: Nordic Countriesand the Switzerland (now included withTicket To Ride India: Map Collection - Volume 2) expansion maps.
summary: Great board game for 4-5 players.  Good with 2-3.

reviewText: Love this game!  We've introduced so many people to it who have all loved it to.  We are big Settlers of Catan players and its a big trend with out friends to play Settlers.  And I feel Ticket to Ride is just as great and anyone who likes Settlers will like it.  I bet it will be the next big hit with our friends!
summary: If you like Settlers, You'll like Ticket to Ride

reviewText: I gave this game to my granddaughter and it turned out to be a great game for the whole family.  We all played it several times during our visit to their home over the Christmas holidays.  The game involves thinking and strategy.  It is fun for the young and old alike.  I highly recommend the game.  It is also good for learning about maps and geography.  I can see now that it would be interesting to buy different versions of the game prepared for different parts of the world, so we could learn about the geography in those parts of the world.
summary: This game is a lot of fun.

reviewText: This is probably the best game I have ever played. Everyone we introduce it to goes out and buys it. We play it with our kids who are in their 20's, and adults up to age 80. It never gets stale, every game is different.
My grandson is learning oodles from this game. His mother loves it also and hopes he will be travel smart soon.
Love this game! Keeps my family occupied on otherwise boring days! My father-in-law is reluctant to try new games, but once we got him to play one round, he's hooked on it!

I am very happy with Ticket to Ride. I play it with my friends (I'm 31) and with my children (the youngest is 5). My kids love it! We play differently than in the official rules and Daddy helps them decide what to do (and I don't always win). A lot of fun for everyone!

Got this game for the holidays. Lots of fun, easy to learn. Relies more on strategy and planning than on luck-of-the-draw. Very intense competition at times. I look forward to bringing this game to many get-togethers.
I bought this for my son for his 11th birthday, and our entire family loves this game!  Buy it, you'll love it!
I purchased this game after playing it with friends.  Now I'm addicted!  It's great fun for children up to grandparents.  It comes with 6 months of free online play as well!

We have been trying to have a weekly game night with a group of friends. We started off playing Clue (just randomly happened one night) after which I started looking for more games to play because it was quite a bit of fun.Ticket to Ride does NOT disappoint! This game is quite a bit of fun and you can spend hours on it. There is a bit of "non-skill" involved in playing the hand you are dealt, but the rest is pure brain power. Work to block other players routes, take risks, etc. A great game!
This was easier to explain than monopoly or the game of "Life".  I great family gather-round-the-table game!  I recommend it!  We had the U.S.A. map, but I understand there are several options.
summary: We played this at our family Christmas after my my wife and I gave it to our son-n-law.  Easier & Shorter than Monopoly,

reviewText: Without a doubt this was the right pick for the prestigious Spiele des Jahres at the 2004 Essen Game show.  Ticket to Ride has the great combination of strategy and luck that any good game design should.  I thoroughly enjoy this game, and it is real fun with 2, 3, 4 or 5 players.  The really neat thing about this game is how different it plays depending on the number of players playing.  I would heartily recommend this game to anyone at all who considers boardgames good fun and time well spent.
summary: Ticket to Ride - 2004 Spiel des Jahres

reviewText: This game will be a classic someday.  All of my friends and family that's played it so far absolutely loves this game.

Simple set up and quick to play keeps the game rounds coming with this board game. The learning curve is almost non-existent. For the lovers of pure strategy this won't do much to sate those needs however for those looking for a new game to try with friends and newcomers to this style of game-play this will do well as an introduction.
summary: Simple but just enough complexity to keep it interesting

reviewText: Ticket to Ride is an excellent game for the whole family. It teaches geography, color recognition, and math skills. We have the Europe edition as well. All members of our family age 5 to 80 enjoy getting together to play this game.It's worth every penny!!

I was worried about this game with my nephew who has ADHD and because of this has trouble sitting through long games. The turns are quick and there are ten different things to think about at once. He has a blast playing, with no trouble holding his attention. I couldn't recommend this more highly!
summary: A truly great game for ADHD kids

reviewText: This game is full of strategy, interaction, and unpredictability. The whole family loves it! But I've played the Europe version and it has more interesting twists including tunnels and bridges. Definitely go for that one over the American map version.
summary: Super fun but the American version is not as good as the European

reviewText: This game was recommended by my nephew and we have only had the opportunity to play it once so we're looking forward to playing it again with more players!

This game was introduced to me at a team dinner. At first I was quite skeptical not seeing how fun it could possibly be, but as I played this game I quickly became hooked. The nice thing about this game is that it's super easy to learn and teach. The board is beautifully designed and is just interesting to look at. I recommend this to gamers who enjoy strategy and a little competition. This has become one of my all time favorite games and I highly recommend it to anyone.

I ordered this game for my grand son 13 and for Christmas, so don't know how good the game is, but hopefully will know soon. I got a fast and prompt service and in good condition. I have heard lots of good things about this game, so can't wait to find out. I will leave a feedback later on that. Amazon is the only way to go and get your items fast. I ordered other things from another  company last few weeks and it took forever to get them and some not here, of course the storm Sandy did harm deliveries,,,but evidently Amazon made it just fine, especially if you have "Prime".

Very easy game for all ages.  There is some strategy involved but not over complicated.  It goes up to 5 players and it is more fun with 5 players.  My kids did get bored with this game, fairly quickly.  But I like it.
This gave is worth it if you like the US (or any other version) of Ticket to Ride.  It's worth the money.
We love this game, especially the fact that 5 people can play.  It involves a lot of strategy, but it's not too hard for an 8 or 9 year old.I've ordered the Ticket to Ride Europe also.

I bought this game on a recommendation from a friend and it is a great addition to any board game collection.  How can you beat a combination of Risk and becoming the next American railroad tycoon?  I highly recommend this game for any party or gathering.

Awesome game. I'm currently addicted to the online version of this game, but I've played the real thing as well. It's a great game for 2-5 people. Honestly, I think it's more fun if you have 3-5 players because there's more potential for your planned routes to be disrupted. When you play a computer, it's not really out to get you, I don't think... people, however, are often out to get you. You know your true friends when they relish the thought of purposefully foiling your perfect train route.I like that it's a relatively quick game with a definite end. Some games (like monopoly)  are great but there's the potential for it to run very, very long. When this game promises to be done in about an hour, it carries out that promise. Lots of replay value here because there are numerous routes. At the same time, it's an easy game to learn, so you can teach a new bunch of people how to play in just a few minutes.The slight downside is that it's only for 5 players. We've played with 6 before by doubling up, but it's not exactly conducive to huge gatherings.Have fun.
I highly recommend this game. It's so fun if you like strategy. I've purchased it for several families now and kids as young as 8 have enjoyed it.
My son has this game and recommended it.  After I played it a few times started looking for it in the stores and found it is better value on Amazon!!  It is a fun game!!
Love the game - it is easy to learn and fun to play.  It was just challenging enough.  Good for ages eight to eighty.

After becoming addicted to Carcassonne, I decided to try other games that had won the Spiel des Jahres [Game of the Year].  Ticket to Ride had such good reviews, I bought it next.  We have not been disappointed!  Ticket to Ride is incredibly easy to learn, but will still challenge you every time.  There is a huge variety in the strategies you can adopt to claim victory.  My wife and I have now played Ticket to Ride several times together.  We thoroughly enjoy the game, but I suspect it would be even more fun in groups of 4 or more players.  Unlike some of the other winners of the Spiel des Jahres, you could easily start children on Ticket to Ride fairly early (perhaps even as young as 6 or 7).  Ticket to Ride will become one of your family favorites, whether you are a casual tabletop player or a die-hard.  Highly recommend!
Ticket to Ride is an excellent game requiring strategy & flexibility.  Great way to learn European geography.  Best for adults & teenagers.
Love the game and this product lived up to what I remembered. Want to buy sleeves for the cards but the game played great.

This is my favorite board game; it was a Christmas present.  We can all play it, it doesn't take forever, and it is teaching my grandson that strategy is an important tool in winning.  We have played it nearly every day since Christmas.  We love it.

I just had to get this for my birthday!  I'm in my 20's but this game is appropriate for all ages.  All of my friends find this game addicting and fun.  The product itself came in great condition.  I would use this seller again.
This is what he really wanted.  He's enjoying playing this with his friends.  This was a great gift and one he really wanted.

My husband and I love games like Settlers of Catan. Anything that requires some strategy, some creativity, and a few extra friends :) This game is perfect for us! Easy enough that my teenage brothers can join us, but challenging enough that we've played with friends and have yet to get tired of it. Once you've played a game and got a good grasp on the rules, it is easy to understand, and the fun really lies in how the game changes every single time with route cards, new players, etc. I can't say we dislike anything - sometimes I wish there were more trains per person! Takes about an hour to play, best with at least 4 players, and surely a game to bring along to parties!

I ordered this game after playing it with my Sister-in-law and her kids. It has become my new favorite game. The more I play the more strategy I use. The directions are a little daunting when you first begin, but after a few games the game moves along a lot faster. After coaxing my son and his girlfriend into trying it with me one night, I was invited over to his girlfriend's house the next day to play it with her family. She said she "woke up and wanted to play it again".The game takes about 45 minutes to an hour (a little longer for new players) and is more fun--and more challenging--the more players you have.
the whole family loves to play this game.  It is part luck and part skill, but all fun.  Geography learned is a bonus.

We bought this game a little over a year ago. We have a weekly game night with friends every Saturday. We played a different game each week...until we found this game. THIS is pretty much the only game we play on game night now with the only other games being Ticket to Ride Europe or Asia. Yes, we bought all three. That's how much we LOVE and play this game. We've even got another couple we play with every other Friday and whenever we can get together. Last week, my husband and I played this on Friday, Saturday, and Sunday. With the couple we play with on Saturday (and sometimes an additional day during the week), we usually play 4-5 games each night. This game NEVER gets old and is different EVERY time.
summary: The ONLY game we now play each week at game night

reviewText: My husband and I enjoy board games and would definitely recommend this game.  It's can be very challenging and after you play it a few times you'll begin to develop a strategy.  Lots of fun!

Our family loves board games. This is a great NEW game. There are always the classics that you break out once and a while, but this one is just different enough to keep us playing.We have several ranges of ages in our family and they all love to play. It educates the young ones with some geography and counting. The strategy aspects of the game keep the rest of us interested.
Every one in my family (including myself, husband, brother, 2 brother in laws, 2 sister in laws, mother in law and father in law) is addicted to this game.  It is awesome.

This is one of our favorite games at the moment. We play it all the time now that we have it. They shipped it very well. No way was this game going anywhere in the box. And we got it earlier than the estimated delivery.
This was a great strategy game to play over the holidays with my family.  It worked well for all because it is fast paced and easy to learn!  Great for a first timer or seasoned gamer.
I love this game. it is easy to learn, easy to play and fun. It also is a game that allows conversation to still take place. It is fast moving. and altogether a blast.

This game is easy to learn and quickly fun, but we didn't stay into it very long and don't see us playing it long term.  I can see this forgotten within a year unfortunately.We enjoy a game where there is some amount of conversation after the game about the strategies used and reasons for some decisions.  We don't find ourselves doing that much.We like it for from 2 to 4 players, thinking 5 is too many. The game does change quite a bit with different numbers of players, which is nice (variety).We think it has the right mix of luck and skill.  It can initially seem too luck based (draw bad cards), but you realize there are strategies to deal with that.Quick to set up and put away, and well made.  Quick to play (less than an hour).I suspect people who find Settlers of Catan and Dominion fun but too involved might like this.The on-line version is great because it is so convenient.  It shows you the cities you need to connect which is really handy.  It is I think $10 per person for a life-time account.  When it's just my husband and I we prefer to sit with our laptops and play that way.ALSO - you can try it before you buy it that way.  You can make an account for free and play 5 games.
summary: Fun, but didn't hold our interest for long

reviewText: This is a great game that's easy to pick up and addictive once you learn. Great for all types of game players.
My 8 year old granddaughter got this for Christmas and she loves it  She said "good job grandma"  I received the game in good time and condition  Thanks!!
My kids  had kids 8 and 11 and everyone enjoys this game.  Good family time—parent don't get board and kids have fun.

Bought this for my son in law.  He already had the Nordic one. Really like this game as all four of us can play but, as others have said, will get the expansion soon as the cards are really small.  Otherwise, everything seems great and it has providedall of us ho urs of fun.

this is a really fun game no matter how many people you have to play.  the expansion is fun also if you like larger regular size cards instead of the mini cards.  they can be more difficult to read for older eyes.
summary: one of the best games ever!!!!!

reviewText: Finally, a boardgame that's fun to play more than once or twice!  My family has played this game about ten times in less than a month.  It's easy to play, once you understand the rules and different every time.
Very entetaining for whole family and friends. Kids 8 and 10 also enjoyed playing ( and did very well )
9 y.o boy loved playing the first time and as an added bonus teaches a little geography as you play.

We played the game with our daughter who had borrowed it.  It was an enjoyable game so we bought it for her as a thank you gift for her hospitality.We were able to get a good price and it was sent very quickly.

My hubby and I have played this game for many years now and love it. I gave it as a Christmas present to one of my friends and whenever we visit, we bust out this game. When first starting to play, it might seem a little confusing at first, but keep playing and you will learn very quickly. Depending on how many players there are, it can take anywhere from 20-50 minutes to play. I would definitely recommend this game to anyone.
We bought Ticket To Ride and Ticket To Ride - Europe and enjoy both games. We play them daily and leave near table. Fun family game. You won't stop at one game!
Great board game.  It is different every time!  The whole family enjoys this one.  Additional packs and themes can be purchased to go with this too!

So I found this while I was searching for Rail Baron, an awesome train game that is no longer being made and no longer cheap to find used. Rail Baron was like a cross between this and Monopoly, but there are no dollars involved with this game. I'm impressed with the quality of the cards and board overall, it's built to last. On the educational side, kids can learn geography of major cities in North America, and how to pronounce Sault St. Marie (it's not "salt"). But enough about that, this game is loads of fun, easy to learn, and doesn't take all day to setup or play a full game. The only downside I see with this is that it's only a five player game. If this were six-player, it would be even more awesome, and I'm not sure if the expansion enables additional players. Ultimately, I this game is a healthy and financially satisfying alternative to Rail Baron...and even better if you don't want the fake money alternative.
This has been the funnest game we have purchased in a very long time.Our teenagers love it.  It is a game we can play as a family and increase family time.Thank youkp
summary: Wow! Fun!  We play it 3-5 times/week

reviewText: We have enjoyed this game with family and friends. It's always fun to see who's strategy wins in the end!
Quick to learn, but so many ways to be interesting. Fun for a wide age range. Both serious and casual players have enjoyed it.

This game is quick, easy to learn (one practice round & you're off & running), and fun.  Easily grasped by kids from 7-8 on up.  We had it out last weekend and it was played for hours on end.  Plays quickly enough that a game or two can be played between dinner and bedtime during the week . . .  it's a nice way to get the whole family together.This game makes a good gift . . . .  well, our visitors have all ended up wanting their own game.  Amazon's price with free delivery is competitive, at least when i made my purchase.We started with Ticket to Ride then moved to the European edition . . .  that seems to be a good transition.  Then tack on some of the Expansion games if you want.Have fun!
Saw this game at my friend house, we played for hours and loved it. I was positive to buy one to play this game with my kid.
instructions seem difficult, but FUN game.  My kids  love playing.  Strategy is very important on this game.  Great for families

Great game for the whole family.  Can be played so that everyone enjoys the game, even if they don't win.  Takes a few games to really get the feel of it and learn how to score the most points.  Can be played offensively or defensively, which makes it nice for all different kinds of groups.  We played it almost every night for about 2 weeks after Christmas.Scoring system is a little complex, but not overwhelming.
This game is great for me and my wife to play. Friends enjoy coming over and playing multiple games together......Great game!

Whether you are a hardcore board gamer or not you will love this game! The rules are very simple and easy to understand. I've bought this game for everyone else in my family and we all love it.Game is based on completing routes across the USA by picking up different colored cards and using them to place your limited amount of trains on the board for different amounts of points.

I love this game!!  We play this with our 3 kids.  The youngest is 8 and she understands it and has a great time.  We also play it with just adults - always have a great time.  Not many games that can be for kids and adults.  Best board game I've played by far!
We love this game. It's great for all ages, but the older members use more strategy to increase the fun..

I played this game with my family (All five of us are 30+) the other night and had a lot of fun, even though I didn't win. I WAS winning at first but those tickets really add up a lot of points at the end!Anyway, the only downside is the fact that the train stop in Minnesota is Duluth instead of St. Paul / Minneapolis and they have it on the wrong side area of the state, so I wouldn't consider it a reliable source of geographic knowledge lol. But we all loved it!! :D
We have introduced this game to others and they thoroughly enjoy it.  the train routes are always different for each person.  You really don't know who is going to win the game until the very end.
This is a great game for the whole family.  Challenging enough for adults but still easy for children to play.
The whole family loves this.  So much fun and never the same game.  The kids are always trying out different strategies to be the victor.

I had gotten bored with my solo computer games so I started researching board games for 2 or more players based primarily simple rules, but layers of strategy and less than an hours duration. I don't like games that have a heavy emphasis on luck.Although the rules were a little obscure at first, we figured it out very quickly and had a great first game. My 16 y/o daughter beat the pants off me.This is the most fun board game I have ever played.
summary: Most fun my daughter and I have ever had playing a game

reviewText: Kids 8-12 love it.  Doesn't take all day.  Twelve more words required so here you go one two three four

We love game night at our house and after friends introduced us to this we can't stop playing it.  the more we play the more we are developing different strategies to crush our opponents.Only complaint is the cards are not full size like a deck of playing cards so not as easy to handle/shuffle.
summary: This is a GREAT family game

reviewText: my friends and i [we're all early 20-somethings] LOVE this game. it's extremely simple and easy to learn, yet can be highly competitive if playing with the right people.

This is a wonderfully entertaining game, with both strategy and luck involved in winning.  Moreover where some games are fun for just two people or for a bunch of people.  This game is equally fun regardless of the size of your group.
Love this game, we just need more time to play it.  Usually just comes out during holidays and with family over.

If you've ever been on Boardgamegeek.com or seen bloggers, reviewers, or anyone talking about Boardgames over the past few years, you've probably seen this mentioned. There is a good reason for that. This game is FUN! Very easy to learn, looks beautiful, plays in about an hour. What more could you ask for? I've taught many people to play it, and not one person hasn't enjoyed this game. Buy it!
summary: One of the Best Games Out There!

reviewText: This is a fun game. There is really not a lot of strategy that you need to learn. it is pretty simple to pick up. The turns are very quick, which kind of make slower thinking players kind of upset because everyone else is yelling at them to hurry up.

My wife and I were introduced to this game by one of our friends and have since shared it with many others. There has been nothing but positive feedback from all who have played. There are many different strategies and playing styles that can be used during this game to make it accessable to anybody. It is a very unifying experience to come together around a board game and sociallize in friendly, competative spirit. In a world of cell phones and facebook and increasing separation, coming together for a game night is a rewarding experience. This is a good choice for anybody interested in such an event.
summary: Wonderful Game for Family and Friends

reviewText: This is a great game for people who have a casual approach to table top.  I played it with my parents (who are in their 70s) and they had a pretty easy time picking it up and understanding it.  The game itself is a classic, with a very low time commitment and is very easy to pick up.I also brought it with me to a table top group, and we all absolutely enjoyed it.  It's great for a starter before you commit to the three-hour RPG that you're slathering over but want to warm up for or are waiting on other people.Haven't tried any of the expansions yet, but the base game seems to be enough.
summary: Great for casual and not so casual table top

reviewText: Quick delivery, awesome game.  I suggest getting the expansion pack, as you'll get bored with the base pack after a few times!

This is now my family's favorite game to play.Were always looking for a fun game that we can quickly (learn, setup, and play a full game).The game is a little complicated to learn because a piece moves around the outside of the board like Monopoly but in this game, the piece just moves to keep score.  The winner is not determined by who can go around the board first.  After the format of the came is learned (it just takes a couple of seconds), the rest is simple.  Your given cards that have location on them and the center of the board is a map with the corresponding location to the cards.  The entire point of the game is to make a train track that connects the locations your assigned.  The tracks and cards are worth varying amounts of points that determine the score.  Players can either concentrate on completing their assigned track or try to sabotage the other players by laying tracks to black where they think the other players need to put them.We also enjoy this game because it's difficult to find a fun 2 person game and the game is even more fun with more people.  More people mean more tracks on the board, making it more difficult to complete your own tracks.I give this game 5 stars and it will be a classic in our house, like monopoly (without the fights).

This game is great for the whole family. You will definitely want to purchase the expansion pack though. Makes for a lot more possibilities in the game and for us folks who have trouble seeing small print, the bigger cards are especially nice. Our family enjoys playing this game so much we have made it a regular weekly event! Thank you to all of the people who wrote reviews for this product; they were very helpful and guided me in my decision to purchase as a gift for my granddaughter.
We've been playing this game for awhile now and still love playing it... Great family game and easy to learn!
Fun game with the family.  Strategy needed for many different elements.  I look forward to playing it, especially if you can get 4 players to make it more fun.
Added bonus...it helps your kids learn where major cities are in the US. As you play more, you learn more strategy and so does your friends and family.  Never the same game twice.

We first played this with our grown children over the summer.  My husband usually skips the board games, but he loves this one!  We played it New Years Eve with our siblings and our 13-year old granddaughter.  It is an awesome game for ALL ages!!

I was introduced to this game at Christmas by my husband's family.  We played at least once a day (sometime more).  It is the best board game ever!  It makes you think, but not too hard.  I'm not one of those people who likes to think a lot and strategize during a board game.  I'd rather play for fun and socialization.  This game is perfect because it allows for that strategizing that some people crave, but not to the extent where you have to constantly be thinking and are left unable to have "fun".  Every game turns out different, so it never gets boring.  I've played it with as few as 2 people and as many as 5 people, and it is a great game either way.  My only criticism would be that the location of the cities in not quite geographically correct for all of them (example: Duluth, MN is in mid to southern MN on the board instead of Northern MN), but it gives you the general idea.  I now have my own game, so my husband and I can play it together.  I can't wait to get the Europe version just to add a little diversity.
Whole family enjoyed planning this game. I bought this as a gift for my brother, but now I wish I owned a copy of my own.
Recently purchased 'Ticket to ride', perfect game for game night with friends, even our kids love this game!  Outcome is always different!

I generally do not like playing games, but many in my family like to play games a lot. I purchased this game with the hopes of more variety (after reading some positive reviews online). I actually enjoyed the game (which is saying a lot for me). A few in my family really LOVE the game. I joked that next Christmas I should buy them something less addictive, like crack cocaine.
summary: Great family game and one that all should enjoy.

reviewText: This was a christmas gift and our family and friends have played it alot from teenage to grandparents. Good strategy game.

This game has been the source of many game nights with the neighborhood kids.  It is entirely open play, and each round leads to more sophisticated maneuvering in the player field.  Very fun and deep.
Love this game! My family is huge game people and we love this game! It can be played with two people which is nice for just my husband and I to play. My ten year old niece can even play the game.

I needed that route!  You just cut me off, now instead of destination cards giving me gobs of points, now they all count against me.  There’s no way around!  My nerves have never felt more vexed than they do now.  That’s Jane Austin speak for: I’m seeing red and now I’m going to do anything I think might hurt your chances for the rest of the game; and the next one we play!Ok, so the first time this happens, there’s usually another way around, it’s probably the long way around, but hopefully you have enough trains to make it, because that’s a constraint you have to work under.Game PlayThis handsomely illustrated elongated board looks has a map of the United States dotted with notable cities that are connected by short and long lines of rectangles (or tracks).  In line of track is one of several colors.You start the game with some cards in your hand that are nicely illustrated train cars of the same several colors.  Each turn you either  take you can draw two cards from either some face up cards or “roll the dice” and choose some from a facedown draw pile, or a combination.  If you pick a wild from the face-up pile, you only get one card that turn.  buy a route (lay down your trains on the rectangles between cities)  You buy the track by discarding from your hand the same number and color of cards of the track where you lay down your trains.  Draw three Destination Cards.  You’ve got to keep at least one.  These give a method to the madness of which routes you buy.As you lay down your trains you rack up points, The longer the track, the larger the gain.  If you successfully complete the route on your destination card, you also rack up points, but those you conceal till the end of the game.The game ends a full round after someone has fewer than four trains- everyone but the catalyst gets another turn.Points are scored as I’ve said, but those destinations you weren’t able to complete, yeah those count as negative points.  Oooo.. ouch.I hate to tell you what to do but…Keep an eye on how many trains your opponents have left, don’t be stupid and fill your hand with destinations when you won’t have time to complete them.If it looks like a route you need is one that your opponent might need, you have a vested interest in getting there first, even if it’s an easy one.You may even consider drawing more destination cards for your first turn or two so that you can spend more time in the game working on more that are related. Than getting those you start with and drawing more in the middle of the game.What does “related” mean?  Consider the following routes:LA to Miami (goes from the south-east corner of the US to the south-west corner)New Orleans to Duluth (goes north and south through the center of the US)Salt Lake City to Houston (goes from the western US to the south-center)Because there could easily be much overlap in the first and third route, but not the second route, I’d dump the second route and keep the other two.ThemeWell, several off-shoots from Ticket to Ride have come.  Not to mention an expansions for the original game that adds several smaller routes.  So there is evidence that the theme can be slanted, but in Ticket To Ride Europe, game play is the same with some twists, like you can use someone else’s route for your destination’s sake without getting points for the route, and you route requiring tunneling through mountains are more pricey.  These off-shoot stand alone games are a good way for Days of Wonder to charge full price for what could have been a less expensive expansion to the existing game.I can hear you say, “Yeah, but they are boards in different venues!”Yes, they are, but Rio Grande seemed to be able to offer double-sided boards (Yes, that means two new maps) and new rule sets for Power Grid for less than half the cost of the original game.“Oh...  Really?”Yup.  But for comments to the theme itself, I think the original game is pretty strong.  Struggling to eek out routes to complete destinations- trying to get there before someone cuts you off can be very nerve racking, especially when two or more destination cards are riding on making that connection.  I’ve got lots of little trains!  Cool little plastic trains!BalanceWhile I often complain about chance and this game includes card, the fact that you don’t have to take all the destination cards you draw mitigates it, and that there are several face up cards to choose from also helps.  Anyone can build anywhere beats the imbalance Power Grid shackles you with.  Tit for tat.  Anyway, for having cards, I have no complaints.InteractionInteraction is low.  While verbal congrats are possible, expressions of dismay and indifference often follow someone laying track.  If you can’t reach the cards, there will be- “give me those two oranges” or, “how about two off the mystery pile of joy!  But as I think of it, this game could be played in silence.  So if you are entertaining that favorite group of mine to pick on- introverts, you already knew what you were in for.Learning CurveLow.  The purchase price card you get tells you how much things cost and the production of a square base on die roll and Robber operation are pretty easy.  Each development cards has what it does written plainly on it.  While the rules are easy, the options are pretty limited and objective is pretty straightforward.DowntimeNominal.  While you do have to wait your turn, there is a possibility that the track you want to buy gets bought on someone else’s turn.  If you pay attention you can make groans at the time they will pay off the most.What’s not to Like?I can’t think of anything bad to say that I haven’t already said.  It’s a great game that has done much good for the industry and I trust the makers are raking in mega bucks with all their spin offs.  If people are willing to pay, they deserve it.  Ah, the beauty of capitalism.  I guess there are eccentric people out there, who are happy to shell out another $35 to $50.Collateral EndorsementI haven’t come across a soul who didn’t like this game, but you may say that my social circles are small.  You are probably right, but I love growing them with games.  My kids love to line up the trains from here to there, but they have severed my board in one place, so beware, the (read: any) board is best set up on a table rather than the carpet floor where wee feet are wont to walk.
summary: The Early Bird Catches the Worm

reviewText: I was first introduced to this game at my friend's weekly game night. I have enjoyed this game immensly over the last few years. I have purchased my own copy of this game. I do reccommend bying the 1910 expansion to this game as it gives you full size train cards, as well as more routes. My friends and I have played various home rule variations on this game, but this game always is good for replay value. THis game is considered to be a gateway game, meaning it is a game to help new gamers get comfortable with gaming. I/my friends have purchased other version of this game, including: Europe, Switzerland, India, and Asia. I want to purchase the Nordic Countries, and Marklin. all of these games are good.
summary: Great Game, Great re play value

reviewText: This game was a gift for my husband. He has been wanting it for many years. Came in 2 days, and helped us to have a great family game night

I absolutely love this game.. it is by far our first pick when choosing a game to play. The only thing is I highly recommend getting the expansion card pack... it makes it much easier and more fun to play.It's easy to learn and once you have learned it the game goes fairly quick. My only complaint is that some of the capitals are in the wrong spot on the map :)
summary: Love this game, even with Helena being in the wrong spot ;)

reviewText: This is one of my favorite games and I was so glad to see it on amazon, as it is usually much more expensive in toy/game stores. Well, at least, that's been my experience in my city. Anyway, I've found it to be a fun game that appeals to people who like strategy games and who do not, as this game involves a bit of strategy, but not so much to make it overly complicated.
This is a great game, lots of fun for many different ages.  Get the family together and have some fun!
I love this game. My brother got me into it, then i bought it and got my boyfriend into it, and now i bought the game for my uncle to play. Everyone loves it! and its easy to learn
Ticket to Ride is a fun game that is easy to learn, but has plenty of strategy.  My only complaint is that the cards are a little small.  Makes them hard to shuffle.

Purchased this game for my husband because we played it with friends and loved it.  We use it all the time during game nights with our friends.  Its great both  for single-players or in teams.  It's not a quick game so expect to spend some time on it. We play with adults but I imagine this is a great learning game for upper elementary-age and middle school-age kids.
I love playing this game! It's great for really 2 to 5 people. It's enough strategy to keep you occupied, but not too much to be overwhelming.
Ages from 12 to 75 in by family enjoy this game.  Of course we all get into our strategy that we always loose track of who's turn it is.

Once you get the hang of this game, it's pretty fun and easy to play. It's really confusing at first however. Give yourself at least an hour to carefully read the rules before you get into game play. Once we got going, it was a fun game for the whole family, ages 9 to 48.
summary: Fun game. Takes a bit to learn

reviewText: This is a fun game and is my favorite of the ticket to ride games. It is easy to play and is challenging. It will be different every time you play. I have played with adults and children and everyone has fun. It becomes more of a challenge with larger groups. It is well made and the pieces are well crafted.

This is me and my husband's new favorite game. When we try to describe it to people, I say it's similar to Settlers of Catan only you're settling railroads and it's very fast-paced. You can be done in 30 minutes. It's easier to learn than Settlers, I think.
We bought this game after playing at a relatives house.  It is so fun and easy enough for our 7, 9, and 11 year olds to play with us.

Played this a lot over the Christmas holidays with family. We had players from age 9 up to 73 and everyone really enjoyed it. It's long enough to put some concentration and strategy into it but short enough that you don't get bored. Fun game!
summary: Family loves it - kids and adults

reviewText: This game was highly touted in the publicity I read about it.  However, it too forever to even get the game set up, not to mention trying to understand the complexity of play.  It was waaay too complicated and waaaaay too expensive.
summary: Waaaay too complicated for a family board game.

reviewText: This game is very entertaining plus strategic. Everyone enjoyed playing the game, but make sure that if you have young children you keep the game pieces away from them--there are many small items that a small child could put in their mouth and swallow. The directions were not difficult to understand. We bought the game after playing it at a friend's house and have had a good time playing it as a family and with friends.
I've played this roughly a dozen times now, with groups ranging from 2 to 5, and it's been fun every time. Probably my favorite board game.

Was simple enough that my grandmother could understand it after about 10 minutes.  As a frame of reference I spent an hour trying to teach her euchre and she still doesn't understand it.  Now we can play something other than scrabble when I'm over there.

The game itself is of high quality, but after reading the directions, it proved too difficult to play with older people and younger kids so we will wait until we are with people our own age who are able to get the strategy of the game.

Sometimes it's hard to find games for just two people so I was thrilled that this was one of them.  I've played it 5 times and have lost every time but still think it's great.  That is the sign of a good game. :)

I love this game! Three generations play together and enjoy making great memories! The rules are simple enough to follow for our son and it has strategy and competition. The games last long enough to not get boring and the outcome is always different. The expansion packs (separate) are nice to have when there are more players. There are rule adjustments for playing in small groups which keep things interesting. Great fun!

Could possibly be a gateway game for beginning gamers who are just weaning themselves off monopoly and Uno. This is a somewhat longer game, but rules and set up are easy to figure out and don't take a great deal of time. The game is technically competitive, but so far we've played it where we each just focus on building our own paths rather than trying to interfere with each other, so it's a game that makes losing less personal if you have to play with folks who get their feelings hurt too easily.
Good fun game for most ages.  If you want to see how it plays look up the tabletop episode on YouTube.
Played it a lot with my family and my 8 year old has caught on enough to challenge for winning the game.  Simple enough to learn and strategic enough to be fun again and again.Perfect Family Game!!!

This is a hidden secret!  The Ticket to Ride game is challenging and tons of fun!  I have even purchased the ipad version it's so good!  We will be purchasing the other Ticket to Ride board game soon!

We play this as a family and all ages love it.  My wife is addicted and wants to play every night.  Good fun for the family or friends.  Does not take a long time to play and can either be a fun, non-competitive game, or you can play cut throat and interrupt other people's paths across the country.  Either way, fun every time we play it.
My family plays board games here and there and we have always had our favorites. Up until recently it was Settlers of Catan - that has now been replaced with Ticket to Ride. Pick it up!

I have played the American version of this game, but immediately snatched up the German version when a friend of mine was selling all of his board games.I was introduced to this game through a board game Meetup group because most of my friends are reluctant to try new board games. This game instantly became one of my favorites. It is fairly easy to learn and I love that it challenges you by requires some strategy. Don't be surprised if you want to play this game over and over again.

My 12 year old daughter wanted this for Christmas, even though she had never played it.  We tried to play as a family, but could not figure out the full game play from the included instructions.  The next day, I decided to look to see if there were any video instructions.  There was an excellent one on YouTube that explained all aspects of set up and game play, and made it very clear how to play, including various strategies.  That helped A LOT.  Before this point, we had never had difficulties learning how to play a game once we read through the instructions, so that was a downside to this one.  All that being said, now that we know how to play it is great fun, and I would like to buy more European games.
summary: Fun Game, but Needs Better Game Play Instructions

reviewText: This game is great for 3 or more players. When playing with only two people there isn't much competition for tracks and cities, each player can build their tracks independently and the game seems rather dull. During a 3 - 5 player game there is competition to see who can get the most popular routes and often players are forced to change their routes because of other players taking those tracks.

My 13 year old thinks this game is the best! (and the adults like it too!) I would say go for the extra $ and buy the 1910 expansion so you can have the full size cards and more routes.  great family fun.

We love these board games that are not your typical American game in the mold of Monopoly/Risk.  Ticket to Ride is easy to learn, tough to master, but quick to play.  Each game lasts about an hour, give or take depending on how many people are playing.  My only criticism is that this version (America) is a bit simple compared to the Europe board.  We don't have any tunnels, which is just one extra feature that would be nice.  But that's a minor thing; we recommend this game!
An awesome family game which is lots of fun for us to play.  Really enjoy it and have now purchased the expansion pack as well.
We all really enjoy this game and can't wait to get an expansion. The game is very easy to learn.
Such a fun easy game for all. Played it with friends over the Chritmas holidays and they will also be purchasing as they enjoyed it so much
I played this game at my sister in laws for the first time and the kids & I lived it so much I had to order one for my home.We play it once a week as a family activity.

It was an easy game to learn and was very enjoyable to play. I gave it to my sister as a gift and she was thrilled with this game. Just the right amount of strategy and luck to keep your interest. I highly recommend this game it's fun.

We are huge fans of Settler's of Catan, so to find a new game that is as much fun can be hard for us.  Ticket to Ride (or The Train Game, as we call it) is fun and, without even knowing it, educational!!  Kids can learn basic U.S. geography of major cities through the placement of rail lines and completion of destinations.  We also love that it was extremely easy to learn and can be set up/ready to place in just moments.  I wanted to teach my 6 and 8 year old nephews to play this game, but they hald already caught on after observing the adults playing earlier.  (The 6 year old need a little guidance but completely understood the concepts.)  We will be getting the European version soon!  It's never the same game twice!

I got this game for my birthday. At first I looked at it and thought..."Oh no, this is probably one of those games that is really complicated and has to have at least 500 players." But when I played it, I actually really enjoyed it. And it only requires at least 2 people! I was also surprised because my dad doesn't like playing games, and he actually liked this one, so I was glad I got this game!I didn't really know how many stars to put for durability because I've only played it a couple of times and I take good care of my games, so I don't think anything will break anytime soon. The most breakable piece of the game is either the cards or the actual board. But I don't think people usually place the game board vertically and sit on it or anything. *Cringe* So if people are capable of not doing that, I think it's fine.I think the only thing educational about this game is probably learning where different cities are and how far they are from each other.My overall rating is 5 stars because I haven't found anything wrong with it and my dad enjoys it which is amazing!

We play (a bit modified) with my six year old and she loves it.  Really takes only 5 minutes to learn.  I highly recommend this game as you can play with adults and older children by following the rules exactly, or play with younger children by modifying the rules a bit...  asking for an expansion pack for my birthday next year!
This is a great game and is quality made!  We are enjoying it and sharing with family and friends.  I recommend it!
My family loves this game! It was easy to learn and we like that it's a quick game; only 30 min or so to play. Definitely one of our new favorites!
We bought the Ticket to Ride game, USA version, and have played it several times and also bought the Ticket to Ride 1910 expansion set to add even more fun to a great game.  5 stars from me :)

This is a great game. If your paragon of boardgames is still Monopoly, then you are in for a pleasant surprise. Far superior games are now available. There is a quiet revolution in boardgaming happening right now.Ticket to Ride is one of the best of these new games. My wife and I love this game. It is very engaging, and pretty short. It gets tense toward the end. It plays well with 2 players as well as 3 to 5 players. It's also great for kids, to teach the geography of the US. This game won the coveted Game of the Year award (the German "Spiel des Jahres" award) for 2004, and it certainly deserves it.Note: There is a possibility for some competitive, cutthroat playing but we don't play it that way.If you like this game, also check out these others, which are also listed on Amazon:Settlers of CatanCarcassonne

This is such a fun game, and anyone can play.  It has strategy, luck, and goes by fast...and then you can't wait to play again! The only sad thing is that only 5 people can play at a time...tho' we have teamed up just to get more involved. Try it!

I love this game because it is simple, yet strategic, and it doesn't take an hour just to set up or explain the rules. It has just enough strategy to make it a competitive game but you cans till relax and chat while you play.
summary: Great game, just enough strategy and luck

reviewText: Much easier to read the cards and play the game.  Will be buying for each family this year for xmas.

This is a quality constructed game, with terrific artwork.  My family and I have spent hours devising our routes across the US and sabotaging said plans.  It's easy enough for the kids, and introduces really important concepts like bluffing, deception and sabotage.  As a responsible adult, I really enjoy this game because its really easy to bluff and deceive kids.  Heh, they never see it coming.  "Hey, I thought you were going that way, but your card says a different route!"  Gets me every time.  Or, "Hey I needed that line!"  Yeah kid, I know you did, I know.Good times.In all seriousness, it can be a riotous good time, and rewards strategic thinking.  Just like all good games.
great game, fun for the family to play together, was a fun Christmas gift for my husband who loves trains

My 9-year-old grandson loves to play every form of Monopoly when he comes to visit, so I read about Ticket to Ride and thought he'd enjoy it.  We loved it!  The instructions were easy to follow, even for the first time to play.  Definitely recommend!
This game is strategic; yet simple enough in its strategy that my wife and girls (late adolescence and early teen) enjoy playing it.
summary: Simple strategy keeps game fun and attractive for a family game.

reviewText: We wanted a new board game for our family nights, and this game came highly recommended.  It didn't disappoint us.
great family game . . . my grandkids have been playing this game continuously since they opened the holiday package!
We haven't played this game yet, but our son-in-law requested it for Christmas. We will be playing it very soon.
I love this board game! I can't wait to purchase other versions besides the United States. Thanks for a great game!

This game is really easy to play and has provided my family hours of entertainment. No two games are ever the same. This game requires strategy and a good sense of humor as routes are continually blocked and new stragegies must be formed. Definitely recommended!
summary: Great fun for the whole family!

reviewText: I played this game with a group of people that have played literally 100s of board games, and it was a ton of fun. I bought it for my parents, who only play about 2 board games a few cards games, and they loved it as well. Might be a little hard for a kid to win, as it does require a bit of strategizing.
summary: Fun for casual and advanced gamers alike

reviewText: A very fun strategy game. Yet it doesn't take up ALL night and is so easy to learn. You won't regret giving this game a try:)
We love this game!!! So fun and just enough strategy to be fun but not difficult!  Love it as a phone app as well!

Fun challenging game for the whole family!  Purchased this as a family gift under the Christmas tree.  We have a 16 year old, a 14 year old, and a 10 year old.  It was challenging and easy enough for us to play again and again.  I
Great game, easy to set up, challenging as you are pitted against the other players, strategy can be important, can be cutthroat and riveting

Our family LOVES this!  We're card players ordinarily, but this game provides some real thinking skills.  I taught it to my 12-year-old nephew who loves trains.  He didn't realize he was learning geography at the same time.  Great game.

This game works with any group of people: parents, children, friends, girls, even someone who cannot read English! Easy to teach, deep in strategy, plays fast, and new gamers have great chances to win!

This is probably the best game to get non-gamers into Board Games. It is so easily to pick up and learn the rules, while strategic enough that expert gamers enjoy playing as well. This is my wife's favorite game and we have bought all of the expansions. This is a reoccurring game on our regular game nights.I will add that, it is great that this game can also be played very well with only 2 players.
Great game!  Endless hours of fun for kids and adults.  Relatively easy to learn and lots of fun.  You will love it!

We are absolutely addicted to this game! My parents, who are retirement age, my children who are ages 19-24, and myself all love it ... it's great for all ages! I am thrilled with the purchase of this game! You have to try it!
summary: Ticket to Ride is a GREAT game!

reviewText: I enjoy this game so much, that I purchased the iPad app of it as well, and play on my subway commute to and from work!

Very fun game... a little challenging until you get the hang of it, but once you do, it is a lot of fun.  Played with our 2 sons, ages 10 and 12 and they really liked it!  Great family game!  House rules had to be made so the game would move along quicker.
Ticket to Ride is a great game to have, lots of fun!  You will want to play it over and over!

Ticket to Ride requires the use of strategy, but the way the cards work injects a fair amount of luck into the mix.  Players need to use their brains, but it's not so complicated as to discourage the seat-of-the-pants player.  Lots of fun!
summary: Nice balance of luck and stragegy

reviewText: Our family really enjoys playing Ticket to Ride.  I bought it as a family gift for Christmas and we've played it several times.  It gets us away from the TV and doing something as a family.  Good purchase!
This is an pretty easy game to play once you get the rules down.  Everyone who has played it with me loves it and wants one of their own!

This is the ultimate family game. If you want your kids to put down their handheld electronic devices and spend more time interacting with the family then this game will do the trick. Our kids 13 & 16 want to play all the time. It requires strategy and critical thinking, so a little brain power here which I think is what most teenagers are lacking these days. If you like games like Battleship, Mastermind and Clue then you'll be in the same kind of league with this game.

Bought this for the family for Christmas.  Directions might be a little confusing at first, but once you get started,this game is a lot of fun !  If you like games that require strategy, you will enjoy this one!

I chose this boardgame for my niece after carefully reading many reviews.  I was able to play the game with her and was a little bit disappointed.  I was expecting a game with more strategy.  My favorite game for all ages is Blokus, since even little people can give it a try without being able to read, and Blokus is all strategy and no luck.

My son is a game designer and buys games for us to play.  This is one of my favorites--I've even won a few times over my sons who are both smarter than me.  As an educator, I think it's a fun way to learn geography.  We love playing it over the holidays.  It's not too easy and not too difficult.  2 to 4 of us have played it and enjoyed it equally.  I see this Christmas my son is asking for the 1910 version, as it's on his wish list.  I want to try the Europe extension so will ask for that. This is a quality game that everyone should enjoy.
This game is a lot of fun once you learn how to play. I gave this present to my 6 year old grandson and he loves it. The beauty of this game is you can buy additions to keep it exciting.
Fun for all ages!  Gives a good opportunity to try thinking and planning ahead, and teaches geography in an enjoyable way!

This is one of my favorite 'party' games--it's easy to learn, easy to set up (unless you're like me and have to make your pile of trains all neat and tidy), and doesn't take forever to play.The best thing about the game is the fact that you can play two ways--you can either focus on your own routes or you can play to screw other people over. And since there are so many route cards, I've never played the 'same' game twice, although it is easy to pick out some of the more popular routes once you've played the game a number of times.You will need a decent sized tabletop to play this on--we tried on a 3x6 folding table and there just isn't enough room for all the cards, trains, and the board together if you have more than 3 people playing.My only complaint is that the scoring mechanism is pretty cumbersome. Most of the time when we play, we simply wait to score everything until the end which adds a nice element of surprise.Just be careful when you're playing and don't accidentally slam your fists on the table in celebration (ala Anne Wheaton on Tabletop)--the trains move easily!
summary: Solid game, great for pairs or a group

reviewText: We play this with our 8 year old son. It is a lot of fun and an enjoyable way to learn some geography. We have now added some of the expansion packs. Our son does very well at this game and picked it up quickly. He is a good game player and can plan strategies. It may be too much for children any younger. It is a great family game.
What a fun game we played at my nieces house in Tx and had a blast my mom bought this to play with her great grandkids. We always played games growing up good family time.
I was looking for a fun game for only two players.  This game is fun with two, and fun with more!

My family and I saw Ticket to Ride demoed at a game store in the Adirondacks and have wanted it ever since, but were a little put off by the $49.95 price.  I wanted a new game to bring to our family reunion, and thought TTR was just the, well... ticket.  I watched it on Amazon, and ordered it when the price dropped a little.  The game has been very well received by our family.  Our youngest daughter, 10, is probably the most enthusiastic, especially after winning the second game we played!  The rules are straightforward, and the game play is simple--players choose one of three possible actions for their turn--making the game as easy to start playing as any of the more well known family board games, like Sorry, Life, or Clue.  It's on par with Risk or Monopoly in that developing a plan will help you win the game, but the game is still enjoyable if played more casually.  Game play is fast once you get into a rhythm.  The bright, colorful, and solidly made game components look to last for years of hard play.  It even comes with a few extra pieces of each color, as a protection against loss.  The availability of expansion modules (USA 1910, Switzerland) and companion editions (Europe, Marklin (Germany) and Nordic Countries) means if you like TTR, you'll be able to play variants for years to come.  (My 13 year old daughter has already asked for TTR Europe for Christmas.)  A real bonus is the key that comes inside the game, enabling you to play online at the Days of Wonder website.  You can play solo against capable "bots," or test your skill against hundreds of online human opponents.  All in all, well worth the above-average price, and lots of fun.
summary: A great addition to your board game shelf

reviewText: We play this with our 7 year old, and we all love it!  :)  Fun for adults, not just families.

This game is such good fun! With two people or with more, we really enjoy playing it. We aren't really board game folks, in fact we only own this one and scrabble but we bought it after playing with some friends and having a great time. For reference, we're in our late twenties and not particularly "wholesome" types who stay in all the time. We have not played with children so I don't know how this would go over with kids. It's a long game and requires some concentration, but with a few beers we played happily well into the night.
summary: Such fun, and we're not even board game people!

reviewText: We love this game! Definitely an adult-teen game! This was a hit this Christmas! This isn't a very interactive game if that's what you're looking for but will give your brain a workout!
summary: Put your thinking cap on and enjoy the ride!

reviewText: My daughter and her husband are addicted to this game! It game quickly, packaged nicely. They play this for hours.

Ticket to Ride really is a first class game.  It's one that requires a tremendous amount of thinking and planning, but also relies a little bit on luck.  If you're looking to try this game before investing the $45, there is an app ($6.99 for iOS) that gives you full game play as well.
This is one of the best board games ever.  It is very easy to learn, but lots of strategy.  I love that we can play it as a family and the kids love it as much as the adults.

Of our huge board game collection, this one is certainly pulled out a lot. It's simple to teach and fun to play.If I had to be picky, I'd say drawbacks of this game include less interaction than other board games we own (but turns are short to balance this out) and it's easy to bump the score markers that are to be placed along the numbers on the perimeter of the board.I still give this game 5/5 stars and would recommend this game for anyone looking for variety in their collection!
We were really excited get this game. The family has had tons of fun playing it and we received it very fast!

This is one of the most fun board games I have ever played.  The game takes minutes to teach and from there the strategies to win are endless.  It's also one of the most original games I've ever played.  Very different from all the other typical board games you might have played like monopoly, life, sorry, etc., The packaging and design is great.  The board is sturdy and well decorated.  You get tons of little plastic trains along w/ some extras in case you lose one or two along the way.  I wish the cards could have been a little bigger but it's nothing that detracts from the overall game.  The cards even have symbols on them so if you're colorblind you can tell the difference between cards.  Nice touch.  Overall, a great family game.  A great game to play w/ friends who have never played "different" board games.  My wife and I are addicted to this game.  She loves playing it and that says a lot b/c she is not into board games that much.  I highly recommend.
summary: Grab your Ticket to Ride.  You won't be disappointed.

reviewText: We love this game so much we keep buying more of them to give to family and friends. A fabulous game for the entire family.  Our 10 year old granddaughter caught on quickly and enjoys it.  A great way to teach geography too.

My son is just getting to the age where we can sit down as a family and enjoy a good board game.  We simply LOVE this game.  We had to play it every night for a solid week before I had to break the habit and get back to the real world!  I would highly recommend this to anyone looking for a great game to enjoy as a family.  You can play as nice or as ugly as you like as there are tactics you can use against your opponents (you can figure this out once you play a couple of times).  I would suggest making card holders for the younger players as it gets tough hiding your tickets and keeping up with your intended routes.  I will be getting this board game for all the kids on my Christmas list this year.  You cannot go wrong with this game!!!
This is a great game.  We have played it constantly since we've given it to the family for Christmas.  Other family members bought it after playing it with us.
This is a really fun game, fast becoming one of my favorites.  It's a simple, elegant games that can be played in less than an hour.  No surprise it was a "Game of the Year".

This is a great addition to our board game portfolio.  In fact, it is our family's favorite game.  My 12 and 10 yr old love to play this game with me and my wife and we have a blast.  The game moves generally fast and involves some strategy and thinking.  We are still noobs but it is very fun.  I recommend to any family looking for a fun game.  I don't know why this is not sold at general toy stores because this should be a staple game for every family.  Definite buy.
Very good game! engaging and fun for all ages parents included this is a must a have in anyone's board games collection!

reviewerName: Maddely "So many books, so little time"
reviewText: My family and I love this game and literally played  it over the entire winter break with visiting family. It's quick to learn and easy to play. An average game ran only about an hour.
