Like other games by Days of Wonder, it's well made- the board, cards & pieces are good quality & beautifully decorated, worth the $50- which I initially thought was overpriced. Our kids' ages range from 4-13, and we all enjoy it (the 4y.o. teamed up w/ a partner).
summary: Ticket to FUN for the entire family!

reviewText: My first time was with my grand kids loved it. When I am staying for awhile we will set it up and play it over and over.  I love that they are learning the placement of different cities in the USA.

It's great to have a new game on the market.  I had fun playing this game with my son and two of his children.  I liked that a map of the US was the playing board and the concept involved connecting two cities by rail.  The game involved some strategy and some luck.  As with many board games, the pieces can be disrupted easily if the board is bumped (by a baby brother in my case).
Ticket to Ride is a great game for everyone. The only thing is only 5 or less can play at a time, unless you play in teams which we have not tried yet.
This is a great game that all should buy.  It tends to be a little expensive but it is totally worth it.  Buy it with your tax return money if you have to for a family present.
We took it to the beach and have many good times learning the game.  Look forward to hours of playing with grandkids.

My grandsons ages 8 to 15 love playing Ticket to Ride. We love playing with them. It's a game of strategy while learning about the U.S. geography. My daughter also bought the European version as well. We just love it.

Awesome game for friends and family get togethers.  It is just one of those good wholesome games that make you think the entire way through it plotting your technique as well as how to possibly screw your opponent.  Hours of endless fun and gaming!!!  I would give it more stars but 5 stars is the limit!
My family, roommates, and I love this game! It's long and complicated and requires thinking. Definitely not for little kids but great for adults!
It is a good family game that requires some strategy.  Game doesn't take too long, sweet spot for number of players is 3 to 4, with 3 being ideal (shorter game, but enough players to be interesting).
Great boardgame that I can play with my teens. Once you are an experienced player, it is best with three, but still an enjoyable game with two.

My girlfriend is fairly new to board gaming so this is the ideal gateway game for her. TTR requires some decent strategy with some luck of the draw. She's addicted to this game and there's a constant request to play this game when friends visit. Thanks!

A classic tabletop game, simple to learn with tons of replay value. But the cards, ugh I didn't even open mine I just ordered the 1910 expansion and used those because my fat fingers cannot deal with those tiny cards.  I guess it can help the game fit on a table better but really blah!
This is a fun game! Some strategy and some luck involved. You never know who is going to win until all of the successful "trips" have been revealed.

This is a fun strategy game that our whole family likes to play.  It is well made, sturdy and the cards won't fall apart anytime soon.  It takes a little time to learn how to play, but it is well worth it!
Is a great game that adults and kids can play together !! It takes more than two hours to finish a game

This is a fun game.  However, the first few times I played it with my friends I did get a little frustrated, due to only being able to do one action per turn.  Once you get past that and get the hang of the game it is really fun!

I purchased this game after playing the phone app version with my friend. It's really fun in that you actually have to use strategy to win, yet it is easy to learn. I appreciate the extra game pieces they provide just in case you lose some, and the artwork on the board and game cards are beautiful. I'm very happy with this purchase; it's a great addition to game night!
Lots of fun to play. The rules are easy to learn, you can play for hours with friends or family without getting bored.
This is one of our favorite games.  Our friends introduced it to us, and when they moved, we had to buy a copy for ourselves.  The game is a good mix of strategy and luck.

A simple game of strategy which has some competitive features, without having you directly attack other players. Everyone we have played it with loves it, and we are already looking at expansions to add more variety. It is unfortunate that the game only supports 5 players, but the Asia map pack supports 6, so we will be buying that soon.
summary: One of my family's favorite board games

reviewText: This is a great great game for adults to. play as  a group and my friends and I play as often as we can

This game is great because it doesn't take too long to play yet is long enough to be enjoyable.  It is not too hard to learn how to play.  Each player can feel like a winner when they accomplish their "tickets".  It helps out with U. S. geography.  I love it.  It is my new favorite.
This is a great. Thinking game.the cost is too much however.too difficult for siblings under10 .focueIsis not there .over 10 is ok

Ticket to Ride is a decent train game.  It comes with a HUGE board, so be prepared to play on a large table or on the floor.  Lots of little plastic trains, brightly colored, nice graphics.  Game uses small cards, two separate decks, destination tickets and train cards(same size).  Mechanics are simple--take one action (draw 3 destination tickets and keep 1 or more, draw two train cards, or use the train cards you already have to claim a route) and score it (if it scores).  You then compete with your opponent(s) to build the longest route, score the highest points, and connect all of the cities shown on your destination ticket(s).  It's easy to get caught up in finishing routes on the tickets, though.  You can end up pulling lots of train cards trying to get enough of one color instead of building routes and scoring along the way--potentially losing you the lead (especially if your opponent(s) block your way).  Also, if you don't finish a mission, it will detract from your points at the end of the game.  I'd recommend this to anyone who enjoys a fairly laid-back game with simple mechanics.  If you're looking for a lot of excitement and super-fast gameplay, this might not be the product for you.  It is, however, a reasonably quick game.

This is a great gateway game. If your looking for something not too difficult in order to introduce players into euro style board games, this wouldn't be a bad place to start. It's easy to get up and running and not too heavy on strategy but doesn't completely rely on luck of the draw. I think it would be great for family and friends alike.
Heard from friends that this was a favorite. We played over Christmas break and both our kids (teenagers) asked repeated times to play again.
This is a really good game.  Liked it so much that after playing it just one evening at a friend's house, I had to get it.

Great game for kids and adults. I have this on the Ipad, but the board game is much more fun. I have been playing this with my 8 year old son, who's English isn't very good because he grew up overseas. The game is very easy to learn, and my son picked it up in no time.  The game is playable with 2 players, however with 3 or more is where it really shines. The only complaint is that the cards are way too small, but with the 1910 expansion the much larger cards are very easy to shuffle. All in all it is a game that is fun for both Children AND adults, something that isn't all that common these days.

Ticket to Ride is extremely easy to learn, but very challenging to master.  While two people can play, it is more fun with three or four players.  Average game takes about 45 minutes to play, great for anyone starting at age 8
This game you can play several times without getting bored. Furthermore, the game is designed very well. A code in the game makes it also possible to play the game online with others.

This is a great game for the Eurogamer to bring their non-gamer friends into playing your type of games. If you have friends or family who think of Monopoly or Trouble when they think of board games, this is a great game to ease them into the 21st century.

We bought this game to play with a 9 year old grandson who loves board games.  We are sick of Monopoly and Clue, etc.  I found this game mentioned in a recent issue of Shop Smart magazine and immediately looked it up on Amazon.  This game, the basic US version, was fun and interesting and taught our grandson names of the cities plus how to spell them.  The game is fun, fast, moves have to be strategic; there is no play money involved (no banking yeh!) and the competition between players is more civil as the board is large, the train routes are many and options for your turn are many.We also bought Ticket to Ride Europe to play with adult friends and it was also a lot of fun--although we had a bit of trouble with the city names, as they are spelled for locals.  Also played this version with grandson and he caught on fast and learned to find the unusually-spelled city names.We plan to buy more of these games for our other grandsons.
summary: Don't tell the kids it's educational!

reviewText: Got this for my granddaughter for Christmas, & she loves it!!!!Takes a while to play, but it's a game that will be played in our family for many years.
We love this game.  If you have a strategic thinking family (chess and the like), you'll probably enjoy this game.
Not a difficult game to learn, and everyone of every age had a great time playing.  We will now look into buying the expansion pack...

Ran across this game while looking for a new family game for Christmas.  There were alot of great reviews so I bought it.  We have played it several times and it is very intriguing the different strategies that you can try to use.  My daughter and her boyfriend played about 5 or 6 times during one day and really love it.All of the games we have played have finished in less than an hour and are quicker now that we understand how to play.Great game, I definitely recommond it.

This has become my family's new game of choice.  My kids really enjoy playing it and games can get pretty heated.  Even my 7 year old can play it competitively, so it isn't necessarily for the older crowd only.  I highly recommend it.
I bought this for my sons birthday and the whole family has enjoyed this game.  It is fun and never the same.  Adults and children will have fun.
I liked that you can finish the game in probably 2-3 hours for 5 players, and around an hour if only 2 players are involved. That's great for kids who don't want to be seaten all day.

I BOUGHT THIS GAME FOR MY GRANDSON FOR XMAS. I HAD NEVER HEARD OF IT BEFORE OR LET'S SAY IT WAS BECAUSE IT WAS NEVER ON ANY  LIST OF MY GRANDCHILDREN. WHEN I SAW HOW MANY HAD BEEN SOLD I DECIDED TO TAKE A CHANCE. WHAT DOES AN OLD PERSON LIKE ME KNOW ANYWAYS ABOUT TODAY'S GAMESWE HAD AN OPPORTUNITY TO PLAY IT WITH HIM AND HIS FATHER A COUPLE OF TIMES BEFORE THEY DROVE THE LONG DISTANCE HOME. IT WAS WHEN HE TOOK THE GAME HOME THAT I REALIZED HOW MUCH I MYSELF ENJOYED THE GAME. THEREFORE I DECIDED TO BUY ANOTHER ONE AND SHARE IT WITH OUR FRIENDS. WE ALL ENJOY IT SO VERY MUCH.  YOU MIGHT SAY WE'RE GETTING ADDICTED TO IT.
summary: GREATEST GAME I'VE BOUGHT IN YEARS

reviewText: Bought this for my daughter's family and they love playing it...I was looking for something new when I came across this game..we had never heard of it but its added some new fun to our game nights!

This is a very good and very expensive board game.The mechanics are exceptional and the replay value is huge. I'll trust that other reviews have gone over the basic mechanics. Let me just say that the play factors of planning your routes, dealing with the cards that are available and sudden changes necessitated by opponents taking routes you were counting on is very entertaining.A video game version of this is also available on Xbox 360 LIVE arcade. You can purchase it for either 600 or 800 points (seeXbox 360 Live 1600 Pointsand others) which works out to considerably cheaper than the board game and allows online multiplayer. A demo of this is available as well.There are several expansions/variations to Ticket to Ride available involving new maps and / or mechanics, but these are not included in this core product.
This is a great game for anyone between teens all the way up to grandparents age.  This game is a lot of fun and very competitive making it great for get-togethers!
We got this game for our friends and family for Christmas, and it was a big hit! Love it. Would recommend for anyone.

This is the game we can't get enough of, since it's never the same game twice.  My 9,8 and 6 year old nieces and nephews picked it up immediately and have won their share of games.  The cards in the standard set are small, for big an small hands but the 1910 expansion solves this issue.

I first saw this game in the European version, with travel among various cities, perhaps needing to detour and at the same time have a geography lesson.  I almost got that one, but when I saw the U.S. one on Amazon.com, I thought it might be more appropriate for my 8-year-old grandson and it is.  Good fun for him, his parents, and grandparents.  Challenging, educational, and not tedious!  Recommend it hightly and look forward to getting the European one soon.  And I hope versions will be available for other continents.And thanks to Amazon for having it available.Ticket to Ride
summary: Ticket to Ride -- fun and very worthwhile

reviewText: One of my favorite games of all time to play with the entire family.  Even the wife likes this one!

This is a fairly simple strategy game that can be played by people from different ages at the same time.My family has been playing Ticket to Ride for a couple of years now, usually after family Sunday lunch with kids from 12 year olds to  50-ish year old parents around the table and quote often the kids either win or at least finish with a very close score to more senior people.We take some 60 to 90 minutes to complete, which is an ideal duration for lazy Sunday afternoons ;-)
summary: A game for the entire family!

reviewText: This game is ok for what it is. It is a simple game where you try and get multiple cards of the same color, to match up with the corresponding colors on the routes on the map. You score points for going from one city to another, scoring more for larger routes. You draw "destination cards" that have 2 cities on them, and if you connect them you score bonus points. The game consists of players making their own routes longer, or blocking other players. Not very much to it, and it is really annoying when 5 turns go by and you never get the cards you need. There is a decent amount of strategy in this game, but it is nowhere near as fun as Power Grid, Carcassonne, Puerto Rico, or 7 Wonders. I have tried to enjoy this game, because the hype must come from somewhere, but to no avail. If you want to begin getting into fun board games that are not too difficult, but better than monopoly or sorry that you grew up with, I would recommend 7 Wonders or Carcassonne.

I purchased this as a family gift for Christmas.  We played it on Christmas Day and twice since then.  It is easy to learn and fun to play.  My children enjoyed it as well as the adults in our home.  I think the age rating is right on. Anyone under 8 would have a hard time playing this game.  Worth the money!

Ticket to RideThis is one of my favorite board games!  Adults and kids can play together too!  The only thing about the rules in the manual that is not clear is the scoring, when calculating the points at the end.  Since I've played with friends before I purchased this game, I tell you.  Here's how:  After a person is down to 2 or less trains, it becomes the last and final round for everyone else and stops back at that person.  The game then ends and calculating the score begins.  For every destination cards that you didn't or were not able to complete, you subtract that number score on the card.  Then the person with the longest train route score an extra 10 points.  Any other cards or locomotive cards in their hands are discarded and not used for scoring.It is a great game and can be addictive.  You can also sign up as guest online at [...] to play it too!  The most basic version is the USA one, other versions may add extra things in it.
summary: USA version, basic, easy, and very fun to play!

reviewText: This is a well made board game.  It's not cheap cardboard.  Great opportunity for learning geography. Great for train enthusiasts everywhere!
Bought for family game nights after seeing it on Tabletop on Youtube. A lot of fun to play, can be expanded with additional maps and cards.

My 10 year old son and I are crazy about board games. Since we got this one the others have been gathering dust. We play at least once a week, and the rest of the week he's strategizing for the next time we'll play. Not only is it a fantastic lesson on urban planning but also geography. I highly recommend this game for a great family experience!

Easy to pick up on. Has a beautiful, quality board. This game is an instant classic. Worth every penny! Fun with a group & just as fun with 2 players. The hubs and I play several times a week. Great strategy game that doesn't require hours at a time or overly intense concentration, making it more fun for the family. Perfect balance of ease & challenge in this game. A new favorite in our home!

After becoming familiar with this game through my brother-in-law (he showed me a YouTube video from Geek&Sundry with Will Wheaton playing this on their Table Top series), I became super intrigued. It looked easy to pick up, fun to play, and depending on the amount of players, allowance for different game play. This past Christmas when visiting, my sister and brother-in-law purhcased the game and we all played it...had a blast, and kept playing subsequent games - addictive! I've since become acquainted with the mobile app game for this as well on my iPhone. Perfect for when it's inconvenient to take out the board game, or a lack of other players. LOVE THIS GAME! :)

Fun game but a few drawbacks:1) Routes do not cover many cities and form predictable patterns for winning.2) Small cards are difficult to handle and shuffle.3) Some card colors are difficult to discern without bright lighting or if persons are color deficient.Apparently the company later recognized these problems and corrected them in an "expansion pack."  The expansion pack is fine for previous versions but newer/current versions should be sold with the corrections in the first place!  Why pay MORE for an inferior product and then the upgrade?!?  Duh, I just answered my own question.  ;-)
This is a great strategy game this is easy to learn for anybody.  I would recommend 3+ people as it can get old quickly for only 2 people.  It is a great game to play over and over again.

Ticket to Ride is an easy to learn game for 2 to 5 players. Three or more is ideal. Each player draws three tickets and has to choose which routes to fill. You may keep one route, or all three. Each route has a different value depending on how difficult or long the route may be to complete. You draw train car cards of different colors and try to save up to "buy" your route. The person who gets the most points at the end wins. Very easy to play. It is my 9 year old's favorite game. We love it so much, we just ordered Ticket to Ride Europe.
This is a great game.  It takes just a few minutes to learn, and will provide you with hours of fun
My husband loves this game! He wants to play it anytime people come over and we always have fun. Great Buy!
Great family game and a great way to spend time together. Nice to have found it at a good price.
Great family game!  So much fun.  We often have game nights with friends and this is a favorite! Love it!
Bought this for my dad for Christmas.  He usually beats my mom, my sister and I at most games, but this one gives us all a fair advantage :)Arrived on time and just as expected.

I bought this for my son for Christmas on the recommendation of all the reviews here.  I was so excited to get it and play.  But we had such a hard time figuring it out.  The directions are very poor and I had to go on to the website to get more info from a critic review.  My husband finally figured it out and they do enjoy it, but not as much as anticipated.
summary: Neat game if you can figure it out!

reviewText: We enjoy playing this game as a family. It is quite fun and can be a learning experience as well. I highly recommend this. It is also a plus when you can use it as family time around the table. You will be surprised what you can learn about your own children just by playing a game with them.

When i played this game at a friends house, i just ***had*** to have it. Being a computer programmer, this game is a dream come true. It's essentially a minimum spanning tree combat game! This game will appeal to all ages and can be played from 2 to 5 players! A great family night game!

It needs changes in four of its rules, and reminds me of Risk, where I could potentially lose friends.  The game takes about 1 hour to play.  The only good thing I can say is the artwork is beautiful.  The cover belongs in a frame and should be hung on a wall. I was accused of being vindictive for blocking two other players deliberately, which is not against the rules.  When I suggested modifying some rules, which would make that type of strategy a waste, those two players said no.  I went to bed angry that night for being labeled the villain.  I was still angry the next morning, and I was angry all day at work over the game!  I haven't played it with them since. Two rules I consider most needing to be fixed are: 1. There should be no penalty for incomplete destinations. 2. Allow the use of double paths for THREE or more players. When a player's destination becomes DELIBERATELY blocked, I see the same kind of irritation you get when a player is attacked in the game of RISK, and that attack takes a continent away from them. Also, the small cars are too easily knocked around on the board. If someone offered me some money for the game, it would take 2 seconds for me to sell it. Since I stopped playing this game, I bought Seven Wonders, which is WAY more interesting, and has no possible avenues for irritation.

My daughter introduced this game to us last week and ever since then that is our game of choice. We have our traditional games that we always play, those are now collecting dust. I try new games once in awhile but I am a hard sell and I uaually return to the old favorites. I bought A Ticket To Ride for myself as I do not want to ever be without it!! I love it because my 8 year old loves it, my 16 year old loves it, it spans generations, and we can play with just 2 players no need to have company over. I am NOT a Monopoly lover and this is nothing like Monopoly!! The game itself is beautiful, the train cars are fun to handle as are the beautiful cards. I would suggest getting the expansion packTicket to Ride USA 1910 Expansionit replaces the train car and destination cards with bigger regulation size cards. I have been told by others if you can only have one Ticket To Ride, this is absolutely the one to have, Days Of Wonder. It is so east to totally get into this game! Other reviewers have described the game beautifully so I wont try and add my own, but if you are teetering on the edge...jump right in, you will NOT be sorry!!
My favorite game EVER!!!  Once I played this at my sisters house I knew we had to get it.  It is our new "family" game at every get together.
Bought this game to add to my groups Tuesday Night Game Nights, great game, quick, easy to learn, fun, goes great after a nice game of Catan!
summary: Great Game for any board game enthusiast

reviewText: This is a great game that our whole family enjoys at virtually every holiday get together.  Great for competitive people!

My grandsons aged 10 and 8 just love this game. We have played it without the Route cards for the 8 year old and he just enjoys building the longest train.  I am thinking I would like to try the European version too since I come from England.

Had never played it before, but it really didn't take much time at all to learn. Easy to learn and play and has a lot of strategy involved. Super fun even with 2 people. Different amounts of people add a different dynamic to the game. Definitely recommend this game.

We love this game.  It has a lot of energy and moves quickly so no one get's bored.  There's a tremendous amount of strategy involved but simple to learn the rules.  Would definitely recommend this game to other families, and you can also add to the game with their many expansion packs.  Your overall objective is to connect cities using your train pieces, the more trains required to connect the cities the more points you get, also with your ticket cards, such as 'Connect Boston to Miami', will add I think 12 more points to your score if you hold this card at the end of the game.  But you have to watch your opponents, they may try to block your route, especially if its a long one, such as 'Toronto to Portland', my wife blocked me at Vancouver to Portland, had to alternate my route and lost out on the extra 20 points.  You also get points for forming the longest route.
summary: Family loves this game and easy to learn.

reviewText: My wife will actually play this game with me!  It's not really for just 2 people, since there isn't a whole lot of competition to get the tracks you want, but it's still a good time, I've heard of playing a third person between the two of you, for extra competition/fun, but we have yet to do it, it's fine with just the 2 of us.

We have only played a few times, but have really enjoyed it and like that it can be played with only 2 players.  The instructions seem complex at first, but once you get going it's really fairly simple to play.  However it isn't simple to win -- it takes quite a bit of strategy and isn't just about luck.
This is the best game Ever! Everyone in the family would enjoy this game.  Great party game also.  Great teaching game also.
Our whole family (16 yrs - adults) absolutely loves this game. We pull it out quite often and have even downloaded the app for our iphone so we can play it "on the run".

This game is expensive for the quality of product received. The directions are confusing and the set up/start is complicated. The strategy of the game is more suited to older kids and adults but the actual play with color matching trains makes it seem like it is for younger kids. This game was a huge disappointment!
summary: This game is not worth the cost!

reviewText: A great game for children and adults! Our family is addicted to this game. The adults even continue to play after the children go to bed.

I'm so happy when I find games that require some concentration, thinking, and is not too complicated.  This is a fun game for the entire family (our youngest plays it without using the "Destination" cards).  This game is really just a fair, fun play that anyone can catch onto.I really like the quality of the board, the style of the cards, and that it actually all fits into the box for easy clean up!  It would've been nicer if they used wooden instead of plastic for the train pieces.  But still a great game!!
summary: Great game for the family that requires thinking

reviewText: Great game. My nephew and niece had so much fun, as did both my husband and I. Takes a little bit of strategy to win and makes you think.

reviewerName: Michelle Jones "he/she who would travel happi...
reviewText: We love this game too. The replay on it is high and the strategy is easy once you play a couple times. I just wish this version had more routes. We have bought India and Switzerland s an expansion, but holding off on buying TTR Europe because I cannot justify spending so much on yet another version that is almost exactly the same s this one.
summary: Another great game from Days of Wonder

reviewText: Great Family game!! Whole family loves it!! Got it for Christmas & played it everyday for 3 wks!! Then at least every week since!! Whole Heartedly Recommend!! You will be glad you did!!
Every loved it from the 10 yr old to the 20 year old, even Mom and Dad.  It even got a thumbs up from the "non-game" lovers in the house!
summary: Great board game for the family!

reviewText: Not my favorite game, but it's ok. The mechanics are good and it stands the test of time by being just as enjoyable the second, third, or tenth time as it was the first. My biggest ache with this game is that you have to spend so much time concentrating on what you want to do that you don't really interact much with the other players. For a game with such simple mechanics, it should be more inviting. If I'm going to play a game, it's just as much for the company as it is for the game itself.

This was an exciting game.  The play money, the destinations.....It provides an hour  of  good fun.  It was not too long or drawn out so children lost interest. This game comes highly recommended by children and their adult co-players.
If you like board games this is a great one.  I was hoping to find a better deal on amazon, but the game is still worth it.
This game is an award winner for a reason.  The rules are simple to learn.  Which means you can jump right into the game and start having fun instead of having to learn through pages of rules.

As almost every review has mentioned, a perfectly put together game that is quick to learn and has plenty of re-playability. Is that a word? Great fun for young kids all the way through adults. Beautiful components as well. An essential game to have in any family's collection.
I purchase this for my sin this Christmas and we love it so much I may have to purchase my own.
almost $15 cheaper then in the store. it was a good buy. i look forward to playing it after christmas
Very enjoyable way to spend an hour with friends.The game is easy to learn, fast paced, and quite fun.
I bought this for my grandson and the price was so much lower than everywhere else, I was really glad to find it.
Pretty fun. Didnt get "board" (ha see what i did there) once even tho I lost by one(1) point. Good game
Three generations are enjoying the game.  Its not too long, not to short, just right.  Greatly recommend to those who prefer board games to computer games.

This is a really fun game, even if you have only two players. The rules are straightforward and we've found it takes about 45 minutes for a complete game with two people who like to think. Not all multiplayer games are good for two, but we've played this with five and we've played it with two and they're both great (but different). I was initially concerned because it is possible to block someone's route and with only two people this had the potential to get pretty competitive and personal, but in practice even if your most direct route is blocked, it's usually possible to find another way around. Basically, I don't find myself getting angry with my playing partner, but it is pleasantly competitive. Other games I like for two people: Lost Cities, Carcassonne; I would put Ticket to Ride ahead of both of them.

This is a fun game, even for those who don't like board games.  I was able to get my girlfriend to play, even though "board games are dorky" She had a fun time playing, and much to my surprise has agreed to play it again.
This game is easy to learn, quick to play, and really fun with a group of people. It's always a hit for game night!
One of the best games ever!
Very entertaining and strategic board game. Great for ages 9 and up, for ages 8 and younger, it is difficult as the true concept of the game may be a tad complex.

Got this game for my birthday last year. I love it. Also got the addition Alvin and Dexter for it. Basically the game is a map of the USA with train routes connecting cities. You draw train routes (Omaha to Seattle, for example) and try to collect enough colored cards matching the color of the tracks. Usually, but not always, there are a few ways to get to your destinations which is a good thing since other players can block your progress. Nobody knows the routes you have and you can play anywhere you want even if you don't have any trip tickets for a route. We play this game at least once a week and everybody loves it. You can win a game on your second try. It doesn't take alot of extra learning to get better. Obviously you gain some experience playing more but that doesn't necessarily mean you will win. I gave it 4 stars because the cards that come with it are miniature. Don't know why they do this. I bought (maybe that is why they do it) an addition, 1910 which replaces the Trip tickets and train cards with normal sized cards. As mentioned above, I also got the Alvin and Dexter addition wehich adds some chaos to the game, which I love. That addition has to little non-discript chararcters which I detailed painted to make them look better. Some people love that addition others find it too stressful. I love it. Bottom line is Ticket to Ride is a great game and will be played for many years. Worth getting even with the little cards.
We first played this game two years ago and fell in love with it.  Everyone with whom we play also enjoys it.  We have given many as gifts.

My wife and I play this board game all the time. We started out playing the Video game version on the xbox. When we learnt there was an actual board game, we couldn't resist. Great with 2 people (takes about an hour to play), add about 30-45 mins per player after that. For the best explanations of gameplay goto the days of wonder website. When purchasing this board game you also get a code for the online game for free!

Something about this game really draws me in! I could play this game every night and never lose interest. Every game is different. Every game takes skill and strategy and not just luck. Part of what I like about this game is the quality of the design. The instructions, the inserts, on down to the box it comes in are beautiful. When I'm playing the game it makes me feel like I'm actually building real-life train tracks ... this is probably aided by the introduction to the game where it tells about rich old friends meeting once each year and betting on who could get to a certain destination cheapest and fastest ... or something like that. I would recommend this game to anyone. It's challenging, pretty, and fun.
summary: love it love it love it

reviewText: We just received this game at Christmas.  Only played it once and we modified the rules a bit to get started because the kids were getting impatient with us adults trying to 'learn' it.  Our daughters are ages 7 & 9, I think once we play a few more times it will become easier and we will learn more about the strategy, but even the first game was fun, even though a bit involved to get moving in the beginning and never having played before.

We received this game as a Christmas gift and have been playing it ever since.  It's fun,  interesting and keeps the whole family entertained.  It is our new favorite game and we can't get enough of it.  I highly recommend it to anyone!
Everyone loves to play this.  Great family game while learning a bot of geography as a bonus. wish they made the cards big again.. this comes with the tiny cards.

My son rec'd this for Christmas.  My kids are 11,10 and 5.  It's sometimes hard to find a game for 5 players that we all enjoy.  We all enjoy this game, although my 5 year old helps mom or dad for now, he will "grow into it".  We love board games, but have the same boring games (Monopoly, Sorry, etc).  This game is a fresh perspective on games.  My kids LOVE it.  We even played w/my daughter's 2 friends one day and now they are asking for it too from their parents.  We do not have the "supplement" to the game, but will be getting that soon b/c the train ticket routes do get slim at times and the supplement adds more to that.  Highly recommend getting this game for "Family Game Night!"  PS - Board is a little flimsy when you open it, be careful when setting it up.
We love this game.  It's not hard, but it does require strategy, so it keeps your interest.  Great game to p,ay with friends and family.

I gave these to some of friends for Christmas and they all enjoy playing it with their families.  This is one of my husbands favorite games, we enjoy playing it with our family.  Amazon definitely has the best price.

We have played this game as a family several times.  It is fun to see the different strategies each family member has from collecting lots of cards to buying sections of track as soon as possible to blocking others to just collecting the wild cards.  Great game that takes about 60-90 minutes.  We have four preteens and  it is great for them.
Fun family game, got it for my 10 yr old for Christmas last year on a whim, and the whole family loves to play.  Any game that can get the family together gets 5 stars!.

Our family loves board games, usually language based ones like Buzzword, Scrabble, Boggle, Taboo, etc.  When my 17 yr. old son received this game from my in-laws, I was skeptical; assembling plastic train strands across the U.S. did not seem fun or engaging.  WOW, was I wrong.  This game, meant for 2-5 players is a wonderful game of strategy, connecting cities across the contiguous 48 before your opponents exhaust their supply of train cars.  Because the concept is simple, even elementary age children can understand how to play and succeed.  That being said, my husband and I spent many nights battling wits with our three teenagers, determined to win before going to bed.  This game has all of the trappings of a timeless classic: simple concept, uncomplicated rules, varied strategy and countless outcomes.  I give it my highest recommendation.

We received this game as a gift 2 years ago.  Today I'm buying it for a close friend as a gift.  Our whole family loves this game.  Players have to collect colored train cards to complete each leg of their train ride.  Players have to put together those legs to form the route, which are assigned by cards.  players get points both for completing each leg and completing whole routes, and lose points for routes not completed.It is unlike other board games in that you do not go around the board in a circle - in fact you may not be able to tell who's winning by looking at the board!  It's just a totally different game that's really fun!!!!!!!

I first played this game at 2am at a New Year's Eve party (not sober to say the least) and still had a blast.  It was easy to figure out and fun to play.  For those engineering geeks out there, this is the traveling salesman problem (an NP hard problem) as a board game.Regarding the dominant strategy (that long northern route), I've beaten people who have completed that route, but it was very close.  You might want to consider the expansion pack of cards if you play with people who go for the easier win.

I got this for my family of teenage boys and they have enjoyed playing with friends and we have loved playing it as a family.  There is a fair amount of skill and strategy involved, but also some luck associated with how well one does.  Each player is a "train" with one or more "routes" going across the United States.  The routes are kept secret until the end of the game.  For every route completed, a player earns an amount of points.  To complete your route, you have to collect cards representing the routes that allow you to "travel".  If you don't finish your route (because you don't draw the right cards to allow you to do so, or because some one else blocks you) you lose points.  Players can complete more than one route and the longest train receives additional points.  The game ends with a final round after a player gets down to three train cars left to place.  Points are then tallied and a winner determined.  It's more fun than I've been able to describe and I would highly recommend it to other game playing families.

Every year Santa puts a game under our tree. So we have lots of games! This year we got Ticket to Ride, and it has been a hit with everyone! This is a fun family game for all ages! Not too complicated, but enough of a challenge to keep everyone interested in the game. We love that it only takes about an hour to play. We love the educational aspects. Our only disappointment is that more people can't play at one time. We plan on adding other versions to our collection. Fun! Challenging! A new family favorite!

This is one of the greatest games ever made. Perfect for my family because it's easily learned, has some strategy and is fun. We had to search around the net to find answers to two questions not clearly explained in the instructions, and an inner corner of the board is peeling slightly, but those are very minor issues.I'm planning to get very comfortable with the game and then buy the 1910 expansion pack. Then we should be all set for many years to come.
summary: Awesome Game, Great for the Family! - Only Two Very Small Issues

reviewText: My daughter bought this as a present for her boyfriend. He and his family have a great collection of games. This was a big hit!
My wife and I bought this game, and we absolutely love it!  Wish there were more games like this!  You WONT be disappointed.

We received this game for Christmas, and have played it several times since.  My seven year old really enjoys it, and the adults do as well.  The game is easy to learn and is set up so that you never really know who has won until the end.  The different "destinations" everyone is trying to reach really spreads the game out at the beginning, and allows for different strategies.  I like how different it is every time you play, and also that it doesn't take hours to finish.  It also is more of a thinking game than a aggressive game, and it has a nice pace to it.  We have found that a game lasts around 45 minutes.The only complaint I have is that it take a while to add up the points at the end, and it is very easy to make mistakes.  The game is structured so that longer tracks have a much larger reward, but it means adding up a lot of odd numbers.  There is a numbered area at the edge of the board to keep track as you go, but it is easy to forget a track, so you really need to add it all up after.
I loved the game. It's very brilliant. A bit complicated at first but once you get it, it's a lot of fun. I played it with my son and he didn't like it much as it needs a lot of patience.

I put this as  amuse buy for board game players, after watching the TableTop episode about this game I went right out and bought it to play with friends, if you're on the fence about buying this game watch this video [...] It'll explain the rules, the fun, and the intrigue, also if you don't laugh then the whole joy of social interaction is lost on you.
My sister and brother-in-law introduced this game to me and I had to buy it myself. It is a fun and easy to understand game for all ages and it won't get old!

There are already tons of reviews of this game. None of the reviews are less than three stars, so that should already speak volumes about it. I really can't think of anything new to add that hasn't already been said. I and my game group play this regularly and haven't tired of it. It is also a great game for people to get into the board gaming hobby.

My 8-year old loves this game. It is the perfect game to introduce him to more difficult ones. If you need extra help with the instructions, search on youtube, where you can find some guides on how to play. Have fun!

Super Fun Board GameMy family purchased Ticket to Ride a few years ago. We love it! Ticket to Ride is a board game that includes cards and trains; The board looks a little bit like a map. Ticket to Ride is $40.00-$50.00. This game is my families favorite game.I really enjoy this game because, up to 5 people can play, it is challenging, and there are acouple extra trains in case you lose one.I have no complaints about this game. I would say it is more of an adult game but kids do like to play with the trains. My family will play the game while my six year old sister plays with the trains.If you do not like games don't get this one because it may go on forever. Ticket to Ride is a super fun game, so if you are a gamer, I highly recommend you to get Ticket to Ride, it is fantastic!

reviewerName: Mrs. Ruth A. Mizell "reader, and mother of re...
reviewText: I bought this for my daughter in law for Christmas and then we all ended up playing it at various times. It's a fun, strategy game and competitive.
Several components of the game are missing compared to Europe version. I would not recommend this one. Europe version is great!
summary: not as good as Europe version

reviewText: I was introduced to this game by my 8 yr old nephew who loves it! I liked it so much I bought one for myself. Great for both kids and adults. Easy to play but involves great strategy. Great gift idea too!

I bought two board games: Settlers of Catan and Ticket to Ride. Both games are very well-loved everywhere I bring them with me, but Ticket to Ride is much simpler to learn. Even children get this game quickly and have a blast playing.I highly recommend it, though Settlers of Catan would appeal more to players who want greater depth of strategy in their games.
summary: Very fun and easy to learn

reviewText: I'm not much of a boardgame guy, but after playing the demo for TICKET TO RIDE on Xbox Live, I decided to pick up a copy of the actual board game.  I'm glad I did.So far, I've introduced this to two totally different groups of people (my family and colleagues at work) and both of them enjoyed themselves immensely. It's very easy to grasp the rules, and while there is some competition between players, it's definitely not a cut-throat experience.Much, much more entertaining than traditional American games like Monopoly (at least for me).
This is a good game, just not my personal favorite. It is a great family game and it is easy to learn if one person at the table can teach the others.

It is fairly obvious after playing 5 or so games that whoever gets a cross-country route is virtually guaranteed the win.  It makes the expansion pack very appealing.Additionally, the cards are uber tiny.  Shuffling is a bugger.  Another problem fixed by the expansion.
summary: It's a good game, needs some tweaks

reviewText: I was looking for a new game to play with my friends. Even thought my friend and I never play it before, we love it once when we began to play. The trains are like toys that take me back to my childhood. :D

Ihad my doubts at first.  Let's face it, when someone says "Let's play monopoly," the first thing you think of is Oh no! a long boring game.  Well, that was my first impression when my husband suggested buying the game.  Totally changed my mind from the very first time we played the game.  We have family night and couples night with this game.  It is fun and worth the investment.  I know it's a little on the higher end of cost but it is lots of fun.
We homeschool our kids and this game definitely helps with learning where many cities are in the US and southern Canada. This is my wife's favorite family game!

This game is so much fun!  It is easy to learn, and can be played with different  levels of strategy, so even young children, age 7 or 8 can play.Our family plays with adults, and it can become difficult as we try to block each other along the routes.
I like the idea of a game, but I like Europe version much more than this one. Less relying on a lack and more on making decisions.

This game is great for a family game night!  We love it.  Our children range in ages from 10-2.  We let the younger kids help place the trains for the older family members or draw the cards.  Fun fun game!  We really love it for family game nights!
out of all the games that I purchased this is the one that I enjoyed the most. I can play it with my nieces and nephew, and know they will have fun.
Fun family game!  We have also had friends over and had a great time playing it.  It is also great for my kids to see the map and put their trains on it.  Love it!

Great game.  Really highlights the idea of simplicity and fun.  Sure there are more complicated board games around, but this one you can pick up in 30 minutes and teach to an 8 year old.  By the end of the hour, you will feel like you are racing to build your train route across the United States while competing with your opponent.  There's a reason this game is so good.  Children love it, Adults love and you will too. Not sure about all the others, but this is the one that started it all.
summary: Fun, Easy to Play and Teach

reviewText: One of those games that comes along so rarely that it should be known by all. I could get on soap box and talk about why this game is a great alternative to video games for kids, but chances are I'd be preaching to the choir. This game is perfect for folks of many ages from senior citizens down to younger kids around 10yrs. Many copies of this game have been purchased from amazon and my local "It's Your Move" as gifts and each person who has received it, has contacted me later and said that they play it all the time. It has been played with coworkers during game nights and with family up to and including my grandparents all with great reception. I can't say how highly recommended this game is.Enjoy.

Wonderful game for family. My boys love to play this game, we usually play 2 rounds on game night beforewe're burnt out. I felt I was taking a chance on this game only because of the price. To me it seems a bit spendy,  however it's been money well spent. It's more of a low key, laid back game. No timer, shouting, orteams. Completely easy to play once you figure out the directions. That took a bit of time for me. Great game!!!!!
This is such a fun game! I remember playing it years ago and I am so happy to finally have purchased it. Amazon definitely had the best price! Shipping was fast and the product was perfect! Thanks!

I'd read lots of reviews and summaries of how the game was played. It just didn't sound that exciting. Then I talked with a guy whose family loves all kinds of games (as we do) and he highly recommended it. It's a bit on the expensive side for a game you're afraid you won't like, but I took a chance based on his recommendation.Well, my husband and I love it! The concept is very simple to learn. We had the basic mechanics down after one game. We've had it now about two weeks and have played 40+ games. I will say that our teenager does not love it. He will play occasionally but he says it doesn't have enough of a 'mission' for him.The game is pretty quick with 2 people, 20-30 minutes. The one negative with 2 people is that, after a number of plays, you can tell where your opponent is going because you've memorized the destination tickets. We're looking forward to playing with friends and think this will definitely up the excitement and call for new strategy. However, I have ordered the 1910 expansion after reading many reviews recommending this for more depth to the game.For casual gamers who play occasionally, I think the basic game will give you fun play for a long time to come. If you play a lot, you'll probably want to consider an expansion. We may ultimately end up getting TTR Europe later on. It sounds like, if you're really into games, that Europe has a bit more diversity in the kinds of routes and the types of moves you can make. It's probably a deeper game for 2 people, which is how we usually play. Hopefully 1910 will give us enough depth to keep it exciting for a while to come.As a point of reference, other games that we like are Rummikub, Forbidden Island (although we want to go to Pandemic now for more challenge), Phase 10, Guillotine, Monopoly, Spy Alley, Munchkin, 221B Baker Street, Spades. For our next purchase, I'm trying to decide between Carcassone, Settlers of Catan and Dominion. I'd welcome recommendations!

Bought this game for my family and my kids love playing it.  My son, who is too young to grasp everything about the game loves putting the trains on each route and cheering when he and I pull ahead of my daughter and wife.  The game features strategy, but is not too complicated.  We enjoy playing it as a family and I recommend it highly.

Such a fun game.  A mix of luck and strategy is needed to pull ahead and build the most routes, or the longest routes, across the map of the U.S. I've played it several times with strangers at Phoenix Comicon, and it never fails to entertain.This is one of those games that you can play with adults and with kids that can pick up relatively easy games.  I play with my 8 and 10 year olds, and they have fun with it.This is one of those games that you can see in action on the Geek & Sundry show, TableTop (on YouTube). I highly recommend watching that episode and all the others.
summary: I shouldn't have waited 2 years before buying this one.

reviewText: Great game and very easy to learn yet provides something new and exciting every time you play it. I highly recommend getting this game, it is truly worth the money.
Ticket to ride is a great game!  Fun for a group of 3-5.  A nice mix of strategy and luck.

Learning Curve – this game is really quick and easy to pick up. Unlike some German-style games, the rule book is two pages and it takes only minutes to set up and learn the game. The rules are simple and not convoluted, yet the game is still complex enough to be interesting.Replayability - because the goals are randomly distributed, this game seems to have almost infinite replayability. We've played hundreds of times, and I can't see a way in which we will get bored; the game changes based on goals, and also based on the cards you draw during the game.Healthy randomness – generally I'm anti-luck in board games, but in this case the only randomness is what cards are drawn. However, this is mitigated by a face-up area of train cards (decreasing the randomness, though not eliminating it), by a lot of ways to get around needing very specific cards, and by the ability to discard strategy cards whenever they are chosen.Narrative/game play – the story that accompanies the game is fun, but the game play is the real strength. It moves fast, and though not everyone is involved at every turn, turns are short enough that you are not bored waiting for others. And because turns are short, no one can run away with a victory early on, giving the illusion, if not necessarily the fact, that everyone is in the game at all times.
summary: Easy to learn, easy to teach. Very replayable.

reviewText: Why do all the best board games originate from Europe?I read about this game on an on-line game site, highlighting some of the best family board games out there, and this is one that made the list. It looked fun and easy-to-learn, so I picked it up in time for the holidays. I had a lot of fun playing this with my family over Thanksgiving and Christmas get-togethers. The game is simple to learn, simple to play, and is really pretty casual. There's a small amount of luck and strategy involved, but most people can play this on an even footing and it is not geared towards competitive game-play. More fun with the full five players on the board, it can still be finished in about 1 hour of play. I highly recommend trying this game out!
summary: Fun board game for the whole family!

reviewText: Great game for 4 to 5 players. To be the winner, you must have a clear plan, and a plan B in case you are blocked by other player :)))

I took a chance in ordering this for my son and daughter-in-law who enjoy interesting board games.  This one proved to be a great hit for them and whoever else played with them.  I rely a great deal on customer reviews and was not steered wrong with this choice.
summary: Ticket to Ride Adult Board Game

reviewText: We have played several hours with this game since we purchased it.  It it great fun for the family and our friends when they come over.  We have even had our youngest who is 6 play with some minor assistance.  If you are looking for a fun strategy game that is easy to learn to play with family and friends, this one should fit the bill.If you check out the Table Top web show ([...]) with Wil Wheaton, you can also gain more perspective on the game play.

Saw this game on Wil Wheaton's Tabletop series on youtube and decided to pick it up for family game night... so glad we did! First night provided hours of fun.  My kids (ages 6-10) were able to understand the concept (although my 6 y/o still needed a little help with names on the routes), they were able to keep track of points easily and were even competing for longest route at the end of the night.
I love this game!  Me, family and friends play it all the time and it never gets old.  It is easy to understand and there are enough variations that it is never the same game twice.
This is a really fun game of strategy! We have been playing it a lot since we first learned it Oct. 2nd at a friend'a house.

My wife and I like board games, but have a hard time finding new games for adults.  We first caught wind of this game on the YouTube show Table Top.  When we first got this game, we didn't quite understand the rules and went through a couple of rounds playing wrong.  Going back, the rules were pretty simple, we had just overlooked one thing.  This is the most used board game at our house and is far more fun for us than any of the games we had been playing (more traditional board games).  The quality is amazing, the cards are a heavier stock than a cheap playing card, which will help the life of the game, and the playing peices are nicely made.I even like that the map give a little bit of a geography lesson to us everytime we play.We like this game so much that I have bought two of the expansions for christmas hoping to give the game a different twist.  I think that is one of the greatest thing about this game, it can be changed simply by getting a new board and a new deck of tickets.
This game will make you play and play and play! Now i want to have all of them!!! They are worth it )
The five of us ages 8-45 all love to play this game. When the kids are busy my husband and I play and still have a great time!
This game is fun for the whole family! I cannot wait to play the other Ticket to Ride games! Thanks.

Played this game first with our daughter and son-in-law. Good way to spend a cold Sunday afternoon. However, they had the Europe version, we ordered the US. The Europe version was a little more challenging, more interesting. (Tunnels and ferries.) If playing with younger children, the U.S. version would be great. We preferred the Europe version.

raved about it!  It looked like a good game for the family, so I got it for a Christmas present.  I think the kids have gotten to play it once or twice, but the adults in the family invite friends over for game night and this is the game of choice.It's been fun watching my niece and husband invite her brother and fiance over to play this game.  They went out and bought one of the other "Ticket to Ride" games as well.It's a keeper and definitely worth the money.  A GREAT break from TV!
summary: Somebody in the family got to play this once and...

reviewText: This is my husbands favorite game.  Everyone that plays it really likes it.  I am not a game person and I have fun with this one.
I orderd this on 4/16 and it didn't ship until 4/21.  The estimated time when I ordered it was by 4/22 and now its not getting here until 4/26.
summary: Don't wait 4 days to ship items

reviewText: Oh my Gosh! We love this game! This is a fast game to learn and doesn't take hours to play. We have spent many fun hours playing this game together and we have loaned it out to friends as well. I recently just bought it for my married daughter for Christmas and she loves it also!
We bought this game and totally love it. Is absolutely fun playing this game. Worth it!!!! Will highly recommend this board game.
My family has only played it a few times, but it's easy to learn -- and fun:  the kids (almost 6 and 8) loved the little train pieces and claiming routes.

I bought this and pandemic and turned my 1 game night a week into 3-4 game nights a week..now I interact with friends/family on game nights instead of txting, emailing..etc..tv is left to play music!!Wife indicated this was her favorite game ever!but it..you wont regret it.

Ticket to Ride is a fun, quick connection game that's suitable for ages 10 and up, but it's a very enjoyable game for adults alone. Using plastic train cards, players attempt to connect cities on cards they hold and block other players' routes. The game can be played in either a friendly non-confrontational manner, or very strategically and aggressively. Ticket to Ride, though designed by an American and published by an America/French company, is an example of a European-style strategy boardgame. If you like this game, you might want to learn more about the hobby. Boardgamegeek.com is a great source of information, though maybe overwhelming at first. There are also a number of great boardgame podcasts, including The Dice Tower at [...] Happy gaming!
summary: Great introduction to European style games

reviewText: This is an easy game to set up and play. I have played it both with adults and children and there was no difficulty with either.
"Ticket to Ride" is an excellent game board, amazing and innovative. Enjoy playing and at the same time learn world geography

This game has a lot of strategy involved.  The rules may seem complicated at first, but they will quickly become second nature, so don't worry!  It is a fun combination of Monopoly, Settlers of Catan, and Risk.

Ticket to Ride is straightforward. Its one of those games where you never need to reference the rules after the first time you play it. Nonetheless, collecting the cards you need and creating your path around the country is surprisingly fun. The goal cards give the game a sense of purpose, and there is actually some strategy involved because of the interaction with other players' paths. Thus, although it is accessible to children (maybe as young as 8?) it is entertaining for adults as well.The educational aspects are a bit of geography and simple addition.
easy to follow board game that my family is crazy about!pick this up if you haven't yet, ya dingus.

I bought this game to play with my grandsons who are 8 & 10.  We had a great time playing it but my husband and I have enjoyed it too.  Good family game with lots of educational value because of the geography and because one needs to plan moves to succeed.

Great game!  I bought it for my 11 yr old grand-daughter Cassidy for Christmas.  My grown daughter Alana has one and we all play it..  This year, my 8 yr old grand-daughter Ariel joined in and beat us all.  She had some guidance.  I also bought the extension of Ticket to Ride from Amazon to add to my daughter's game.  It made it more fun with all the new short stops.  Love it.  Thanks Amazon.
summary: Ticket to Ride and Ticket to Ride Extensions = Great FUN!

reviewText: Game can played by a variety of ages. Played it with my son and 7 year old granddaughter and bought it for my 24 year old granddaughter. Easy to learn but can be  different every time you play.Playing board is very sturdy. Directions are  easy to understand. Bought it Dec.2013.
summary: Ticket to Ride is a journey to Fun

reviewText: A really fun board game for the whole family - especially if they love trains.  The goal is to build railroad lines across the USA and ratchet up more points than your opponent(s).
summary: Great train game for those who love trains.

reviewText: We've been playing this game with friends of ours for a long time.  Got it for my wife as a Christmas gift and we've played it at least once a week since either with each other or with friends.  Fairly easy to learn and play, helps with thinking out strategies and plotting.  If you're looking for a game the whole family can enjoy, even younger kids, this is a great one.

This is a great, simple game that plays with up to 6 people. The premise is that you are building railroads to different destinations across the United States, and you get points for placing trains and for connecting cities. Very good introductory game for people that don't normally play boardgames.

I first learned of this game while teaching in a Special Education School where the instructional aide was playing the game with a group of SH kids.  It is amazing!  They learn so many geographical concepts and have so much fun while interacting with the mainstream.  There is much to be learned from simple place locations and names to intricate strategy techniques.  And this goes for all, from the SH student to gifted.  Adults?  Move on a get a ticket to a foreign location!
My family absolutely loves the game. I bought it so my son won't have to bring his home every  time  he comes home. I would recommend it.

I purchased this game as a Christmas present for my 7 year old daughter. This is a very entertaining game.  The game encompasses geography, math as well as strategy. Despite the educational aspects, my daughter just loves it and has wanted to play it over and over since Christmas.  I was apprehensive about the high price tag (not sure if one could get the game elsewhere for less money) but I now feel it was money well spent. I can see us playing this game for years to come.  Even the adults enjoyed it.

My husband and I love this game!We like to play scrabble and Monopoly and this game is even better! We've had friends over to play it too and all our friends love it too! It's a really high quality game and all the pieces are sturdy and durable.I would DEFINITELY recommend this game to others!
summary: Awesome game for those that like strategy games

reviewText: Great game for kids, parents, and grandparents. I highly suggest the getting the expansion with the full size cards. Easier for kids to handle and grandparents to read.
summary: Fun for the entire extended family.

reviewText: What a great game...My wife and I bought several games that were reviewed highly for 2 person play and this is our favorite...all around fun...Haven't played it with more people, but I sense it would be just as much fun.We also really enjoy:CarcassonneDominionCastle Panic

Everyone we have showed our new game to has loved it! We love it too and it's a fun strategy game that is great with just two people. It is worth the price for sure! We just play in teams if we have more than 5 people. It's a great strategy game that is fun but not too hard to catch on to or play. Love it!
Son Inlaw introduced us.  It's educational in a fun way.  Makes you learn or remember your states and locations  FUN
MY EIGHT YEAR OLD GRANDDAUGHTER NOW AN AVID FAN. SO NICE TO HAVE A GREAT BRAIN GAME THAT KEEPS US BOTH ON OUR TOES. PLAY IT WITH ADULT FRIENDS. SUCH A GREAT GAME FOR WEEK AT THE BEACH.

I have never left a review for a product on Amazon after being a customer for years.  That being said, this is the most fun family game we've ever played.  I have many children and have purchased many games over the years but none come close the entertainment this game has provided.  Don't let the $50 price tag scare you away as it almost did me.  If your looking for a great way to spend some quality family time you won't go wrong here.

I can't really top any of the other excellent reviews for this game.  However, I'd like to toss my hat into the ring and recommend the Ticket to Ride series to anyone looking for a well designed family game to beat the usual crowd (Monopoly, etc).  It's fun, replayable, rewards experienced players, but has some luck to make it interesting.  TTR even masks some fine educational merits in a pretty package... geography, math, tactical and strategic thinking.

This held my attention for the 90 or so minutes we played. On one of our precious days off from work, my wife wanted to spend some time decompressing. This was perfect. We really got into it. It's not overly competitive and keeps your brain active. Will see what happens when we get the expansion.
We gave this as a Christmas present and have already played it six times.  Everyone in the family enjoys the game.
